8FMNpl3F0U_q0l6xsZpmiw.text: Pretty amazing atmosphere as I am sure has been said already. I had shrimp cocktail, cream spinach and the medium sized prime rib. My dining partner had angel chicken, asparagus & French onion soup.  Service was spectacular. French onion soup was really good and cheesy. Shrimp cocktail was not so terrific- The shrimp although large seemed a little old. Medium sized prime rib was huge and tasty. Angel chicken was light and flavorful. Asparagus was not so great - a large portion but something was missing. Cream spinach was OK, but I would've preferred sauteed spinach.  Overall, worth the trip and the experience of dining in a truly iconic Las Vegas location.

XHzhWeR2NZQoc_0fF8VPxA.text: Great old ambiance!  Service was excellent. Food was just as good. Bone in Ribeye perfect med rare.   Will return again!

JwlDI9jkGQOp5H8YzeHFbg.text: Golden Steer was overall a nice place and the steaks - food was very good.  They need to get beer on tap however.  The service needs some improvement.  Long wait for drink refills and to simply get someone to take and process our bill was a 40 minute hassle.  This would really question whether or not I return.

6nMxu89x7JI8d419ai103g.text: Really nice old fashioned steak house and the service was superb. The prime rib is huge and all the side dishes are big too. Lots of family birthdays that day.  It does not feel like you are in Vegas as this feels so much at home. It is next to Lucky Dragon hotel on the north of the strip.

tqOkVr2Mv6CInoK4abQ9iw.text: My sister was getting married in Las Vegas and we were trying to find a spot to dine after. She is in love with the rat pack. (Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin etc.) We had heard that they would dine here on a regular basis so of course she wanted to make this her wedding dinner. I was a bit skeptical as its an older establishment. We drove up and I became a little more comfortable. As we walked in the staff was amazingly helpful. Our reservation was for 8pm and we showed up just after 7pm and they sat us right down. It is a beautiful place with amazing food and service.

cigO867akMpHFyD5pp1kTQ.text: Great old school Vegas steakhouse. This was my parents favorite steakhouse when I was growing up and now with many other options it's nice to revisit the past. The service is great, good quality food, great atmosphere! Try it for a change from the ordinary strip steakhouses!

ly8VD0XVhO3TNPy0FhoBdQ.text: This place ruined our dining experiences for the rest of this trip.   The Golden Steer was so amazing Friday night literally from the moment we walked in until we left completely satisfied you guys (and girls:) were on point!  The only problem is the rest of our dining experiences (Luxor - Tender steak house- HORRIBLE!) suffered trying to maintain the level you set.   Can't wait to bring the wife back to enjoy this place. Won't be visiting Vegas again without stopping here!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime - prime rib was amazing too!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very expensive. But worth it!

WUfuPdUDehl7IycJOsISgQ.text: I've been wanting to try this place for the past 18 years! FINALLY we made reservations (not really needed) on a Saturday night. The steak is no doubt 5 stars and high quality meat, BUT everything else needed help taste wise. The bill was $275.00 for 3 with NO alcohol (includes tip).   PROS: Steaks (filet mignon & bone in rib eye)             Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail (HUGE shrimp)             Old Vegas interior & great pictures  CONS: Clams casino (these looked like stuffed clams)             Beefsteak Tomato Salad (bland)             Creamed Corn              Creamed Spinach             $$$$

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden Steer (iconic)
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon with crab, asparagus and bernaise sauce
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

eE9xtFsUdjpPOVW8TF7PuA.text: Fantastic dinner! The service was impeccable. Scot had a great recommendation for our wine. I can't wait until my next visit!

ANoR1HO1sGBmFDBxcadbhQ.text: Had reservations. Showed up 10 minutes early and the Host sent us to the bar stating no tables were available even though I looked in the restaurant and there were several available. So, we go to the bar and order two Cadillac Margaritas. What we get are two regular margaritas that tasted like juice with ice and no alcohol. I remind the bartender we ordered Cadillacs that have premium tequila and a shot of Grand Marnier. He responds that it is premium and that's our house tequila. I look at the female bartender and ask her to please inform the male bartender how to make a Cadillac Margarita, which she does and we can tell that she's been picking up the slack for him. He gives us an attitude for us basically asking to receive what we're paying for. We finish our drinks and have now been waiting a half hour. I walk up to the Host to remind him we have reservations for a table twenty minutes ago and, he again states with a rude tone this time that there are no available tables. So, at this time, I assertively asked him what are those three tables for? He grudgingly grabs a couple menus and with an attitude says he can seat us now. I tell him no thanks, I'm done with this place and the gangsta attitudes from the staff. Place is in a crappy crime area and is way way way over rated. Save yourself the trip and head elsewhere.

oQeKrQUmysZOxdSo0Ct-cw.text: My husband and I dined at The Golden Steer when we were in Las Vegas celebrating our 15th wedding anniversary. The meal we had at The Golden Steer was by far the best meal we had while in town. The atmosphere was amazing and the service was impeccable. My husband and I both had the petite filet and it was prepared perfectly. The twice baked potato was excellent as well and big enough to share. The restaurant is located in a strip mall which may deter some people but please don't let it! When you walk in the doors it is like entering another era of Las Vegas and your every need is attended too. Excellent!

KDPT3rNqvQYikBinIelNQA.text: You get the feeling you've stepped back in time to old Vegas at The Golden Steer.  It's a cornerstone establishment off the strip with enough history to make it a museum. This is a must visit.  The table side Caesar salad is phenomenal. The filet is as good as any and lobster too. It's hard not to over indulge here.  Finally, the service is fantastic. Highly recommend a visit here.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The story
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

Gxpf4V2bff1yJ4Jtjn3vYQ.text: I ordered the Ceasers Salad which was very good and of course whipped up table side which We have never seen performed before... My partner she ordered the House Salad which she said was also wonderful...          For our meal I had the Petite Filet 8oz med with twice baked potato.... Chris ordered the Porterhouse Pork Chop and Baked Potato... Of course the meals were served with delicious warm bread w/plenty of butter...           OMG when the dinner was served .... Chris's Pork Chop was as big as the plate WOW !! And her potato had to be served on its own plate because we have never seen a baked potato that large in our life !! You do NOT want for more food here when your finished eating here that's for sure... You will be full...  EVERYTHING was absolutely outstanding... My steak melted in my mouth and her Pork Chop was also very tender...           The atmosphere was wonderful in this old Vegas restaurant... We loved the decor and old photos and just the thought that we were from Florida but we're still able to enjoy a delicious meal where the Rat Pack ate many times years ago and Muhammad Ali and Mario Andretti was wonderful... It just doesn't get any better than that when your on vacation just looking for a place to have a nice meal....

Jt4ta44hA0r77ue2A2paXg.text: FABULOUS!!!!! Great service! Great food!  Old school Vegas...they will treat you like a VIP!!! Enjoy!!!

iAF7LeRC8eAvl1WWVeK5Rw.text: Best Prime Rib I've ever had.  Will I be back, heck yea!  Not sure what else to say.

f1rG-vh8WZr7mMreMhl80Q.text: Not only is the historical aspect of this place incredible, but the food equally matches it's reputation. We enjoyed the oysters rockefeller, shrimp cocktail, ribeye, & asparagus! Everything was perfect and our service was above and beyond.  If your in Vegas, come into this joint.

d1GtLdxl4K446aMXHnQCrw.text: I personally didn't think anything about this place stood out from any other steakhouse I've been to. My ribeye was huge, tasted like any other steak I've had and my twice baked potato was really good. My boyfriend had a lobster tail and New York strip combo. His lobster he enjoyed but the steak he did not. It was very chewy and flavorless. The service was excellent! Paid $260 including tip for just the two of us.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge ribeye, looks better than it really is. Kinda flavorless.

VOZIgvHGhIL7YunQLpFsHQ.text: Had dinner there tonight and the service was horrible.  I waited over 15 minutes at the bar for a beer.  One Bartender, there was another guy ( long hair and beard ) who was kinda helping out when he wanted.  He just looked at me a few times and ignored me ( not sure because I was Chinese or in a T-Shirt, However when another person who came up to the bar in a dress shirt and caucasian 15 minutes later he served him right away)   The 2 bottle beers cost $16.  The ribeye was pretty good $54, corn $ 9, and soup $ 10.  Not really complaining about the cost, just the pro service at the bar.  I would not recommend it and definitely not come back.

yEEmzF6Qokscr5oA3QmB6w.text: Simply the absolute best old school steak and sea food restaurant in town. If the history doesn't get you, the perfect manhattans will!

gXpAohZi99BcU0DAWL0LWg.text: Went here tonight for my anniversary dinner with my boyfriend. From the outside, I was not impressed. It was definitely not like other steakhouses we have visited before. Once inside, the decor made up for the dumpy looking exterior.  We started with the fried ravioli and calamari. Both were excellent. Next up was a side caesar for me and chicken and rice soup for my boyfriend. The caesar was delicious and freshly prepared. For our main course, I ordered the chicken parmesan (not a steak fan) & my boyfriend ordered the NY strip. My chicken was excellent and a very generous size! My boyfriend was happy with his steak and said it was very delicious.  Besides our amazing food, our waiter Alfredo was excellent. He was attentive, hospitable and very aware our needs. Very satisfactory visit.

MpE-QDWwlQ4biWFCmfXB3A.text: Loved the atmosphere.  Service, not so much.  Food was good, not great.  May have to give it another try.  Twice baked potato was the highlight.

XdhZlO20anpYXSZuCmaetw.text: The Golden Steer was fantastic! From the table side Caesar salad and bananas foster to my perfectly cooked filet and yummy twice baked potato. All the servers were nice and attentive. We were in the side room (party of 6) and I would love to sit in the main room next time (in one of the little booths). The atmosphere was cool and although it's a pretty classy joint, it had a casual feel to it. I highly recommend it!

FwuQO2_doBZ_beWq8Gd_KA.text: It's been 10 years since we last dined hear. The atmosphere brings you back to the mob days in Vegas.  The oldest restaurant in Las Vegas.    The steaks are very good but not the very best I've been served in town.  The sides were small. Our server made up for any issues and was great.  Go to golden steer it is still a must stop to dine in town

PT27rtjGE0nV_RTPlidDwg.text: The Caesar salad made fresh at the table was delicious! The portion of steak my husband got (ribeye) was ridiculous- enough for 2-3 people.  He said it was very good though. I had the poached salmon with dill sauce and enjoyed it. There is nothing for children at all on this menu. My fourteen year old had the toasted ravioli with marinara sauce and liked it.  My ten year old would eat nothing but bread .  The desserts were definitely nothing special.  Cheesecake was very small and plain, no sauce whatsoever.  The creme brulee was likely the worst I've ever had... not creamy at all, very thin and runny. I would have no reason to return.  Sorry, but a lot of hype for an average place. Extremely overpriced. Our bill for three people eating dinner was $245.00

dIUA-paHUEDFy2GGcNJYbA.text: The reason this is 3 stars vs 4 is due to expectations vs reality.  This is a traditional, a la cart style steakhouse.  They are a left over from a different era and can be quite an experience to be in.  I've been in several similar restaurants (and worked in them as well in my youth) so I had a certain expectation to how it should be.  Atmosphere and ambiance was what I expected.  Service is off though.  I'm used to being introduced to the waiter or waiters for my table and the bus boy and asked if I'd been here before (if I wasn't recognized as a regular).  Instead it was very lack of warmth.  We were brought the wrong salads and when we got the right ones, they weren't brought out at the same time.  We also had to flag someone down for water and ice tea refills at least once.  Also, places of this caliber have an intermezzo service, Golden Steer does not.  The food was ok but not worth the price.  At this type of place I expect to pay high prices but I should be getting phenomenal service and top quality food and prep.  The so called "world famous ceasar salad" was not table side prep, was a small plate of a basic ceasar salad - nothing more.  The house salad a friend got was even more disappointing.  It looks like a salad I would get at a casino cafe.  Our tabled had 2 ribeyes and a top sirloin.  My wife commented that her sirlion was a bit overcooked and while good, she had had better.  The 2 ribeyes were cooked right and tasted fine but seemed to lack seasoning and didn't impress me much - for $52 bucks I can go to several other gourmet steak houses and get a superior piece of meat.  Golden steer is still trying to sell people on prime corn-fed beef at prices for what other competing places give for dried aging and grass-fed.  The power went out while we were there (not their fault).  Staff was vary accommodating because of it and reduced the check for the inconvenience (didn't even have to ask or mention anything).  We'll probably just skip this place in the future, there are better places where the food and service is better and I can get that fine dining experience.

nAbhlE_xeeiSuHimQzCMxQ.text: Now, I will admit; I am very generous when it comes to reviewing and rating, but I only write about things when True emotion and feeling are conjured up. It's not like I don't have the time, it's just that the inspiration is gone. Not within The Golden Steer.  I will address the fact that I have been coming to and living in Las Vegas since the early 80s as a child. I have seen 90% (probably more) of the businesses come, flourish and then be gone. There are few places in Las Vegas that offer an AUTHENTIC old steakhouse, and even fewer near the Strip. Everything about this place, maitre's d  and all. Other than Bally's, Circus Circus, Smith & Wollensky and Golden Steer, EVERY SINGLE other steakhouse (on the strip) doesn't pre-date 1989.  I have been to ALL OF THEM. They all are 5 star worthy, But S&W can be a bit pricey... Golden Steer is far and away, my champion of Steak AND Service in Las Vegas. It sits in an inauspicious strip mall 1 block west of LVBLVD on Sahara. The best word to describe this place is Incognitus Majorus. It isn't pain-in-the-assedly normal "In the Rear of the Casino" Location, see: Circus Circus and Bally's. or tucked away in a location that is too crowded (everywhere downtown). Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin, Sammy Davis Jr, Joey Bishop and Marilyn have their own booths. There is a Grand Piano in the front Lounge area. The decor looks as if it hasn't changed since 1957. It is reported that this was one of the frequents of aforementioned characters of yore. What a perfect spot, in close proximity to the Thunderbird, El Rancho and Riviera, and then later, Sahara.  I came to dinner with the most obnoxious accessory to diners and servers alike: A BABY. They not only sat us immediately, but Our Hostess, Stephanie (?) offered a bowl of mashed potatoes before even handing us the menus for food or wine. That was incredible. Haven't seen that before, or since.  It was my 5th time there overall and first time with my daughters. The prices were on par with every other steakhouse in town, so I don't mind. The food was not only phenomenal, but the service was incredible, and everyone was so polite about my baby girl. The same hostess even offered to hold her while we finished our last bites. The Crab Legs were huge, sweet and buttery. The steaks were cooked to perfection with the right amount of char and smokiness. The service was jaw droppingly amazing and we ended up tipping everyone that helped us.   Not only was this my favorite steakhouse from this point on; but my favorite dining experience in Las Vegas. Hands Down. I hope that someone actually reads this from front to back. I am a local concierge and VIP Host in town, it is my job to report accurate findings out and about in Vegas. I pass over the mediocre and certifiable, I give Kudos to the businesses that inspire me. Golden Steer offered a dining experience that I will remember for the rest of my life. Not only that, they set the curve. I have eaten quite literally around the world, and experienced service at all levels of remuneration, but have NEVER experienced dinner like my 5th visit to Golden Steer.

fr8zBfa_adgyA0fu6znIAQ.text: We had dinner here last night. I think the atmosphere does bring back the old Vegas feel. This place is old school with todays high prices. I think it is good to try it once.  The food was good and the service was great. You pay a lot for the Golden Steer Status - being the oldest Vegas Restaurant. That's about it.

sHQnUgx7ouY_4CTDBqXxMg.text: Had to try this place since its been rated so highly for years. Overall it was relatively normal for the environment. The steak was a bit dry and overcooked, but flavor delicate. The salad was awful, and the asparagus ok. The place is clean and nicely decorated. However the service was mediocre especially for the class they are supposed to be. The waiter spilled wine all over my table and several other servers dropped food tray lids, neatly dropped a salad bowl, and silverware. Hostess was rude after our last plate was taken and I paid the bill, she plopped into our booth and said our lounge is nice. It was very obvious that we were waiting on my two sips left of my wine.

ACLR09rJV0HienktX1nXrw.text: Had dinner there a few days ago with a large group. Bartender over charged for two drinks to start with and his boss had to return me $9 dollars .  Next was dinner . The prime rib had a large portion of fat and not tasty. The seafood starter didn't taste fresh, bread was ok and the salad was bland. The dessert cheesecake was very plain. Ended up paying over $120 for a meal worth about $30 tops.

6bnFpBqPdFyKEY4hNRQQcQ.text: One of my favorite steakhouses in Vegas. The bone in ribeye was very tasty but a couple of us had a little too much grissel this time. Everything else was fine. I'll be back.

8JXqX5PmgCZtSpJryZCGQw.text: great food, delicious shrimp and steak.. the lobster was best i ever had

SqC1NTJg23OjfIiscCH-Xg.text: Best steak I ever had, hands down. Pricey but worth it. Expect to pay about $100 per person when the bill comes.

xY2km1o3gNBi8B34K1Ydiw.text: If you are looking for an old school Las Vegas steakhouse, this is the place to go and Tom Kehoe is the server to ask for! Tom is awesome. We had a great dinner with wonderful service. Next time you are in Las Vegas you are missing out if you don't have a meal here. Loved it!

ewubuSf0xbQCIT76I1CCeA.text: There's always something interesting to see in Las Vegas.  The night BF and I went to Golden Steer, we saw a man pick up a streetwalker in the parking lot.  The interesting part was that, the street walker was an old man and he was wearing pink leotard and pink tutu.  I can't be certain but I think he also had a pink bow on his head. The whole incident took about 7 minutes and we couldn't stop staring!  When the lovely "couple" drove away, we decided it was safe to get out of our car and walked towards the restaurant.  From the outside, the restaurant doesn't look like much but inside, it was really nice.  I'm a sucker for ambiance and I really liked the old school and classy decor.  All the servers were dressed in formal uniform and they were very attentive.  To start with, we shared a bowl of Lobster Bisque.  It wasn't bad but it tasted slightly different from all other lobster bisque I've had before.  It was smooth and creamy but on the heavier side and somehow it tasted a little tart (kind of like sour cream).   For entree, BF had Petite Filet Mignon and I had Lil Cut Prime Rib.  We both ordered medium and both meat came out perfect.  The Prime Rib was HUGE and it was delicious especially with the freshly grated horseradish.  As for the Filet Mignon, BF said he's had tastier piece for much less at other restaurants. I believe him; the man always gets Filet Mignon at any restaurant that has one on menu.    Overall, I'd rate this place 3.5 stars.  I enjoyed the Prime Rib but the Lobster Bisque, not so much.  Also, we saw two of their staff hanging out and taking cigarette break in front of the restaurant - one before dinner and another after dinner.  I didn't expect that for this type of restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really cool and old school interior

YaNqZiK2LuskVlJFKyET_w.text: Finally made it for dinner after decades of Vegas trips and other steak houses.   Service was great and the food was excellent. Best part was the experience of dining where the stars and the mob of the past use to enjoy the riches of life. Old Vegas baby!

-0ShJAKyqn16uRUwItnYvQ.text: I was invited to the Golden steer while in Vegas on business by a local who is friends with my boss. The build up was incredible, the food was a little meh.   The decor is very old school vegas. You can almost feel the energy that previously occupied this space. You can picture this place on a busy Friday in the late 50's or early 60's. We were seated in a large room in the back of the restaurant that we were told was used a meeting room by mob members visiting vegas and some of the members of the rat pack. Pretty cool.  We ordered our food and were all surprised with amount of food that came out. The portions are HUGE. I ordered a filet that while huge was a little bland. The twice baked potatoes were good but tasted like they'd been frozen at some point. The desert was okay but also had a frozen taste.  if I was judging this restaurant on the food it would have been a 3 star review but the service was pretty awful. Just slow, unconcerned and borderline rude.   Not saying I would never try this place again but for the money there is so many options that would blow this place out of the water.

wpf0bIt_P4K_GOgmLr3K3g.text: Old world charm and good food combine to make this a Vegas classic. The ambiance alone is worth trotting over to what appears to be a hole in the wall restaurant in a rather less appealing part of town. The hubby and I tried it for a dinner out after a show and we were pleasantly surprised by the experience. I absolutely love love love the decor. When you walk in it's like walking back in time to when wood paneling and large leather covered booths were the epitome of class. The dimly lit dining room with the rich dark colors made my head swim at the sight of it (or maybe that was the wine). I imagined what it was like years ago when the Vegas elite frequented it and I don't think they have changed a bit since.   The service was impeccable. We couldn't have asked for a more attentive waiter. The food was scrumptious. We ordered the shrimp cocktail and oysters Rockefeller, both were divine. The oysters were lush and perfectly seasoned while the shrimp were fresh and cooked to the ideal texture. The bone in ribeye was delectable. I am a ribeye fanatic and I order my steaks rare which makes it easy to tell if a cut of meat isn't up to par. There was plenty of marble in the meat and although the outside wasn't as crispy as I usually like it, the taste was incredible. My husband ordered the filet and enjoyed his as well. The portions were ample and hearty. I relished the evening of divine food and vintage glamour.

jWqZBayEbzZ5sWBQ9Qo_uQ.text: Came here looking for a good steak and found it! Sort of... It's all al la carte here. I ordered the prime rib and my boyfriend got the rib-eye. His steak was awesome! Cooked perfect and full of flavor. My prime-rib; however, was not very good. My first bite was awesome. Tender, moist and pure perfection. But as I ate on, I hit spots on the steak that tasted chalky. I don't know what the deal was, but it wasn't right. It didn't even have the texture of meat! Luckily the steaks here are the size of a side of cow so I was able to share my bf's steak.   The chopped salad was so so. Not your typical steakhouse salad. The only thing steakhouse about this salad was the price. It had large pieces of lettuce, garbanzo beans, tomatoes, and lettuce. I didn't even finish it and I shared with my bf!   The service isn't great either. Our waiter was not attentive. We had to ask for refills twice. He basically dropped our food and never came back until he had something else to drop off. Overall, the experience was okay. For the price, I'd go elsewhere.   And for those of you wondering about the bread basket.  That was average too. We were given three halves of a mini baguette. I'm sure it was good at one point but it was hard by the time it got to me; wasn't fresh  :(  Overall, I'm not impressed. But if you find yourself here, go for the rib-eye! :)

qKzWMPJ4zPqdxSXYcCLk_Q.text: I love restaurants with history, I thinks it's cool to dine some place that was a fixture so many years ago. The food is more 4 stars but I kick in the extra one based on the excellent service and history at the golden steer. We started off with table side Cesar salad, which was great ! I had the large filet and it was cooked perfect and served in an interesting au jus. The best part is its considerably cheaper then the strip options like blt cut craft etc. While there are dozens of those types of restaurants throughout the country, there is only one Golden Steer ! Make sure you visit for your piece of history.

ll1S1TlywCwyIyUcu4rk-A.text: I have been to the Golden Steer now 3 times and I would return.  The service is impecable but a little slow, but I don't mind that when i am spending a decent amount for dinner.   The last time I went was with a girlfriend, who loves to flirt and we got free bananas foster!    The food is some of the best food that I have had in Vegas.  I have had the escargot here and it is pretty tasty.  We always order the table side caesar and it is fantastic because the dressing is made from scratch right in front of you.  I don't usually order caesar salad because more times than not it is from a bottle and tastes terrible.  The steaks are very tender and flavorful and the sides are big enough to share.  The bananas foster is excellent and is also served tableside.  They add a little orange zest to the sauce, which I have never seen before, but it adds a nice little zing to the dish.    We love taking out of towners here for dinner mainly because it is fun to reserve the rat pack booths, but next time I will request Elvis's booth (just found out that he used to eat there).  Love the old timey vegas ambiance!

yDzHuGgwAfCuRdGoji18ww.text: Great ol school atmosphere, melt in your mouth New York strip and bananas foster to finish up. I will definitely be back..

Wm0Q1UuUnODXkcSQaciNMw.text: The food was good and service was good. The wine selection by the glass was very slim.  The whole room was so loud that it was difficult for us to hear each other at the table.  Nothing bad but nothing remarkable, so I probably wouldn't go back.

Vnhnd__N3tr1ApP0YR1Inw.text: Probably on of the best steaks I have had in a long time.  I had a filet medium well with the peppercorn sauce and I could tear it apart with my fork--yes medium well!  Great flavor!  The other side dishes were perfect including even the smallest things like the bread.  The deserts everyone got were good.  The service excellent and what made the experience the best was I did not have to pay!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More good food
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. History. Rat Pack, Elvis etc.

osZuhb71IBQcec9P-nIOjQ.text: A hidden little treasure the steakhouse was the Rat Packs favorite place to dine and drink.  Great food & great service.  If you're ever in Vegas don't miss out of on this great steakhouse.  Nostalgic and impressive ambience

1R_JGSOWnNihty4fgZJG8w.text: Great steak, great flavor. The lighting is really dark in there but that's just a side note.

m5srs6LvdSbDDFVCpcWp_A.text: I recently went to Vegas for a conference and was more excited about the restaurants than the shows or gambling. Earlier in the week, I ate at Hell's Kitchen and was totally underwhelmed. The best meal I had in Vegas, and one of the best meals I've ever had, was at the Golden Steer.  According to the website, The Golden Steer is "Las Vegas' oldest steakhouse" and they carry on the tradition of old-school steakhouse dining. It's located at the north end of the strip near the Stratosphere.  Our service was spectacular. We had a waitstaff of at least 4 people who were knowledgeable, helpful and entertaining!  I love Caesar salads and I make them all the time. I've been perfecting my recipe for over 20 years. The Golden Steer Caesar was easily the best I've ever tasted. The chef made the salad at the table so I picked up a couple improvements for my own recipe.  Our sommelier recommended the Duckhorn Merlot. I'm typically not a Merlot drinker but it did not disappoint! Everything is a la carte so we had the sauteed mushrooms (in a pool of delicious butter sauce) and fresh cut fries, which have caramelized onions. I had the one of the specials which was filet Oscar (which is topped with asparagus, hollandaise and crab). It was perfectly cooked and the sauce was delicious! Everyone at our table had some kind of steak and everyone was blown away by the quality and preparation of their steak.  For dessert we shared cherries jubilee and bananas foster, again it was prepared at our table. By then we we had very little room to eat much more but both desserts were finished anyway.  Because if it's location, it could possibly be overlooked but it's totally worth the cab ride if you're staying on the south end of the strip or anywhere else in Vegas for that matter!

hPYNAfVdCSj8Ot7QrWZX8Q.text: Two words encapsulate my entire review: old school. We were blown away upon entering the Golden Steer: lipstick red leather booths, mammoth Jeroboam bottles of Perrier-Jouet and magnums of champagne utilized as decor, dim lighting, prerequisite steers bolted to walls, and a decidedly retro vibe. Not an iPhone in sight. This steakhouse delivered in spades to a family of vegetarians (one member of our party opted for steak). Everything about the Golden Steer was old school--menu, ambiance, attentive waitstaff, music, and milieu. We ordered salmon, halibut and the aforementioned steak--all good and all memorable. Service was impeccable (Ali and numerous other attendants).  The vibe was so strong and seductive that we adjourned in the bar following dinner for another hour of retro diversion.  Don't be fooled by the seedy exterior of this upscale restaurant. My favorite restaurants are all in the Wynn and I put the Golden Steer in the same category of par excellence. The Golden Steer is both a restaurant *and* an experience.

TT4k96rlgO2w6Tza88RNGg.text: Looked for steakhouse that was open late and Yelp gave this place high ratings. Totally love the Rat Pack vibe. The staff was polite, knowledgeable and friendly. They had a difficult patron sitting in the booth next to us and the waiter showed great patience. The food was amazing! Been to most of the big steakhouse chains and this place was at the top of the list. Definitely coming back again.

4AqpMdYl_MafIVk8IE2HUw.text: Brought hubby for a yummy steak before he out in the field for 45 days!! It was perfect.  Creamed spinach was amazing.  The seafood appetizer was delicious too.  Cherry jubilee for dessert... first time I've had it. Cherries were good but not my thing.  We will be back... matter of fact I want steak now!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite filet
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porterhouse

FNKBrB2ZrkdmfPZUuVgQZg.text: This is an excellent steak house.  We started with half a dozen oysters, and they were served beautifully with all the condiments that you'd expect.  We had the chateaubriand for two carved tableside.  How exactly can you go wrong?  The meat arrived just as we asked for, cooked to perfection.  The gentleman that carved the steak had clearly done this before, and he prepared and plated the food nicely, which was being served with a side of vegetables.  The veggies were also prepared perfectly.  They have a very nice wine selection, and we were able to find a bottle of zinfandel that went great with our dinner selection.  The big question you'll have to ask yourself is, is it worth the money?  If you at all flinch about spending a lot of money for oysters, meat, veggies and wine, then you do not want to come here.  If you like nostalgia, pictures of old Las Vegas on the wall, and fantastic service, this is a great place for you to consider.  So, there's the issue, what's important to you.  For me, once was probably enough, but I am glad that I went.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3DDPmTLMm5dHpdgZ2srVKQ.text: Always the best! I've sat where Marilyn & Sinatra sat - definitely cool establishment but amazing filet!

QiHUsGUADWNbT6Hb-L8zAw.text: Definitely need to call for reservation before entering. Walk in are not recommended. There was no one there. But for a party of 4. We were told there is 2 hour wait. Also I don't think it would be great for kids. Although my kids are in teens. Still not recommend for children's. It's dark and heavy cigar smell.

3RoLzO6KycwckUhpDWKVUA.text: My husband and I always wanted to try this restaurant since we moved here 10 years ago. We finally had a chance to celebrate our 11th wedding anniversary. Our waiter recommended their specials which are steak Oscar and lobster thermidor and Caesar salad. We took his recommendation and to our surprise. They are all cooked to their perfection. But the Caesar salad was a bit too much dressing but the flavor was good. The waiters were attentive to our service. Not too many restaurants know how to make or serve lobster thermidor any more. The last time I tried it was my 1st wedding anniversary with my ex husband and that was 42 years ago.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fHp2j6ULWErW6K7nt6iPPQ.text: Old Vegas, baby! The atmosphere and decor is classy and very old-time Vegas. Steaks are the best! All the food is delicious. My husband and I have been there many times and are always treated as if we are the only ones in the room. We had our wedding reception there 11 years ago! We now live out of state, but if there is only one place we can stop for dinner when we are there, it will be Golden Steer. The bar is also incredible and the drinks are generous. I tell everyone about it and it never disappoints. I highly recommend you don't let this one slip by.

MYufYOVrgHHl8vZQwwfi7g.text: Old school eating at the oldest steakhouse in Vegas!  My companion and I greatly enjoyed our steak dinners at this restaurant. My friend went for the 22oz Ribeye while I opted for the leaner 16oz New York Strip. A giant glass of aged Chianti and a couple slices of warm bread later we received our meals. Aside from the red wine, our giant slabs of meat were the only contrast to our predominantly white dinner setup. It really makes the meal stand out, and for me to dive right in!  Both of our steaks were cooked to perfection and I was especially satisfied with mine. No need for extra garnishments, no steak sauce. Just pure, unadulterated meat. I really wish I could have ate it all but I easily hit my limit. I also wished that I had room for dessert after seeing a few of the waiters flambe some Cherries Jubilee right next to us.  Our server was very attentive, informative and made sure our glasses of wine stayed full. His formality is top notch and really reflected the establishment well. I really appreciated the recommendations, if you're open minded, definitely hear the staff out when inquiring about what to order.  Attentive and well-paced service accompanied by excellent food is a win-win for me, especially in a city where I always lose. I will definitely be back for more during my next visit in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium-rare. I&#39;m so happy!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY Strip, 16oz of deliciousness, $54

zCoGuKnlUv1vQPxSSHWCAQ.text: Had the opportunity to eat here unfortunately it was so crowded that I had to eat at the bar or the bar area if you will the food was fabulous everything was cooked to Perfection the wait staff was amazing I think I will definitely go back and sit at a table where it is more comfortable and enjoyable I would definitely recommend reservations ahead of time but they were able to squeeze Us in within minutes of our call shame on us for waiting to the last minute and thank you for accommodating prime rib was a hit at the table and my steak was fabulous

D--9X7DskMUi3_uuPW5FGQ.text: Not worth the hype! Prime rib was very dry old fashion and tasteless very disappointed! Service was good! Vegetables were steamed with no flavor and for Only $11.00! The best thing was the cherries jubilee! Don't waste your money unless you want a great dessert!

6oZL4sv8KBrv_SLXyP3C5A.text: Amazing!!! simply Amazing!!!  This place has a old school Vegas feel to it but is so great and has a lot to offer.  The food, drinks and service are unbeatable.    You should plan to make a reservation but if you don't then you may be able to get a spot in the bar area.    Either way you'll be happy

y5JI7kYIaUUIocFy2uKf2w.text: How can you not rate this place 5 stars!!?? The ambiance, the service , the history... THE FOOD.... literally every aspect and every detail is worth every penny you pay here! This place has been here since I can remember and has been just as perfect every time I have been. Highly recommend to anyone looking for an amazing steak dinner with amazing service and a historical Las Vegas restaurant to do it at.

TTWF2cWoifsYS4rbh7_sjg.text: Such a disappointment.  I had been looking forward to visiting this establishment since the reviews were promising and the overall history revolving around the Rat Pack and the icons of that era was intriguing.  Every time I visit Vegas, I plan and make reservations at establishments to check out their offerings of steaks.  On our last visit, my steak visit was The Barrymore and had a wonderful bone-in Ribeye steak so I knew my next visit would have to, at the very least, equal or rival the experience.  The Golden Steer is located on the north end of the strip, next to the Lucky Dragon Casino and west of the Riviera Hotel (sadly now gone.)  The exterior is easy to miss, given the drab strip mall front but the vintage steakhouse feel emanates old school Vegas the minute you step over the threshold.  Banquettes are lined with white linens, dim low lighting creates a cozy and romantic feel, candlelight flickering throughout.  The wait staff here also resonate old Vegas, dressed sharply in their b&w suits.  It made me wish I was born in that era of new music, big band, jazz,  A-list, and entertainment.  The menu encompasses typical steakhouse offerings: steaks, Italian, salads, appetizers, sides, and dessert.  I knew exactly what I wanted: 22 oz bone-in Ribeye steak.  When I placed the order, I requested medium rare but in hindsight, should have ordered it rare to avoid the possibility of it being too done and dry.  We also ordered the giant baked potato with all the fixings and the Chicken Parmigiana.    My steak looked amazing when it arrived so I was very excited to cut into it.  Imagine my shock when all the juices seeped out and covered my plate.  That was the first sign to me that the steak did not sit long enough.  My first bite was horrible: the steak was dry and chewy.  There was little to no marbling and the steak lacked any flavor.  My experiences with Ribeye is the thin layer of fat that weaves itself marking off several sections of the steak.  There was no evidence of this on my cut.  Unfortunately, I had to make do with the baked potato since that was very tasty chock full of butter, sour cream, chives, and bacon.  My friend's Chicken Parm was also very good: it was moist, tender, and the layer of melted cheese a blessing since it imparted even more goodness to the dish.  It was accompanied with a side plate of 3 deep fried raviolis in their marinara sauce, a slightly sweet and acidic tomato base, which I am more inclined to.  I was very disappointed with my steak experience here.  Perhaps it was an off day, but when I am paying $55 for a steak, the expectation is to receive the entree accordingly to the pricing.  That being said, my friend's meal was good and the service prompt and friendly, especially that of the staff refilling our waters and clearing off the table so to them, an easy 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior, very cool
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Those rolls were damn good
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried raviolis and Chicken Parm

6xrsWz6EhhLRTkvVljdN7A.text: Are you looking for old school cool? Are you looking for the best steak in Vegas? Want to sit in the same booth that Frank Sinatra sat in before he'd do a show at the Sahara? Look no further than this glorious piece of Las Vegas culture and history. From the table-side prepared Caesar salad and the leather booths, everything here yells "Las Vegas Institution."   Looking at the place from outside, may be a tad concerning...There's a ton of construction going on and the area isn't the greatest, plus the vintage bulb-illuminated sign and surrounding shops might give you pause. But don't judge this book by its cover...  We came here on a Monday night, place was busy but not at all packed. Reserved the Frank Sinatra booth (seats about five comfortably), on the phone they said, "no guarantees" but the booth was available and we got immediately seated. (You can also reserve booth's once occupied by Dean Martin, Sammy Davis Jr., John Wayne and a whole host of other pop culture luminaries.)   This is an old-school dining experience (think Ruth's Chris or Morton's), but not so old school...They've expanded and updated the restaurant in recent years but at the same time have made sure the older part retained its charm - while not making it feel like your Grandfather's den (ok, it feels a little like Grandpa's den, but that's ok).  We came for both the food and ambience. Both were excellent.   The meal: Our server was good-ish, not great. We told him we were 1st-timers and he was relatively informative, considering. We ordered a few different types of steaks - a bone-in rib eye, a filet mignon, salad, and a few sides. Then the server pretty much handed us off to his table buser after taking our order...   Meal overall was great. Steaks were incredible, pricey, but easily the best we've had at any point in Las Vegas - and we've dined at almost every high-end steak restaurant on the strip. But...we were very taken aback by the taste of the creamed corn side.   Apparently they prepare the cream corn old-school style, with nutmeg and some other sweeter spices - the server did not mention anything about this when we ordered the side. And there is no mention of the way it's prepared on the menu. We would have sent it back, but as I mentioned the server pretty much disappeared for the last half of our meal (after the food came). Server also did not offer to remove the side from the bill when we asked him it about (after he re-appeared) at the end of the meal and the whole side remained un-eaten.  Aside from that, Caesar salad (made table-side) was also the best we'd ever eaten. (We ate at Rao's in Caesar's Palace the following night - we also ordered a Caesar to start there too, but Rao's charged two dollars more for one that wasn't made tableside, wasn't nearly the same size and tasted like it was pre-made.)     Steer management, your server cost you a 5 star review because of no mention (by him or on menu) about the variation/prep of the creamed corn - thankfully, no one in our party had a food allergy to nutmeg...  Worth the trip, will definitely return again. Won't order the creamed corn.

dAR-7v4Ci2Y8d9eKQLE6kA.text: Met early for business dinner. Got drinks at the bar to start. Bartender (forgot his name but Hispanic guy) scooped ice and didn't use an ice scoop. Barf!!!   Shortly after we went to be seated in dining room and specifically asked to transfer tab. Same bartender said they don't do that and they are separate and we had to close out. Then he hands the credit card machine to the one paying and asked him to press the button equivalent to the percent tip he wanted to leave.  Bartender didn't bother telling him grat was already included for our party of 9. So embarrassing seeing someone so hard up for a tip scheming for money. Nobody goes there and wants to scam you out of a tip when they have no problem paying $60 for a steak so relax.   Go be a cabbie you sheisty hack..and wash your hands!   Oysters and apps were good. Table side caesar was nothing great. We only wanted 8, but they made 9, took the extra one away, and charged us for 9 anyway. Guess this is a tourist trap where they figure no one looks at the bill that goes on the company card anyway and that's how they make a few extra bucks that probably really adds up. 3 of us got steak Oscar (2 ordered medium rare and one medium) but all 3 filets were dry.  Tsk tsk. The guy that got the pasta enjoyed his dish though :-/.  Think it's just a place you go for the history and nostalgia.  The rest is out w old Vegas standards and in with the new cookie cutter garbage.

YKXir8Bbhv70LMXZcpeTIw.text: A truly hidden historical gem and relative secret as it is off strip and quite under stated from the outside.  As Vegas old continues to expand toward Vegas new this forgotten restaurant will surely be top of the list again.  Get there while it's still reasonably priced.  The presentation of food is inconsistent with modern standard...table side prep of Caesar salad is awesome, but that's tempered with a main course presentation reminiscent of room service.  The sides are a decade or three outdated, thankfully the dishes taste awesome and the historical ambiance is really unmatched.  I mean, the wood paneling at first feels dated but that's part of the whole point - relish the opportunity to dine as you would have back in the past.  This place won't be under appreciated too much longer, get there before it's another overpriced Vegas attraction.

OzGpgq2MnUcpbOXYffr_5Q.text: Fantastic atmosphere, perfect food and thanks to Scot we had amazing service! Filet mignon was absolute perfection. The macaroni and cheese was divine. Caesar salad is a must have!

SidnDCgAuhaqTo8_Bw98_A.text: Places looks way classier on the inside than it's shanty look outside. If you like rib eye you'll love this place. I had a rib eye which was seemingly flawless. Great ambiance and solid service.  A tad pricey but better than the Capital Grille. Love this place! Can't wait to talk my wife into it again. Clean restrooms and awesome decor. The manager actually came around and asked how our service was. Solid gentleman. Great great place!

aVySEgGkcyy5HsJuhSzr6w.text: On arrival at the Golden Steer, you may question yourself. The exterior is sketchy, it seems as if you are far from the glamorous Strip, and nearby Circus Circus looms, questioning your decision with its white pillars of 1970's hotel blocks. You walk in and things still don't seem right at the bar. Your barender is distant, demanding; you can't transfer to your table. It seems this is awkward.  However, you steel yourself, saying, "I made the right call. The fancy overpriced places on the Strip have nothing on here, this is Old Vegas, and Frank was right. If they were trading on name alone, the Steer would be gone. I have faith." And you would be right.  As you're led into the main dining room with your date -- or, as with me, my cousin -- you would be wholly validated. The world opens, angels sing, tuxedoed waiters do their thing, and all is right in an onomatopoeic universe where quality is rare and the Steak is too, capital 's' intended. Enjoy it.  Do not question your decision. From the moment you set down in your red vinyl banquette, your waiter treats you as if it is 1958 and the Steer just opened. Charm and discipline exude in equal measure as the oiled wood and red banquettes simultaneously place you on display for all to see and sequester your conversation in privacy unheard of in the modern era. It's a lovely experience.  If you're an old-school aficionado of the steakhouse as I am, you should convince your partner to order one of the most difficult of "old cuts" of steak to find -- Chateaubriand for two. This extra-thick cut of the tenderloin is sliced tableside and accompanied by wonderfully crisp-tender carrots, asparagus, and broccoli with Bearnaise and Hollandaise sauces that put the 50's to shame. The vegetables and sauces were excellent and worth the wait. The steak was out of this world good, perfect doneness and a complete delight. My cousin and I opted to add a twice-baked potato with each of us having half. It was a good decision, but nothing special.  We skipped dessert as we were quite full but enjoyed our experience immensely. As we were there early in the evening, our waiter guided my cousin around to some of the named tables and pointed out how they used to enjoy their orders and experiences. She and I sat at Oscar Goodman's table, which was fitting for our evening, and enjoyed the history and charm of the staff immensely. I wish more places like this existed in the world; but if they did, they wouldn't be as special, would they?  Thank you, and I will certainly be back when in town. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chateaubriand at the Golden Steer

Loxk8TuoWYssTZ7bzc8TOg.text: If you want unprofessional service and to be harassed then come here. My boyfriend and I decided to come here for a nice dinner as we are visiting Vegas. We got here right at 4:30 and were seated right away. We were looking over the menu when one of the waiters Daniel I believe came over to us. He asked us if we have been here before and I said no but I have been to Golden Steer Steakhouse in California before it closed down. And he blunty said we have no affiliation with them and walked to the kitchen. There I heard him making fun of me and laughing with a coworker about my response. So my boyfriend and I were shocked that the workers here would mock their guests. We felt it inappropriate so we decided to leave. And when I got up, a man was trying to stop me from leaving my booth. I told him I did not appreciate the worker making fun of me and laughing so I was leaving. And he was trying to tell me that they were not making fun of me. But I just wanted to leave and I took a step and the man grabbed my arm! He was not letting me leave. He said I just want to explain to you. And I told him no, you do not touch me and I do not have to speak with you. I am leaving. And after everyone's attention was caught he finally let me go. I could not believe this happened to me at this restaurant. I just wanted to leave and he was not letting me, it's not like I had ordered anything yet. Very unprofessional

2F8VSA44pLnRNnXdssMHIA.text: The Server Telling You To Tip In Front of Him! I'll start with the good- 1. I loved the ambiance and history of the inside. You get to sit in the booths of people like Elvis, Sammy Davis Jr., Sinatra, and the list goes on. This was very cool. 2. The ribeye (20.oz) was excellent, but it should be for $54.  The just okay- 1. The Caesar salad (overpriced). The filet, okay, but needed some more flavor. 2. The outside (a portion of a dilapidated strip mall). 3. The service- did check on us, but when we needed something they didn't take time to listen, and bolted off, then came back with the wrong things. The bad- 1. The $75 large lobster tale was overcooked, tough and chewy. The worst I have tried to eat at a restaurant (even including chains like Outback). Never again. The sides- I wouldn't recommend the $9 twice baked potato, the server said it could not be ordered without bacon, because it was made yesterday (ok, probably my bad decision). The asparagus was okay, but sauces cost extra (really?). 2. When the Bill Came, the server had a handheld credit card runner. He ran the card, and told us to put the tip on it Right Then and There. In front of him staring at us. Well, we hadn't expected that, and had not really figured out the tip. We were so shocked that we just guesstimated 20%. But, I really hated that whole thing. It was uncomfortable and tacky, not what you should get in a place as pricey as Golden Steer. 3. Holly Madison has a booth plaque...yeah, her. Has Gone Downhill....

t5vHQo9Fb3ChUOJZtY392g.text: So, um, yeah, I got violently ill after eating the table side Cesar salad. Bummer.   That said, the steak was excellent and HUGE - enough to split with my girlfriend. We ended up splitting the potato and the steak. She didn't get sick, but I did, which lets me know it was definitely the salad.  The vibe and decor are very old school. The service is black tie, which is nice. Everything is served a la carte, but the portions are so big that you can easily split everything, which ends up being extremely cost effective.  I want to give this place more stars, but I can't ignore the end result.

FwV2xg-LwOlhSR48XgZ7Xg.text: Prices were reasonable for a steakhouse in Vegas. I have mixed reviews on the service. The server was a little bit abrasive, but other workers were helpful and nice. I ordered the bone in rib eye and thought that the meat quality was really good; however, the meat lacked flavor. I have definitely had better, but I guess it's a good place to check out for the old school vibes.  Also, we ordered the caesar salad. It's made from scratch... meaning they make the dressing in front of you. It was an interesting experience and it tasted pretty good.

95rfmGMO9ucMFvlFf8d8Zw.text: A bit pricy but you get what you pay for.  Service is great, ambiance is unbeatable.  Sitting at the same table that Elvis, Streisand, or Sinatra sat at...can't find that anywhere else.  3rd time visiting, never had a bad experience.   Caesar salad will leave you craving it in weeks to come.  A must do when in Vegas.

-CQ7lGskwN6w6PFAfgFSyA.text: Best steakhouse I've been to!  I've gone to other steakhouses on the strip, but wow, I was mind blown!    This is a hidden gem located on Sahara between Las Vegas Blvd and the I-15.  It doesn't look like much on the outside, but you feel like you're in a mobster movie and stepped back in time when you walk in.    This is the spot where Frank Sinatra and other famous people would go on the regular.  I've heard from others that Frank Sinatra has his own booth here.  The servers were very friendly.  They definitely made sure we were taken care of.  At least 4-5 servers would come to our table just to make sure we were okay.    Their wine glasses are huge.  Their breads tasted like it was freshly made.  The steaks were juicy and cooked to perfection.  The whipped potatoes were light and fluffy.  We got the salad, 8 oz filet, 22 oz bone in ribeye, whipped mashed potatoes and creme brulee (with a hint of chocolate) for dessert.  Everything we tasted was purely amazing!  This is my favorite steakhouse by far.  Can't wait to go back!

Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22 ounce ribeye medium rare

_esT7m3Tj1-WgiX-ZmxdKA.text: Service was very nice in the beginning but then became very slow and almost inattentive.  Prime rib was pretty good but I have had more tender prime rib at less expensive places.  Creamed spinach was tasty as was the crab cocktail. Not worth the $700 for 5 of us!

hXaGHMlnj3DPz2BBPnAIOw.text: Regretted coming here immediately. I'll start with the positive. The food was definitely good quality. Had a steak that was quite impressive and the shrimp scampi were delicious as well. But nowhere near as good as the high prices would have you believe. S40 for three shrimp scampi? $60 for a steak with no sides?  Decent food isn't enough to mandate these prices. If I'm gonna pay that much, I want a restaurant that is center-strip with a view and a famous TV chef, lol. Or at least at a place that doesn't look like a 1970's liquor store from the outside.

7-Xb2qYZuXEaHz_iC_Uz9Q.text: MA$$IVE DI$APPOINTMENT.  I've been to the Golden Steer about half a dozen times. Last night was the first time in about  6 years. It has a retro, old school Vegas vibe. Unfortunately that's about all it has going for it now.  Last night was such a tacky, mediocre experience and when dinner for two was $384, it's just awful. The waiters were all very friendly and the meat was good, but that was about it. There is a plaque on the front entrance stating that proper dress is required. I can't imagine where they draw the line. The room had plenty of men in T-shirts and foam trucker hats and women dressed like they belonged with a guy in a foam trucker hat. The first chair my husband sat in had a shot seat cushion that collapsed.  The room is nice and dim and the atmosphere is continuously ruined by large families with plenty of young children on their phones taking flash photos or tables filming everything with their phone's  light on. In such a dim room, it's very annoying.  The room is swarming with busboys and waiters in oversized ill-fitting black jackets. I don't think I've ever seen so high a staff to customer ratio. Unfortunately, service was still slow and lackluster at best. I had to remind them of our drink order and I had to refill our wine glasses.   We started with the table side caesar salad for two. Instead of being prepared in a wooden bowl rubbed with garlic, it was prepared in a large pebble finished translucent plastic bowl like you'd see on ice in a cheap salad bar.  The bowl with the big plastic salad spoons created a loud annoying clapping sound.  I  didn't want to watch, just wanted it to end. The salad was fine but the table side presentation was just a bore, at best.  We had the Chateaubriand which came with lots of veggies and also ordered two lobster tails. The meat was fine. The accompanying hollandaise and bearnaise sauces were already coagulating in their little stainless gravy boats. The asparagus was under cooked and totally void of any seasoning, the broccoli nearly raw and equally bland and the carrots cooked to mush and again, no sign of seasoning. Think hospital food. A waiter asked how the food was and I told him how bad the veggies were. He kind of shrugged and said they're just steamed. Whatever. They're just horrible.  The lobster tails, $75 each were on the dry, chewy side. Not horrible but by no means excellent.  We had a bottle of riesling wine, one of the cheaper bottles on the list at $50. It was good.   As dinner concluded, two different waiters asked how everything was and I told them. One feigned surprise and the other understood. Both told me that they had no choice in how things were done there. Apologies and excuses are fine, I suppose, but they don't change the fact that it was a mediocre experience worsened by the ridiculous price.  They were kind enough to comp the wine and both offered us drinks or dessert. We declined. We just wanted to leave. The final bit of tackiness was when we paid. They bring a portable card reader to the table and it has preset buttons for the tip. 15%, 20% etc. It's a stupid way to take care of the bill. I'd much prefer that they just take my card and bring me a receipt to sign, like  a nice restaurant would do.    Considering all the dining options in Las Vegas, I can't think of a single reason to ever go to the Golden Steer.   We won't be back.

gg0kXYDV7M0znbdNlz8Opg.text: You got a love it. So oldschool. You almost expect to see the rat pack drinking martinis and smoking inside. I don't think they've changed things since this place opened- and they better not!The food is awesome!great steaks,great salads and the martinis are amazing. I always come here when I visit Vegas. It is one of my highlights. Don't change guys! Keep it real.

Poi8Cm2B2vi17VP8kaZUCA.text: Delicious and what a nice experience. I haven't been here in years. Can't wait to go back.

LVfziLh6tx-zqmZABCtLQw.text: We went to this restaurant looking for the nostalgia of the Vegas of old. It is definitely old fashioned and that part was cool, minus the fact that it was really dirty. The food itself left a little something to be desired. Our steaks were very salty, the lobster was very rubbery, and the creme brulee was literally cold, chunky and brown. The waiter(Tom/Tommy) was going to get us a wine list, never did. He barely even came back to the table. He wasn't very personable and waited over my shoulder as I entered in a tip and also pointed at the receipt showing me which gratuity examples there were for him. I found it to be very rude and was really disappointed. We came to see a restaurant from a lost time, we saw it, but everything else was a miss, we will not be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée.....cold,chunky, and brown. They comped it, but it was after I had taken a bite and gagged.

hkpPrI0T2o5JfEAl2mcRxg.text: If you want an excellent steak with all the fixings, this is your place. It is a throwback to the olden days of 1950-60s Las Vegas. Nothing has changed.  Dim lighting, red banquet booths, dark paneling, old time pictures of the Rat Pack and other celebrities of bygone eras.The place was packed. Make sure you have a reservation or you could be waiting in the crowded bar for over an hour on a Monday night! It seemed like we were the youngest people in the room and we are not terribly young ourselves! Had the yummiest bread ever and then a magnificent petite filet mignon, cooked perfectly medium rare. My partner had a huge 22oz rib eye which he said was one of the best steaks he ever had.  We shared the loaded humongous baked potato and added some asparagus for greenery. It was alot of food and a fantastic meal.  A fun blast to the past. We sat in the booth frequented by Pat Morita and our host was full of hilarious stories about his visits. It was a entertaining tasty evening.

4UMPELgGGwJ1N64EelZI9g.text: Old time Vegas is persevered at the Golden Steer Steakhouse.

Qzf2mO2SnF02y18WMIYwSw.text: Wow, was very disappointed.  I ordered a strip steak, $48.00 and a side of broccoli $8.00.  NOt that I mind the prices. But I do mind when the service is terrible and the food does not come out the way I order it.  I had ordered my steak "well", the server suggested that I get it butterflied.   I agreed.  Then I had asked to have my broccoli triple steamed, I said I want it muchy!  Any way the steak came out still bleeding and not butterflied, and the broccoli, well was still crunchy!  Not complaining I just didnt eat much of my steak, and still there was no questions asked of me.  Anyway I don't recommend this place!

bRbItWCZE2kDIdA97rpKyQ.text: My Birthday dinner was disappointing; ceasar salad tasted like too much mustard! Prime rib was rubbery, however, drinks were excellent. Not even a complimentary birthday desert.

Ubyz4MT2d9P3n2hvFzpGoA.text: Jay, gave me the worst service, ever! He reached across a couple of our guests to serve drinks and when he finally got around to taking our dinner order, at his leisure. All of our drinks were empty, and that didn't seem to bother him either. And amidst him taking the time out of his busy schedule to take our order( with 3 other tables in the place), he proceeds to tap his hand on his crossed arms. One of our group mentioned that we must have pissed off the waiter.  Steaks, tough! Feel free to check out my other reviews. I am never negative about restaurants, but this one took the cake. The only reason it was given 3 stars was because of the atmosphere. So if tou dont care about the food being good, or the service being worth a darn, well this is your kind of place!!

JroYFuNrtXXy4i3YryUMcg.text: Off of the strip; out of the 60s ...The Golder Steer is a classic old steakhouse.  The food was good and the prices are in-line with this level of Vegas steak house.  I would definitely recommend the Steer.  While it is not the top of the line food in Vegas it is a very good meal and the ambiance is a cool remnant of old-time Las Vegas

n_dSGgjgtx9FuBMQirAKDw.text: I love this place. You walk in and the place reminds you of a bygone era. We sat in a large leather booth with a Dean Martin sign behind it. Apparently we sat in Dean Martin's booth. How awesome is that. So we order the caesar's salad made table side. Seriously?  It was the best salad I've ever had. I mean its just greens right?  No. You haven't eaten a caesar's salad until Bobby has made one for you at the Golden Steer. We then get our prime ribs and lyonnaise potatoes. Awesome food. The finale however stole the show. The table ordered the bananas foster and the cherries jubilee. The cherries are likely the best dessert I have ever had. And i love good dessert. If you do nothing else, order the caesar salad and finish it off with cherries jubilee. Seriously. It could all end then and you would have lived a full life. Bon apetit

bDOervbJiSeGdki-ozou2g.text: Great steaks!  Service was quick and the food was really good.

_KpVjq3UwWjq7Cf3zq5T_Q.text: This was a clear disappointment.  The main waiter had no personality, although all of his helpers did-which was the most pleasant part of the meal. We've eaten at many steakhouses in Town in the last 25 years and the quality in the meat served was mediocre at best. When you pay almost $50 for a steak you expect to be able to cut it with a fork. We won't return.

PYNrlKpntxCXPyHdsBWaGg.text: Great ambiance the service is top class.the food was delicious and the Cesar salad made at the table wonderful nothing but good things to say except the price is a bit much and the look from the outside is nothing like the class when you get in.

osD51aCiIBoyyaeQkSlKMw.text: I love this old Las Vegas landmark. I've been going there for many years. It is a steakhouse the way Las Vegas used to be. It's a couple hundred feet off the strip on Sahara. If you like a big traditional steak, this is the place for you.     I don't think I've ever had bad service there. I've always left happy.

MDGJlBhyIBVCrpicmgCA-Q.text: What a great experience!  Sat at Joe Dimaggio's booth The steak was fantastic But even better were the crab legs!  The lobster tail was huge! (16oz) Mark (our host) was great and our server Tommy was delightful.  Couldn't ask for a better experience!

557lYkbUToJoEJxBe7W_-w.text: Love, love, love this place.  It is as old school Vegas as it gets.  We go here every year on our yearly Vegas trip of debauchery and it never disappoints.  Oh, and the waiter is a DeNiro impressionist.  That NEVER gets old...    This is a must visit.

3d0Bdsh6ctWlojyWH61ygg.text: After 10 years of hearing good things about Golden Steer, we finally went last night with a friend visiting town for the MvP fight.  The hostess was friendly and immediately walked us to the Dean Martin booth.  Lighting and decor were exactly what I expected - perfect for that old-school, "Rat Pack" dinner experience.  Our waiter was soft-spoken and attentive, checking in on us 3 times between order and check.  We enjoyed the Rib Eye, Prime Rib (end cut), Chicken Parmigiana, stuffed mushrooms & creamed spinach - all delicious and cooked to order, though it's worth noting the creamed spinach seemed more like cream w/ spinach.  No room for dessert this time, so we've already agreed to share an entree next time.  Overall, a great meal.

1KpDSpT1UgVzx_i6K32_-A.text: My coworkers and I go here for a nice dinner about once a month and it is our favorite place in Vegas, hands down!!! The service is incredible, the steaks are amazing and their wine selection is top notch (for those that wish to drink). Things to try: chilled seafood appetizer, filet, Caesar salad (prepared table side), filet and lobster, and the creme brulee.

XpqEdMtQ1Y9fYiPw3pg57w.text: Sure, you could go to one of the steakhouses on the Strip that have been decorated to look like an old-school steakhouse... but for the same money, why not GO to an old-school steakhouse?  The Golden Steer looks like a total dive on the outside, but inside it's the room that time forgot. Everything looks exactly like it would have back when the Rat Pack was said to be among the Steer's clientele. Service is equally old-school - your glasses will never be empty and every crumb quickly swept.  The menu is equally traditional - steaks, creamed spinach, etc. It's cooked to order and tasty.  We've gone here to celebrate signing big deals, but we've also just gone to get a great steak. It's worth the cab ride.

CipR-tEGGunhuLqW-fxeNw.text: I've been here a couple of times, and it is hit or miss.  The last time I went in with friends, and 2 of us ordered Petite Filet Oscar Style.  The steak they brought us was defiantly not a Petite Filet, and we both noticed, but just ate it because it was there.  When we told our waiter, he told us we should have informed him as soon as they brought us our meal.  The wine list is average.  The Caesar Salad is the best!  The asparagus is plain, and the mushrooms are just ok.  For the price point, I would choose somewhere else.  You are basically paying for the atmosphere here.  If you are looking for some old school Vegas atmosphere, go here.  Our waiter seemed to be lost, and had a team of every single employee in the restaurant who insisted on introducing themselves the entire meal.  I prefer to have 3 to 4 people come to my table during a meal.  It feels less intimate with a tribe of servers, runners, and busers.  1 server, 1 runner, 1 busser, and 1 sommelier.

-N8Yoyq_0tdHu4iz1zjkJg.text: Plain and simple, good ole fashion steak and sides. The most simple you can get while getting all of the savory flavors of the meat.

5imNYXcz6Wzig3oontUYdg.text: Came here for my birthday tonight excited because I never have been (and being a vegas native) the lady that seated us was super pleasant and helpful, even pulled out an iPad for my nephew to watch a movie at the table so he wouldn't be all over the place our server kinda sucked forgot my sisters drink, didn't check on us, had to ask some one else to take our dessert order and for the bill, the place wasn't that busy and they have a milling people waking around... Whatever, then I asked the old bartender what way to the bathroom (that's wasn't doing anything) he was a snob and yelled "YEAH YEAH YEAH THAT WAY" ... I'll probably be back because the food was SO good but come on for a $450 tab you would think they would be on it...

N_Za47Mbeu7XkEv6tQ2EKw.text: This was not the experience I hoped for....  The filet mignon was excellent.. The rest was mediocre at best.  The "signature" garlic bread was not garlicky at all.   The creamed spinach was runny, you needed a spoon to eat it. The whipped potatoes were too thin and had no "whip".   For dessert we ordered the plain cheesecake and the cherries jubilee. The cheesecake was very flat and mediocre at best and the cherries Jubilee was runny and not good. Then I ordered a cappuccino that said it had 8 different liqueurs in it, however it was way too strong and was basically liquor, no cappuccino flavor.    The ambience of the restaurant is nice and it is definitely old school!  I loved the decor and the old leather booths. But if you're looking for a nice steakhouse with a good meal this is definitely not the place for you.   If you are looking for old-school ambience and mediocre food then go for it!

qi6qxyMxcJrgaLMqC_wdxg.text: My husband found this place on line. So glad we tried it! This will for sure be a place that we will return to every time we make it to Vegas. I got the prime rib. It was great. My husband ordered the surf and turf. That steak and lobster was AMAZING! They are also known for their table side Cesar Salad so don't pass that up. Even if just one person in your party orders it, 2 people can share.. it is pretty big. The decor is old school but in a CLEAN updated way.

UicqLb7Y42q8eKHq25E-cw.text: What a fantastic find in Las Vegas just 1 block off the strip on Sahara. The decor is old Vegas theme with the dark wood furniture and framed pictures of Stars from the bygone days. Steaks are their speciality and they are SPOT on. So tender you don't even need a steak knife! Although everything is A la cart, the choices are great. Huge baked potatoes, broccoli, asparagus, mashed potatoes. All yummy and cooked to perfection. We had never been there and went using a Groupon , and now that we know how great it is we will return. Service was excellent and a good time had by all.

JY7bhEwyr7jg7Y_6rTW_eg.text: Wanted to have steak while in Vegas. Found Golden Steer and decided to give it a try and oh my best I've probably had. Filet mignon was juicy and soft. Price is a bit expensive but well worth it and for Vegas not that bad. Highly recommend, will be returning.

CXsSxmp27_zJ6Dc7e5VuIA.text: Old school Las Vegas style steakhouse with the waiters in Tuxedos and they brush the crumbs from the white linen in between courses . This is a pricey steakhouse so come with s big appetite . I ordered the Chicken parmigiana  on my second visit here since I had previously had the prime rib and it's very good but I think $29 for a piece of chicken & 3 ravioli is a little crazy . I really wanted to come back here for the banana fosters & cherries jubilee and I wasn't disappointed . If you have never been here it's s great place to celebrate special occasions and the dress is nice casual /dressy . Make a reservation online this place gets booked .

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizer &amp; salads

FX1bjA1AMNBdjPuqV_DM-Q.text: What does old Vegas look like? Well just like this romantically classy restaurant cause I doubt much has change about this restaurant since old Vegas.  Menu is traditional, service is traditional, and love the old school ambience.  So unlike modern fine dinning, this place want you to enjoy the meal and experience it not as the appetizer before the main event but as the main event.  I love table side cooking, and felt that it's a big lost for modern fine dinning experience, unless you are here.  Yes, they do table side cooking! Only thing they could do better is if the prices were 20 years old too! I kid, but the prices aren't bad at all and cheaper than most fine dinning establishment on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2znB8DCuyom2KJvsIn_kSQ.text: Great place with a fun history! Had a great steak dinner here with a fun table side Caesars salad presentation and the salad was also very yummy!   Steak was done well and we had the creamed spinach which might have been the best I ever had!   The baked potato was very large as promised and we even get to sit in Sammy Davis's booth!

LuUvM48tJhWrOOgD8Wdolg.text: As i catch up on my reviews to all the wonderful places i have recently been, this one is at the top of the list.....and most locals (and loyal Vegas visitors) certainly know about this long time treasure....the Golden Steer.  I have to just tell everyone point blank that everything here from the service to the entrees are top notch (and they know it).  The wait staff are professionals, they know their product inside and out, they have the gift of making each dining patron feel like royalty. The meat is prepared beautifully and near perfectly ...it IS a steakhouse ya know they are certainly savvy in their own business. If you order a dessert it is prepared right in front of you (flambe and all). To all those in the Yelposphere who are debating on whether to try it out......it's worth the money you spend. How many places can you truly say that what you spend was actually 100% WORTH it?? Tell 'em I sent ya....

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-1wpPzUg7Vsi9GcujPjEiQ.text: Wow!  I'm such a fool!  I'm born and raised in Vegas and have thought about coming here many times and never went through with it. My wife and I are celebrating our 10th anniversary and I have her a list of restaurants to choose from for our dinner.  I'm so happy that she chose the Golden Steer as it was freakin' amazing!  Humberto and Ali were very professional and took great care of us.  We started off with escargot and shrimp cocktail (amazing) then she got a filet and I got a bone-in ribeye (amazing) with mushrooms and asparagus.  Had a great bottle of Chilean wine too.  Of all the restaurants we've been to this is the best.  We loved the ambiance, service, prices and food.   If you want "old school Vegas" with great taste and service then this is your place!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Bday!!!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the steaks here
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5ZVgCx8dZcb50ezkiwOPeQ.text: Golden Steer AKA the oldest steakhouse in Las Vegas!   I've been here twice for birthday celebrations and both times have been quite enjoyable.
