Ambiance: Classic, vintage fee - you feel like you've gone back a couple decades. Dim lighting makes an intimate setting for a nice formal dinner.  Food: Prime Rib is a specialty on the menu but I've had the bone-in ribeye twice and am obsessed. Perfectly seasoned and cooked to the temperature of your liking. Never overcooked or undercooked - True steak professionals! Their sides are delicious too - I've tried the mushrooms, whipped potatoes, and creamed spinach. Their seasoning is definitely on point here!   Service: Nothing memorable (...TBH) however no complaints   The steak here is So. Dang. Good. I'll definitely be back just for the delicious food!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushrooms
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib

Ft0vVIxp8fnbW105DZopsw.text: Perfect steak house in Las Vegas , thanks to Dan and Ali their service was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Mh7AMi5IVijQnlu6SIhPRg.text: I went here for my birthday for the first time.  I had read great reviews and wanted to try it.  We had the filet mignon, the ribeye, ceaser salad, mashed potatoes and creamed corn.    The best part of the meal was the cream corn. It was amazing and I considered returning just for that.  The steaks both really lacked in flavor.  The rib eye was tough.  The Cesar salads were great.  They make the salad dressing fresh at your table.  I wasn't prepared for all the ingredients (like raw egg and anchovie paste) but it was really good.  I think I would almost rather not even know those things were in it.  The mashed potatoes were pretty good.    I didn't think the steaks were worth the cost.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pazWS5VND6gDH_0Zf_EyBg.text: I would be hard pressed to recommend a better dinner house than Golden Steer.  We went last night on the recommendation of a friend, and we were very impressed, not only with the food, but with the ambiance as well.

bP5IrQv0OxMZNZKupgQCsw.text: We heard about this place from a friend. It is very sketchy looking on the outside but when you go inside it's like fine dining back in the days. It's a classic place with booths waiters in suits. Everyone was friendly but service seemed rushed. We ordered the table Caesar salad for two, 22oz ribeye , lobster tail, Mac n cheese, and twice baked potato. Caesar salad was amazing, the steak was delicious and so were the sides but the lobster tail although big, it was over cooked. We shared everything it was more than enough. My husband got a slice of cake and candle for his bday. Wine I believe I got merlot by the glass about $15/glass and my hubby drank Stella $7. Overall it was good experience! We will come back next year ... with stretchy pants :)

E5L9PkCyXXQPqFxXYXS0JA.text: On the review they say "Dog ALLOWED."  When I walked inside.  They told us it's only for service dog.  A wrong indication to confuse people who are pet lovers.

ckTMqCdF8iQA84RaFxKGpw.text: A Vegas icon for 60 years, don't let the location or outside fool you. A culinary oasis awaits you inside. Dark and intimate with linen  on the tables and booths named after Hollywood (and Vegas) famous...you are transported from the moment you walk in the door.   Greeted by Hugh, who didn't make me feel underdressed in my travel attire after a long day of airports and the dynamic duo of Scot and Andre who silently waited and watched to offer suggestions and bring each delightful morsel. The whipped butter and rolls to start followed by French onion soup.  I'm kind of a French onion soup snob and prefer gruyere topper to their Swiss but I pushed it aside to get to the steeped onions and broth and it was excellent.  The special was the petite filet Oscar which I ordered medium with a twice baked potato. It came with asparagus, which I don't like and asked them to leave off.  Everything was excellent and I couldn't finish it all.  I want to come back with a food partner and share the meal and end it with the bananas foster. I got to watch it being made but for one person it is a bit much.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Petite&#34; filet Oscar (8oz) and twice baked potato
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corner Table, best seat in my opinion

vUzEyeU4EktNFkbLCpHtbw.text: My wife and I were out for a drive and we were passing by the Golden Steer and I asked her if she ever ate there. She said yes, about 30 years ago. I said I have never been. She said she would take me for dinner one night. Well that day came and I was looking forward to a good steak. We arrived and were seated right away. I have to admit the decor did bring back the old days. Yes, "old blue eyes was playing". Our waiter/waiters set us up right away and after a few minutes took are orders. Wife's was the Chicken Parmesan, I went for the 24oz Porterhouse with a mixed salad and their big baked potato. Now mind you, there is two of us. They brought the rolls out to start and only bring 3 for two people, have to question that theory! Then my salad came out and looked big but then I noticed the plate was just small so lettuce kept falling off. Next the main courses came. Wife's Chicken Parm was just that, chicken, cheese, sauce and a side of ravioli, 3 of them again, not two, not four 3. Pasta would have been nice.  Now to my Porterhouse. Just like the salad the plate was to small for the steak. Hard time cutting it and keeping it on plate. Would have helped if the steak knife was sharp. Don't get me wrong it was good but I've had better and cheaper. Next I went for the baked potato. Took the first half and started to eat. The first few bites were just right but as I got to the middle it was still hard, not cooked through.  In a place like this that has been around since the 50's and the prices the dinner should have been spot on. Doubt if we will be back anytime soon.

oaYR1ntoixnJDjPPoaYjww.text: This place is amazing.  A definite throwback to the days of old.  Golden Steer is located in a small and unassuming strip mall.  When you walk in, you're transported back in time.  The bar is right in front of you and the dining room is to the right.  We had a large group and got the Prix-Fixe menu option two.  Toasted ravioli were tasty, marinara sauce was good. Stuffed seafood mushroom caps were also very good.   Caesar Salad was made tableside, only negative was our server did not call attention to the salad being made, so most of our party missed out.  New York strip with whipped potatoes.  Normally I'm a rib eye or prime rib fan, but the NY strip was huge!!  Hands down the best NY Strip steak I have ever had!!  So juicy, soft, and flavorful.  I gave my dessert away since I don't really eat sweets, but I'm told the Chocolate Cake was devine.  I highly recommend the Golden Steer to anyone wanting great food, great service, and great atmosphere.  I'd much rather come here than go to a place in a strip hotel.

oqAMFBe3JPBr-EdgJH_oOg.text: Absolutely loved it!  The atmosphere and decor are unique, unlike other high end steakhouses which are indistinguishable from one another. Impeccable service from the highly professional wait staff.  Pros: The server who was deboning a Dover sole thought it was slightly undercooked. He served it, but immediately put in an order for another one. He was right, but it was definitely edible! But the second one was perfect. Love love love the mobile credit card machine which has been used in other countries for decades! Bravo, Golden Steer!  Cons:  Guests wearing shorts, baseball caps, and getting louder and louder, behaving like they were in a local bar.  They should be seated in a separate section!!

0xOnUvrqQj6BkRoK5ZDhuA.text: OLD SCHOOL STEAKHOUSE  serving up melt-in-your-mouth meat!  The steak was like butter. I don't prefer sauces on my meat but I gave the peppercorn one a try on the side, but decided the beef was so good it didn't need anything to mask it's flavor and I ate the whole 22 ounces just plain. We sat at the bar and the service was super friendly and attentive. Don't be scared off by the flashy neon exterior this is a classic steakhouse with bowtie servers. My only complaint and the reason for holding back a fourth star is they close up kind of early for a place like Vegas. By 11:30 they had turned the lights out cleaned up and were ushering us out the door. So there is room for improvement...but the steak was one of the best I've ever had!

f8aLE2eNvL1tgP_2ExBIMw.text: This place.   Steakhouses in Vegas are in my view kind of a scam. Like everything else there they cost a fortune and eating in a casino basement, regardless of food quality, just doesn't seem that cool. And if you have even basic skills, or skills you can pick up by watching YouTube, and know where to buy quality meat you can cook a fantastic steak on your own grill for a small fraction of what you pay in Vegas. And even if you want to get a steak at a steakhouse in Vegas at the better ones quality is pretty consistent in terms of the meat so you're paying for brand, or to eat where so and so eats, or sides and appetizers.   In other words, you're paying for the scene not for some meal you can't produce yourself.   But, steakhouse scenes can be a fun experience and this one is tops. It's off-strip, old-Vegas, and looks the the part (if you want modern, sleek and stainless go elsewhere). Take an uber or taxi (the wine list is good, they have a great sommelier who can really help you find the exact bottle you want for what you're having, and parking sucks). And then enjoy.  This is an old Rat Pack hangout and it still has that kind of feel. You can imagine JFK dining in a back room and it's like you're stepping back in time with the furnishings and ambience inside. So while it's not cheap it's an experience worth paying for if you're into that kind of thing and the food is excellent. Really good (and really big) steaks, very solid standard sides, they do a real bananas foster dessert, and they make good old-school drinks the right way. Again, don't drive.   One thing that impressed me was that our server actually suggested we get one steak and split it rather than two when we were talking through our order - that's good service rather than trying to make the bill as big as possible service - and we should have taken his advice, we ended up with picnic lunch the next day for a desert trip.  Also relaxed not rushed service, this is not a turn and burn place.   But, regardless, this is not a cheap place but so worth it.  So look, to each their own, but in my view this beats the strip steakhouses hands down. Steaks are steaks, this place is costly but not outrageous for what you get, and the scene is just way more interesting than the "name" places on the strip.

OD_IeQeV1J1NpuOdt_lE5w.text: Lots of Vegas history in this fantastic steak house. The service is attentive and well versed in the establishment's offerings. We had an excellent dinner and thoroughly enjoyed our first visit to this Vegas landmark.

zhRDR9IBHf7bcHervSRjpQ.text: I never have room for dessert. Always 5 star service and beyond. Cant beat the ambience either!

g7HX10N3kAXMuIJ8qKp-dw.text: The Rat Pack - The Sinatra Booth - old Vegas charm so very much missed - and great food in a charming atmosphere, The Golden Steer has it all.  As they say don't judge a book by its cover well arriving at this non descript place from the 1950's on the corner of the strip a Sahara makes you long for Yesteryear when all of Las Vegas probably looked liked this.  Truly unremarkable as you drive up and enter then you are transported back to the days Frank, Sammy, Dean, and the boys swinging in for cocktails or sitting in one of the many red booths, or in our case our party of 12 is escorted to the back dining room where we have all the privacy in the world.   We sit and Joey our waiter begins the hey I'm not here to sell you anything extra I'm going to simply tell you what we are known for then let you make your own decision.  Those are words to live by unfortunately that's when Joey got rolling about the Shellfish platters, appetizers, etc and simply would NOT LET THE **** UP until I said listen we are all grown men, we know how to order a meal, please allow us to order whatever the hell we want in as many quantities as we want and shut the **** UP~! Again he interceded with the Have to have the Caesar salad mantra then you don't need 2 potatoes.. UGH if a guy wants to O.D. on starch allow him.  I almost replaced him but he finally got the point.   The Good:  Shrimp Cocktail, huge cold horseradish on side extra kick up tasty & Fresh 4 were enough for 2 persons $19.00  Escargots de Bourgogne | 16 fresh with sauce just enough to accent them without being overpowered  Alaskan King Crab Cocktail | 16 Hunks of crabmeat with same cocktail sauce that kicked up enough with butter made this a cant miss.  Caesar Salad made table side $11.00 per person was good - not spectacular just good  The Great Rib Eye Steak, Bone-in 22oz. | $54.00 4 of these were ordered to a man stated best steak they ever had.  New York Strip 16oz. | 50$  3 of these 2 absolutely perfect charred with temperature on the button flavor off the charts  1 was sent back overcooked then when returned it looked nuked then grilled quickly it as not consumed.   3 Filet mignon Oscars with crabmeat were all outstanding -  1 Market price $75.00 Australian lobster tail was simply OK a bit tough  Sides:  All excellent from the baked potatoes to the creamed spinach to the sauteed mushrooms, and twice baked potato they simply make each dish outstanding.   The Bad - the Steak being taken back and then returned unable to be consumed was a definite mark off.  Even had to tell them Take it off the bill at the end should have been done without asking.  Service was good after old Joey stopped selling me like a car salesman; it's not our 1st time dining out.  Private room for 12 of us was fantastic and rest of staff was A Plus.  Definitely on the repeat list when in Vegas!

0QWf4fZ4C_BqBvUUVmvIWA.text: Save your time and go somewhere else. What's the point of taking reservations if you don't honor them. I'm not talking 5 minutes or 15. Not 25 or 35. Not 45 minutes. Don't make people wait over an hour for a table. An hour after the designated reservation time. Just ridiculous and disrespectful.

UA8XQMIEdPBtEDlvDSwbHQ.text: Very pricey dinner and relatively poor food. Very disappointing. The bread was hard, dry and stale so we ordered garlic bread which was dry and covered  with cheese BAD #1. The caesar salad was bland BAD #2. the veal marsala was grizzly and tough with a brown buttery gravy on it which did not have any marsala wine in it  BAD #3, the prime rib was average at best BAD #4, the eggplant parmigiana was inedible-it was cut thick and was tough and rubbery  BIG BAD #5 &  it was left for the kitchen and minimally eaten! The sides were fair at best such as bland mushrooms, very buttery creamy corn and salty creamed spinach.  But the lamb chops were excellent as was the filet. After spending $750 plus tip, there is no reason anybody would return from our dinner party reunion.

dUrxaJdghFenwp6dYra1Gg.text: Old school. With great history, great food and service.  A must if you are a True steakhouse fan.   Not the tend glitz of the chefs in the posh hotels.  But a locals favorite and memorable expirence with real history

uUfW9j_BhhP_hzOuNvanew.text: Excellent old school steak house. Don't let the location or exterior deter you. It's excellent! Real Caesar salad made tableside and excellent steaks n fixings.

qheDg0VDAHCChtpEK92hZA.text: We celebrated my cousins 50th at the Golden Steer. Let's just say you will leave this establishment 5lbs heavier and pleasantly satisfied. There were 26 of us that night go dinner.  We started if off with the seafood appetizer, stuffed mushrooms and fried calamari.  All the appetizers were delicious.  We then had their Caesar salad which is made right there at your table.  I love anchovies so I was very impressed with the dressing.  I ordered the Oscar filet mignon.  All I can say is that it just melted in my mouth, it was so tender!!!! We ordered the twice baked potato, creamed spinach & steamed vegetables. I tried a little of everything, but I would definitely recommend the twice baked potato. It was crispy on the outside and creamy deliciousness on the inside.   The cocktails were good and strong just how I like them, and the service was absolutely impeccable.  We were all so full we couldn't even order dessert, but the table next to ours ordered the banana foster and it looked amazing!!!  They brought out a dessert for my cousin with a crazy sparkler on top.  Let's just say the evening was off to an excellent start.  Next stop Intrigue Nightclub to work off those extra lbs!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twice baked potato!!!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab stuffed mushrooms
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can I just say this Filet was amazing!!!

Gfm5F1F_FRbtWew6SS74-A.text: The last time I visited the Golden Steer it was for my birthday and it was a memorable visit. The Golden Steer is nostalgic, some of the staff has been there for decades and every time we've been lucky to connect with an old timer who will share a story or two about his time there. We struck up a terrific conversation with the maitre de one evening who graciously offered us a quick tour of the restaurant - I didn't want to interrupt the other diners so we asked him to share a story instead...he obliged and mentioned a back door a certain member of the infamous Rat Pack had to use. Fascinating to hear.   Besides all the nostalgia this place is fantastic. I adore dimly lit dining rooms with those terrific naugahyde booths that line the perimeter. They envelope you almost like a hug.  Steaks are excellent...bone in ribeye is my usual and the last couple of times we were smart to share it as the portions are giant. The baked potato, perfectly baked with all the fixings is by itself too much for two people. We've had the petite filet and New York as well, both equally delicious. Lyonnais potatoes are a treat.  Classic cocktails flow easily (plan for Uber or taxi, GS has them on speed dial).  We always finish our meals with the bananas Foster table side, it's a treat complete with banana liqueur, butter and brown sugar en flambe.  Sure there are other steak restaurants, but this one has history and a charm all its own.  What's even better is the location...no casinos or valet parking. Can't wait for the next visit!

6ntmx99UeGrQmOVxjCLfZA.text: The Golden Steer is hands down the best steakhouse in town. It is a vegas icon and no one can get steaks cooked to perfection like this place.

toJpSGZZAsHR2bN79uj8SA.text: Going through the motions. Past its Prime. Simply awful. These are but a few of the things that cross my mind when I think back to what has to be one of the worst dining experiences we have had in some time.   Having heard of the place from my father who had eaten there some time ago and having had a requirement for Prime Rib for my sons birthday, we thought we would give the Golden Steer a try. It was memorably bad, the kind of bad that has the whole table on edge and wanting to leave. Allow me to explain.....   From top to bottom the whole experience was terrible.   Service: BAD and got worse: . The waiter visited our table EXACTLY 3 times in the 90 minutes we were there. Since the wine list was spotty, I went for a beer. In this day and age it is not unreasonable to ask for the selection since no drink menu was placed on our table. More to the point don't roll your eyes at me either and look put out, how hard is it to say Bud, Bud Light, et al. (Seriously no local craft beers?).  The next and biggest sin in my book was not clearing the table between courses. When you see the appetizer plates, the salad plates sitting at the table, perhaps its time to clear before you try to WEDGE the next course in.  Clear the table BEFORE you ask about desert.   If the service was bad the food bordered on edible. It was by far some of the worst food I have had in some time.   The appetizers:   Toasted Ravioli: Not only was it clearly a food service product (Sysco perhaps) it was not properly fried so the interior was not completely melted. (Food temp seems to be an issue with this place too) The marinara sauce had a canned quality to it and was pretty much lifeless.   Shrimp Cocktail: Shrimp was decent and the cocktail sauce was just okay. I also appreciate the addition of horseradish which helped pump up the cocktail sauce.   Bread: First basket was okay, the second clearly was old. I could have taken an at bat against Madison Baumgarner with it.   Salad/Soup  Table-side Ceasar: While they did prepare ours as part of the larger party next to us (and honestly I don't expect the poor guy doing it to make just two for us) it was dull and lifeless lacking much flavor. The croutons tasted like they were from a prior decade.   Onion Soup: The broth was actually okay (more like an Au Jus) but again the issue of properly heating things reared its ugly head. The soup looked like it had been placed under the salamander and was never brought up to a proper temperature. The soup was just warm at service and that made the Swiss cheese clump within minutes into a curd like manner.   Mains  Prime Rib: Not a lot to say here but it was clearly NOT slow roasted but rather quick cooked. No seasoning and it was tough and quite chewy. The Jus had no taste either.   No desert as we were thoroughly disgusted at this point. Its clear that this place is on its last legs and perhaps needs to a featured restaurant on Kitchen Nightmares or Restaurant Impossible.  Either that our closed to put and anybody who is thinking about eating there out of their misery

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dishes stacking up because nobody could be bothered to clear the table between courses

fMQm19xW7HchdGqKc6XAKg.text: Great place but location is in an old strip mall.  Don't let that stop you.  Once you get inside it's first class and the waiters are dressed in tuxedos and suits. Steaks are the best.  We had T-bone, lamb, and their signature salad; delicious and done to perfection.  We also had the Golden Steer cappuccino with 6 liquers.   It was outstanding as was the service and the dessert.

BT-UXhp9I7icLnh3dKX6bA.text: Six of us spent 1 1/2 hours to wait for the best steak dinner ever! Yup we didn't have a reservation but the Bar had the best hospitality and kind bartender! The hostesses were great to attend to our wait. If your looking for "The Rat Pack" hangout this is it tell your friends

m80y2qGWqdMyglKz55jlRQ.text: Best LOBSTER by far!! We celebrated Valentine's dinner at this amazing restaurant. Yes the service was not great but it was worth it. The food was incredible!!! The wine was devine!!! And the main course was mouth-watering! So great to be a part of Las Vegas history. First Steakhouse in Vegas! You have to experience it for yourself!!! YUM!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon and the best Lobster EVER!!!!

7FD3uuyMBVPIFBSrubI3MQ.text: What better place for a wolf pack of five guys than to eat steak where the Rat Pack dined?!?  Sure, it wasn't on the strip nor it didn't have any flashy decor; rather, it was dark, walls plastered with pics of famous actors and actresses from the heydays of LV, oozing with rich history. If only the walls could talk ...  As for the food, the quality of meat they prided themselves on wasn't just fluff; the 22oz Ribeye with bone in was very juicy and flavorful. The medium rare steak cut with ease, and the amount of plump fat was just right.  Like other $$$ steak houses, my heavenly creamed spinach was a la carte. Ate it all up.  I'll have to come back again to see how consistent they are. Until then, fly me to the moon ...

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oqzJCt7ujcD7lq_5oJkzmQ.text: So, the next stop on my tour of old school Vegas steakhouses brought us to the Golden Steer Steakhouse tonight. After doing a bit of research and reading a fair share of reviews, I was a cautiously optimistic about what the evening may hold.  I have to say that, for the most part, this was a fine experience and I will certainly be back!  Ordered-  - Caesar salad ($12) - Whipped potatoes ($9) - Rib Eye Steak, Bone-in (22 oz.) ($54) - bread basket (complimentary)  (+) Ambiance and Decor are absolutely incredible! When setting up the reservation, I had requested the Frank Sinatra booth, if possible. Even though we were just a party of 2, they were able to accommodate my request! Usually, it is reserved for parties of 3-4 I was told. This was greatly appreciated! I was geeking out at the thought of dining in the same space where the 'Chairman of the Board' would dine as well! So. Freaking. Cool! The  bar area looked really sharp too! I can't wait to come back and enjoy some drinks here! (+) Service was off the charts outstanding! Everyone was attentive to our needs and checked in on us to make sure everything was good! Fantastic service all around! (+) The steaks were so tender and juicy and full of flavor! It's right up there as one of the best steaks I have ever had! (see pics) (+) Ordered one of the Caesar salads just to see them prepare it table side. lol It was prepared much faster than I thought and tasted great!  (-) those whipped potatoes were the only part of the meal that was not superb! They were actually quite disappointing and tasted like 'instant mashed potatoes'. Ugh. Definitely will avoid that next time!  It's a matter of when, not if, I will return to the Golden Steer! The steaks are big and tasty, the service is incredible, and the old school charm and history of the place is something I can't get enough of!!  I really went back and forth between 4 or 5 stars, which is why I wish Yelp! would institute 1/2 stars into the rating system. I will likely update after some more visits...so for now it will be..  4.5 stars!  Woohoo! Pretty f*cking awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y9IN1gyXE_JnCCULkt2G0A.text: LOVE the table side Caesar and Cherries jubilee!!  Been a while since I saw the Caesar down right !  The steak was good.  But worth the old Vegas glory days ( reminds me of old Hollywood ambience) WORTH the table side Caesar and Cherries Jubilee ( no crepes with this one just ice cream ;-)

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hPiz-DaggHohcITd39UfTg.text: We were recommended Golden Steer as alternative to eating at pricey hotel steakhouse. Located in a bit of a run down area. Close to Strip. Great old fashioned interior ambience, prompt seating with reservation and expedited ordering and delivery of food by very good wait staff. Cocktails were good, a little on the strong side. I didn't care for the Golden Steer, regular martinis were enjoyed. Shrimp and mushroom appetizers were good, filet was okay; dry and no real flavor, sides such as creme corn are average size and okay, creme brulee dessert was not very good, had an un appetizing dark filling, left with smoky and bland aftertaste. Prices were almost as high as hotel. They bring a portable credit card machine and wait, prefer to take our time and tip with out waiter present. If the food, specifically the steak, had been over the top I would have given higher stars.

Bz-XQcBoHNLEz_RSxJjqrw.text: What a terrible experience. We were so excited to try this restaurant for years. I made reservations telling them it was an anniversary celebration and asked for a nice table. We get the booth by the hostess stand that started the night. No one saying happy anniversary but again we were still being positive. We sit and wait 10 minutes before the server greeted us. He drops off the menu and leaves for another 15 minutes. He comes by never to share the specials for the evening as we get our salad and soup he doesnt offer fresh grown pepper.  He never checked back until we were almost  done with dinner. The restaurant wasnt busy but he had a table that seemed like his family as he was hanging out with. Had to ask for water several times as well as to ask 2 servers for our check. We get the check I tell him we had a groupon as he takes my phone which was also my purse and walks away with it. Then he brings back the check without my credit card or a pen. I get up to speak to the manager and all she says is sorry. That's it she sucked just like Henry which wasnt his name. We will never go back. The food was amazing but the services was the worse we ever had.

htQ6NvSm5y0TofLXUCV4Dw.text: The filet was absolutely perfect, you could cut it with a fork. The whipped potatoes were delicious and creamed corn had a unique flavor almost like Christmas.   Wait staff was friendly, helpful and checked in on us consistently throughout our visit.   This is a definite try.

eVdYfDJkCDhNl3SKYZZp2A.text: Went here with a few people from work. I ordered crab cakes for appetizer which weren't very good. Then for the meal I got filet mignon and mashed potatoes. To say the least I wasn't impressed. When I get a filet i expect it to melt in your mouth but I had to put work in when chewing. The potatoes were ok but nothing amazing. I wouldn't go back and I had better food at Morton's.

eR0Tgvc3j8UtrzjeKe1BGw.text: Great night in Vegas. Has a very old school feel like it should. I've hit the bar and had dinner here numerous times. Great food tons of history and good times. Beyond the food this place is iconic in Las Vegas history. If you haven't been give it a try and make some new memories.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BQ0U3BlxPkZJYu246x_Tww.text: Got a Groupon, couldn't find someone to eat with so came by myself and ate at the bar.  The older bartender Joe Extremely friendly along with the lady and gentleman who greeted me upon entering.  I ordered the bone in rib eye, twice baked potato, and caesar salad.  Steak was delicious, twice baked potato was slightly overcooked yet still good. Everyone raves about the table side caesar however I was bar side so I don't believe I had the same experience.  It was good but nothing amazing.  The bread comes out warm and soft with slight crisp so good.  I like the ambiance and music here.  It can certainly through you off from the outside.  My  meal was about 75-80 by myself though :-(, so prepare to shell out a little money.

R7TLaioDM2hbzpQguPtnnA.text: Had the T bone and stuffed mushrooms it was great, very flavorful. Great music , tom was our server ...very friendly and fairly priced. Very nostalgic ...

mcOwQlY1kJU_78_CaScHBw.text: Food wasn't that good for an expensive steak house, a step above Outback. Supposedly our waiter had been there for 40 years, he sucked!!!!! Service was terrible

VZ0DbVYB_mK_fZa3VeMT-g.text: Came here with a large group excited for a good meal.  Very nice decor and atmosphere inside.  And that's about the only thing going for it.  The only reason I'm not giving 1 star is because of the free cheese cake offered as our wedding gift.  The prices are quite extreme for the portions provided.  The salmon was nearly $40 and was barely enough to fill you up with its tiny scoop of plain rice and 4" long salmon steak.  Service was very poor.  My wife asked for a drink refill and it was never delivered and the staff was rude and stuck-up.  Couldn't even tip low due to a unavoidable 20% tip already included.  Never again.

P0CC00QuEC03rWuwca1T3g.text: Over priced and the service was lacking.  We decided to never return. The steak was not worth $50.00 for the cut. There are better choices like the Steak House at the Circus Circus.

CFmd6BsH3cbxjRvin5NpeA.text: The Golden Steer has been around since 1958 and if only those wood-paneled walls could talk. Oh those red tufted leather booths, white table cloths and oil paintings on the walls are retro and ageless at the same time. I had the $40 prime rib and since it was early in the evening I requested an end cut and got it. I kid you not folks ... It has been several years since I ate that slice of beefy heaven and I can still remember the delirious waves of culinary ecstasy that each bite sent swirling through my body.  No, it is not cheap, but its not the most expensive steak house in town either. Their baked potatoes are legendary for their size and flavor, so at least one person in your party should order that. Service is classy and attentive but not in your face. Their bar is gorgeous and glamorous too!  If you would enjoy traveling to another era for a couple of hours, then do try this place. As other reviewers have said, it is not all that inviting from the outside, but give it a chance and all of your senses will thank you.

LTkRmDm8B25KuZkOwAPCwg.text: My boyfriend took me here my last night before our work weekend began. My last night in Vegas with him before he geared up for NASCAR season and I returned to the skies. I had never heard of this place & even was a bit skeptical when he first mentioned it and I've been to Vegas about 5x per year. How could I not have heard of it??    Amazing is what I describe this place as. We got there early. Chris had  a reservation he made the same day. The hostess was unable to find , which may have been a problem on a weekend night; But we sat at the bar and caught up about our day...& tried to warm the crotchedy bartender up. Fail on that. He's old school and seemed  stressed by his 10 or so patrons and staff. Premium liquors and he poured what he liked , it seemed. He had some good wines... No list at the bar..& almost grumpy when you ask for one..lol... BUT I do get a kick out of old codgers like this. So there was no way this guy was gonna get to me on the last night in Vegas. The bartender knew all the wines nonetheless;and pours a good pour. Impressive. Don't try carrying the tab over to the table.. Nope. He's not having that either.   The decor is very old Vegas .. A bit mafioso... Many celebs from the era of when have been here : Marilyn Monroe; Joe Dimaggio; Mario Andretti, to name just the few we saw over the booths named after them and the restaurant  has that feel to it. I personally love character in a place and you will find it here. We ordered the chopped salad... With the Roquefort dressing ... It was divine. The serving size just enough. My date got the ribeye and I the filet...  My usual , when I eat steak. The twice baked potatoe.. And we shared the creamed spinache.. We ordered a Rodney Strong Cabernet.. Offed the bottle and two extra dirty Martinis ; it's Vegas, right?! I can't tell you how amazing this meal was ... Not that I could fit another bite in... My boyfriend didn't want the meal to end without a dessert ... So we ordered my favorite creme brulee ... And shared it... Yummy... It's not as vanilla--y or creme de la creme as I recall in France but still good ... And bc the waiter liked us so much... He said it was on him... Cheers to that!.. Go there ready to drop some $$ ... It's ala carte ordering ... And this was easily a $180 meal... But oh so worth it... :-) I would say my return factor is 10-10; even with the grouchy bartender.

gOKI0Rh1ZIshoPiimCotoQ.text: Atmosphere was great, food was good but service was BAD. It was pretty expensive, about $100 a person and I don't mind paying for a nice meal as long as you get treated properly. There are so many great steakhouses in Vegas and being a local and industry person I've been all over and I won't be going back to Golden Steer just because the service was so poor. Everyone acted like they were at a funeral, no one smiled or made eye contact, the servers seemed like they didn't want to be bothered and it was a very unwelcoming vibe. A good expensive meal needs to be accompanied by good service but Golden Steer staff was rude and snobby.  It was such a disappointment because we were really looking forward to eating there and having a great experience. We won't be back and I hope the staff can cheer up and learn some guest service techniques 101 so they don't ruin the business.

EX22vDe3onTSLf4qgC5PLQ.text: Old time vegas they deserve the respect of 5 stars. It is alittle overpriced and stuffy but they put out great steaks and prime rib.  They should remodel alittle and maybe change the uniforms alittle out dated .

rZOn2lcZZik3eQMgdtlBxg.text: We usually take my dad to Del Frisco's when he's in town, and he loves that place. However, this time, we decided to also try the Golden Steer. I'd been there before and like the ambiance (even though it's a bit worn), but I don't like being cheated, so I won't be back. Read on if interested.  We arrived early and had a drink at the bar. I ordered a very standard Cosmo, which the very grouchy bartender, who barely acknowledged us, is apparently unable to make. I asked him what he had put in it that made it so sweet, and he responded that he'd put in... pineapple juice! It was quite yucky and it was obvious that I was not happy, yet he made no attempt to make me happy. My dad doesn't like the fuss, so we paid for the drinks and took them into the dining room when the table was ready.  The nice waiter asked me if everything was ok with my drink, and I said I hated it. He was fantastic and immediately offered to give me a real Cosmo (for free, of course). He went and fetched it from the bar and I was definitely pleased with that. The food was decent, but not outstanding. However, when the  bill came, I saw that I was charged for a Cosmo -- what a job! I'd paid for the first one at the bar and the second one was supposed to be comped. Turns out the hostess and the waiter thought I'd ordered the first one from the waiter and thus charged me for it. How is that possible? They saw me walk into the dining room with the drink and he was the one who asked me if I had enjoyed it, and since he hadn't taken the order, it was clear that the drink must have come from the bar. I was quite flabbergasted by this and told the waiter to take the drink off the bill. He said it would take 15 minutes to do this, as they were so busy. What? THat's insane. As an alternative, he offered another drink instead. I didn't want another drink. as I had to drive, but they made it very clear to me that it was terribly inconvenient for them to remove this drink -- which was their mistake in the first place. The whole experience left a bad taste in my mouth and I will most certainly not recommend this place to tourist friends. I don't want them to get bad drinks and then get cheated!

_zkrKUusfU8j2xuVj4WsbA.text: Absolutely the BEAT meal I've ever had!!!  Wow!!! Steak and lobster was just amazing. Service was outstanding. The history of this place alone makes it a once in a lifetime dining experience. Few things remain from the old Vegas, I hope this place never goes away. You can sit in the same booth as Frank Sinatra, The Rat Pack, Marilyn Monroe, Clint Eastwood, John Wayne, etc etc.

QTZnCZ_dsQcVCA43_mG72A.text: We went to the Golden Steer for the history and heard the food was pretty good too.  Was so disappointed.  It says proper dress attire required and people came in in sweat shirts and blue jeans.  There were several people yelling on their cell phones which if they had any manners they would have taken it outside or at the very least, management would have asked them to take it outside.  The food was normal steakhouse food, but we won't go back.  $220 later, I'll go back to Del fresco's anyway.  I never mind the price if the whole experience is worth it.  VERY disappointed.

lzFlzwtYaZmv9QnrpWNCdg.text: My husband and I have been coming here for almost 5 years - had our first date here and went this weekend to celebrate our first wedding anniversary.  How convenient there was a Groupon as well!  Well, as soon as our waiter learned we had a Groupon, he treated us like dirt.  Didn't take a drink order.  When we finally got to place one, he brought them after our salad had arrived.  Terrible service.  If you're struggling and need to partner with Groupon to get new customers, something is wrong to start with and you better make sure you do your best to get those customers back.  Food was good - but their prices are pretty steep for what you are getting.  I used to think highly of this place - old school charm, etc, but they are clearly going downhill.

KwtkS8icobUhfR81261mlg.text: I don't know if it was an off night but this is just barely an okay steakhouse.  So many better choices in town that do it much better.  I have been wanting to go here literally for years, as this was my stepfather's favorite steakhouse, who passed away about 6-7 years ago.  A coupon came up on Groupon so my husband and I had a date night, and overall were pretty unenthusiastic about our meal.  Here's the good: The ribeye on the bone is really tasty, and it comes served with au jus that makes it taste even better.  However, there's very very little discernible char, which would have made it incredible.  I also ordered it medium rare, and it came out more on the medium side.  I actually enjoyed the flavor of this steak more than the American waygu at Cut, if you can believe it.   The service and the atmosphere is also mostly good, but the food came out so fast that we felt rushed to eat and get out.  We literally were back home in almost an hour after sitting down to eat.  Cocktails are pretty phenomenal, this might be a good place to do happy hour.  They know how to mix a drink better that I've had in most places.  The bad: The fillet mignon was tough.  This is supposed to be the most tender meat, but the ribeye came out much more tender than this.  Also, it was ordered by my husband medium rare, but was so rare it was almost inedible in some areas.  Why he didn't send it back was beyond me.  The french onion soup came out lukewarm and not hot, and the cheese was not melted all the way.  When you took a bite, you could see the entire slice of cheese come up out of the bowl.  I implored him to send it back, but being a dork he ate it.  Caesar salad - they do the table side Caesar service and it was okay, a little overdressed and on the oily side.  There are much better places to get a quality caesar salad for more than half the price.  Garlic bread - supposed to be "famous," which reminded me of the meals I used to have at the Smoke House in Burbank, CA across from Warner Brothers Studios that had the greatest garlic bread ever.  This was prepared somewhat similar, but nowhere nearly as good.  And for $5, they give you a whopping three small pieces of it.   So I would not recommend this steakhouse at all, and recommend instead The Flame at El Cortez, or Vic and Anthony's in the Golden Nugget for more of an old school Vegas steakhouse that is much better in the same price range or lower.  I still have to try Hugo's Cellar, which I'm told is also similar but have not made it out to try it yet.

rrlS3gMPICRzA9ptAN6KJQ.text: Original padded leather booths, stiff drinks, table side Caesar salads done right and a gracious staff that OWN what they do not to mention some terrific steak.  if you're looking for real in a city that can be considered (mostly) fake this place is IT. No visit to LV is complete without a dinner here.  Thank you Golden Steer!

A05pGTLpj29DHu1HQPgAPg.text: well hate to say it but the Steer has no more  mooing any longer, not worth the price any longer. order the 22ounce bone in rib eye looked like 16 at best, fatty ordered medium came M Well -- no steak should ever come MW sweetie ordered the filet NO taste- dry and actually a bit chewy. Salad good Cesar mixed at table- $9.00 for a half of potato-- come on- bill was $180.00 with no booze and free cheese cake , I use to eat at the Steer from 1980- 2002, had not been back and wont be going back- sorry for the bummer review, but the days have past for the steer Jimmy J from LA

X4_N6TdrObLYKr6yMNDLZg.text: I went to this place with some high expectation since a guy said it was the best SH in Vegas. I was very disappointed! If large portions mean good to you this place is for you.  My filet Mignon was crap.. I ordered it MR and it came out burnt on the entire outside which left about 3/4 inch of extremely well done dry hard steak and then a absolutely raw center. not to mention a quite large piece of grizzle i spit out and hide under my parsley garnish.  my buddy got the onion ring which were very good. Chop salad was very good with blue cheese dressing.  Overall probably the worst steak house I have been to in Vegas.  Avoid this place. way to many great steak houses.

Ib2V-CbcCI7F7sylJ55Dug.text: Celebrated my 50th birthday here December 7 with a party of ten.  Our experience was fabulous.  We arrived when the doors were open...we were going out that night and wanted to take our time, eat, and enjoy!  That we did!  The staff was wonderful.  Everyone really enjoyed their meal, the service, and the experience.  Can't wait for the next special occasion!  Yes, the location is not eye catching....and the decor...I'll say...vintage, but I love that old style!

W4lJ7LE2xfB-dhDaKp1ODA.text: I was really disappointed with this place. I heard it was the oldest steak house in Vegas and the Rat Pack used to go in here. I geek-ed myself up to go check this place out cause I'm a history buff.Food is not that good. I ordered a NY Strip ($40) medium, when I got the steak it was burned I mean burned, when your suppose to be eating a medium steak its' not suppose to taste like charcoal, it tasted like a low end steak. Mash Potatoes ($8) that I got wore horrible, I expected fresh made mash potatoes for the price that I was paying, they were definitely instant mash potatoes, no doubt. Salad ($8) I ordered with ranch was horrible, it was drowned in dressing and then when they cut the lettuce they put the bottom of the head in the salad and it's nasty, salad didn't taste fresh at all. All in all I spent $64 on a meal that was in all honesty worth $17. I was amazed at how when I'm paying $40 for a steak its burnt. Very Disappointed in the food.  In all honesty when you look at this place from the outside your expecting a cheaper steak house and you figure its old etc, But to pay $64 for a NY strip dinner is crazy, maybe that's why there was only 2 other tables in the restaurant. If they charge $64 for a steak dinner then Outback needs to charge $128 cause there NY steak dinner is light years better.   Like I said don't spend money on the food WAY WAY overrated. If you want to see the place they do have a bar where you can have drinks and look at the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was suppose to be a Medium NY, and look how overdone and burnt it is
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0ah13e2Bcvj7_2uWZzHXNA.text: Don't judge a book  by it's cover...or location... From the outside, you wouldnt expect to walk into the beauty that it is! Inside... The dark and intimate ambiance --just takes you back to when the Rat Pack was around.  Food wasn't 4/5* but I'd give it a solid 3*... over all the food was pretty good.  We ordered steaks (order steaks if you go to a steakhouse...) didnt have to send anything back--cooked perfectly! Dont be in any sort of hurry or rush when you dine here--service isn't bad, but they do operate a little slower here!  Not a restaurant I'd tell you to run to as soon as you arrive...but if you're a frequent visitor to Vegas, and you haven't eaten here-- I'd def. try it out!

8kDWvB7I7pjYO86pu9R3JA.text: This used to be a nice place, but has gone very downhill recently What a terrible experience last week when dining here on business trip ! Almost choked on large pieces of shell hidden within my Lobster bisque. Waiter refused to remove cost of soup from our bill.  Got terribly sick the next day, ended up at the hospital in serious pain Medical tests just confirmed SALMONELLA poisoning Just got off the phone with a top lawyer, considering legal action Also had my doctor contact Nevada Department of Health DINE HERE AT YOUR OWN RISK !!!

GpWU9xiwy2l1etWDD0FilQ.text: This is THE steakhouse in Vegas. There are plenty of them in town, one in each hotel, but not with this old school vibe plus solid cocktails.  Tableside service is just plain fun and when's the last time you had Cherries Jubilee?  I love The Golden Steer and may drop into LV just to have a TBT.

AGoSUyrA_cBhiBbb0f9JxQ.text: We ate here Saturday night.  Joe, our bartender, made us some excellent Bourbon Sours while we waited for the others in our party for our 9pm reservation.   This gave my friend and I (two girls) a chance to peruse the menu, as we had been invited and didn't know much as to what to expect.  After the initial sticker shock on the prices of the prime steaks, she and I settled on sharing a 18 oz. prime rib au jus with horseradish cream (the smallest size they had; $40) and a Jumbo Baked Potato ($8.)  They were both delicious.   The wines were good and fairly priced per glass in the low teens.  We could hear each other converse which personally I appreciate.  I would have liked to try the authentic Caesar Salad ($12 per person) made table-side, but we really didn't think we could eat that much so we didn't order it.  If it cost a bit less - say $8 per person, maybe we would have tried it.  The service was attentive and not overbearing.    I'd definitely come back.  I enjoyed the atmosphere of the Rat Pack era Las Vegas - the booths even have plaques with the names of the people who would reserve them, such as Dean Martin, Elvis Presley and Frank Sinatra.  There was a man playing piano in the bar.    I would like to see this restaurant busier - by 11pm when we finished the place was pretty empty and it's as good as any of the more crowded places at the strip hotels.  People need to know that it's still there!  (Since 1958.)

xjx1pVXxgFrymAzHEBJSRA.text: From the outside, I just knew I had to eat here at some point, finally made it in.  I give it about a 3, my Aunt, who is rather persnickety, loved it, we will settle with the 4.  We went on a Tuesday and the place was just about packed by the time we left.  I knew the inside would be dated.  Their menu describes it as Turn of the Century San Francisco.  Now that I think of it, it does remind me of the back food area at the Golden Gate Casino downtown.  Lots of red and brown going on.  Contrary to the other reviews, I thought the table side Caesar was pretty good.  The french onion soup was a little on the cheesy side, but who can really complain about that.  The lobster bisque was also good but of course any lobster bisque could always use a little more lobster in my opinion.  Auntie and I had the crab and fillet, GF just had the fillet.  I had mine cooked medium and it came out just right.  The crab was okay if not a little dry.  The entrees came out fairly quickly, actually within a few minutes of finishing the soup/salad...guess I prefer this to waiting too long.  Service was fine, although I was expecting a little more.

P5amfMqQrPlHFOgGRcuTXA.text: Nothing to special. They have a good steaks and a good but really pricey Caesar salad and interesting deserts. However the atmosphere, the service, the quality of food, just does not justify the prices they charge. I would have given the place 4 stars if it was more reasonably priced. But the prices they are charging it should be better all around.

pzT5tQVOIgxrEVz-sdeyTw.text: Old Las Vegas steakhouse w/mob restaurant ambience and pictures of old celebrities over the walls.  5 star steaks, prime rib and seafood and gr8 ceasar's salad.   Cool bar and gr8 wine list.  Service is old school good.  Been here for 60 years.  Don't fix it if it ain't broke.

K8crT5DDzaXh45ECtULqOQ.text: To start with i dont think i have had better service from  a wait staff anywhere. The tableside ceasar and the tableside cherries jubilee were awesome. The parking is however really bad. We were searching for a parking spot forever and started to blow off the reservation and go somewhere else. About to pull out on to sahara blvd when a spot opened up so we lucked out. Not going to be an issue if your taking a cab. The interior is something that we were both glad we were experiencing at night rather than daytime. If you know what i mean .The filet my friend ordered was perfect but my ribeye was something i honestly could have made better at home. For a dry aged 22 ounce ribeye i expected to be knocked out. It didn't happen. It reminded me of a steak cooked at Denny's or a roadside diner.The cream spinach was soupy and although it tasted delicious the texture was off. I chose this placed based on a locals recommendation. I think that local needs to explore other steak houses. Good ..... but not knock your socks off great.  Thus 3 stars.

TRU4aSwE_z6sJzSLJXNZNw.text: SUMMARY: My Dad and I wanted the old-school, real-deal Vegas steakhouse experience. We got it!  THE SETTING: Red leather seats, crisp tablecloths, some Sinatra drifting by in the background. Waiters in bowties dressed better than the patrons. DO NOT LET THE CHINTZY FACADE OUTSIDE FOOL YOU - this is serious business.  THE SERVICE: My father has recently had a stroke, and as such has had to seriously limit his salt intake. This was noted when the reservation was taken, and the hostess took great pains to make sure that everything was setup to accommodate his needs. If we needed water or bread or anything, a waiter was right there to provide it.  THE FOOD: First and foremost, the tableside caesar HAS to be gotten. Anchovy, raw egg, the genuine article. I do not exaggerate when I say that we ate the salad one slice of Romaine at a time, as each piece had its own unique combination of elemental flavors.  'Elemental' was the watchword for the steaks, as well; simply beef plus time for aging in a controlled environment. Cut like butter, melted in the mouth, crisp on the outside and perfect-rare inside, sitting in a pool of savory juices.  The salad and steak were so filling we split only a potato on the side, with butter and sour cream. It was good, not great, but hey, it's a potato - it can be done poorly or decently, there is no 'amazing potato'.   The only slight miss was the creme brulee; the texture was a bit lumpish and it had clearly been kept in the fridge, then quickly blowtorched to melt sugar on top.  The coffee was excellent.  THE DRINKS: 2 martinis each, well-prepared, no complaints.  THE BILL: For four mixed drinks, two salads, two steaks, one potato, two coffees and one creme brulee, $200.

9E7dU--GDbDd_N9mzx7iZg.text: My parents, my cousin and her husband, and my gf and I went to the Golden Steer awhile back. My gf used to go here a lot when she was in college and always talked about it, how awesome it used to be to get a serious steak dinner in an old school steakhouse with charisma and old school charm. Johnny the original bartender is still there, been told he's been there for 50+ years. (I bet he has some stories)  Being from the Midwest and raising cattle my parents love a good steak. And my cousin and her husband are cowboys(girls) from Red River NM and they love a nice piece of meat as well.  This was perfect, they were all staying at the Flamingo Hilton (behind the flamingo tower) and I swung by to pick them up.  Being so close to the strip it's an easy trek up LV Blvd from flamingo.  We walked in and were immediately greeted and escorted to a table in the middle of the room, we wouldn't all fit in the few booths available. The place was remarkably quiet for the amount of people in there, a huge group of Texans with cowboy hats occupied a table of about 12 in the middle of the room but they kept it down even though there were about 4 bottles of wine empty on the table already haha.  I ordered the Ribeye and it was out of this world. Such a big piece of meat!!!! Ribeye is my favorite cut of steak, the marbling is perfect in this cut and it holds a flavor really well. Some cuts of steak that you try to season never really hold a marinade but ribeyes do. I had the baked potato and it was huge as well, I didn't finish it all.  My whole family still talks about their experience at "that steakhouse" in Vegas talking about how big and reasonably prices the food is. And they're from the Midwest where prices are about 60% of Vegas standards for the same quality and size of steaks so that's saying something.   Will definitely be back someday. Still waiting for a steakhouse to do better than this in this town, however there have been a few that are close to comparable.  Overall experience was 5 stars, Can't wait for my parents to come back so we can go again (since they paid (: )

-ndm_7tz-ifoG2pTGaEzvQ.text: I wish I had a 'to be fair' line I could throw in here, but it's impossible. My wife and I ate at the Golden Steer on 5/16/13 (Her review is before the Golden Steer plant's review below mine.), and the food was simply horrible. For starters, we sat at the Marilyn Monroe table. Yes, the place has been open for a while, but they do stress the old star-power a bit much, making one wonder of the quality of the food. You'll see why I say this:   When the bread and butter was brought out, we were eating it and noticed a really strange flavor. I tasted the butter on its own, and it tasted as if it had sat in the fridge for a very - very long time before being brought to our table. Sure we wanted to sit in Marilyn's booth, but we did not want to eat the same butter that was served to her!!! Right then and there I wanted to get out as fast as possible. Nevertheless, we decided to overlook this, notify the waiter, and give them another chance. He didn't bring out any more bread and butter, hence the bad butter must've been all they had. NOTE: Steak is often cooked with butter....  The ceasar salad came out and it was prepared at the table. We passed on the raw egg, which I feel is a wise move after reading previous reviews alleging salmonella. Barring that, the salad was edible.   I ordered the ribeye medium rare, and my wife ordered the porterhouse steak. Mine actually was tasty, though bloody and borderline raw. My wife's porterhouse, on the other hand, was a different story. She told me her steak tasted a bit off, similar to liver. I took a taste. To me it tasted like pee! I spit the bite into my napkin.   The waiter attempted damage control by bringing her a slab of prime rib. She didn't like it. I tasted it, and it was bland, unsalted, and I have had better at $15 buffets - time and time again.   I really wish I didn't have to write such a scathing review, but this place is priced like an exclusive fine-dining establishment, yet prepares food like as if to act in direct defiance of the health dept. We will not be returning.

TBu8VH8Up1QiQxQ4BZVixQ.text: Professional waiters, delicious food, great attention to detail.  I was given a slice of carrot cake after the meal, totally unexpected and compliments of the house.  I love the history and atmosphere as well.

B1y6PUvyiNnDeJtZocRx4Q.text: Went here to try something slightly different than our favorite- Hugo's Cellar. Wish we wouldn't have:( Half the servers were a pleasure, the other half seemed very unhappy. Although the quality of the food was high, the taste left much to be desired. Service seemed very unorganized which is strange for such an established restaurant. The hostess seemed confused, multiple servers asked if anyone "had gotten your drinks" and "did anyone ask you if you'd like dessert". One server took the check with card in it even though "it was not his table". The facilities were dirty for the sake of not going into detail. Overall- for the money and drive- Hugo's got this place beat 10x over on quality, price, taste, cleanliness and service!

A7kVx3K0dvV2cQ-QMhL9ig.text: This is it.  I mean it.  Don't waste time looking around for the "latest thing" just get over there and enjoy the True steak in Las Vegas experience.  Oysters, yes.  Shrimp cocktail, yes.  The traditional Ceasar salad, done with flair and style at your table?  Yes.  Don't miss a very nice martini at the bar.  Oh, and the steak?  It's what this place does best.  I do not go Las Vegas without going to the Golden Steer.

rNh6WyZNFWoS40p-f1LexQ.text: We held a private party and the staff was unbelievably wonderful, John helped us get everything organized, Stephanie ensured our cake was delivered, Tom was the best waiter ever...and the food, just like every time we've gone was simply Devine! Can't pass this place up if you want great old fashioned service and a taste of old Vegas!

0df6_Pux62WRnLjPCplMpA.text: Classic old school vegas steakhouse. My NY steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare. So good..still thinking about it 3 days later! Service was fantastic. Oysters were very good, so was the twice baked potato. Best caesar salad ever. Prepared at your table. Not all fake and glitzy....perfect!!!

LzdmQO2bmyzCTSBMFgaFHQ.text: This place is amazingly delicious, a gem hidden just off LV Boulevard next to a bank of other food joints.  We went for my birthday and were not at all disappointed!  It felt like real Vegas old school swank -- the old oil paintings of the West, the tuxedo-clad waiters doing a nice tableside Caesar salad, the giant steaks that are cooked right and moist.     I wonder if Elvis had a giant roman candle jabbed into his slice of birthday cake, too?  It lit the entire room up for 45 seconds.  That's the Golden Steer -- doing it big, doing it right.

amnoU38WSKMMhJmUuJ2V_A.text: I have driven by this restaurant hundreds, probably thousands, of times while growing up here in Vegas, and I had never tried out out until yesterday evening. I wish I had tried this place out earlier, as it proved to be some of the most excellent steak I have had in Vegas.  The real reason I held off on trying this place out for so long was the cost. It is an expensive restaurant, which each steak priced at least $35 and the Italian Specialties (Chicken Parmigiana, etc) running at about $26-$27. That being said, I did use a Groupon to eat here. The Groupon was good for $50, enough to really only cover one person.  The interior of the restaurant stands in stark contrast to the crappy strip mall that it resides in. It's dark, as classic Vegas restaurants tend to be, and has a wonderful atmosphere. It's definently obvious the place was built in 1958, and the history of the building is easy to see and feel.  The waiters couldn't have been nicer. They greeted me as though I were a regular in the place, and popped over my table from time to time to share stories about the more famous patrons (The Rat Pack, Elvis Presley, Mario Andretti) of the restaurant. Apparently, Robert De Niro's son also works here as a waiter, which doesn't make much sense...but hey, that's cool.  As an appetizer, I ordered the signature garlic bread ($5), which was pretty tasty. It's pretty much impossible not to make a huge mess when eating it, which makes it all the more fun. The regular bread was excellent as well, and came out so fresh and hot that I almost burned myself when I grabbed it. No complaints though, I'll take hot, fresh bread any day of the week :)  For the entree, I had the 14 oz. Top Sirloin steak ($37) and a side order of steak fries ($8). I am a seasoning and sauce fanatic...but this steak needed nothing extra. Much like Bob Taylor's Ranch House, the meat is cooked in such a way that the natural flavor of the meat is rich enough that no extra seasoning is necessary.   When all was said and done, my bill came out exactly to $50, so I just had to throw the waiters a tip. It was truly an excellent meal, and I would consider this in the upper echelon of Vegas steakhouses.

Duh5JP8BthNbhysi-jL8Sg.text: My wife, Sandy, and I have lived in Las Vegas since 1998. We had promised ourselves to eat at the Golden Steer some day. Well, that day finally came and it was well worth the wait. I ordered an end cut prime rib and she had a top sirloin. Both were perfect. We each ordered a chopped salad, fresh and delicious. The whipped potatoes were to die for. Our greeter Stephanie filled us in on the history of the place, a hang out for the Rat Park, Joe D. Marilyn Monroe, Clint Eastwood et al. If only the walls could talk. We will be back, on our next special occasion.

2SItaNsEGz63dDsf1r6l3g.text: I'm as tough of a critic as they come & have experenice with steaks all over the world. The outside may surprise you but...Go, dine, enjoy old school Vegas at its very best! Superior service, super steaks, divine caeser! Will visit every trip to Vegas! I truly have to question people's low reviews?  Our experience was truly awesome!!

hlPjR8T96altubqPmQACug.text: A wonderful stop for a genuine change of pace. This steakhouse embodies the heart and soul of old time Las Vegas. It is everything you're looking for when you want a perfect steak and a glass of red wine in a swanky black leather booth. You'll feel like an Italian mob boss of days gone by being welcomed home and attentively served by these gentlemen in black suits. Make sure to get the caesar salad; crafted table side, you won't forget it.

73yBHVeYJEuMjrjHvHsecw.text: Classic, old Vegas. It's "off" the strip but not really. The food and service are fantastic. I loved all the pictures of the rat pack. It was a nice place to dine away from the chaos of the strip.

AZtwbiCzj0VVJHVhHZBX0w.text: We had been waiting in anticipation of our dinner here with our 3 children. When we arrived the host was nice and talked a little with our son and gave him glow sticks to share with his 2 sisters.  We were sat down and the first thing I noticed is how loud it was in the dining area. We were in the corner "Ali" booth and I had a hard time conversing across the table.  The wine menu was on the higher end of price but a decent selection. My husband and I enjoyed wine yet the children were not offered anything other than water.  I had a petite filet and quite honestly it was not that amazing for $40. It was cooked to perfection but didn't have much for flavor. Even the juices were bland and lacking. ( My 2 younger children ordered the 12 oz filet and shared it and my older daughter had the petite and they were just as underwhelmed. )  Our sides that we ordered were the "whipped potatoes", broccoli and asparagus. The potatoes were obviously russet and thinned out with cream/ milk. They were runny and lacked much for flavor. The asparagus was ok but the broccoli was woody and tough.  Time for desserts... hard to mess them up. My husband and I had a port. My children ordered cheese cake, Creme Brule, and tiramisu. My son devoured the cheese cake so we assume it was good. The creme Brule was different... it was dark brown  but taste ok. Not great but not horrid. My other daughter waited patiently for her tiramisu to come out and when it finally did she anxiously put her fork to the desert only to find it frozen solid! We got the attention of the staff and he apologized quietly and took it away. He assured us it would be taken off the bill. Nothing else was offered.  When it was time to pay the bill the staff was quick to point out the "tipping chart" at the bottom of the bill. We eat out often with our 3 children, often at nicer establishments, and this was a complete turn off. It isn't like our children are naughty or making a mess. They are 10,12,14! They sat with just as many,if not more, manners than many adults. Will we be back? No most likely not. It is great for the tourist who wants to be where the "greats" have been. I personally think that for the $350 I would rather eat at Hugo's Cellar at Four Queens or The Steak House at Circus Circus.

c5yhpRwh8AoJ7dMAEjRd3Q.text: Short version: terrible service and staff is rude, food is just ok, good cut but bland (my steak was extremely under cooked). I recommend you to go somewhere else for steak.   Long version: After all the great reviews I read, I had to try it out myself and I am SO DISAPPOINTED. Hear me out, I am a recent college grad 21 and my bf,24 so obviously we are the youngest people at the place but we dress like everybody else in the restaurant so they shouldn't treat us any differently right? Wrong! The host gave us the most condescending look as soon as we walked in and act like it was the end of the world when we said we don't have a reservation. I said "no sir, we called in and we want the bar, which is first come first serve" but he gave us exasperated sigh and gesture us to the general direction at the empty seats (the restaurant wasn't busy so there are lots of seats) so first impression is already a zero star. We sat on a small table and waiters flew by multiple times without a second glance at us. A group walked in after us and the host was overjoyed and he would probably lick their shoe if they ask him to. The waiters almost ran up to give them some menus and treat them like royalty and we are still waiting for someone to notice our presence there and give us the menus, a glass of water or anything really. 10min passes and finally someone came by to put a fork on our table. I kid you not he gave us the weirdest stare (does it help to mention that I'm Asian and my bf is Hispanic?) but at least we get some service going here right? Well that's all we got. The food came, my steak was under cooked the cut was good but the steak was bland I felt insulted and will not recommended anyone coming to eat here unless they want terrible service and condescending stares.

46tK1f5z4Hl4C7230UtEwQ.text: Love everything about this place! I'm a old soul in newer body! Food was outstanding, customer service was amazing. Really love the old school Vegas vibe!

6xQ8gPwxwwTKxZ-UOwdvqw.text: The good part about living 30 min from the strip, is time to write your review while your dinner date drives you back home. 8:30 reservation, we arrived a little early and I had a martini while we waited for our table....not a long wait, we were seated just before 8:30. I had a little sticker shock when I realized martini was $18 (including tip.) sometimes I forget about strip prices...it was an excellent martini though, extra dirty as requested.  We ordered basic dinner salads, a side of asparagus, a side of twice baked potatoes, I got a  petite filet and my husband got the 12 oz filet.   We received our salads promptly and noticed a few minutes later that two very loafed carts were going to the dining room beside the one we were in. Even at 8:30, the place was very busy. I was feeling pretty relaxed from my (strong) martini, and didn't even notice how long we had waited for our food to come out until Lynn stopped by to apologize for our wait, and let us know that dessert would be on the house (which was super nice, but I had been hoping for honey toast somewhere else...)   The asparagus was perfectly cooked, the twice baked potatoes were okay, last time we had creamed spinach and I would have preferred it over the potatoes. Our steaks were glorious. I should preface this by getting a little cocky, and saying that I can grill a perfect filet mignon...I like medium rare with a gorgeous crust, and I've got it down pat. For this reason, I usually don't order filet when I am out to dinner...but theirs is *almost* as good as mine. I buy my filet at Costco for $38 for 3 steaks vs $42 for 1, so I have to take that into count... :-p   For dessert we went with their chocolate creme brulee that tastes exactly like my granny's homemade pudding, and the chocolate cake, which is one of the best cakes I've ever had at a steakhouse.   We had a $60 groupon, and dessert was on the house, so our bill came out to around $72. Considering I had purchased the groupon with a local deal coupon for like $20, that wasn't bad.   Staff is friendly and you get the fun old-Vegas ambiance, with the free entertainment of drunken bachelor parties, and middle aged men on golf trips. If you live in Las Vegas you should experience it at least once. Check for Groupons before you go.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate creme brûlée and chocolate cake
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vodka martini--shaken, not stirred.
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gorgeous crust on the filet

vZTdEKW1cOyDMGzPhjzkzA.text: It's been a long time coming for this review as we went to this restaurant a few years ago on our anniversary. The interior took me back to old Vegas! It did not disappoint walking into the historic establishment. Our waiter was more than happy to explain the history of the rooms and booths. We sat at the Joe DiMaggio table. We ordered the shrimp cocktail and Cesar salad to start. I ordered the filet and lobster for the main course and my husband ordered the veal dish. Nothing about this restaurant disappointed us. It was a dream come True to be able to experience the Golden Steer. We will definitely be returning for another special occasion.

QRiFE-ijb3TCoNimZah55Q.text: Love this place . We took my mother and father in law here because we loved it so much.  I really enjoy the atmosphere and the food is delicious! Get the cherrie jubilee it's AAAAHHHHMAZING !   Do the steak Oscar style to have some surf and turf .   Highly recommend !!!

I901AYom7OIACq8tfNZg9g.text: This is a real deal steakhouse. Don't let the storefront deter you, they have been around since the 1950's serving the megastars Sinatra, Elvis Presley & others. Servers are professional & friendly. Steak was cooked to perfection (Medium rare plus) Caesar salad prepared table side & made classic style (no bottled dressing here.) Had the privilege of sitting in the Elvis booth (next to the DiMaggio booth) Prices for the meal are what to expect at an upscale steakhouse. Portions are huge so recommend sharing. We split everything & still a lot left. Cocktails were also mixed traditionally & classic (perfect mixology) Best meal we had in Vegas.

_nKqGSUMk4XjBbwj-OZ7YA.text: A golden ex-steer-ience!  The Golden Steer saved the happy hour day during the first trek at Rock N' Rio. After eating dinner at the SLS and finding that there were no happy hour specials on Fridays we wandered onto Las Vegas BLVD - I saw the Golden Steer in the distance and was drawn into the light.   We walked in and were greeted by a tux with a furled brow. After explaining we just wanted few a drinks and we'd be out the door, he obliged and walked us over to the bar. This place is a True Vegas landmark with pictures of Mobsters, The Rat Pack, and Hollywood celebs adorning the walls. You get a real sense of old Vegas, where everyone knew your name and your drink. This place is so old school with the red vinyl seats and the golden accents everywhere; it makes the show "Mad Men" look like a modern day TV marvel.   The bartenders Patty and Blake were awesome, very friendly and willing to chat with us about the place. We ordered vodka sodas and shots right off the bat and after our second round, I started eyeballing the happy hour menu... "One order of escargot please"... Yes. I'm a big fan of this land dwelling mollusk, and whenever I see it on a menu, I have to order it. The Golden Steer's versions of these are very good. Swimming in butter and garlic sauce and not too chewy either, the snails simply melted in your mouth. The only thing is, I wish they came in their shells. These snails were served pre-shelled for easy consumption, where's the fun in that?  This was my first time here, but definitely not my last. It's time to make reservations and party like it's 1959!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot! Not the prettiest picture, but delightful.

whdBCnPpqaEky0tb-WIi6w.text: We were near there and I saw it and I said, I'm going there. There's a good reason why an old traditional steak house is still in business. This place is classic. Delicious 24 Oz porterhouse, old school French onion soup, baked spuds and a dry Tanqueray martini. No wonder this place counts the Rat Pack as former clientele.

SBwKGZGN6pMmQpX2U_D5Uw.text: Over-the-top old school Vegas as it was meant to be! This place is fantastic in every way!!   From the read pleather booths, to the napkin over the forearm, this place looks like it hasn't changed in 50+ years.   We enjoyed the ambiance, the service, and the food! Oh, did I mention the food? The best steak I've had in Las Vegas!   Thank you Golden Steer!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Since 1958....it&#39;s like a time warp back to the old-school days of Las Vegas.
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tableside prep of the Caesar salad.
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;petite&#34; Filet...melts in your mouth!

MeUGyc0oQ0JaTxaUneWAlw.text: There is one constant when I go to Vegas.  I will ALWAYS eat at Golden Steer.  I will always get phenomenal service.  I will always get a wonderful steak cooked to perfection.  And I will always feel like the Rat Pack should be dining with me.  This visit was no different.  The T-bone was cooked to perfection.  The whipped potatoes were a wonderful surprise.  The only difference on this visit was that I split a dessert.  The chocolate cake is every bit the equal of their steak.  It was a wonderful combination of moist cake and a milk chocolate mousse and a darker chocolate icing.  I'm normally an ice cream guy if I do dessert at all -- but that cake may well be the best dessert I've had in a long time.  The real star of the evening was our server, Scot.  Scot told us he'd only been at Golden Steer for a year, but you'd never know it.  Utterly impeccable service.  He knew the menu and virtually the entire wine list.  He knew the history of the restaurant and its place in Vegas lore.  He was friendly and chatty without being overly obtrusive.    I look forward to my next trip to Vegas where I will go out of my way to have Scot take care of my steak cravings again.

BRkNk-618zcVIAGgm872-A.text: I was looking forward to visiting the steakhouse and it lived up to the reputation I had read about. You don't just have one waitstaff you have a team, kind of like a team of surgeons in a hospital, only they are there to make sure you're taken care of in a very professional Epicurean manner. The food was unbelievable and the atmosphere has delicious, old school rat pack vibe! As far as how much it cost? It's not for the faint of heart. The steakhouse is definitely worth it at least once.

DeoFSmvqalTtxiy9oUx18w.text: What do you say about a steakhouse that is a legend among legends? I feel like I should pay double, no no no, triple what they ask just for the pleasure of having the Golden Steer aromatics permeate the fabric of my totally unworthy attire.
