I don't bathe myself or my best steakhouse ensemble for weeks after visiting; every evening I roll around naked on top of the pile of clothes I wore, praying to the yellow bovine god that that smell never leave me... but it always does.    The thing that makes the Golden Steer so special is not the locally sourced, grass fed cattle that happily give up there lives so that we may live, it's not the award winning wine list or expertly made cocktails. It's the table side salad tossing.   Oh lawdy, you haven't lived until you've have your salad tossed by the sweet princes and princesses of the Golden Steer. The rigorous training these masters of the salad tossing industry have endured in order to step foot on the floor of this legendary institution are second to none, and no one, you shut your mouth, I said no one tosses better salad than Carl.   King Carl, tosser of salads, sweet-mouthed wizard of sangria, will be your Caesar Sherpa, his strong hands and subtle wrists making sure every piece of green has the perfect amount of sauce. Born a poor child of little wit with his left leg 3 inches shorter than the other, Carl had a tough road ahead of him, with expectations high for this 5 generation salad tosser, but like his father and his father's father, his father's  father's father, and great great Grandfather Carl, for whom our hero is named, Carl would not be stopped. He is without a doubt the Las Vegas Salad Tossing King. Bow down.   You stop what you're doing right now, put down the cough syrup, and book a flight to Sin City. Go get that salad tossed by a living legend at the greatest steakhouse to ever exist. And don't forget to ask about their fine selection of artisanal sangria.   Thank you, Carl, you sweet prince.

1yneoAC6708TYRAaDJxSrA.text: We met here this past Friday evening for a surprise birthday celebration.   For everyone it was the first visit. Service was attentive, drinks were good though overpriced, atmosphere was comfortable and warm. We started with shrimp cocktail and crab cake appetizers and they were quite good.   The Ceasar salad, prepared tableside, was top notch. Dinners included shrimp scampi, filets, chicken of the angels, and prime rib.   Everyone enjoyed their meals.   I had the scampi and thought the shrimp were slightly overdone, especially compared with those served with the shrimp cocktail.   That was the only small complaint amongst the 6 of us. We were visiting from out of town so we probably wouldn't be inclined to be here again soon...with so many tempting places in town we'd likely try something else. But I would suggest this to other folks looking for a quality experience in LV

jHydWQqTDjbtettGT0_oiw.text: The Rib Eye was cooked to perfection, medium rare. It had a nice seared crust and very tender in the middle of each bite. We went with a group of 7 and were able to share the twice baked potato (a must), mushrooms (we ended up going double), cream corn was sweet and salty good, and cream of spinach (very creamy). We also started with the Table side Caesar which is as one of the better Caesar salads I've had. Worth getting if you like a fresh Caesar and fresh dressing. I've had steak in Omaha, which was quick marinated and thought I had the best then, but this was comparable.

wHQ9QWFCOSSJP-3GWtXI6Q.text: 5 stars for this place, it was my first time here and I found it on yelp. It had high reviews and the pictures of the food looked amazingly good. I made a reservation on open table and when we got there we were greeted and seated right away. The booths were old school, lightning was dim the place just had a great vibe.  Our waiter Scot was very nice and helpful with the wine and dinner menu. We got the ribeye which took up the whole plate you gotta have an appetite to finish the whole thing. Then the lobster and filet mignon was to die for, I love my steak a little pink on the inside and they cooked it perfect. Lobster tail was huge I couldn't even finish it all. The twiced baked potatoe was filling it's enough for 4 people, the mushrooms were so good I wasn't a fan of the asparagus it didn't have too much flavor. We got a bottle of wine which topped off the whole meal I definitely would recommend trying this place it's pricey but we'll worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My plate filet mignon and lobster with the twice baked potatoe in the background.
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye was huge and delicious
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad made fresh infront of you it was delicious.

byL-BJ1MV2L8IA-BjRdW7Q.text: My husband & I went here for the first time last night.  I had the filet mignon and ordered it medium. It was raw in the middle when it arrived so they took it back but when they brought it back it was ruined and over cooked.  The rolls were warm and good. My husband had the rib eye which he loved.  We also got the asparagus but it was still hard, not cooked enough. We had the Cherry Jubilee for dessert but I ended by getting sick once home. Not sure if it was food poisoning or what. Total dinner was $250. Not worth it, def had better. Especially with the disappointment of the filet.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pwxP2qzsIQQTAHnA3Sjs2Q.text: The overall experience at the Golden Steer Steakhouse is five star. This place takes you back in time to when Frank, Dean and the boys used to come in and order a few cocktails before their meal. If you haven't been here you are missing a part of Vegas history.   The decor is fantastic - old leather booths, table cloth service, an absolutely great bar. Complete steakhouse menu with a few gems - ribeye is the way to go. Only wish we could still light up a cigar at the end of the meal!

GdiZcLYzWn0iILP19T6Arw.text: I read all a lot of reviews and really wanted to like this place. It seemed like the reviews were either raves or people thought it wasn't that good. I would judge it as very good, not fabulous, but very good. The table side Ceasar Salad was really good but be sure and tell the server that you don't want anchovies. He didn't ask before he started so you have to be proactive. I like anchovies, my wife doesn't so he tossed some on my salad after he served my wife.  My wife had the petite filet and really liked it. I had the highly recommended 22 ounce bone in rib-eye. It was cooked perfectly so no complaints there. But, it was not quite as tender as I expected and it didn't have that rich flavor of a great rib-eye. It was better than a super market steak but not up to the prime beef of other top level steak houses. When you pay $56 just for the steak you should have something special not just good.  We had the creamed spinach and the sides are so large two people can split them and still take some home. The creamed spinach was very good but had a spice flavor I couldn't identify. I would order it again. We also had the twice baked potato. Again, two people can share this big thing. You could taste chives, bacon and the cheese on top. I assume there was sour cream in there but I'm not sure. It was a little dry but I would order it again.  The place is definitely iconic. We ate in the Dean Martin booth and the background music was predominantly Sinatra. Would I go again? Probably if out of town guests wanted to go there, but there are other steak places I would rate just a little notch higher. But, I would not discourage anyone from going here.

pQh4QgPApOpZRJoQVgmlZQ.text: It pains me to write this review. I have been coming to the Golden Steer for over 20 years. The food and the service have always been top notch. Our experience this evening, however, has changed my perception and I have sworn to never return there again. I don't know what's happening with the management there, but I hope they soon correct what is going on.   First off, when we arrived at our reserved time, our table was nowhere near ready, and other guests at our table were still in the middle of their entree. No big deal, since I was here to enjoy my dinner with friends on my birthday, we shrugged it off and waited the extra half hour for the prior occupants to leave.  A few minutes after we were seated, an extremely large group of men arrived. There were at least 40 of them in the group. They came in shouting, whistling, laughing and talking at the top of their lungs.  They took up the entire section across from where we were seated and continued to be so loud and obnoxious that we couldn't even enjoy conversation within our group. The 3 other groups around us were obviously feeling the same, as all of shared looks of dissatisfaction.  It go so bad that I finally walked up to the front desk and complained. The lady who said she was the manager told me she would talk to the group and ask them to keep the noise down.  SHE Didn't.  We decided to finish our meals and get out of there as quickly as we could.  Throughout the time, the group acted as if they were in a locker room, shouting, laughing, whistling and being obnoxious.  At one point we told our waiter that the noise was so disruptive it was ruining our meal.  He simply shrugged his shoulders and said, "what can I do?"  Another member of our group went and spoke to the same manager. She was virtually worthless. I asked why they didn't plan this event better and put the loud group in a more appropriate area of the restaurant. She told us that this group came every year and always reserved the same section.  Her response told us everything we needed to know: they were willing to ruin everyone else's meal experience for the sake of a large, well-paying group of loudmouth jerks.  It was at this point a waiter came up with a birthday dessert for me, which had a Roman candle thjng on it.  I had to shout over the noise of the other group, just to tell him he could keep the dessert and just give us our bill.  The female manager came over and said she would take the cost of 3 drinks off our meal.  Seriously? A ruined night out that cost hundreds of dollars? 3 drinks??  I told her I had been coming to the GS for over 20 years and had never had such a negative experience before. She did not even reply. It was clear she couldn't care less about our measly little group and our measly little meal.  We paid for our dinner, without leaving a tip, and told her we would never be back.  Do they even care?

sIwQcbZlIhTYq7JKAXGlYA.text: What happened?? That's what I keep asking myself regarding my most recent trip to GS on April 13th.  I'm a semi frequent visitor to Vegas from SoCal.  The last couple of times I've come up with my friend.  We like the Craps tables and after getting our fill of "rolling the bones", we head off to get our fill of our favorite Steak House.  On this occasion, we decided to bring our wives.  Mine had never been to GS and I was anxious for her to sample the outstanding food.  We had reservations and arrived slightly early.  Our table was still occupied and we were asked to head over to the bar to wait.  This wasn't a huge deal for me.  Things like this are beyond the restaurants control.  The previous party were, obviously, simply enjoying themselves.  After about 30 minutes, the hostess came to get us and we proceeded to our table (Dean Martin).  About this same time, a large group of approximately 20 to 30 gentlemen entered the restaurant. The first thing we noticed was the significant rise in the decibel levels.  The second thing we noticed was that they were being seated in our same section of the restaurant no more than 20 feet from our table.    Next thing we know, there are people standing up giving loud speeches with loud whistling and cheering in response.  Because of the confined area, the sound levels became unbearable.  We were starting to have to shout to each other in order for us to hear what the person sitting only 2 feet away from us was saying.  Needless to say, we brought this to managements attention.  Not once, but twice.  What came as the biggest surprise was their reaction... or should I say their lack thereof. Let's put that on a back-burner and talk about the food.    Let me make this clear, the food at GS has always been AMAZING!!  That has not changed.  The petite filet and lobster I had that night was cooked to perfection.  The Caesar Salad mixed at our table is so beyond any other restaurant salad I've had... and I've had a lot of restaurant salads.  The desserts are no less labored over and easily measure up in their own rite.  Now let's pull that pot from the back burner.  Part of my dining experience is my desire to share in that experience with the people I come with.  To fellowship and engage in conversations that saunter on through the evening, winding their way to their ultimate conclusion and, inevitably, a night of great food and great memories.  On this evening, that was not to be the case.  On this night, Golden Steer management made it quite clear to us and the other diners around us that our comfort and enjoyment was not nearly as important as the larger group of individuals who were racking up a hell of lot bigger check than the $400 we ended up paying.  In fairness, the manager did offer to credit us a round of drinks to our check but the damage had already been done.  So, we left... terribly dismayed and upset... enough to write this unfortunate review.

qPcsP8JNdL_N8lzNLPX0WA.text: This place was recommended as a great place to eat steak in Vegas.  Old style Vegas.  It's expensive so be prepared to drop a couple hundred when you make reservations.  My husband and I ordered the chateaubriand because I love filet mignon.  That's my go-to steak when we splurge.  Everything is a la carte as well,  $10 for this $10 for that and so on.  They have cool table side features such as Caesar salad made fresh at the table.  Another table had banana fosters made at table side too.  We, on the other hand, were too full to eat dessert. The steak wasn't melt in your mouth like butter. They did give you tons of veggies with it.  The sauces were good -- bernaisse and hollendaise.  The steak was a bit bland but wasn't the worst I've ever had.  I'd say the bake potato won the show in my book.  Too bad it was a $250 potato.    The service was fantastic,  which is the only reason I'm giving fore stars.    Not sure I will give it another try at their price point.

icPfGf2WiShmfYP0mec8Jw.text: sat at Clint Eastwood's booth and enjoyed a steak and some oysters with the woman I love. would rank this just below Peter Luger as my favourite steak house in all of the land that is known as these United States of America.

TWfLhde6lWF7B54If0pflw.text: My friends and I decided to meander off the strip and find a nice steakhouse for our Sunday supper. Wow, Golden Steer is a place that is after my heart. If I could manifest a dang near perfect steakhouse from all my dreams and memories the Steer would not be far off. Once you step inside you forget you're in Vegas (this is a good thing). The surfaces are covered in rich mahogany tones and the walls are plastered with photos of crooners and movie starlets of yesteryear.  I had the 22oz ribeye ($58) cooked to a perfect medium rare and seasoned well. The wedge salad ($12) with lots of bacon and creamy blue cheese dressing did not disappoint. For sides we (three in our party) all shared creamed spinach, mushrooms and a twice baked potato ($11) each. I washed it all down with a glass of French Malbec ($17). Finally, for desert we shared the carrot cake and strawberry cheesecake ($7) a piece. Service was fantastic and the bill was very reasonable at $275 for our party before tip. This place has clearly been rocking the steakhouse vibes in sin city since 1958. I don't plan on heading back to Vegas for quite awhile but if I do, I'll be sure to bring folks to this magnificent vestige of Americana. The only drawback is once you leave you walk outside to see the blight of the Las Vegas strip and remember where you are...

m9xd3xsp6F47gXn3id5__g.text: Classic Vegas baby! There's a rat pack vibe here because they actually frequented the place. Every time we've come to this restaurant the food has been exquisite.  The decor is old school Vegas with beautiful wood paneling, brass fixtures, and red leather booths.   I've had the had the Caesar Salad made table side and the French Onion Soup as starters. The soup has a complex and fresh taste and the ceasar is flavorful, and tart.  The main entrees have been outstanding with fantastic flavor. The ribeye and t-bone are aged, sumptuous, rich, and perfectly cooked.  I've never had a better tasting t-bone. This visit we had the Chicken Angelo and the prime rib diamond Jim cut.  Both dishes were consummately executed.  The Chicken Angelo was a creamy and tangy delicious combination. The prime rib was tender, rich, and flavorful. The meat is of high quality and expertly slow roasted with an expertise that will soon be a thing of the past. Check it out before it goes the way of all cool great things.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken of the Angels with Toasted Ravioli
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib Of Beef - Diamond Jim Cut

TJo2MGg_YxwY2v5gms7dXQ.text: Came here for that old school nostalgic chop house and got what I was looking for! Amazing environment, feels like you stepped back in time and are dining where Frank and the Rat Pack have dine and according to the waiter,  old school mob figures as well.  Highly recommend if you want an old school chop house feel.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster Rockefellers,  had better
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Foster
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye

yWAIqNmthvc2w9hfsSPnng.text: A decent restaurant, however massively overpriced for the average quality of food. Steak was ok, sauces were trash. Calamari was large rubber bands covered in breading. The dinner rolls tasted like salty rocks. Wedge salad looked like the most average wedge salad possible. Basically golden steer is the missionary position for vegas steak houses. Would never go back.

OOVFh8VZ9uHPRpOuikph4g.text: I RARELY give a place 5 stars, but I have to admit.  This was the BEST steak and lobster I have ever had.. and I've had lobster from Maryland and Jamaica.  I've lived in Vegas for years.. best meal my husband and I have ever had in our lives.. no joke.  Service is very good and professional.  Worth it to spend $30 on the groupon to save $60 because it is EXPENSIVE.  I had the filet (I think it was 12oz?) and jumbo lobster tail.  It was $130 bucks.  Sides are $11 each.  Mac n cheese and creamed spinach were amazing.  Sides are quite large.  My husband got the ribeye.  Big, gorgeous, and both steaks cooked the most perfect med rare.  Lobster melted in my mouth.  All together meal was $215, groupon took off $60, but of course we tip on the original bill since waiters have to tip out on that, not discounted meals.  It was just amazing, but who can spend $200 on food? So once in a while, it's the perfect choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet and lobster tail $130
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye $60

OdwHZqT-VJlzXz1YSXEN2Q.text: I'll start by saying that this is my FAVORITE place in Las Vegas. The staff is sooo personable and friendly, and the food is the best value for the dollar in all of Las Vegas. The history behind the joint is impressive as well, to say the least.   Myself and two other coworkers ordered two appetizers - Meatballs and Mushrooms. They were both delicious, and the mushrooms were so good that I ordered them as a side with my entree as well. I had a Porter House (Medium Rare) because I was craving a huge piece of red meat. My table ordered two sides as well - mushrooms and cream corn.   The coolest part, was the Caesar salad. The waiter brought out an entire cart with and empty bowl, and made the salad in front of us, all while carrying on a very fun conversation with our table. It was intriguing, delicious, and I've wanted to make my own salad ever since!  The entire bill was around $550 with everything, including a bottle of wine. All together, I will come back here EVERY time I visit Las Vegas - hands down.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushrooms
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad

elgcV57vhYYgXMoaTThKpA.text: I was expecting to leave a 4 or 5 star review.  I really was expecting more from such a well established local steakhouse.  Don't get me wrong, the food was excellent.  The vibe was there and it was everything I expected from a classic steakhouse.  Unfortunately, the staff is not friendly and unaccommodating.  Not kid friendly as well.

aRyYjojlNU5iGmL-aA2HUA.text: Bryon was our server and was very nice, professional, and accommodating. The food was delicious as well!  Had the 22oz ribeye and the seasoning and cooking was spot on. Will return!

6R3l04DjyUIkgcsRQf3gzw.text: Best steak I've ever had.  The table-side making  of the Cesar salad is top notch and the double baked potato is delicious.

uumeRsdFYZLc0MaknqnYvA.text: I went to Golden Steer in March 2019. Its located on the north end of the strip, not the best of neighborhoods, in a strip mall area which seemed a little strange.  When you walk in you definitely get a old school speakeasy steakhouse feel. If you are looking for something that screams old school rat pack vegas this is the place. I ordered the Cesar salad, Prime Rib English Cut 10 oz. and sauteed mushrooms. Everything's al a carte . They say the are famous for their table side prepared Cesar salad but I didn't think it was that special, it was good but not $12 good. The steak was delicious and I believe it was $47. The sauteed mushrooms were not to my liking, they didn't feel sauteed they were hard and just bathed in some sort of gravy. I would avoid the mushrooms. My friends got the baked potato and mac & cheese. The potato was huge and looked great. I did get to try the mac & cheese and it was great. They do not split the bill so if you go in a group it will be all on one check. You and your friends will have to settle up with each other. Overall I wasn't wowed or impressed especially for the price $75-$100 per person.   Atmosphere inside: 4 Stars  Atmosphere outside: 2 Stars Salad: 2 Stars  Steak: 4.25 Stars Mushrooms: 1.5 Stars Wait Staff: 3.75 Stars

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib English Cut 10 oz. Medium Well

6znuE-M50pKMthpM7tzCKg.text: Interesting place to eat.  The Rat Pack ate here.  We sat at Sinatra's table.  I had the prime rib.  It was good, but not the best I ever had.  The sides are ala cart.  The bread was pretty good.  The place is a little outdated, but that is what preserves its history and elegance.  The servers were friendly, courteous and respectful.  I met my cousin and her husband for dinner.  They did the bill at our table with a handheld device which was pretty cool.  All this technology and they said that they couldn't split the checks.  WTF?  Seriously, WTF?  Every restaurant in Vegas splits checks except Golden Steer.  I'm glad I went, but I would never go back.  Several steak houses to choose from.  4 stars for the service and history.  Food was just ok.

0pWXZuVnca_NYNse1Mt7hg.text: Fantastic hidden gem right off the strip! This is a place where all the famous people dined! The booths are named after the stars  Very elegant and upscale atmosphere. Amazing table side service with a smile. My friend introduced me to this restaurant and I'm sure we'll be back. We both had the filet mignon, whipped potatoes & grilled asparagus. Dinner was delicious & the salad was freshly made right at our table.  We sat in Betty Grable's booth! Fancy & retro love this place!

Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mG-11_mxFXvljlEQVq4b3w.text: Excellent  food service and ambiance. Filet Mignon was cooked and prepared to perfection. Highly recommend

EjFIw4OZCgLrYcN3Xb5WOw.text: I recommend the Cesar's salad, a portion for 2 serves 4! The classic Golden Steer drink is worth every dollar. The steak, salmon and lobster tail were the best--- I'd like to lick the plate the lobster tail was in. Eduardo was informative and made great recommendations. Can't wait to go back next time I'm in Sin City.

kangqMZA7DA7V5I90GdNRA.text: It's rare (bad pun) to find a sgteask house with inferior food. I found it. The shrimp hsd been refrozen and thus the middle was mushy and tasteless. You can't miss this , so it was served knowingly. Sent it back. The rib eye was fatty. Second rfate meat. Service, at best is adequate. Strange place.

9YOXoHbBZjUOCDK9uOfTkA.text: Very interesting place. If you're an Elvis, Marilyn Monroe or Mohammed Ali fan, this place gives you so much history on why this steakhouse is one of the best before and even up to now. Customer service is above and beyond

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cherry jubilee

zKSZ3jt-hTrazLlEQsmRgg.text: Hands down this is my favorite restaurant in Vegas. I make it a point to eat here every trip. The staff is superb; they are friendly, attentive, and professional.  The restaurant is classic Las Vegas with a deep history. Finally, the food is amazing. Table side Caesar and amazing steaks. I cannot recommend this place enough!

4V-0hNt6n4tAUfovKgx8sg.text: I just received the worst service experience in my years of eating at high end steak houses. The food was good overall but I don't need to be disrespected and insulted on top of mediocre service when I'm dropping a grand in your establishment.  We had a group of 8 get together for a post Viva Las Vegas dinner. Please note that while this is a rockabilly convention we all dressed up to the nines for a "classy" dinner experience at the Golden Steer. When we arrived we asked to have separate checks because as with many high end steakhouses, the items are served ala carte. Thus, it makes figuring the bill at the end a nightmare with this many people. The excuse was the computer system can't handle it..and apparently writing it down on paper is too hard as well for the 200 dollar tip. Our group was not loud nor over demanding yet had a lot of trouble getting service in general as others have mentioned in reviews recently.   As expected, the chaos begins when it comes check time. We get handed one copy of the check and are basically told "you need to figure it out". After lots of asking we finally got multiple copies to try and make sense of the confusing bill. This whole process takes us 40 minutes of struggling with the staff to clarify the bill as if it just too much trouble for them despite the place being less than half full. We ended up missing a show in Vegas we wanted to attend dealing with this fiasco.  As we start paying, the real fun begins. We are told by one of the servers in a very condescending and rude tone "well, maybe they do that at Denny's but we dont do it here" in regards to the poor service with the check. It seemed to be a personal shot based on being from the convention. Also, when asked why we are not being taken care of as is a servers job.. He replies "is it my job?" as if he would be doing as little as possible for the 20 percent tip. The older waiter over hearing the conversation was clearly embarrassed by his colleagues remarks.  Sorry but there are too many other great steak houses in Vegas to deal with lazy and insulting staff. Perhaps he should not have been so judgmental. I work for a Fortune 100 company and like to take clients to dinner. I make a good living and I am highly educated, I dont eat at Denny's thanks.  I don't need this garbage. Guess who isn't taking any clients here anymore?  P.S. Denny's probably has a spot on their overnight staff for your rude server. He obviously can't handle this gig.

T5WOo8bB5Y1ov-hPem8iDw.text: Step in to the Golden Steer and out of 2012.  Welcome to the age of the Rat Pack, where people drank martinis, dressed up for dinner and ordered chateaubriand for two with table-side caesar salad.   Leather banquettes, a staff that are pros at this and atmosphere that just won't quit.  There were 6 of us.  We walked in, had a cocktail, and were seated.  The hostess (who was great!  I wanted her to join us!) gave us the history of the restaurant and tales of Sammy Davis Jr.  She knows the history of Vegas well!  We ordered an assortment of steaks (rib eye, new york, filet mignon) and prime rib (the diamond jim cut - HUGE!), caesar salad, creamed spinach, asparagus and potatoes.  We left FULL.    Note that the meat is cooked tru to temperature - if you say medium but are hoping for medium well... well, order medium well.  We never felt rushed.  We had a 5-Star experience all the way.  I can't wait to come back!

RQbMMpqewifAIm1odleS7Q.text: Great dinner for my birthday. I would have given them 5 stars but my filet mignon was over done. We loved the environment, the service was great. We love going to the old school Las Vegas restaurants. Golden Steer really fit the bill. We will definitely be back.

ycvVQ-jHcfxx0gfZFpxxNA.text: I was not a huge fan of this place.  First of all, I realize it's an old establishment, but the neighborhood around it is not the best.  I went on a couple of friends' advice that it was the best steakhouse in Vegas.  It is not.  A friend of mine and I ate in there not terribly long ago.  I had a filet, a salad, and a glass of wine.  He had a ribeye, a salad, and a beer, and we split a baked potato.  And it was about $225.  It might be old school Vegas, but they charge some really new school prices.  The servers were curt and not very friendly.  We had to ask for water refills.  That should never happen in any restaurant, let alone one you're paying a house note to eat at.  They weren't busy, so there was really no excuse.   I've had much better steaks at Gordon Ramsay, Carnevino, Hugo's Cellar, Capital Grille, Vic & Anthony's, and others.  So, unless someone else is buying, I will not be going back here.  It was not worth the hefty, hefty price tag.  And despite their lack of business, the parking is terrible.

H_EJt_6dQ4egEk0EwPOw1A.text: Finally a rib eye done right, not some over processed over priced Morton's meat.  I am from Iowa we got our black angus steaks from my grandfathers farm.  Also, the wait staff is old school high end and you don't get that training anymore.

25nMSYcCekk-y5H6RpTnOA.text: I would give 5 stars if they didn't being so rushy....Thurs night open tables everywhere, 10 mins in food is on the table, while we are talking "are you done?" Umm ok yea...another 10 mins " sir, are you finish?" Anyways, the fastest fine dining we ever had. From seated to done about an hour and 10mins. Steaks is no doubt one of the best.

TMwRe6-FU3oq9Io4UauRgg.text: Visited this place for the first time earlier this week, let me start by saying that it was phenomenal. The ambiance really makes you feel as if you are sitting across from an old time vegas mobster having a steak dinner.  Impeccable service from the moment we walked in to moment we left. I was impressed by one of what I would call a bus boy, he was quite young but his service was on par with someone who has been in that type of service industry for many years. I am sure you have heard enough about that, I know you all want to hear about the food.  Most everything is served Al la carte, I love this aspect because I can choose what I want with my meal. I started with the French onion soup.  It was so tasty I dreamt about it that night,  the cheeses stretches and stretches, I think they should supply scissors to cut it. I choose to have the baked Alaskan salmon with sauteed mushrooms. The salmon comes with a small serving of rice pilaf. The gravy the mushrooms comes served in is delctable. The salmon has a nice crust to it. They also have a wide variety of desserts, bananas foster and cherries jubilee are made and served table side. Even the coffee we finished the meal off with was delicious, strong and robust.  I will definitely be going back. This is an amazing place for a special date or to just feel the old nostalgic Vegas.

RUMU-U-WpiuoqUTZUGsfMA.text: We went here for my mothers birthday and it was a great experience. The staff were very personable and friendly. I ordered the larger filet (12oz I believe) and it was delicious. I can't say it was the best I ever had, but it's definitely up there and better than I expected. The temperature of the meat was perfect. I also shared the twice baked potato with someone and it was delicious as well. If you're looking for a nice steak dinner, this is your place.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12oz Filet Mignon. Medium rare. Perfection.
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8XM9POJm3-uMnQQdfHvRRQ.text: I went here for dinner last week and I just wanted to update my review by saying YES YES YES!  I still love this place for steak and escargot, and always will.  They recently won Best in Las Vegas for this year, so congrats to them!  As usual, everything from appetizers to dessert were wonderful.    If you haven't tried this place, take the time to make a reservation and stop by.  It's more of a special occasion place because of the prices, but if you're in the mood for a great steak, being served and catered like the good ol' days with that old time atmosphere, please do stop by.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cherries jubilee
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hXUObIAP-lW_Y-ZhYxlzcQ.text: I've been coming to Vegas for 30 years and no matter how many designer chefs start a new fancy restaurant at a new fancy hotel... this is STILL the Best Steak in town!  Excellent service and the perfect cut of steak with a nice glass of wine and Sinatra playing in the background make this the 100% Vegas experience.

7R2CX-xQfcJExUEnmTjJSQ.text: It's my second time going to this restaurant and so far so good. I love the history of this place and I've always enjoyed my dinner, drinks, and our server. I came with a big group and had a great time. Although my steak got switched with another person, so it was a little under cooked, i still enjoyed my experience. Great ambiance for an intimate dinner date or friends.

W3YuXc2dhQKiHYKA6g4j_A.text: Old school Vegas best describes this landmark place close to the strip.   Table side Caesar prep and banana foster and cherries jubilee are highlights.  Wait service is very attentive.  Another highlight was the side of creamed corn.  For a date night or longing for Vegas of old...This is your place.

II8Vi6Hd7qEd-dSOVMdAYg.text: Oh sweet baby Jesus, I love this place. Retro decor, a waiter who does a Robert DeNiro impression, and amazing steaks.  About mid way through my (rare) petite filet the other night-I turned to my husband and said, "I want to give this steak a baby"  Because that's how good it is.  There's always a point where I start to get sad that my steak will be gone shortly, so I try to slow down. But it's too hard at the Golden Steer! I don't want to slow down! Nomnomnom.  Forget the stupid fancy places in the hotels on the strip, the Golden Steer is the real deal.  Go. Now.

kpQY5E7JOaXQ0QJKV_R-FA.text: Who can resist the GS. Great food, staff, service. You just can't go wrong. This is the secret (and not so secret) of their success! One of thebeststeaks thatI ever had.

Wnd3bGjWD-_BPh-lxy8KWQ.text: OK - a lot of people slam the Steer for having an "out-of-date" menu - but the Steer's charm doesn't come from the food. The Steer, along with Hugo's Cellar downtown, are the last of a dying breed - classic Vegas restaurants with red tuck-and-roll upholstery booths and a vintage spirit. I wish I lived closer - their lounge would be my new home.  I ordered the scallops marsala which, I hate to say, was a bit strange and totally missed the mark - but the creamed corn and steamed broccoli sides were really well done. We told them it was our anniversary when we booked our reservation, so at the end of the meal they threw in a cheesecake dessert with a flame-thrower of a sparkler on top! Festive!  The waitress was chatty and filled with cheesy Vegas tales, the old goombahs in the booth across from us kept ordering the waiter around like ex-mobster royalty and talking about how so-and-so's neighbor was a prostitute. Lots of local character and vintage Vegas wackiness.  Like I said....you don't go here for the food!

DDiQmT1HRgBWasoxMk_U2g.text: You go here for two reasons: 1. You are hungry for a sniff of old school Vegas. (I am pretty sure I smelled Sinatra upon entering.) 2. You are hungry for steak. If you are hoping for anything beyond that, such as fresh mixed green salads, mind blowing sides, delicious seafood, or even a speck of modernity, I say skip it and head to one of the bajillion steak joints on the Strip. The Steer is Vegas, BABY, not the Vegas where what happens here stays here only in theory.  We went on a Saturday night, and it was dead. I was a bit concerned, but I was still grinning at the truly old school surrounds, complete with red banquettes and a live piano player. Service was relaxed; it could have been a bit more attentive in explaining the menu and getting our order in a prompt manner. (Casual is okay by the way as there were some old school locals there in their everyday getups.)    Our order included the chopped salad, the "Ambassador of Tenderness" (12 oz Filet) and onion rings. The salad is drenched in dressing and tossed table side, so you may want to request light dressing. It is basically an iceberg salad with some chickpeas and carrot sticks, nothing spectacular. The onion rings were breaded thickly, again okay, but I am still beholden to my Atlanta Varsity rings.  The steak, however, was perfect and lived up to its Ambassador title. Enough said.  They appear to have private rooms, so round up your Rat Pack and prepare for a protein feast.

xbhMl-YlbHRE1ErkbYJDAQ.text: I don't even know where to start with how fantastic this place is!  On a three night (aka three dinner) trip to Vegas, we went here twice after having such an amazing experience the first night.  As people have mentioned, the outside is not remarkable (strip mall-ish), but the inside is something out of the early 1960's.  The food is all fantastic - in our two visits we had escargot, Caesar salad (table-side...fantastic!), oysters Rockefeller (AMAZING), chicken parm, eggplant parm, petit filet mignon, baked potato, blackened salmon, cherries jubilee and bananas foster.  All were great.  But it is the service and care that make this place worth the price (items are a la carte and while cheaper than steak places on the Strip, still higher end).  Our server (both nights - we made sure!) was Scot who is remarkable, personable, kind, attentive and an absolute pro.  Any time we are in Las Vegas we will be back.

nmIYykV3TDU69ITqKUHu_w.text: Old School Vegas Steakhouse.  AMBIENCE:  3 stars.  The bar needs to be fixed up--it is the first place you see when you walk in and it looks aged (and not in the good way),  Once you get into the steak house proper, then it is classic Rat Pack vinyl booths, with memoribilia and photos from famous people who used to frequent the steak house.  We sat at the Mario Andretti booth!  SERVICE:  4.5 stars.  We were met by a super nice hostess and seated immediately (we did have a reservation--which I highly recommend).  The server and his support staff were very good and attentive--and certainly knew the menu in and out.    DRINKS:  3 stars.  A steak house should have perfect cocktails--ie martinis, cosmos, etc--ours were served promptly but the Golden Steer seems to use fairly pedestrian liquor in their well.  FOOD:  4.5 stars.  We started with the best Caesar Salad we had ever had--made table side by a very skilled server.  We had the Ribeye, which was good sized, cooked perfectly, and very flavorful.  We also had the Lobster Tail--which was prepared perfectly as well.  Our sides were the Twice-Baked potatoes--which were amazing and I highly recommend them--and the Creamed Spinach--which was quite good as well.  The desert was the best part--Bananas Foster made table side--the bananas were lightly coated with the carmelized alcohol, and they were amazing!  Unfortunately the ice cream it was served atop of had ice crystals which kind of took away from the overall effect.  VALUE:  This place is not inexpensive--but it is nowhere near where some of the super fancy places on or just off of the strip.    OVERALL:  4 stars.  I think the service and food are quite good--but the bar is an issue that should be fixed.

jav6LDissrlCBQJXuxSHcA.text: The Golden Corral, I mean the Golden Steer has REALLY gone downhill over my past many visits. Crab cakes? Cool cold center, wait! Bone-in rib-eye medium rare? Overcooked, but the waiter wanted to argue it wasn't. After over an hour wait I didn't want to wait for the redo. Asparagus was VASTLY over-cooked. Well, they were VERY busy tonight, so I guess, next time I'll come when the place is near empty? No, there will be NO next time, thanks.

0NC_FumGqHhw8guEl4QAMw.text: Awesome food and great old school environment! Celebrated my birthday and we loved it. Service is superb!!!

6Q7nTZgqP0sFLysbOhu36w.text: The food was amazing, I cannot stress that enough, and the service initially was spot on. However, a buser accidentally dropped a wine glass breaking it upon the top of the chairs of two at our table, with the shards shattering all over their backs/chairs. It was quite the fiasco. They were okay, and the chairs were switched out with sincerely apologies from the buser and our own waiter. However, with something such as this happening (where out table of 10 racked up an amazing bill), nothing was comp'd or discounted. Unhappy, we asked for the manager, Lynn Piersol, and said we were disappointed. Her response was "Well, you guys weren't hurt, right?" We pushed the significance of the event (spilled drink? Sure no big deal. Broken glass everywhere? C'mon), but she did nothing at all and was extremely unapologetic, though it was a special event for us. Go for the food, but beware the manager!

q0yD_IiS-6m9h-oUHfdJCg.text: Listen to me very carefully. There are three ways of doing things around here: the right way, the wrong way, and the way that "I" do it. You understand? - Ace Rothstein  It so happens that there are also three reasons to come here:  1. Old School Vegas (It's rightfully the most popular statement used to describe Golden Steer) 2. Old School Steak...be it Steak & Potatoes or Steak & Lobster 3. Old School Table-side Prepared Caesar Salad  Golden Steer doesn't have the sophistication of a modern steakhouse. That's not necessarily good or bad, just a little more unique these days. They will tell you they let the food stand for itself. While, the're not serving the best cuts in town, they do serve a high quality product. For me it is all about the atmosphere. The Golden Steer isn't the place I'm typically interested in settling down in to enjoy my dinner, but I can still appreciate the charm and appeal to others...It's Vegas Baby!...Old School Vegas...better days, when the Mob still ran The Strip and you were taken care of so long as you played by the rules.   You are taken care of at Golden Steer as if you were an old mob boss. The staff is attentive and dressed to impress. The food is executed well. The bar tenders are lively and good for a story or joke if you're in off peak hours.  While here you can confidently explore other options like Escargot, Oysters Rockefeller, or an Oscar topping for your filet. You are after all at Golden Steer Steakhouse, make it a golden experience!

Y1_GxPpT4zESmEkK4pjfCw.text: Came here my first night in town to spend some father and son time with my dad.  We had some shrimp cocktail which was great but my French onion soup was to die for.  Unbelievable that I have never ordered their soup before that night.  In addition, tried their 18oz prime rib which I came now where close to finishing.  Very good.    Took some important partners to a night for steak.  Rather than going to the usual suspects, I decided to share my favorite little secret in my organization with them.  Get straight to the point, the meal and staffs friendliness was more than our expectations.  Sitting in the Ali booth, we were greeted by such a entertaining server who started us with our cocktails, followed by a seafood tower and some wonderful steaks.  I look forward to my next visit to this wonderful establishments.  Just so it's noted:  Top three must visits:  #1.  Peter Lugar's Brooklyn  #2. Golden Steer. Vegas #3. Abe and Louie's  Boston  Thanks for keeping this place great!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FtMQUcXO3l5bP1zyK9oCMQ.text: This is my second time here, my wife has been a few more than that over the years.  We had a 6 P.M. reservation for four as we were taking our son and future daughter in law out for a celebration.  We showed up early so my wife could play some video poker and have a drink before dinner.  The bartender was very nice and full of conversation.  We didn't get rich but it did only cost us 40.00.  We were seated by a very nice maitre de and our drink orders were taken.  We had the cold seafood appetizer, I ordered it for 4 people and the waiter told me to order it for 2 and it would be plenty, he was right, we also had the crab cakes and they were very good.  The Caesar salad was entertaining as well as delicious.  I had the diamond jim cut prime rib with asparagus on the side, my wife had the filet with lobster tail and the lobster was exceptional.  My son had the bone in rib eye with creamed spinach and my future daughter in law had a steak with mashed potatoes.  We all had the tiramisu as our desert and I had a nice glass of 20 year tawny.  Also delicious!

0wYy71dRVpYTRyz8EN-moA.text: Dinner/food was outstanding. We enjoyed the shrimp scampi, ribeye, twice baked potato very much. The table side caesar was delicious, too.  The service was amazing. We celebrated a birthday and they put a huge sparkler on the piece of cheesecake. So fun and memorable.  We loved the ambiance of old Vegas and the overall experience!!!! Thank you Thomas and Cynnamon. We had a wonderful time.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner was amazing with outstanding service from Thomas!!! He&#39;s easy on the eyes...with a great personality.

0Qo1iM33vSgE1j3OcjqUqg.text: The filet mignon was the most tender steak I have ever ate! The veal parmesan was more then tasty, not to mention the twice baked potato, garlic bread and raviolis...EVERYTHING WAS DELICIOUS! The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because they didn't give free refills lol.

RbkyHhbWvpvZdV4Cse7BKQ.text: Excellent old school Vegas style steakhouse. This is a must do in Vegas! The food is to die for and the service is exceptional. Lots of great history in this place so be sure to ask the waiter to fill you in.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Golden Steer Steakhouse.....Classic Vegas! One of the best places to eat in Las Vegas.

Rg7VVLjhHAnfOaPAg0uqqw.text: Incredible food, even better service, old Vegas ambience. Make your experience even better by requesting a specific booth! Sinatra, Monroe, even Holly Madison haha

Mf_m3go7sknmxgeUwhH_kQ.text: First time at the Golden Steer Steakhouse for my Birthday and it was phenomenal!!!! Humberto our waiter was Excellent! The Filet Oscar, Creamed Spinach and Twice Baked Potato was Delicious! The Ambiance was great Old Vegas! I am glad we still have some old history left! Next time would like to have dinner in one of the Rat pack booths!

ra_y6srViV32bq1UVQnIyQ.text: Impressive. There are a lot of great steak houses in Las Vegas. In fact there are a lot in this area... Resulting is stiff competition. This place definitely holds their weight. From the outside, it doesn't look like much, but the inside is nice enough. I called to see if a reservation was needed and the woman that answered the phone was a little punchy. She gave me the info but made me work for it.   When we arrived we noticed a lot of the other customers were very casual. It was warm out so my companion was happy to leave his coat and tie in the car.   I ordered the filet and crab legs. I think it came with a salad, or it was extra I'm not sure.... Either was the salad was over priced. Just a boring mix if basic lettuce and dressing. I will skip the salad next time.  The filet was cooked perfectly and very tender. Crab legs were opened and very easy to eat. A lot of meat per leg. Steak fries were pretty good as were the asparagus. All and all a pretty nice meal, although slightly overpriced.

nD-_7TgYn596zTzjiicIhw.text: We were there this past Sunday and what an amazing dining experience we had. When you make reservations ask to sit and Eric's section. Not only did he treat my family with the upmost courtesy, professionalism, he had great descriptions that made your mouth water  while telling us about the specials. He knew the main menu inside and out. Service was flawless. He made several suggestions for specials and both of them were to die for. We have the bananas Foster which they do at the table and not only do they make it in front of you they tell you exactly how they're making it.  This is an iconic restaurant and if you truly want to taste the food, hospitality, and service of old Las Vegas  this is the place to go.

o6aVAu-8O0kUvqc7xkIlKQ.text: This is one of my favorite spots anywhere.  This is the type of place my dad would have liked. In fact I do believe he came here back in the day. This is off the strip here in Las Vegas and not many tourists go here. But the locals sure do. It's never real busy during the week but you do need to make reservations.   When you walk in here you feel like you just stepped in to the 1960's-1970's. It's really cool. And the respect to the dinning experience is what it is all about here. Unlike the rest of Las Vegas they care about service. A lot of the wait staff have been here for a long time and are just not working here until they finish school or make it in acting or something. They care about your experience.   Oh....and the food is off the charts. The steaks are amazing. The seafood tower is terrific. The Caesar salad is old school in the fact that they do it the RIGHT way. At the table with all the ingredients that are suppose to be in a Caesar salad. Like a raw egg and anchovies.   If you come to Vegas. Come here!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye medium Rare at the Golden Steer in Las Vegas. WOW! amazing.

BomY7pCbeVZKeT1l6NIbVQ.text: Really a great escape from the strip and a journey back in time, in a good way. The food was delicious and wait staff very attentive. The filet and shrimp were delicious and cheesecake was light and fluffy. The Caesar was one of the best I have ever had and the table-side service a nice touch. My only complaint, if I had one, was that the bathrooms needed some attention and could have been more upscale for the price point.

akRgxZI_7zN6PZ3tWzQiRA.text: Please know nothing I say with give the experience of this incredible steakhouse justice! I must admit from the outside appearance I didn't have my hopes up but the moment we walked through the door we were transported back in time! The entire staff made us feel like VIPs! We already loved the decor/furniture and the history all around us, then we were blown away by our servers in tuxes! They were all very professional and suave with all the humor you want! So fun!! Then ... our main server of the night ... Venko. Oh man, he took the cake and made the night one to remember. Venko, thank you for taking such time to cook for us table-side and share such incredible memories with us. Memories of the greats you had known so well over the years especially the greats who had sat in our very same booth! We can't wait to come back and see you! Oh, I should probably tell you they are the BEST at what they are best at ... the steaks were cooked to perfection and everything we ordered was so delicious. Seriously we were sad to finish eating, it was such a treat!

pMBedRqdKp3SFZpVu8KL2Q.text: This was our first time here and at first we were skeptical due to the odd location. I was not particularly impressed with the server that originally sat us. We asked a few questions about the menu since it was our first time here. His responses were pretty rude. We ordered drinks and at that point I felt that we had made a mistake by coming here.  Thankfully we ordered the Caesar salad which is prepared table side. Venko prepared the best Caesar salad I have ever had! I have never seen someone prepare a salad so gracefully! His service was exceptional and definitely over compensated for the original servers poor customer service! I was originally disappointed but Venko definitely turned this experience around for us! Overall the food was great with the exception of asparagus which was a bit bland. Would definitely come back!

--XO91SYI2dnMEtYaC9RIg.text: Not the experience we expected. My husband and I were looking forward to a nice anniversary dinner and Instead we were sat in a booth adjoining a large party. My husband wanted something a little more intimate (it is our 22nd Anniversary)and spoke to the manager to see if they could move us to another booth, one that would be more private , we were willing  to wait; Instead of  the manager being accommodating he was a pompous and told my husband it wasn't  a large party we were seated next too and asked my husband if he would like to point out a booth he would prefer.  His  mannerism took my husband back and we decided to leave. We have enjoyed many nice dinners as locals in Vegas and we're highly disappointed.  We will never go back to this restaurant. The manager is more conspired of how many parties he can squeeze together instead of providing a memorable night

E0RCE7wnjH4SjjAPwkaJCA.text: I went with my two friends last night and had an amazing bone in Ribeye and two bottles of wine. The service was great and ambiance was even better. I do wish they had a little more sides but didn't mind it to much. I'll be back

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome booth

wL_w65iZOaXjxIufBrZcBQ.text: We again went with a fairly large group and ended up in a room with an even larger group (we were 10 and they were probably 30) so hearing one another was definitely a bit of a challenge. The table had the following items and then some.  The table side Caesar salad was probably the BEST Caesar salad we had all week in any restaurant in. Eggs! Old line food and service with a smile.  The service was a little slow but once they got going it was fine.  The table enjoyed some of the following items.  I of coarse had the worst meal as I subbed chicken for the veal in the marsala sauce and the chicken was rubbery and the sauce was quite salty.  The boys all enjoyed their steaks and the table had a few like a bone in rib eye, a filet and a couple others that slip my mind.  But all in all this is a great place in Vegas with wonderful history and always a fun night is had here! Drinks are also a decent size and not too watered down like some places!  We always try to have a meal here when we are in town.

IT4fkS5YeGbbl3pis6yMZQ.text: Lucky enough to eat at the historic and nostalgic steakhouse just like the vegas legends used too! Great atmosphere for any occasion and the service was excellent. F on the rat pack pictures on the walls and the fresh Cesar made in front of you this place was great all the way round. Loved the bread, loved the steak, loved the golden steer sign!!!! Will be back next time in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great place to enjoy a cocktail before dinner!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. For the vegetarian the  gpplant Eggplant Parmigiana and cheese Toasted Ravioli.
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The classic signage!!!

nZcUwXlzRY29VeDZA8qklw.text: Lived in Vegas for 27 years and never heard of this place somehow!!!? Did a search to find the best steak to celebrate our anniversary and this place thankfully popped up. We are a young couple and I didn't think the "old school" ambiance would be that captivating right away. Definitely felt like it wasn't 2018 on the Las Vegas strip! Maybe we were starving, but even the complimentary bread and butter was to die for. We started with the table side Caesar salad. Such a unique taste. Mustard and garlic definitely stood out more than your typical Caesar! The steak of course was perfectly prepared. Most importantly... order the Mac & cheese!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OCjZO17pnXpnb09XH90HJQ.text: Absolutely great steakhouse. Classic steakhouse environment, well mixed cocktails and unbeatable service. The food was perfectly cooked and the steak was tender. And for what we got the pricing was actually not very high. We will be back the next time we are in Vegas!

Q4wxGBPKlvHYST_2bzptTw.text: We liked the restaurant until the waiter spilled the wine we brought on my husband. They offered free dessert but we don't eat dessert. We asked for free corkage of the $100 bottle of wine that they spilled. They refused. We won't be going back.

yODSy-bFkjlW8hlisCbuIQ.text: For a strip mall steakhouse this place was AMAZING! Do not let the location or the exterior deter you from dining here. It is very nice inside, old Italian style steakhouse. Fancy, but you can wear jeans.  I suggest reservations because it was busy when we went the day after Thanksgiving.  I ordered the lobster and I am so glad I did. It was the sweetest, most flavorful and perfectly cooked tail I have ever had. And I have had lobster everywhere from Japan to France. I believe it was New Zealand lobster which is miles better than any Maine lobster I've ever had. It was pricey, as lobster usually is, but it was HUGE!   Highly recommend! Next time I go I will order the table side bananas foster because a) supposedly it's one of the only places in America that offers it and b) it looked and smelled so delicious!

82RUd3_Y_j5UdCtfa2mWiQ.text: A True gem! Don't let the outside fool you. Golden Steer always impresses! The food, the service, the ambiance,  the history... everything is spot on! Lynn met us at the door with a huge smile! Leo was friendly and personable. We always enjoy this locals treasure and we love sharing it with friends and clients. Make sure you check it out for cocktails, appetizers, or a full dinner. You will not be disappointed.

Y2BnwytsuedOXvvdtX-7UQ.text: Went here to have a nice New Years Eve dinner and was very disappointed.  Food was terrible for the price we paid and our waiter had the personality of a stone!

MejaAA4cu5ayF0QqrqZ50w.text: This place is kind of pricey but good. Golden steer is an old school steak house where Frank Sinatra and the Rap Pack use to dine. The parking here is small and the restaurant sign, although large is very plain and worn down. Shopping area around here is rundown but everything changes once you're inside. Decor is a very old school, dim lightening, wooden tables and chairs. The service is very attentive and pleasant. I ordered the calamari, snails, cream corn, double baked potato, and the ribeye. Food came out fast. Calamari was dry and I don't recommend ordering. The snails were also okay but honestly not worth the price. Cream corn and potato was interesting but fun to eat. Ribeye was delicious, very tender and juicy. Overall, experience here was good but I don't see myself coming back here anytime soon. Good place to celebrate a birthday (most people here are older, like 45+) or an anniversary.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old fashion
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

hQsCH7MxNKJofawfKF0d_g.text: Wow! This Old Vegas location is fantastic! Hubby and I went there on a Saturday night for our anniversary. They were packed! Definitely make a reservation. The food is excellent and the service is even better. Table side service is second to none and the atmosphere is very cool.  If you want vintage Vegas, this is the place.  There is a reason they have been in business for 61 years!  We had the oysters for an appetizer which were delicious. I had the Petite Filet and Crab. Hubby had the Shorthorn.  Everything was cooked perfectly. We both had the sauteed mushrooms and the asparagus sides which were plenty for both of us.  We ordered Bananas Foster for desert. Absolutely delicious! They are prepared and flambed at the table. We also had the Creme Brulee because we couldn't decide. ( : We will be back for sure!!

YLVuANrGU3B4-i_xgJknbA.text: Let's startwith the positive. Their prime rib was one of the best me and my husband has ever had (5 stars). The lobster tail was succulent and sweet (5 stars as well); however, a bit overpriced at $75 for an 8 oz. tail (just because of the price 3 stars). The table side ceasar salad was good but, slightly oily. I'm not to sure how to describe the crab cakes. They were not fishy but, the texture was kind of doughy. It seemed like they were under cooked but, it was really hard to tell because the lighting in the restaurant was really dim. Overall, I recommend you order as their name implies... beef. Let's not forget dessert, the cheesecake was silky and creamy with a fantastic drizzle of strawberry puree.  The service was above my expectations. Our water glasses were always full and there were at least two waiters that were checking on us. Venko was our table side waiter and he was fantastic!

I5MtrhnEJUfDu0sHJqyLyw.text: Since I first came here for one of my honeymoon weekend diners I was hooked! That was 1991, way way back! Incredible old school ambiance, maitre d's, bow ties, red booths, table side preparation, and Elvis music playing in the background!! Golden Steer is one of my favorite go to places every time we are in Vegas, you may even have a star sighting! Steaks, salmon and shrimp cocktail were all a big hit tonight!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scrumptious Shrimp!!

oH-4TnFV8PHLByFOY8AFgw.text: If I could give this place 0 stars or even negative stars I would. Came here for Mother's Day meal and the food is good as past reviews have stated. However, I really do feel that we were discriminated against because we are Hispanic and I am choosing to not eat red meat (the other 5 family members do). From the moment we placed our 1st order the service has been sketchy to down right crappy.  Except for one of them.   Food good...service borders on very very poor.  It's rare that I feel this but other people in my party felt this way too including my mother.   I frequent Vegas and WILL never come back here.

gmzXD0gu9Mqwx9wXpbg3WQ.text: Amazing Vegas atmosphere!  You pay a little more for the food because of the nostalgia but it is well worth it. Our waiter, Carl, was outstanding in his knowledge, service, and friendliness. The steaks were high quality and cooked to perfection.  The Caesar salad, made table side, was excellent as well.  The steaks were filling enough that none of our group had room for dessert. We would definitely recommend the Golden Steer!

8ZIUmEBJXj-yk2euKx8t0Q.text: Old school style in service and decor. Sitting in the booth named after your favorite rat pack is pretty cool. We tried different dishes since we were a table of 6. Meatballs and calamari for apps, both very good. Caesar Salad, great and made table side. Beef....the prime rib was great and oscar filet was outstanding. Both cooked perfectly. I have to mention the horseradish cream sauce (prime rib) and hollandaise sauce (filet) were both really good as well.  Veal Parmesan, surprisingly very good for a steakhouse. Creamed spinach was family style and so good. Even the hot rolls and butter were tasty. No room for dessert sadly, we really wanted to try the banana foster:/ I read reviews about the service not being great which I can agree with in the bar, but once we sat at our table the service was on par. Will go back for sure.

fgjnVJeIioykMsuntgFHFQ.text: Make sure you make your reservations, this place gets packed. This is the oldest steak house in LV, history in this building, you might end up sitting in a celebrity booth. Dinner was decent, service was good, we weren't wowed.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot Cake

5T3n1mqBLJJcyNRbkuYcqQ.text: WOW this place is incredible! Steak is superior and so is the service. Wonderful ambience and a big thank you to our server Humberto he was fantastic!

FTVSkfiLhiUcvVZvsBseqA.text: Celebrated wife's 64th birthday here. Best restaurant in Las Vegas and we've lived here since 1973. I recommend the table side Caesars salad, ribeye steak and cherries jubilee also prepared table side. The wine list is excellent. Highly recommended. The service was perfect.

Lryqe0vqICVBLC8GaCoc1A.text: This place is so bomb!! I love the ambiance very dark and old ! Not a bad old either ! I had the lobster on top of rice pilaf and a side of crab legs !!! They were both so good!! The cream corn I was not a fan but I was of the button mushrooms!! I did also have the fried ravioli so good !! I tried there famous Caesar salad wasn't a fan the dressing was to thin I like a little thicker Caesar dressing ! This was my second time here and again I was not disappointed!! This place is better than the "steak houses" on the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n4cR-RXYrCAr5trQs8-LZw.text: Requested a specific booth twice when making the reservation and didn't get it when we arrived.   The NY strip was cooked perfectly and was delicious, but the sides were not very good. The mashed potatoes were bland and very thin, while the asparagus was so undercooked and also bland.   The atmosphere has a cool, historic vibe to it, but there's other places in town that check more boxes.

v-y6DekEJEB0Bh30d5NbjA.text: With 790 positive reviews , i will keep it short as I ad another .   The the service was impeccable , the food was incredible .   The steaks simply melt in your mouth .

Ryk4SlzZSvVma14BNWySuQ.text: When arriving at the place we wasn't sure what we was getting into. Once entering the building, it has nice old western decor and intimate feel.  After having to wait a little longer than our reservation. The staff was very attentive once seated. We shared a porterhouse steak, twice baked potato, spinach, and asparagus. Everything came out the way we ordered it. Everything has great seasoning and taste. Anyone visiting Las Vegas and wants a good steak off strip. This is the place to go.

nmqa57sKyahLWq53t5b_7g.text: It was very disappointing to have a horrible waiter (tall, asian guy maybe in his 50s) and it effected my opinion of this place. We felt ignored the entire time we were dining. It took 15-20 to get water (after we FLAGGED down someone) and the restaurant wasn't even halfway full. It was like we were invisible!   The food was okay. The petit filet mignon and the NY Strip was pretty bland, lacking flavor. They also didn't cook my bf's NY Strip as he requested (medium), and instead gave him a medium rare piece--red but not bloody. He's too polite to say anything so he ate it anyways. The oyster rockafeller, 2x baked potato & creamed spinach was delicious though. The "special garlic bread" was soooo lame though! 3 pieces for $5! It was basically texas toast! After reading reviews from others, I wanted to also mention that they also double charged us for the "special garlic bread" with 2 orders when we only ordered 1 and it was over-priced to begin with and dry.  To top off the night, the waiter had the audacity to ask me if we were using a GROUPON when giving us our check (keep in mind I had to ask for it because of the crappy service)! WTF!?! HAHA I'm not sure if that was a standard inquiry, but I thought it was an interesting question upon payment. I didn't find it appropriate, especially for a mediocre meal with embarrassing service. As Stephanie Tanner from Full House would say, "How Rude!".

I0MnuVQJhYgMDwhoVJE0tw.text: This was not the experience we have hoped for. My husband, daughter (age 20) and myself were seated in the Dean Martin booth   We had ordered drinks in the bar while we waited for our table.  Our table captain introduced himself and the other two assisting him.  When we declined further bar drinks and change to iced tea, his attitude sharply changed. As we were trying to add to our order he thought we were finished and walked off. Several minutes later our iced tea arrived and the attitude was cold and icy. We had to beg to ask for service and it was clear larger tables with higher tabs were more important.  We l were dismissed as a low ticket table and treated as such. The tables were full and they will not miss us. Go there if you can show you will be spending a large ticket and I'm sure it will be fine. If not, the strip has plenty of options.  We travel the world and I have never been so dismissed as we were tonite.  By the way, the food was average at best.

m_TRyHeUT3wzgHH_U0UQkQ.text: A great restaurant to me is defined by all components of the meal from service and front of house to the last lick of the spoon..this place exceeded our expectations..I've been to all of the usually spots but if you want classy superb service and quality look no further..so much Vegas history was made in this building..the food well I'll let the pics do the talking
