Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cherries jubilee

6UgswYd3nkzdv2GDcGTACA.text: Ambience!!! Steak tender, rib eye my favorite cut. Great flavor didn't need sauces. Huge baked potato and Caesar salad spot on!! Table service excellent. Actually flawless.  Interesting to note I usually get cold in restaurants but even the temperature was perfect. Ill definitely come back.

0ojRobCtUIy_H7U28tebwA.text: Not sure why this restaurant gets such great reviews, the food was very average. The place is dated and in bad need of an upgrade. Plus the location is horrible. The service was amazing, from the bartenders to the wait staff. There are way too many other steak houses to waste your time going to this.

OKyDraXxUDDVPwYCQDX_Kw.text: I've had much better food for 1/4 of the price. Way overrated. Whole paycheck here folks.

s3QuMXH1kio0dWkf1G8KdA.text: It's a Vegas gem to escape the strip.  Food is very good.  Service can be both overbearing and confused.  Love the history and the atmosphere.

BgDWo9hPg4qqM9CYteFxpQ.text: I love this place for the classic, old-school Vegas atmosphere. We went on a very slow night, and had the pleasure of being seated at Oscar Goodman's booth (soon to be Carolyn's booth, our waiter informed us), while the only other diners in the restaurant included an Elvis impersonator at the booth behind us. Frank Sinatra music played in the background. Bring in the showgirls. So Vegas.  Credit goes to our server for making the experience so memorable. He's been there for 33 years and shared a little of the restaurant's history with us. It's refreshing to see a truly professional front waiter, and I get a kick out of seeing my food served off a gueridon, as it reminds me of the horrors of a dining room service class I had to complete in culinary school.  Oh, right, and the food. My husband enjoyed his prime rib and twice baked potato. There's no room for a whiny vegetarian in a steakhouse, and I was perfectly content with my chopped green salad with garbanzo beans and housemade creamy Roquefort dressing and a large portion of fresh green asparagus with Hollandaise sauce. The garlic bread with cheese was also very tasty.   This is the kind of place I would love to take a visitor from out of town. I'm dying to go back and try a dessert prepared tableside (another culinary school memory), so hopefully some touristy people come soon!

1G-rH_Ap4QKHm63jCL-rWw.text: This place encompasses all the things that a great steak house should be.  The ambience is that of Old Style Las Vegas.  We were seated in Muhammad Ali's booth (a party of 6) which was way cool!  I had a salad to start.  It was okay, just your basic dinner salad.  My husband and I both ordered steak.  I got a petite filet and my husband ordered a filet.  Both were cooked to perfection.  Leave it to a steak house to get it right.  I also had the twice baked potato which was delicious as well. My husband had the asparagus and they were cooked enough but still had a little crunch to them and were very good.  To end the night, I had been hearing good things about the bananas foster that they make table side.  People come here for the bananas foster and cherries jubilee.  Because this is an older Las Vegas establishment, they are grandfathered in and one of the only places that are allowed to have an open flame to make their signature desserts.  I must say that my first bananas foster experience did NOT disappoint.  The one caveat is that they could not split up our check, however they do take multiple forms of payment. Note: Proper attire (business casual) is expected at all times.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our booth at Golden Steer steakhouse!

7Jyn1-nUrPZMdqemD9tBHA.text: Great service to start the evening, ordered the Caesar  salad, garlic bread,rib eye,band twice baked potato.  The salad bread and potato were outstanding.  The steak however severely disappointed, after talking with the waiter and being assured and recommended medium, it came out somewhere between medium well and well done.  The manager came by to see how everything was right after they brought the food out. Between then and the end of the meal our waiter was no where in sight, another waiter eventually came by after the table was cleared to offer us dessert then the check.  Overall i'v had better cooked steaks and better service at establishments offering 8$ locals specials.   The only thing salvaging two stars is how good the sale bread and potato were.

5TR48ElnZ12YPpwXmHagnw.text: The absolute BEST steakhouse in Vegas.  The quality is outrageously great!   Forget Mastro's, capital grill, prime or anybody else.  Impress your guests, impress your tastebuds and impress yourself and do NOT miss this gem!

klNOiC-nIqj2Tqr0f-Ksaw.text: On a recommendation from a cab driver I decided to venture off the strip to this classic steak house.  I ordered French Onion Soup, a twice baked potato, creamed spinach and a the smallest cut of prime rib on the menu (18oz)  The food was sub par to say the least but at least the portions were huge.  Soup came out warm not hot and the cheese was not melted properly. The soup itself was tasty but again served at the wrong temperature.  Like many of the other reviewers mentioned the meat was not delivered at the correct temperature.  I ordered medium rare I got somewhere between medium and medium well.  The Prime rib was tender and served with a soup bowl full of horseradish which was necessary because the meat had no flavor of its own.  Normally creamed spinach is my favorite part of eating at a steakhouse.  It was inedible here. IN-E-DI-BLE!!! disgusting just plain horrible, the worst I've ever had, worse than I can even describe, sour, bitter and oily.  Also it was terrible.  The twice baked potato was... nothing to write about, turly uneventful, really neither good nor bad.  At least my Bourbon tasted Okay you can't really mess up pouring Bourbon in a glass from a bottle, Oh an the staff was pleasant, I never felt rushed or ignored.  Their friendliness should be commended.

NfKG_dPtg_eCqOMVcSQ8jA.text: So happy my boyfriend and I finally checked it out after all the hype we heard. However, we didn't think the food was all that great. Very so so for the prices.

FrVfk4V_Jz4Rzvol2MJzGw.text: Visited for my dad's birthday recently. I really enjoyed the Golden Steer. This is really a trow back to a couple generations earlier. It does not look like much from the outside but inside you will find a dimly lit classic steakhouse/lounge. Service was solid throughout our meal including a free birthday dessert. They have several table side preparations to add some old school flare including a Cesar salad and I believe bananas foster. I myself opted for the New Your strip steak which was cooked beautifully and had a great chard flavor and was seasoned well. A great steak for sure. I also had the twice baked potato which was very good. Had a lot of bacon and cheese and the texture of the potato was perfect.

99trsHPZlKD3xyENnHTlzg.text: Old school Vegas at its finest. Black tie waiters, salads tossed table side, good steaks, decent wine list and the interiors are right out of the movie "Casino." Parking sucks but hey its located in a strip mall. This was THE place to eat before all the Fancy Smancy strip casinos opened and it STILL is... Recommend.

oOyLVwOLrnShbN5yVRsBZQ.text: The vibe inside is very old school mob rat pack. I feel like the decor is what you are paying for as the food was slightly underwhelming for the price. I've been to way better steakhouses in vegas for the quality and price point. I will say the Cesar Salad was as delicious as we expected and was so fun to watch the salad spinner make it in front of us.  My husband and I shared the Rib Eye (it was huge) and well prepared but we both felt it was under seasoned. The steaks come al a carte and the sides are definitely big enough to share. We had the twice baked potato as well as the creamed spinach. I thought both were ok and husband thought the twice baked was incredible. I'll tell you what was incredible -- the chocolate cake. My husband and I were fighting over it. I would of given three stars but Carl made the experience incredible- so attentive and friendly. He made the experience unforgettable- I give him 5 stars and the food 3 and a half. He suggested and awesome bottle of wine (Justin cab) that went perfectly with our meal. I'm glad we went it was on our vegas steak house bucket list. I like to say been there done that won't return.... but I'd return for the salad chocolate cake wine and conversation... if we could request Carl as our server !

SpLGrRxp0j8rRjfHDueDnA.text: I don't usually dine at pricier restaurants, but I had a groupon. I had the prime rib. Ordered medium, it was more medium rare, but that's fine too. What was not was the seasoning, or lack there of. Prime rib is suppose to have a nice seasoned crust. There also seamed to be a lack of flavor overall. I also had the asparagus, average. As for the restaurant ambiance- the music selection was abysmal.   Rat Pack's 5 greatest hits on a loop. Decor dated, I realize they are going for the Rat Pack look, but my god!!   The service was the highlight! Superb. Great. Stupendous. By the time I realized I needed something they were walking up with it.

UyZAMNLUkildZ0Sg0cfr8g.text: Forget eating at half the hotel steak houses. This has to be my favorite in Vegas.  Love the decor and the ambiance   We came early so we were seated immediately. By the time we left at 7 it was packed   The hostess was extremely pleasant and the waiter was superb. Helped guide us after a bunch of questions as to what would be best to eat   Clams casino were pretty good Filet mignon cut like butter. And it was cooked perfectly - medium rare. Has the double backed potato and it was awesome. Then I had dessert, cherry jubilee. Holy cow. Amazing   My buddy had the t bone and creamed spinach. Also excellent.   Can't wait to go back.   JG

HPs07IgV9NO3JDJi2c2sNg.text: The atmosphere was relaxed, the chicken parm was slowly cooked perfectly. I'll be back.

s8gpM_k6Rw3n37PCUxnGzQ.text: I have a soft spot for this place... it's one of the last places, if not the last place, I ate out with my father. Walking in, I was waxing nostalgic and a little sad... and really - maybe too much so - looking forward to one of the most amazing meals on the planet.  Ooops.   To be fair, nothing was *wrong* but it just wasn't the 4-5 star amazing steakhouse that, I have no doubt, it once was.   The "meh" experiences:  The lobster bisque had a good flavor but it could have been a little bit deeper. It was also a bit too thick and began to form a skin pretty quickly. I expected much, much more.  The Caesar was a disappointment. (1) It was made in stages; the preparer actually walked away in the middle to do something else, then came back to finish. (2) It was made too soon... so it sat while I finished my soup. I felt rushed because of this and passed my soup on to one of my friends who wanted to try it, just to make room for the hovering staff to deliver the now wilted, warmish salad.  The great experiences:  My escargot were perfect. Tender, a lot of flavor, and with a generous portion of garlic butter without drowning in it. Simply prepared and presented, the meat was the shining star here; spot on.  My companions had the shrimp scampi with fettucini and a petite filet with a side of creamed spinach. The shrimp were large, tender, and done very well. The steak was cooked perfectly to order with just the right char on the outside. Very juicy, fantastic texture, and delicious. I didn't have the spinach (only because I was full off the escargot and tastes of the rest) but it was well received and, in fact, devoured promptly.  The wine service was done well and the bottle of Paso Robles cab sauv I chose was (of course! ;)) the perfect accompaniment to the meal. We were also gifted a Sebastiani as a second bottle. It was good, but nothing spectacular. The thought is what counts, yes, but - and I hate to look a gift horse in the mouth here - you are a steakhouse and touting your wines... serve us something you would tout and celebrate.  The creme brulee we shared was tasty. Nothing more, nothing less.  So far, a solid 3-star experience. A-OK, and "good."  But then...  The AMAZING experiences:  The overall service (minus the salad fiasco) was personal and friendly and engaging. Camacho and Jay and the gang want to be a part of your experience and take care of you old-school style. They are ingrained in the history of the place and are, by far, the main reason to dine here. They will, in between filling your glasses and placing your plates, fill you in on history (the good, the bad, the baudy) and are always quick with a smile, a handshake for the guys, and a wink for the gals. They truly enjoy what they do and it shows.  If you want energetic, you have it. If you want quiet and intimate, you can have that, too. Let them know what to create, and you will find the atmosphere you want. *THIS* is the reason it's a 4-star review/place (as many say, I would do 3.5 if I could). Let the staff take care of you. Be not afraid to make requests, have opinions, and let yourself enjoy the evening.  PS - Camacho's special coffees (not for the under-21 crowd) are yumminess in a cup. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Special&#34; coffee. Tia Maria, Kahlua, Bailey&#39;s.
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Onion Soup

8efzu1TAdGxq6olC6q8s7A.text: It was a very nice birthday dinner for the Hunny. We had a reservation way in advance (we're local so we knew we'd be there on the date/time) and we still got stuck in the middle of the dining room. Food was good. Service was good. Had one of their signature drinks - little too sweet for me (and I like sweet drinks). Doubt we'll be back, but am glad we gave the place a try.

rBq4H9rvvTglQQDCDRRJfw.text: Short and simple. It's all about the ambiance and the atmosphere, baby!   Like many have mentioned, this is old school Vegas. The superficiality, the glitz and glam of all those other prestigious restaurants on the strip....you can forgit-about-it!!! It's always good to go back in time and enjoy what Vegas was once all about.  Food was delicious. (Of course it was...wouldn't expect anything less from a fine establishment like this.) One really cool thing they do here is that they make certain foods in front of you. We ordered a Cesar Salad and it was a fun experience to watch them prepare it for us. Ordered steak and shrimp scampi as our entrees, we were blissfully satisfied.  Also...they lit desserts on fire??!! Seriously. It looks cool to watch but we were so full from our dinner...I couldn't stomach anymore food. Maybe I'll just come here for dessert another time?  Definitely check this place out!

X8UVyWQD6_MuKm05PSxZ-g.text: I, along with six friends, was visiting from out of town to celebrate a special occasion.  We decided to eat at the Golden Steer on a Tuesday night.   For our dinner, we spent over $600.00.  I ordered the large cut of prime rib.  The cut of meat was so full of gristle that I had trouble cutting it with restaurant's steak knife.  Because the meat was so difficult to chew, I could only eat a few bites.  I gave a bite to the person sitting next to me to confirm what I experienced.  So as not to disturb the celebratory atmosphere at our table, I discreetly asked to speak to the manager.  I was directed to a man who identified himself only as "John."  I told John that his restaurant served me the worst cut of prime rib I had ever experienced.  John was not at concerned about the quality of the meat.  He did not even want to see the cut of meat.  He appeared to be concerned only that he might have to give me my money back (for which I never asked).   John said there was nothing he could do.  I would have to telephone and speak to the real manager on Friday.  I think we can find another place to eat on our next visit to Vegas.

5w5oFiV2Z3clarBI0pp_Kg.text: As Las Vegas locals we have been to our fair share of amazing steakhouses around town and we were looking forward to trying one of the classics, we left disappointed. The service and the food were mediocre at best. Our server was short with us and acted like he didn't really want to be bothered with doing his job.   There were six of us in the party and we all ordered the table side Caesar salad, it was drenched in dressing and the dressing wasn't even tasty. I ordered the filet mignon medium and it was served medium well. The sides were nothing special, we had asparagus, mushrooms, whipped potatoes and creamed spinach. The others in the party seemed okay with their entree selections but nothing stood out. We had bananas foster for dessert which was the best part of an otherwise disappointing meal.    With all of the choices in Las Vegas, this is definitely not up to par with the best steakhouses. We will not be back.

1h07_ZUXkd1y0xQbUy2MFA.text: Good; My wife had a filet that was nicely prepared tender and flavorful.  Bad: My Rib Eye was chewy to the point that it was almost non-eatable. The twice baked potato was just barely warm and had to be sent back.   This was our second visit, our first was approximately 2 years ago.....and believe there has been a significant drop off in all around performance based on last night's experience.

KFQHosI9DK7gMPJPb5DugQ.text: Wanted to love the place, but very underwhelmed.  Bad oyster filled with Mud, jumbo shrimp not cleaned right.  Not ever going back.  Also, stupidly expensive.  Like along the lines of Maestros or Joes Stone Crabs but have the quality.  Not feeling it.

2hHBQmxjZCBHAL-saJylVg.text: Like someone else pointed out..... the prime rib was tasteless: it had not been properly seasoned prior to cooking and needed a lot of salt and pepper to give it taste. Even the Au Jus lacked flavor. I am 54 years old and consider myself a prime rib expert, eating it at least 10 times per year and often cooking it myself. The quality of the meat was acceptable with good marbling in the field worthy of a somewhat USDA Prime grade but the chef FAILED to season the meat which rendered a tasteless steak. No flavor!!!!! No fresh ground pepper or salt or rosemary for flavor!!!! WTF!!!!!! for $60???... WTF!!!! The lobster was nice sized and just ok in flavor... once again lacked seasoning!!!!. The asparagus was cooked perfectly but lacked seasoning. The twice baked potato was kind of lame. The table salad served by some guy was PERFECT!!! Our waiter suggested an" Old Fashioned" for a dinner drink...... the guy was a genius!, wow.... better than wine with dinner..... really great bite and flavor!!! The service was very good/excellent and the decor and ambiance is the best that I've been to in Vegas... so peaceful and relaxing. BOTTOM LINE: for a $300 dinner I'd rather drive the extra distance or take a UBER or LYFT to Tuscany Grill in Henderson... still the best prime rib I have ever had, not as romantic or classy but prime rib so tasty and seasoned I still remember it the first time I had it 5 years ago. I most likely wont be back........

UwvqJcckb-A2YzNz35MkaQ.text: I absolutely adore this place like no other in town. Some of the best food around, and your standard low key dark old Vegas atmosphere.   The servers are always top notch and I've never had a bad meal here. Bad dates here, but never a bad meal.

-MwNGAZzkm98KqFnySmNMQ.text: The rating on this one was hard for me.  I loved my steak and potato, but the service was not good and the mushrooms were weird. I guess I will stick with 3 stars, because truthfully I won't go back.   This restaurant is pretty upscale and the food is pricey.  I live next door, so I have wanted to try it for a while.  Then I saw a groupon for $30 off, so I took it.  I took my Grandpa who is 94 and loves a good prime rib, and one of my friends, because well, I like her.   We went pretty early because my Grandpa eats dinner at like 4 in the afternoon, so I have to usually feed him NLT 5:30. Anyway, we got there about 5:15 and it was empty except for one other couple. The decor is very nice with big red leather booths and a romantic atmosphere.  The great thing about the booths is that the tables slide out, so any size can fit!!!  Our waiter took our orders, but seemed very quiet and distant. We asked for tea with cream...no cream came. Then we asked to order wine and he started taking our food order before my friend even ordered her drink. Then there was a small spider in my wine. The waiter offered another glass, but I had drank most of this one and all the spiders siblings, so I declined.  He took it off the bill, but still had a distant demeanor. I almost felt like he didn't want us there. I kept telling my friend, you really expect so much better service from an upscale restaurant.   I ordered the massive 22oz rib eye, because that is my fav cut and the only one in the menu.  It was huge, cooked well and flavorful. I knew this would require a Togo box. Then my friend and I decided to share a twice baked potato. This was yummy. It was crispy in the outside and creamy in the middle with bacon yumminess.  I also ordered the sauteed mushrooms. Warning, these are not typical sauteed mushrooms. These were whole and came with a sauce over them instead of the expected slices in butter.  The weren't gross, but I didn't finish them or take then home with my steak.   Ok, so when we were getting the check, I heard a very bubbly friendly waiter giving the "specials" to his table. Dang, why didn't we get this waiter or were told the specials?!?  I decided to mention it to the manager, because the service was just so disappointing. She told us the waiter had been there for 40 years and was loosing his eyesight and confidence. Now I felt like a jerk. I feel bad for the guy, but I'm torn, because when you order a $52 rib eye, you expect a certain amount of top service to go with it....hmmmm.  What do you think?

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Weird &#34;sautéed&#34; mushrooms. Would not order again.
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twice baked potato-yum!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22oz ribeye cooked med

4DE1sqRJQTA8CoSWC2Z5AQ.text: The worst dining experience we've ever had! Bone in ribeye average at best, no comparison to Delmonico's where we dined the evening before, their "famous garlic bread" tasted like a margarine and cheap cheese on bunt bread, they add Tabasco to their table side Caesar salad which destroys the True flavor, (or masks the quality of the ingredients). We've been disappointed with food and service in the past but, this place was the worst! When I made the reservation on OpenTable I clearly stated we were celebrating my Lady's birthday, when I checked in with The hostess, who was rude, I reminded we were celebrating a birthday and again during dinner I reminded her and our waiter. After our mediocre meal they brought the check without mention of her birthday. I stated my displeasure whereupon they offered a slice of cake to go, I declined and stated my displeasure was being reflected in my gratitude. There are truly great steak houses in Vegas, Delmonico's and Cut in particular serve far superior food and know how to treat their customers. My advice, stay away from Golden Steer Steakhouse.

zXDxwfLF_pB_kiU9YxaqvA.text: LOVE this place.  Great food, and likely the best service in town.  One of the last "old school" steakhouses in Vegas.  Don't let the outside fool you, it is definitely worth a visit.

zzxaGDlTQbqEdNZZC3T96A.text: Best steak I've ever had. The mushrooms as the side was a great choice too. My friends and I showed up in "club" attire and it seemed a bit too much compared to what other people were wearing lol. It is very fancy looking in the pictures but once you're there yeah. Still best steak !!

L0KbfRp1OENNWnktZwFmrw.text: nothing more than a big tourist trap......much better places in vegas for a great steak.....and a whole lot less expensive. ..can not  even make  creme brule correctly ...stay clear of this trap...food was luke warm at best....they need to step it up a few notches......look elsewhere. ...

LVopajIBhZJZaO2P_NEyOQ.text: If you go to Las Vegas and don't dine here, well your just another idiot who wasted all your time on the strip. Hands down the best steak you'll have and a staff that's been around for a while so knows what the meaning of service is.  This is upscale but not pretentious and great for any occasion. You can show up in diamond or denim and not feel out of place.  The bar is fantastic, so if there's a wait, grab a martini, and enjoy all the nostalgia from the days when Las Vegas was entertainment capital, when truly anything went, and when Deano, Sammy, and Ole Blue Eyes ruled the town.

H49cCbshatyl9guNzI-Uww.text: Bryant was our server he was so professional and well educated in Hospitality. I recommend this place 100% food was amazing my wife had filet with lobster and I had the chicken of angels. Amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing dinner.

3ROl_jpjmOCfhvdvI2CfrQ.text: Surprised my wife by taking her here on our last trip to Vegas. When she saw the outside she thought I went cheap on her. Outside it looks seedy but inside is great. Great service and great food. Salads prepared table side and some of the best steaks in Vegas.

8jxvlwjjzEC4Wn93P4mu6A.text: The Golden Steer is not only the oldest steak house in Las Vegas, but it's also one of the tastiest.    The ambiance is classy and the staff are dressed to the "T".  We of course got the table side Cesar salad, as recommended by many fellow yelpers and also the fried calamari, which for a place in the middle of the desert was delicious!  For an entree, I got the bone in rib-eye, which was honestly one of the juiciest and delicious steaks to which I've ever indulged myself.  This accompanied with a twice baked potato was the perfect classic meat and potatoes meal.  My only regret was not being able to finish everything and get dessert.  Next time!  If you are looking for a great spot for a classic meal or an anniversary or birthday dinner and happen to be in Vegas.  Give this spot a shot, you won't regret it!

r_A7uy6FUXxDDD0g7wXMSg.text: Definitely an old school steak house and I say that in a good way!  I haven't been here since the 80s when we came here as tourists.    A friend and I went here to enjoy a tasty steak, and that's just what we did.  Since we were there early, we had run of the place.  We took photos of the different booths where Sinatra, Elvis, Sammy Davis, Jr. and Dean Martin dined.  The hostess showed us a side room where she said Tony Spilotro would dine and she had a story about a counter where their guns were placed before they sat down.  When she said that he was there only a month before his body was found in the desert (after he was murdered, he was buried in a field in Indiana), it cast a little doubt on the authenticity of her story.  Enough of that, on to the meal.  We both ordered the 12 ounce filet that their menu refers to as "the Aristocrat of Tenderness).  I ordered a chopped green salad with Roquefort dressing.  I got the jumbo baked potato that the menu bills as "Vegas' biggest."  Finally, we each had some chocolate cake for dessert.  The bread basket was simply some sliced Italian bread--nothing special.  The steaks were wonderful.  Mine was very tender.  I ordered it black and blue and that's almost the way I got it.  It was done a bit more than I prefer.  My friend ordered his well done--he's a Brit--go figure, but he enjoyed his steak, too!  I only got butter with the baked potato and it was swimming in butter.  It was excellent!  My friend got fries which he described as chips as good as you can get in the States and as good as what he gets at home.  We both ordered the chocolate cake.  This was a bit of a disappointment.  It was a bit dry and a bit small.  There was no dollop of whipped cream to dress it up.    Service was great.  Our server has been with the Golden Steer for years, and he was on top of everything.  Very nice dining experience in a classic Las Vegas steakhouse that has been around for years and years.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The side room where Tony Spilotro would dine with friends.
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate cake.
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super sized baked.

RTuwOZo7cq9qBjJ_84rL7g.text: Nice ambiance. Old style steakhouse. Tableside Caesar salad was prepared well.  The steaks, seafood were properly prepared and the add on sides the same. The wine list is adequate and price points were good.  The only downer is they offered to call their "car service" for our return trip.... this was slower and double the cost if ouir two taxis. Skip the car service and you will enjoy the meal.

sPhK95F3kXQVIoIZGq678Q.text: The ambiance is really great, very dark & sexy & it feels like you stepped back in time. The customer service is exceptional with many people paying attention to your every need & treating you like you're special.  Frank Sinatra tunes play in the background & the food is straight up delicious. I love seeing old school things still popular these days with all the newer restaurants. This was my third visit & won't be the last.  If you enjoy a traditional steakhouse this one will not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Finished product! Hot bananas in caramel over vanilla goodness!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas foster!!!!!!!! Table side! Ridiculous :)
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi...smells like lemon &amp; ocean heaven

qbTnNBpRd7lfig7cqenMnA.text: We come here every trip to Vegas. I make a reservation so I don't have to cool my heels in the bar. Party of seven this visit and everyone said they would definitely come back. Our check average was $75 per person plus drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OTVenLEr3kCVsITczxbSbw.text: great old school decor, nice staff,  great Ceasar salad,the best onion soup, fillet OK but pricey, high end wine list,all in nice meal was ruined by noisy, rude banquet group that disrupted diners in the immediate area, spoke to manage " john " and got the dead pan response 3 times " thanks for telling me " would have been nice to have moved us when they came in or even offered a desert, appears he is not concerned with local business as he lives off tourist one time diners , this not burger king but an upscale Las Vegas steakhouse and the customer spending $***** should be treated  better, Henry was our waiter and he is old school and fab!!do not allow them to seat you near the  banquet rooms, very noisy, think we will stay in summerlin in the future dining R &C CARSON

X4POAcvOYLOuJb9mpDsqaA.text: I've been coming here for years and always enjoy it.  Since I'm new to Yelp I thought I'd make this one of my first reviews.  The Steer just oozes 1960's steakhouse.  If you aren't old enough to remember back then you may want to make comments about how dated it looks and how uninspired the menu is.... so you should not even stop here but just head right over to Prime at the Bellagio.  If, however, you have a clue and enjoy this type experience, read on.  The first time I came (many years ago), it was slow so the lovely lady who takes care of seating gave me the whole story of how the guys from the Ratpack used to go there after their shows for dinner.  They even have the booths that each of them traditionally sat in marked with plaques.  These days it's rarely slow and I would suggest reservations.  For those goofs that somehow seem to think the world is supposed to make way for their last minute whims, there is a bar area where you can wait.  Start with the seafood sampler but be sure to tell them for how many.  Not as much variety as some of the more elaborate offerings in Vegas, but not as expensive, either.  Follow up with the traditional French onion soup for sure.  Traditional in the 1960's sense.  Perfectly acceptable if you know what to expect... if you're a snotty food snob, maybe not for you.  The steaks are great.  If you want to argue about level of doneness when it's brought to you, please educate yourself before doing so.  They will of course do their best to please you but I have been present more than once when a pompous ass tries to show off what they think they know about internal temps for different levels of doneness only to end up proving how little they actually know.  I've never done desert here as I'm partial to Lappert's ice cream (another review to get done) and feel like the time for my driver to get into downtown is worth it.  I can say that the espresso is good and will send you on your way with a little energy to get moving after a heavy meal.  All in all this place is a great nostalgic experience for us older folks who appreciate the traditional and are not looking for the latest gastro-craze goofiness.

ObtT6xZoHQYqF7sYU1sqIA.text: Unseasoned is the name of the game.  I thought the ambiance was 5 stars.  I thought the wait staff was 4-5 stars.  We sat at the DiMaggio booth and the vibe of the place was really quite terrific.  The food, on the other hand... tasted really bland and dated.  We ordered the Chateaubriand for two.  The temperature on the steak was perfect.  However, there was not a lick of salt or pepper on either the vegetables or the meat.  I don't just mean that it was underseasoned, either... it literally tasted like a steak for someone who isn't allowed to consume added salt.  I'm not sure how can you leave cooked asparagus or broccoli unsalted?!  The dish did come with bernaise and hollandaise, and I presume that this was meant as the seasoning agent... but even still, the steak and veggies should have been seasoned.  The food was a massive letdown.  If they could just salt their dishes, then I think you have a winner.

PZsUd_NC6xZ8-fVuuXMPcA.text: Five of us had dinner here last Thursday night (11/4) and it was incredible. The food-steaks, prime rib, Caesar salad, creamed spinach and creamed corn were the best. Service was impeccable and Rika(sp) the hostess was a real treat.  Don't hesitate to go, you won't be sorry.

BEennO8yfnT1_-W4r0B6qA.text: WOW! Fantastic meat! Avoid all the sides except potatoes (mashed or baked), as they are unremarkable.  But I'll go back again and again for the FINE beef and great service. A legendary place with legendary steaks.

HXEDo4b1vf99cELtLbrH2g.text: We were looking for a great steakhouse on a birthday weekend and the taxi driver told us about this place. He said it's where old school politicians & attorneys frequent. He mentioned the location wasn't amazing but not to let that deter us. We came in on a Sunday night and were a little skeptical since its in a strip mall but upon entering where promptly greeted. It was late and only 3 other couples were there. The decor was old school. The waiters were dressed elegantly. We had the house cab which was good. We started with the oysters Rockefeller and the flavor was yummy goodness. I had the filet mignon and crab legs and my honey had the 22 ounce bone in rib eye with a side of creamy spinach. The food was phenomenal. We ended the night with some creme brulee go ahead and pass on that no good. Overall amazing food & service.
