Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamy spinach
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22 ounce rib eye in its juices

HxoNv9gw41jz_mdGdA5exw.text: We really enjoyed this place.  We had filet Mignon and lobster dishes.  They were excellent.  For dessert we had the cherries jubilee which was really neat to watch preparation and delicious to eat. We would definitely return.

6Wn_BSvnPEVu5y6bECfYqg.text: Dined at this restaurant hoping to experience some of the charm of old Las Vegas. Unfortunately we only found some good sides, pictures of past celebrities, and poor customer service.  When we first arrived and were walking up to the front door we were not greeted by a valet or door man, but by a transient who was going through the butts in the ashtray next to the front door. When checking in at the host stand I mentioned that we had a reservation, and was told to pick any table since few tables were in use. I suggested that the host check the reservation two more times, hoping that he would see the special occasion notes that were made with it, The host did not check the reservation and I was never able to covertly mention the special occasion throughout the evening.  After selecting a table our drink orders were taken by the host. A short time later a waiter came to the table who spoke with a thick accent and was somewhat difficult to understand. He seemed to indicate that our drinks probably were not being made and said he would check on them. When the drinks did arrive, the waiter commented that it was a good thing he checked because they were not being made, then asked if we were ready to order. Waiter never introduced himself or explained anything about the restaurant or menu. We placed our orders of rib eye (medium rare) and fillet mignon (medium) with a table side Caesar, side salad, creamed corn, and twice baked potato.  Salads came to table and a busser/expediter tried to remove them from he table while we were still holding forks and eating. Explained to him that we were not done yet, but would definitely set our forks down on the plate when we were. Same young man came back about four minutes later and tried to take the salads again!  The entree's were brought by someone other than the server. The cooked medium was fine, but the medium rare was over cooked. When the server was flagged down by us (never came by on his own) we advised of the issue. The server looked at the cut and excused himself to get a woman who appeared to be the manager. We explained again that the piece was over cooked, and the server interrupted the conversation with the manager to insist that we cut further into the center of the steak in hopes that the exact center of the steak might be to our liking. The manager admonished the server a little, and said obviously the steak was over cooked and had a new one ordered.  When the replacement cut arrived it was under cooked and almost slimy. My partner was frustrated as my meal was almost completed at this time, and when asked if they should fire it up again we declined because my meal was nearly completed and mentioned to them that the cooks at a "fine" steak house should be able to get their cuts cooked correctly since that is their specialty.  We left feeling quite disappointed in our attempt to visit "Old Vegas" hospitality and dining, and have told friends both in LV and going to visit to skip this steak shop.

J13T6pau_tVGJUSlhWTsVg.text: Loved it but not 5 stars love. Wonderful server (Umberto I believe) Nice place with old school charm. A few things that would make me happy would be: Serve the martini with an extra shot on the side in an ice bucket. Improve the bread choices. Loved the broiled crap legs and the prime rib was very good. Still, next time I am in the mood to spend over $100 a person in Las Vegas it's back to Hugo's Cellar!!

LsDGGmgpCKZMVbddfp0WCA.text: I think I must be reviewing a different dining establishment many Yelpers here are raving about! I love nostalgia and especially the vibe of the golden age of Vegas, but that is all this place is surviving on and poorly at best.   The steakhouse salad we were served was disgraceful. The cheapest white garbage iceberg lettuce (cmon people, not a leaf of green) inadequately drained with chunks of carrot that were actually old and dried out, 5-6 chickpeas, husband had a tomato slice, all topped in an already runny "Roquefort " dressing. Diluted Roquefort dressing my favorite.  Prime rib was not prepared to temperature. No flavor. No herb crust. I prepare prime rib multiple times a year in salt crust and it's flavorful moist and delicious. This was NOT from top grade quality prime rib! The broccoli was essentially raw. The generic French Bagette wasn't even Trader Joe's or Smiths quality. Very generic. Dining partner had lamb chops which were decently flavorful. Nothing to rave about.  Service was "ok" but water spilled on member of our party. Main course dishes left to sit for was toooo long after dining was complete.  The vibe is one of surviving on a shoestring. ...Serving a fairly low quality and mediocre flavor experience for ridiculous prices to maximize profit. The leather circular booths are nostalgic. Don't look on the ledges surrounding where they meet the wall where some giant wine and liquor bottle replicas sit. Dust is 1/4 inch thick...  Look for this to make it maybe a few more years. Could be made really appealing. Clean it up a little, do a little overhaul and for Gods sake get a real chef in charge who didn't start his career  as a short order cook at Denny's.   Disappointing would be an understatement.

ubz9w0d7Rl1N4wRMEexG5A.text: Wow.  Words can't do justice to how special they made my wife's and I feel on our nice night out.  The authentic Old Vegas reality of this place is just incredible, something no other strip restaurant can ever touch.  Don't let the strip mall location fool you or affect your experience, once you're in the doors you feel like Sinatra is just in the next room.

3bB2PQs2o1R6ywc2AKeO-A.text: This is one of my favorite dining experiences ever....   1. The food is amazing: Caesar Salad is made at your table from scratch, Steak is perfectly done, the twice baked potato is a must 2. Love love love the atmosphere 3. Stiff drinks and good wine list  I can't understand why people poo poo this anything below 4 stars... and the reviews that complain about the servers... nonsense... old school gentlemen in tuxes who are no-nonsense.  I think others who don't dig it are used to the steak houses in the hotels that are more modern decor and such... pussies

vyWwxPmSONu4if-Xf62FcQ.text: The moment we got out of the short taxi ride from Wynn to Golden Steer - we were transported back in time, setting the clock back a few decades.  Just take a look at the exterior building, and the signage, and you'll know what I mean.  Once you enter the restaurant, you'll see the decor of an era that has come and gone, with the leather red booths, and classic bar.  If you are expecting or desire up to the date modern plating and presentation, this is not your cup of tea, unless you count 70's plating style as modern.    However, taken as a whole, serves good food with period decor and atmosphere that just isn't replicable and if replicate just isn't genuine.   My steak was cooked to temperature, I enjoyed the huge shrimp cocktail, and the twice cooked baked potato, as well as the caesar salad.

2DcwA1sx3larwo_qDO2JeQ.text: like going back in time to hang out with the rat pack!  steaks are fantastic, the lobster tails are HUGE, and any place that makes your caesar salad in front of you deserves an extra star just for that alone.  can't wait to return!

IuWBkxGz50or3z4599ftBA.text: It took 16 years,  but we finally made it!  A great steakhouse with outstanding service and food.  Wait staff was excellent, steaks were prepared perfectly,  and cocktails were tasty.  Recommend!

06mj0updHbV0wURZoo57_g.text: Poor Service but most of the food was excellent WHEN we received it.  There were 9 of us so to make it less confusing we had 2 people in our party order all the appetizers and the sides so we could share.  Three of the  fourteen  that we ordered were missing and it took another 15 min for those to arrive with no apology.  Our Waiter acted as though it was our fault. Everyone ordered their own dinner but I personally ordered 4 sides of mushrooms, 2 with butter and 2 without.  When the mushrooms came with the main dishes only 3 were delivered and it took 20  minutes to get the last one so most of us were finishing our steaks.  My prime rib had no flavor and was tough.  An expensive meal to be so disappointing.  One of the people in our party told the waiter she is vegetarian so she just ordered the baked potato as her entree.  When it was delivered, it had a lot of bacon on it so she was unable to eat it.  The waiter was indifferent. There were 2 birthdays in our party so they promised a complimentary piece of cheesecake but it wasn't delivered until after the bill was paid.  The 2 birthday people left after the bill was paid to go to a show so the waiter wouldn't leave the complimentary cheesecake with the remaining 7 people at the table.  How petty was that when it was his fault that he didn't get the cheesecake to the table 2 hours after we sat down and the bill was paid.  The 7 left at the table were just finishing the wine I personally brought which had a corkage fee of $30 per bottle for a total of $120 for 4 bottles.  We had been to the Classic Steakhouse at Circus Circus 2 nights earlier and the wine corkage fee was waived for a party this big and the food was fantastic.  Great Classic atmosphere but when you have bad service it takes away from the atmosphere and the food.

99jvv6NqHP4JYqx5DN74Vg.text: This was the best steak dinner I've ever had!  My family and I had been looking forward to this dinner for months. The ambience and history of the restaurant make the dinner that much more memorable. We ordered 3 cuts: 2 bone in 22 oz ribeyes, 1 - 16 oz New York strip and 1 diamond Jim cut prime rib that was 24 oz. we started with the seafood stuffed mushrooms and ordered 3 sides to split between the four of us, which was more than enough to share and we had leftovers: creamed spinach, twice baked potato and sauteed mushrooms. We ended the meal with a shared order of the table side prepared bananas foster - to die for. It had this amazing pop of orange zest. Best I've ever had by far. On top of this amazing dinner, the staff is fantastic. They interacted with us and made the experience even more memorable. We come to Vegas at least once a year to visit family and this has always been on our list to try and I'm so glad we did.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in ribeye left and top, diamond Jim prime rib right and New York strip on bottom

LoSXqmG3_V3rLS0_yTmkEw.text: I had a $50 steak that was not very good - too much gristle and not very tender or flavorful.  The clam chowder was surprisingly outstanding.  The sauteed potatoes with onions was very tasty as well.  The ambiance is old school Vegas, and the location is way off the strip.  If I'm going to pay $50 for a steak, I expect it to be excellent and the location and ambiance stellar--this place is far from that, unfortunately.  I did like the service a lot; nice waiters.

QY-TEUy_xiuPqs91or58EQ.text: If want to get away from all the hype on the strip. Make a reservation, dress up and treat yourself to a classy dinner at The Golden Steer. I'm only in my 30's but I got a glimpse of Old Vegas as a little girl. This place is a well preserved piece of that era.

sdeLToxU0LjdPrSo1r6ZIg.text: We've been in Vegas for 20 years and never set foot in the Golden Steer till now. The ambience is definitely old Las Vegas from furniture, decor to food. Good traditional prime rib and rib eye. It was cooked to the right temperature of medium rare. My husband ordered the $34 salmon and it was dry. That was a disappointment. But I told him who orders seafood at a steakhouse? LOL. We had the cream of spinach and the potato lyonnaise. I took a bite out of my neighbors baked potato- should have had ordered that instead. Sidecar was potent - thank you! The crowning moment of experiencing the flaming banana foster could be more theatrical. I had to ask the server to tell me about the restaurant which I think he could've entertained us more especially for a $1000 bill. He gave us history of the restaurant, the Brat pack and the Mafia. Now that is how you wow your guest.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Foster
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband&#39;s salmon.
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot- I had pet snails once ...

zntihk9U2skgSeVAMkDXsw.text: WHAT A MEAL!!!  Traveling on business with a large group, we had a breakout dinner with 16 people. We had a reservation so they were expecting us.  I usually start commenting on the food, but this time will start with the staff and service. WOW!  Amazing!  Excellent!  These folks have it together and didn't miss a beat all evening. From the time we walked in, they make you feel like family and that we are supposed to be here.  Once we were all situated and seated, the main waiter gave us a run down the appetizers and wine/drink selections. But he also proceeded to tell us a short story of the history of the Golden Steer. Very intriguing. Love the old pictures of Dean Martin and Sammy Davis jr.  For apps we ordered several of the seafood platters. Scallops, shrimp, crab, oysters and prepared to perfection. A few bottles of red wine were in order since we all selected steak as our main course. I personally had the 22oz ribeye. Delicious. Several others had Filet or prime rib. No one left hungry this evening and we skipped dessert.   I would HIGHLY recommend stopping by when in town and making this one of your meals in Vegas.

I7-5ss4a0b49DcxciFkmfQ.text: Just celebrated my birthday at the Golden Steer Steakhouse. Had a 34 oz. rib eye steak custom cut for me. Wife had prime rib. Olie and Jonathan were our wait staff.  Extraordinary-steak. Amazing service. Absolutely 5 stars! Highly recommend. Mike S. HENDERSON, NV

My6zd7xZQgc4L-S8__TZjA.text: The only reason I am not giving this steakhouse 5 stars is because of the knives they gave everyone to cut our steaks (everyone else agreed)... such a shame to rip apart a steak like that...   All in all, this place was very good... but "the Steakhouse" at Circus Circus is still my favorite

DJDPh6bEJJx5FNtr9H9jfw.text: We got a recommendation to eat here so we decided to give it a try.  At the north end of the Strip off on Sahara... the Golden Steer is "Old Las Vegas".  When you drive up you will think the place is stuck in 1958. And you might consider giving the restaurant a pass. Don't. The food is great. Fantastic steaks and seafood. We had both. You will be hard pressed to get a better steak in Las Vegas. And try the asparagus.  Oh... and consider making a reservation.

cvssc_xxlPrKN-yo4bxViA.text: On a whim we landed this place. We had no reservations, but there was a cancellation, and were seated right away. Service was decent and friendly. We were in jeans and shirts (race weekend), probably a bit underdressed.  Our party of three ordered a prime rib, filet mignon, and a ribeye. My husband said the prime was good. My ribeye was very good. We ordered brocolli and a twice baked potatoe as a side. The sides were mediocre. The steak truly was the highlight of dinner.   The steakhouse totally had a old school feel to it. Dim lights, leather booths, and rat pack memorabilia.   It was a good no thrill restuarant, away from the vegas crowds. Would come again. Our total tab was $230 for a party of 3, no alcohol, tip included. Would not split the tab.

Rq1dDUxYPLANvx4ezGE4lg.text: Great food and fancy joint on the inside (not the outside though!) Located in a rinky dink mini mall parking lot, you'll be surprised to walk in and see the wait staff in tuxedos. The steaks are my absolute favorite, very worth the high price.   Only two issues, one being the woman on the phone had attitude, I was trying to book a reservation and for some reason she didn't sound polite, she came off stuck up and rude. Always train your staff to be super sweet and professional with costumers.  Second being, it's super awkward when a waiter comes up to you at the end of the meal with a hand held credit card processing machine, where you're forced to pay the bill and select a tip option right in front of the server. I feel that should be a private choice to make, without the scrutinizing pressure. Why don't they just run cards the old fashioned way? If Frank Sinatra ever ate here, I doubt he had to experience that nonsense.   Food warrants the pricing, outter facade and a few other things need some work.

CqAWkC0I5XXu7BpFhy-UDQ.text: Old school steakhouse. Can't go wrong. Very good Escargote

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot is great

Pt8bIMNP8W8FGXRmUdhljA.text: Went with a group of 9 people , had a nice semi private room in the back. Service was mediocre, They forgot a few extras things we ordered. It is a little picky but these types of places are known for their service. Food was good but not at a level commensurate with the price. The prime rib had little taste. Dollar for dollar you can do much better in that great food city.

kvPrB2Av05TkFs4eMooQ4g.text: As good as it gets, indeed!  The ambiance, service, drinks and food were all impeccable.  At a slightly higher price point, I expected everything to be amazing and it was.    Our party of 15 (split into the 4 Rat Pack Booths) shared 3 servers so everything was quick and accurate.  The restaurant has an awesome vibe that is chill and relaxing yet with it's decor you kinda envision the era and what the good old days were like there.  The rolls!!!! ... Piping hot and oh so fresh, if it wasn't for wanting to taste all the food, I could have eaten several more.  I loved my glass of wine!  The steak was juicy and cooked perfect to my liking!  All the sides were great.  Our table shared broccoli, mushrooms, a huge potato and calamari.  Of course we had left overs, but it was worth it to try as much as we did.  I highly recommend this place for a nice dining experience and/or a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our spread...all delicious!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GubSXEBn3R-wxgeEDt0oRA.text: I'll say 2.5 stars, rounded to 3 but it's pushing it. My boyfriend made reservations here for my 21st birthday dinner after seeing all the great reviews.   The service was pretty slow overall and had a hard time knowing who our waiter was, or getting the attention of any waiter at all. The steak was good, as you should expect in a expensive steakhouse, but the fries just didn't cut it --they were pretty burnt when they came out. When the time came to bring out the birthday dessert, the waiter literally put the dessert in front of me, lit the candle, and stood there. He didn't sing or comment or even talk, just kinda stood there and stared at us.  I wasn't sure if that was restaurant policy or what, so I tried not to think anything of it. A few moments later, another table had a birthday, and the same waiter sang to them and did this whole thing. Like ok????? Time came for the check and the waiter (whom we had probably seen once) was shocked at our complaints and simply gave us attitude. For being so renown and expensive, it wasn't an experience worth the price, and the customer service didn't make up for it. Won't return.

IvRdiYHHEle6quc8F5OyBA.text: This review is for the bar only!  A couple of months ago a few co-workers and I were talking about steakhouses.  We work very close to this one and heard a lot of good things about it.  The food is supposed to be good as well as the history of the place.    When my friend mentioned he'd like to go here on his "Goodbye Vegas" tour (he's from here and moving "forever" away), I figured this would be the perfect time to finally try this place out.  Upon walking in, you can feel the history and not just with the kitsch on the walls.  Coming in from outside is almost like a time warp.  It's very reminiscent of what a "fancy" restaurant was like for me as a child.  I personally love the decor and ambiance.  Pure classic old school steakhouse.     While we didn't eat dinner, we did get a couple cocktails at the bar.  There's a section that's a couch, a love seat and few wing back chairs.  This couch is the most comfortable leather couch you'll ever sit in.  A very nice place to have a few drinks and conversation.  The bar is pretty big as well.  This section, plus ample bar tables and the bar itself (about 15 people long).  The service was good.  Bartender was quick and available.  Came by our seats to check on us.    The drinks were great.  The Golden Steer was perfect.  Great balance and really pretty.  The negroni was excellent and perfectly bitter in the right way.  I tried my friend's Bramble.  A little sweet but still very good.  Definitely looking forward to having a meal here.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice big bar area
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Living room section of the bar

abvBW-ssE_5CvHtvlI6-1w.text: Great vintage Las Vegas steakhouse from the Rat Pack day's. Steak was outstanding as well as everything else.  Only reason why I gave it four stars is because I'm a regular at Peter Luger's which in my opinion is the only five star steak house in the country.  I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamed Spinach
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo Baked Potato Vegas &#39; Largest
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib Roast

FCjqNsY_AQO8u7xumQXv1Q.text: The finest steakhouse and most elegant waitstaff with ambience steeped in rat pack 1960's history is found right here 7 days a week.   No better place to experience an authentic. Las Vegas experience with fantastic good.  Service is top notch and friendly and efficient .

AH20j68HPzP9JG40nUyfhA.text: What an experience dining at this historical restaurant. The ambiance is excellent so don't be afraid of the surroundings on the outside of the building. When you open the door and walk-in everything will melt away just like the steaks do in your mouth when you take your first bite. Don't miss the table side Caesar salad. It will take you back to the old days. I sat in Dean Martin's booth where he dined consistently when he was in Vegas.

JrOKm5DzkzRh0fhKk3epJQ.text: We've been meaning to try this steak house for some time now, we are local and live right around the corner, driving by it nearly every day. The other night we finally booked a table and went.   WOW! Everything about our experience was perfect. From the greeting, seating, our team of waiters, and the manager stopping by to check on us - TOP NOTCH.   The food is great, we love shared sides, and all the selections of main courses - so GOOD!   Our waiter Carl was a dream. Funny, engaging, super helpful, and just meshed well with our personalities - we will be requesting him from now on.   I ordered (at the waiter's suggestion) the Filet Oscar, on special that night. And it was DELISH! Thanks Carl.   The hubs ordered the 12 oz filet and it was just as tasty. The cut, prep, everything was YUM!   We are thrilled that our first time was so good - it will most definitely not be our last.   Thanks again, Golden Steer - we will see you again soon!  Cheers!

vQcOIqgwtDUs08PhaTF42A.text: Talk about old school cool!  In town for business we always try to have a nice meal on the trip.  Perusing the hotel steakhouse offerings, they all seemed pretty similar and we weren't getting excited.  Then the bartender at our hotel recommended the Golden Steer.  Off the strip, we thought, we'd give it a chance.  Pulling up to the restaurant, it isn't much too look at.  Stepping in is taking a time machine back to the 60's style, with coffered ceilings and old style booths.  Straight out of Good Fellas I tell ya!  All the waiters were in tuxes, very well dressed, but the atmosphere was more casual, not so stodgy which we enjoyed.  The food, excellent.  Tried the scratch made Cesar Salad, the best cesar I've ever had.  The prime rib was perfectly prepared, much much better than Lawry's (I'll never go back to a Lawry's ever again) and I got it Oscar, cuz why not.   The Australian lobster tail had a great sweet flavor you expect from Australian lobster tails.  Moscow mules, well made.  All in all, if you have been too Vegas and haven't been too the Golden Steer, you haven't visited Vegas.  This excellent experience really has gotten me to consider getting out of the casinos for eating experiences.  The service was top notch and the experience was refreshing.  I think everything is better once you get out of those damn casinos!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib....Oscar cuz why not

oXfLZ9_sI7O2o56SffYuSQ.text: Second Steakhouse I have gone to in Vegas, as it seems like a good meal to have when visiting.  This time I went with "classic", and glad I did.    Authentic, delicious, and honest, Golden Steer doesn't mess around with image because it doesn't have to.    Treated my Dad to dinner, with us both ordering the Ribeye (duh) and  a Caesar Salad to begin, which was made table-side.  The service was excellent, the food outstanding, the atmosphere real, and the overall experience worth repeating...

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks/Location can be deceiving...

AwBt77gq4lCOyrd8x6SHkw.text: Off the strip location on a shopping mall strip. It didn't look flashy or fancy from outside. Hold on! This is where the old adage "do not judge a book by its cover" applies. Major twist... Once you go in, you are transported in time to glamorous 60's!    In summary, best meal we had in Vegas (relative to value)!  Ordered oyster Rockefeller, stuffed mushroom, prime ribs - 10 and 18 oz - with side dishes Jumbo potato, creamed spinach & corn. Couldn't venture out this time on table side Caesar salad because of the recent e-coli outbreak. Maybe next time.  For someone who dislikes raw oyster, oyster Rockefeller was a perfect appetizer. Had better stuffed mushrooms but the important stuff, Prime Ribs, were cooked spot on - medium rare! Tasted better than Lawry's (and maybe better than House Of Prime Ribs in SF). Creamed corn was a tad sweet but couldn't stop eating. Creamed spinach was right on.  Definitely better attentive services than HOPR by Ali and his staffs! That is a huge~ plus.  All this feast (and some non-alcoholic drinks) was at about 1 person's price at a high end strip location restaurant. I like it!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best meal of the entire trip!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side dishes... jumbo potatoes, creamed spinach and corn
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib 18 oz

Elilozob4mQvqUmAbPsfsA.text: If you ever go to a steakhouse just to buy a side of creamed corn, then you know it's got to be the best creamed corn ever made... I don't know what they put in it, but it is delicious !! When I am on my deathbed my husband has been instructed to bring me this creamed corn and some foie gras and then I can die happy !!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. To go creamed corn,  a little  pricey  at 12.00 but you get a good amount  !!

AAXgxbVeZvNYRPaz9Y7Bjw.text: A great old school Vegas steakhouse. Great food & service. A must goto for locals & tourists.

FA9wppWEo7IiIFrzpEsVjw.text: I was shocked on how the food was, not what I expected...had the ceasar salad, tableside...good but the entrees were not good, waiter forgot to bring the wine with my steak and had the nerve to charge us, luckily we looked at the bill....but the bar guy came rushing over and said "I noticed this sitting for a long time you still want it?" Ugh hell no,  we wanted it wyrh dinner dumbass....we didn't order dessert,  couldn't wait to get out....wont be returning

ofrGH03CP9FcvKrxBinYEQ.text: Our favorite dinner in Las Vegas!! A lovely old world steakhouse off the strip. We loved everything about our dining experience. Decor, service, cocktails, food and desserts were all outstanding. We will definitely return to this restaurant!! Every detail was what I was hoping for and they delivered!! Loved it!

b2HzA4kuiACDhd3-cAJ9XQ.text: What a cool spot  For sure a classic old school steakhouse. I love the fact that it still is authentic Vegas and didn't collapse into a remodel. The food was excellent and everything you would expect. We had the table side Ceaser Salad followed by filet and bananas foster.   The sides were twice baked potato, Broccoli simply steamed and mushrooms. Steak was perfectly cooked.

t6Tpmypk6rov6_FGRxPqrQ.text: OUTSTANDING....what else can be said.  We both ordered the filet and lobster. The filet was melt in your mouth tender and the GIANT lobster tail was cooked to perfection.  To top off the meal was the flaming bananas foster.  Service was very attentive and on point.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vAbstSgs9ufO0zoocbiPug.text: Absolutely fantastic!! Great service, beautiful atmosphere, professional staff, exquisite food.  This is a super restaurant.  You'll have more fun here and leave with a better story to tell than from any steakhouse on the strip.  Also have lots of seafood options that are very good.    Thank you for a memorable and wonderful evening.  I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cocktail.   Great

hXIYdlW1JMzNSCiJWwqyMQ.text: Could not be happier with this restaurant.  The cocktails were good, the steak was perfect and the staff was amazing.   This place is old school steak house with that Vegas charm that has been lost on the strip with their mass produced overrated slop houses.  This is now my new go to for steak in Vegas.  The nostalgic feel just makes it that much more enjoyable.

tkA_pLvA3elA0AFFcg3cxw.text: As a Las Vegas local, this used to be one of my favorite steakhouses to take friends to. Not sure what has happened but we won't be back. Food has become average at best, and service is lacking. It was always a bit pricey but the atmosphere made it fun. Plenty of other great steakhouses in town. See ya!

Q9qHmmkpKbLTZ5UktuB_Yw.text: A tremendous dining experience!!!! The steak was cooked to perfection and the service was spectacular...This restaurant really takes you back to the way Vegas used to be!!! I highly recommend the The Golden Steer!!! The Caesar Salad is made tableside!!! Old School Style!!!

EmFvvde2bKd6SDmXE7G0Yw.text: I seriously love this place! Such a unique vibe and the food is great too. I love all the history behind the restaurant and the service is phenomenal. Definitely my favorite steak house in Vegas.

dsvv7uNgg8Z91h-xZoGC1Q.text: All I can say is WOW!  Not much to look at from the outside, but a 40's era on the inside.  We were greeted by the friendly hostess.  We were 20 minutes early for our reservation so we waited at the bar.  Bartender was very nice and was helpful in recommending a red wine for me. In the dining area, we sat at the John Wayne booth.  We ordered the special fillet of the day topped with crab, prime rib, asparagus and the Caesar salad.  Everything was delicious.  The only thing I would ask for next time is to see if they could add anchovies or anchovy paste to the salad.  A True Caesar has anchovies in it. The service was over the top!  We will definitely be back!

7uExRj3hq05_fOu-GlVkYQ.text: Great experience for the first time visit. Ambience was great, service excellent. Ordered the Ribeye bone in and one the best steaks I have ever had in Las Vegas. My side dish of mash potatoes was like being home with mom making them from scratch. Definitely will visit again for another Bone in Ribeye.

N1mzhmh3pB0m1GWGb1eE8Q.text: Great steakhouse with lots of history. Had a packed house when we arrived but they offered the gangster room for our smaller party. Appetizers were great, Caesar salad made table side. I have had better steaks but it was cooked to perfection. Bananas foster is a show in itself! Will go back

Wf_pqhxrDgrW-9JSGVdLfw.text: WILL BE BACK! We wanted to celebrate a special occasion with an exceptional steak dinner. We also want to avoid the celebrity-themed restaurants in any of the mega-hotels. Well, we picked a winner when we picked Golden Steer! Other reviews describe the ambiance and they're spot on. It feels like Las Vegas several decades ago...which is a good thing. It has old world Vegas charm and friendly, professional staff who helped make it a great night. At our table we had two filets and one rib-eye. All three of us thought our steaks were perhaps the best ever. Cocktails, salads, sides, wine, coffee and dessert were also great. The Uber ride from our hotel near the center of the Strip took less than 10 minutes and cost $8. Will definitely go again on future visits.

rzuk8xHyUkX15Tf6bjIxpQ.text: Good Las Vegas steakhouse. Oysters on the half shell were rather small, great horseradish tho. Steak was very good, had the 22 oz ribeye which was big enough to share. Perfectly cooked. Paid about $175, pretty pricey for tiny oysters, a shared steak and chicken Parmesan. Not even any drinks.

ZxK382FEJ4emLwiH0xhaLA.text: I didn't expect to walk in to a seen from goodfellas or godfather. it was such a cool old school Vegas restaurant, I think I even ordered our food with a bit of a Italian gangster accent. I was like "Aaaaa da lady will have da labsta" anyway the steaks were very good, the lobsta fish was ok, and the sides were all excellent! we had a Great time and I'll definitely go back.

wY5RUIzw9tJo8-bhEbYI5w.text: On Wednesday night friends  took me out to dinner at the Golden Steer For my Birthday, All I can say is WOW. The food was incredible. I had the Prime Rib the Diamond cut, it was perfect. From the service to the Desert everything was so good. The staff was so friendly and you felt like they truly wanted to make your time with them amazing.I know its not really a big deal but even the Ice tea was so fresh and perfect and the glass never when empty, the waiter would fill it again just after a few sips. I would suggest that if your looking for the best food and a real nice time you need to have dinner at this restraint when in Las Vegas.

84oGdyeRYy7W_dNecj5HUg.text: An absolute classic!!! If you love "old school Vegas" this is the place. Great food, great service, classic decor...a little too dark but not bad. Food was delicious and the servers are incredibly friendly and very knowledgeable.

_5bWmH12IuWsXQ80vuCjMQ.text: Clark and Ali were awesome. Every time we're in vegas  we try a new  steakhouse and the golden steer by far has been the best. The porterhouse and cream corn are to die for. The side car and cosmo were great.  The ambiance is amazing and the knowledge that Clark had of the history of the place and his story telling was amazing. If you go ask to sit I the rat pack section and let the stories fly. Felt like I was transported back In Time to to 50's-60's. The place has a great feel don't  let the outside fool you. Open the doors have a drink in the lounge and enjoy the expierience.

O0Hg79PZX2jyzVSntZiiRQ.text: Okay first and foremost the steak was profoundly amazing (as were the sides, the creamed spinach was like unimaginably delicious) but everything about this place was so great! The ambiance and interior space are like so thoroughly nostalgic and exude that old school Vegas glamour (this restaurant has been open for 60 years, so it's actually like a perfect time capsule of that era). The service was exceptional; we had not one but TWO waiters, Scott and Eduardo, who were both really nice and super attentive. Also, Fabian from the kitchen was really sweet and offered to bring our food back out to present a second time without me even asking (my uncle was in the bathroom when he brought it the first time and he must have intuitively known I wanted to include him in the food presentation, lol). This was an amazing dining experience I will for sure treasure.

ntd4ZUqOzFpc6FsHFuo_kw.text: It was my husbands 30th birthday! His father was in town with his girlfriend   ... And wanted to take us out to dinner... We were having a hard time coming up with somewhere to eat...and I suggested the Golden Steer..have never been, but a landmark in Vegas I had always wanted to try... I am a upscale hairstylist and take many clients out and suggest many places to clients... Who are also educated and well to do....  We had reservations for 4 people at 7:45...     We walked in and over to his father and girlfriend sitting at the bar... they looked a bit frustrated...said they had been sitting there for 10+ mins and had not been offered a drink.. Said that "It  seemed as if bartender couldnt have been bothered"... Tried asking the bartender myself for a service when he had a moment... Didn't really aknowlage me and we stood there another 5 mins... I guess that should have been our sign... Decided to just go to dinner and order wine at the table... Stood at the front podium where I noticed an older lady who was our hostess? No greeting .. Just 4? And turns....we follow hoping that we should be .... Sit at the table and young man offers us water.., yes please and can we order some wine?              Then our waiter appears...      Fabian, I'm told later, he states  "So we are in dire need of drinks!??" with a condescending undertone, but doesn't even have the wine menu with him!.. Walks back and practically drops it in my husbands lap.  Another 15 mins later ! Comes back and we eagerly order wine and an appetizer. Fabian "our waiter" doesnt ask if there is a special occasion? nor does he introduce himself..or anything of that nature a waiter should do...  we are now all picking up his rude attitude around the table.. My father in laws girlfriend leans into me and says ... Did we do something wrong to our waiter? I has just wondered that myself I replied... With a shrug..;( When the wine and appetizer comes its been another length of time... Fabian drops it off and my husband has to call to him, quickly as he is already 10 feet from our table  ... "Excuse me... But may we order please ??"  Then he hastily takes our order in a way as if he is too busy to be doing so, doesn't write it down.. ...doesn't take our enormous menus from the table. My husband asks him to "Please be more diligent with us and  would you mind checking on us more often, we also need..........." ( I kid you not as he asking him this he is literally shaking his head yes while walking away before he can actually finish his sentence!  A few more minutes later a NEW waiter comes, I guess Fabian just handed us off?, with our wine and is much nicer but pours my Cabernet into my father in laws Zinfandel glass with wine actually still in it (cab is red and zin is pink)  I'm sure everyone knows and hate to say it but its absolutely a fau pas to do that..... .. Wow ! That's never actually happened before ) gives me my husbands merlot and  2 down and 2 to go... Father in laws girlfriend gets her Chardonnay (yay!) and no Zinfandel for for him;(.   Ah yes okay 3 wrong 1 right... Hahaha its almost comical how bad this is going The rest if the dinner is satisfactory.. ALL IN ALL... the food was very decent,  service sucked so  horribly bad that the overpriced (decent food ) was NOT worth it!!  Will be telling my family friends and  clients not to go..

ySxdcfrZ9qwiAaLYdO8W6Q.text: Originally went to this place on the recommendation of a cab driver and have returned a half dozen or so times since. The ambiance is fantastic. The food has been great every time. The complaint remains the same as with all other reviews...the wait staff is sub par at best. They are disorganized and frankly quite rude. If you are capable of over looking such a thing it is a great place to have a fun older style dinner.  I will continue to return on every trip to Vegas.

d0HH9Vq3Icy7L4DUAk5eEw.text: Great service food is just mediocre .. I have been to tons of steakhouses in Vegas and this one falls short of the hype. We had the calamari, Caesar salad , prime rib, creamed spinach, bone in ribeye , petite filet and shrimp scampi. Their hollandaise sauce needs flavor and the rest of the food needed to be salted which is not something I normally do. Would unfortunately not come back

z58GHBZD4PAiY6wE3sphGA.text: My friend and I went to go check out the oldest steakhouse in Vegas, we wanted to see where the Rat Pack frequented and many other celebrities.  The service at best was mediocre, the setting and ambiance was nice. I ordered a coke which was flat,  a garden salad that was drenched in ranch, a filet mignon medium rare that was tasty and cooked to perfection, creamed spinach that was so soupy and runny it was disgusting, whipped potatoes that tasted like box potatoes, the "famous" garlic bread was burned and tasted like there wasn't even a hint of garlic on it, for dessert cherries jubilee that ended up like a soupy mess..the bill was $246.67 of course before tip. I have had much better service and food at other steakhouses.. I should've stuck with Anthony's at the M. They never do me wrong.

e91s6AnZeBS3k8YjU5wTVw.text: I went here with a few friends on friday and our experience on this night moved me to make this my first review.  First off, I'm a fan of this place, I've been here a few times.  It's a local steakhouse, interesting history, a real old school Vegas feel and definitely a place to try if you're looking for something cool and different in ambiance in LV.    So the service is eh, average.  Although the host was excited we were there, the waiter was less than friendly, robotic, interested in taking our order, and moving on to the next table.   The food was good, traditional steak, american and some italian pasta dishes.  We ordered the escargot, crab cakes and calamari.  The escargot were good, buttery and garlic-y.  The crab cakes big, nice and calamari was just ok.  I tried the lobster bisque and it was delicious.  Everyone had a some sort of steak and we shared the asparagus, which were done very well with a nice buttery hollandaise and also mashed potatoes.  When we got our steaks, one was wrong, not just grilled wrong but the wrong cut.  After a 10 minute wait the correct steak was brought out.  And it was disappointing that when the bill came out, we were charged for that steak despite the inconvenience and error on their part....and our starving guest having to wait for his food!    The Golden Steer has been around forever and obviously do things well and it is a must try place.  In the future though, I may try other local steakhouses unless I'm dragged here again by a GS virgin.  This experience was less than golden so I rate it 3 stars until they fully win me over again.

j5vGpm8hajPJitW8-1sPlg.text: Was very pleased with my steak.  Perfectly cooked and melted in my mouth.  Will be returning next time I am in Vegas.

F8U7n160K0ebhB7Fz1IGww.text: Wow did my steak suck at this place. It was tough and chewy, a complete waste of money, service was good and I would have sent my food back except I was with a large dinner party and the host of the evening had raged over the food quality.  I'll dissuade my friend next time he suggests a steak house.  I can't emphasize how bad my food was and what a disappointment it was not going to a good steak house in Vegas, I hear there are a couple of alternative places to go.

ZdySjKYrZvlvXmr7N7nVbQ.text: If you are looking for a great old steakhouse off the stop and out of the hotels this is the place. Don't let the outside scare you off. You'll get a good deal for about $75-100 you'll get prime quality beef and a few sides.  Try the caesar salad tossed table side. Awesome.

taCLbSV56XGyIkLKml6e8A.text: My husband and I ate here on May 16, 2013.  We've lived here for over 10 years and I have been wanting to go here for quite some time.  The ambience is nice - very old school Vegas, and romantic.  The service is also top notch.  Unfortunately, other than the caesar salad, the praise ends there.   The bread served was warm and tasted fine, but the butter was sour.  At first we thought perhaps we were eating sourdough bread, but when we tasted the two separately, it was obvious the problem lay in the butter.  We brought this to our waiter's attention, and it was quickly removed, and no replacement was brought out, which makes me think perhaps their entire butter supply was spoiled.  My husband wanted to flee, but I decided to stay the course.   Next up was the caesar salad, prepared table-side, which was tasty and fresh.   My husband ordered the ribeye, and I the t-bone steak.  We both asked for medium-rare and they turned out to be more on the rare side.  My husband's was good, albeit slightly chewy.  Mine, on the other hand, was absolutely awful.  The first few bites were o.k., and then somewhere in there the meat started to taste like liver.  I was amazed - maybe they had inadvertently dropped some butter on the grill?  Anyway, I had to return it.  The waiter brought out some prime rib gratis, even though I told him I didn't want any.  I'm not a prime rib person so I only took a bite;  hubby tried it and gave it a "meh".   This isn't something you would hear me say too often, but I should have listened to my husband and bolted the minute we tasted the butter.  Despite it's Vegas charms, this place does not deliver.

yByYFEbmqZTQCzgBCqN58Q.text: Very old steakhouse in Vegas. The outside of the place looks weird and unsafe, but the steaks really are killer here. Some of the best I have had. The servers are all cool and can tell you stories about the history of the place. It's been a famous Vegas steakhouse forever, and was frequented by Elvis, Ratpack , and OJ Simpson. Pretty expensive, but worth the experience.

THRMtFJ4fLpn1uDV2RcCIw.text: I had heard from several people what a great steakhouse the Golden Steer is. So one Tuesday night, with Groupon in hand, the hubby and I ventured out to not the best neighborhood in town and tried it out for dinner. After walking past the neighboring seedy bar (the one that had signs saying "Karaoke With Porn Stars" plastered on the window), we walked into the Golden Steer. We were immediately welcomed and noticed the bar was bustling. The decor/ambience - dark, wood paneling, cowboy oil paintings, big horns on each wall, red pleather booths, staff in tuxedos - classic or cheesy? I can't decide. In comparison to the polished, popular places on the strip, I'll be nice and say vintage Vegas.   The lobster bisque was thick, heavy and creamy, and not in a good way. Consistency resembled ... plaster mix.   I ordered the NY Strip. Cooked perfectly. Very good. The hubby's rib eye was a little overcooked. But was ok. We've definitely had better for about the same price range in places like Mortons or Ruths Chris.   Overall, the whole experience was ok. Service was good. Not sure if we would eat here again though, but I'm glad we tried out it out, at least to experience a little "old Vegas".

c9OM4PtE9MmLpiDGKKP6Mw.text: After driving by a million times and hearing about it from a few fellow foodies, my boyfriend and I decided to go Check out the golden steer on valentines day.   They accommodated our request for a booth and decorated the dining room and bar nicely for the holiday. We were told it was a great old Vegas steakhouse and found ourselves sitting in Joe Demaggio's booth.   The waiter was nice enough and the service overall was okay. The famous caesar salad was pretty good and so was the lobster bisque. I enjoyed the prime rib and my boyfriend ordered the t-bone. The twice baked potato and sauteed mushrooms were to die for! The creamed spinach was ok. We loved the bananas foster dessert and overall enjoyed our experience.   Definitely a novelty experience and enjoyable old Vegas vibe. I'm planning on taking my grandmother for her birthday as a special treat...

jEG4hv1UX7ZMhy0Mwl_Xdg.text: This was indeed a wonderful meal.  The wait staff was professional and helpful in suggestions and the food was most flavorful.  We had the prime rib and it was excellent.  A nice glass of wine to go with it and I am only sorry we were too full to try the desserts

I9SJ_ESXPf_v0Z82OgLcWg.text: I've lived here since 1965. As a kid I remember driving past this restaurant and it's business sign with the steer in the center. Last night I ate at the Golden Steer for the first time with my husband. OMG this is my favorite place to eat now! I can't believe it I've been missing out on this local gem. The old Las Vegas ambience and impeccable table service is incredible! We were treated like royalty and the food was out of this world. We had the Cesar salad and Banana Foster prepared side table - great presentation! Love, love, love this place!!! 5 stars for sure!

U8JbV8dRAwU22A7gv4WT6A.text: This resturant is VERY over rated.  Made reservations, no one came to our table for 10 minutes.  $8 steer salad was white iceberg lettuce with sliced carrots and chick peas, 2 pieces of tomato and cucumber all mixed up and placed on a plate....very tacky, diner presentation.  The steak was good but over cooked "rare" and the potato was sent back because it had a slice in the skin and 1/4 of the potato was black.  No quality check before serving the meal.  Will not return.  Could have had a better healthier salad from a buffett for 1/8 the price.  This was on a weekday evening at dinner hour so maybe the weekend crew is better including the salad chef.

gSPn2iqyw9ZwgRrs6LEyVw.text: Not the greatest steakhouse in the world, but a good one. I came in with mild expectations. When you first walk up to the restaurant, the decor looks real old-fashioned. You feel like you are entering the 60's version of Las Vegas. Pretty classy. I was greeted by a beautiful hostess who led me straight to my table. From there it seemed like I had two waiters for some reason checking up on me. It was kind of weird.  I end up ordering the Caesar Salad, Stuffed Seafood Mushrooms, and the Bone in Ribeye Steak.  Caesar Salad: (5/5) The salad was tossed right at the table with all the classic ingredients. The salad itself was amazing, probably the best caesar salad i've had. You could taste the subtlety of the anchovy. The croutons were also crisp, by airy.   Stuffed Seafood Mushrooms: (2/5) I really did not like this appetizer. Usually I don't regret my orders, but this one was a big time meh. While the mushroom was cooked fine, the seafood stuffing was bland, lacked texture, and just tasted whatever. I had to force myself to finish it. Honestly, my friend makes a better version of stuffed mushrooms.   Bone in Ribeye Steak: (4/5) The steak came out on a sizzling plate and looked like ready to beast on. The first couple bites were out of this world. It was perfectly marbled. I was ready to give the trophy as the best steak to this one. But as I beasted on the edges of the steak, the interior got a tad bit tough and was not marbled. As I got closer to the bone, the marbling came back, and I was happy again.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in ribeye and stuffed mushrooms.

TDG5wXDVBio_etRmChG28Q.text: Want a decent cut of beef without the pretense, noise, long waits, or other nonsense on the strip and associated tourists? Eat here.   Want to be hand fed lychee chocolate mousse while your waiter spins 500 feet in the air describing the sunset over Pahrump in between French accented recitations of poetically composed winelists and exploding white tigers backed by a Beatles soundtrack? Eat elsewhere.   Best prime rib in town, pleasantly served at a reasonable price. A friend who's a local introduced me to this place a dozen years ago- since then,  I try to make it here at least once every time I visit the area.

o4XJKNHS5vLDpXg7xCrMGA.text: What an awesome evening. My man and I had heard this place was so cool and tasty...so we had to check it out. It was every bit as awesome as everyone had said.   The hostess was very pleasant and complimented me on my dress (I told her where to get it and then we had a mini conversation on how great that store is).  We were seated at a cozy and intimate booth with lots of pics of the Rat Pack. Then we meet Fabian....and he was hilarious...with really cool hair.   Fabian made us laugh and just made the dinner so much more delightful. He was poking fun at me for ordering an espresso while I was munching on my steak which sent me into scores of giggles (I must admit it isn't like me to have espresso before dessert...but I was dragging butt). Then he made the most amazing bananas foster table side. It was hot, sweet, tasty and gave us a good show by setting it on fire before pouring it over ice cream.   Overall it was an amazing night and my man and I will be back for the great meat, great drinks (literally fishbowl sized martinis), and great people. So much fun!

BljoJkky4FyB3HA75swi7A.text: We really stepped into it at the Golden Steer. Very typical steakhouse fare but low quality steaks, a really, really crappy $20+ Caesar Salad (maybe the worst I've ever had) ....everything else marginal. The stuffy waiter was telling me how their Black Peppercorn Sauce was similar to a Bordelaise Sauce.......not even ballpark. It truly added nothing to the meal and was very bland (and about $5 extra)......a baked potato with too much butter & sour cream can be had anywhere...or at home for pennies on the dollar. Their desserts were ordinary.   Folks, there is nothing special about this place as far as I'm concerned. Decor is OK, certainly nothing to go out of your way for.   I am not a snob foodie at all, however: I cannot really see the appeal of your typical everyday steakhouse anyway. The food  all seems the same whether its Ruth Crist, Mortons or the Golden Steer. I admit to not having tried some of the joints from famous names (Craft, etc). A steak plopped onto plate is pretty boring and lacks insperation, and I can do a better technical job of cooking it myself.   If you want some tasty beef "on the cheap", pass this place by and head out to Southpoint Casino where for $16 (total) you can have a pretty good slice of prime rib with all the trimmings.....and it is, by far, more delicious than this hole. Or I have heard good reviews for some of the other pricey places....just don't do this one......really.  The only people I would "Steer" here are unwelcome visitors, drunken tourists, superstar entertainers, and a few deserving others that I know of.

wRn1fg8NMGIs61-KJqEuFA.text: While the steak and table side Cesar Salad was perfection, NOTHING else at this restaurant was even close to acceptable.  From the moment we arrived, until we left, our service was simply HORRIBLE. First, at the hostess stand the hostess stood glaring at her computer screen as we stood waiting to be acknowledged. Never did acknowledge us, so we turned around and went to the bar. 2 cocktails (a beer and a wine) 17 bucks, gave the older man bartender a 20 and he NEVER CAME BACK WITH OUR CHANGE! The assumption that, that was his tip was rude and in very bad service and bad form. Of course he was going to get that as his tip, but to assume. BAD!  VERY BAD. Its stealing! And if he "forgot" even worse, he shouldn't be working at such a restaurant as the Golden Steer.  So we went back to the stand and the "harried" hostess was able to accommodate our reservation, clueless as to our earlier "encounter".  The food service was slow, wreck-less (no refills of anything: water, bread, butter, coffee, or up-sell cocktails!), and the removal of dirty plates never happened. We stacked our plates to get them out of our way after sitting empty in front of us for 15 minutes.  The Prime aged 20 oz. T Bone was very good, as was the Cesar Salad. AS FOR the desert - forget it!! I wanted REAL NY cheesecake: I got Sara Lee...Im almost positive; NOT restaurant QUALITY in the least.  Coffee arrived bitter, luke warm, and no refills were offered.  In closing, Id skip Golden Steer. There are wayyyyy too many fine steak house in Vegas to be bothered with this dinosaur.

7mjU3h2aLT8Ot_ROyHPINQ.text: This is old Vegas. Ambiance. Style. Warmth. The staff is extremely welcoming as soon as you walk in. Softly lit dining area is filled with conversation and laughter. Then there's the food. Amazing. The appetizers were terrific. We shared shrimp, lobster, crab, calamari, oysters, and toasted ravioli. Had the Caesar salad, prepared table side. Then, a filet mignon with whipped potatoes and asparagus with Hollandaise sauce. For dessert, chocolate mousse cake. An incredible dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A rare fillet mignon with whipped potatoes and asparagus with hollandaise sauce.

SVNH80MYGWRblOwafmqxKA.text: The food was spectacular, the service was stellar,and I will be back. This place is a hidden gym that I will be telling everybody about.

RyK5fFYFxun-3Kj81fgt4A.text: This was my first time to this restaurant and We made reservations with Roland for 7pm we called to say we will be minutes late because of traffic and he told us that we basically had to hurry our meal then because of the next party. When we arrived he didn't even greet us just took us to the table.. it was very rude and unprofessional of him especially working in the front. Bedsides that one issue the food was AMAZING and I would definitely go again. The service was quick and all the waitors check on you often and get you anything you need with no problem.

3IZgkgsD9RrP5XAWyuFoGA.text: Love love love!!! Food was excellent had Alaska king crab cocktail rib eye and mashed pot! The bartender made me a delicious dirty martini with blue cheese stuffed olives. Great service he even told me some history of the place which I loved. I cant wait too go back!

WmsETNNnMLcbpp9t0DeMYg.text: This is a great old time restaurant.  Scot our server was impeccable and funny.  We enjoyed the table side Caesar Salad, my Filet Mignon was perfect Medium-Rare,  my husband shrimp Scampi was spot on.   This place has been around forever,  we have been back over the years and it does not disappoint.

yp3vPujVYgYVrtgz4t_FjA.text: Fun to come to as it has history, just wish the server gave us a little more insight into the history. Service was normal.   Food Highlights: - Garlic bread - Caesar salad (we shared 3 orders among 7 people and it was the perfect amount) - Filet mignon   Aside from those listed above, food was ok. I would try the other steakhouses that have similar price ranges, but better prepared steaks.  Probably won't return as there are a plethora of other steakhouses in LV that are better.

6VZk3MA2exhegmeU7LhD4w.text: This is probably My fav of the Steakhouses in town :) Old school swanky and the food is divine! I've never had a bad dish here, awesome history and lots of class

Ws-ikms9z-YP6yTYRs5b1A.text: Very disappointing. I heard great things about this restaurant and my husband and I went last weekend. The food was bland. We ordered Chateaubriand for two and a tableside Caesar salad. The salad was not anything to rave about and the steak was served with steamed vegetables. I could have cooked this at home and done a better seasoning job. The waiters were more attentive to the tables with the big drinkers and after our food was served there was minimal interaction with us (only one glass of wine). What surprised me the most was when what I am assuming was the manager went over to the table next to us and requested that they move their party into the bar after they were done and relaxing. I know they were busy, however they had not finished long before that happened. Even thought this was not directed towards us I was immediately turned off. Will not return to this restaurant and will not recommend to anyone.

53Etpm_r49hjFKnK704FjQ.text: Wonderful hosts and superlative hospitality. One of the few stand-alone steakhouse establishments who offer the traditional accouterments of fine dining.  Unfortunately, those efforts seem to be wasted on most of the "come as you are" patrons who are most likely more comfortable with casual style dining.  Perhaps if you check your potty-mouthed, entitlement attitude at the door and, leave the flat-billed cap in your totally sick, lifted monster truck, wear a buttoned-up, collared shirt over your wife beater and "I'm dangerous" tattoos, keep your bro-ho in check and, generally speaking, act like civilized human beings, you may find your experience here even more delightful.  Seated in the DiMaggio booth, (my personal favorite), started dinner with a Cesar Salad, best I've ever had. The table side, properly trained technique, attention to detail in the presentation and preparation with fresh ingredients is superb.  I highly recommend the Chateaubriand for two, ordered medium rare. By the time it is sliced and plated table side, it has rested to perfection. Much better than most steakhouses serving up average $45 strip steaks. Spend the extra twenty, enjoy the show, and enjoy a proper cut of beef, served in a manner befitting an adult with refined tastes. The twice-baked potato is delicious!   Desert? Cherries Jubilee. Anytime you can have someone bring a pan of something sweet, covered in Kirschwasser, Cognac, or Brandy, and flambeed at your table, DO IT! Queen Victoria would be honored.  The Golden Steer has been and IS the best of Las Vegas.

Jl2wMPKVXmamsKg4fzYW1Q.text: If you are thinking of going here, go to Vic and Anthony's instead.   I would not mind spending nearly $400 for dinner for two (1 appetizer, two steak and lobster combos and 5 drinks) if the food was amazing.   I would have been irked spending that much of the food was just good.  Because the food was mediocre, at best, I was very upset.     I wasn't keen on the service.  But, that was no big deal.   The big deal was that the steak and lobster came out lukewarm.  And, the lobster was TOUGH.  I couldn't even cut it easily with my knife.  All this for $110 per person for the steak and lobster combo.    The creamed spinach tasted odd.  The twice baked potato was fantastic.     To be fair, I have to admit that I did not complain.   It was our first wedding anniversary and we were just so disappointed, we really ate what we could - left - and got a late night pizza that was amazing.

NvRLWbXdD82xljY8pJTVng.text: The quintessential Vegas steakhouse. This is a must for anyone looking for an old-school Vegas experience. The food is delicious and the service is impeccable. It's right off the strip and a quick cab ride from most hotels. I live in Vegas and it is, by far, my favorite place to come for a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas Foster is made table-side. It&#39;s also delectable.

1G_tzuVVdMbtSZwIA-Hfsg.text: I always have the best birthdays and celebrations here.  Classic dining in a comfortable, elegant setting.  The "ghosts" of Sinatra, John Wayne, The Rat Pack, and Elvis the King inhabit this iconic restaurant.  Our waiter Leo was outstanding.  Friendly, helpful, informative.  The highlights of my many birthdays there are the making of the Caesar salad and the huge birthday candle.  Leo was the Best waiter I could have hoped for.  The hostess was helpful too.  Highly recommend for a classic Vegas experience and Excellent food.  I hope my photos show you what a great time I have there. Get there early and check the closing times.  Try Groupon for savings.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gxDd6TxWbrClTJqAAJffHQ.text: Wow what an amazing place. The history.. the food.. the ambiance.. We loved it all. We will definitely be coming back!! The prices are perfect!! I have absolutely nothing to complain about :) and I love how they kept it the old las vegas

dgbdf1F-8xHvz_HpeubcjA.text: Wow! What  a great place. Full of Las Vegas history , with service to die for. Oysters on the half shell were great! My NY strip was cooked perfectly ,the Australian lobster was so good I couldn't believe it. My wife loved her filet too. We had a great bottle of foley Johnson wine 2012 wine that it required a second bottle. The cheese cake yum ! Atmosphere was great too. I love this place and is so worth the money. 5 stars was not enough what a great place. The other patrons around us were great too. This restaurant  brings out the best in people for sure. Loved it and I will be back when I'm in Vegas next time for sure.

3VLIYL7eBzQtrkKfOvbhDw.text: Certainly my favorite steak joint in Vegas, and maybe anywhere, really. Very old skool and classy. The food comes first -- the steaks are absolutely perfect, as well as the sides. The service is also impeccable. The Rat Pack used to hang out here "back in the day." It has that vibe. The martinis come huge. Nothing is cheap here, of course. But that is ok, because you will definitely get what you pay for.

VcmFn9lWVIzdoXvVXiEv9g.text: Little hidden Gem! The service and food was phenomenal!! Just when you think it can't get any better...dessert!! Bananas foster sealed the deal.  Steak and lobster...Cesar salad-all highly recommended. Our severer Scott made our night memorable.

N2is8we6QatIJqAdxmurUQ.text: Went with a bunch of friends on a Saturday night when we were in Vegas. Our waiter was great, very nice and helpful...  Although. Two of us got Caesar salads and mine came out right away and hers came during dinner, neither were made table side. The waiter got the wrong wine for my friend and said he would take care of it, he didn't get her another glass on the house or do ANYTHING about it. The food is extremely overpriced, but it's a steakhouse in Vegas.  Our waiter then brought out four desserts for our "birthdays" which was fun, but we didn't want all of that dessert and then felt the need to tip him. We asked for a dessert menu and he brought a bunch of desserts instead.  I purposefully didn't get my own steak, just had a few bits of my husbands, because I knew I wouldn't be able to eat it all...but still, I don't know - $120 for one steak, a twice baked potato, a Caesar salad and a glass of wine seems excessive, but we overtipped because of all of the desserts we didn't eat.  It was a good experience but we won't be back.

RbKzvWL0vA0IvrMdOEcWVQ.text: OMG....WHAT A BIG MISTAKE.  We sat at  dining room last night  we just order two main courses..... a capital offense or for the Server is that all you guys having in a very sarcastic way  and then the person disappear totally forgot about us  didn't forget he  or she was avoiding us all night even send some else to give us the tap luckily the support staff was there by the way I was there a few weeks ago i sat at the bar by myself fine good service  by the bartender even he is a character. But I will be the same way it will be on his position no time to babysit idiots servers didn't even know what a Manhattan is keep it up. Joe you might be the reason if I return to the place. he would go four  starts . Oh thevserver name I forgot it is not important even when I cannot tell if she or he that's the most accurate description I can give. The food was nice and hot the table was marked properly by the support staff oh yeah I know my business that's why I know exactly when a server don't give a s*** about what customers.......

IjnlhmaGK66HtksaH46X4Q.text: As usual the good was excellent.  Everything cooked to perfection.  The food was 5 stars but the service was slow.  The easiest thing to do is drop the check.  Unfortunately that took a while.  If you are looking for the friendliest hostess in Las Vegas simply go to the Steer when Rika is working.  Her smile and customer service is contagious and more then made up for the slow service.

7kFaOLzmPibSPXjCOZrATw.text: Old school charm- great food. The bar's a great place to grab a drink. The bartenders are pretty outgoing. Anthony was able to whip up a new bourbon based cocktail that my wife experimented with and truly enjoyed. Food is fantastic- one of the best steaks I've had in years. Caesar salad new table side was a nice touch. Service was very attentive as well.

oubI3Z7xb-zhqnQWDDZFlA.text: The Golden Steer is a Las Vegas classic. The ambiance alone is worth the trip. The sides and starters were average but my 12 oz. filet Oscar style was fantastic. The bananas foster made table side was great as well. Service is wonderful and this restaurant is definitely a must for any local or just anyone who is interested in a classic Vegas dining experience.

nKxxoTFV1vkm4V_CbjVBfQ.text: Super old school high end GEM in an old run down strip corner If you can call it that. Impeccable service. Very comfortable

TtBg0Ap3qLjV3cmP6vJSlw.text: It def was not what I thought it would be!! The shrimp was dirty, the twice baked potato was salty as hell (I couldn't even eat it, had to have them take it back), the steak was full of fat & grissle, and my friend king crab was salty as hell too!! They messed up our bill adding a extra $50 for something we didn't buy, the waiter was kinda rude.. But we was the only blacks in there so maybe that's why all this occurred. With all the great reviews I can't understand why it was that bad! I have it 2 stars because it beautiful inside and the calamari was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp was good but it was dirty and the calamari was great!!!

KtKGnLUDR0pKZlT_54mSwQ.text: So I am a big fan of the Rat Pack. No I don't mean Molly Ringwald, Emilio Estavez, Anthony Michael Hall, or Ally Sheedy. I'm talking about Frank, Dean, and Sammy baby. I'm talking about a time when being smooth was what it was all about and the dolls bore names like Marilyn Monroe, Judy Garland, and Shirley Maclaine.   I am also a big fan of Vegas and despite it's several facelifts over the years the gold mine in the desert is one of my favorite places on the planet. This is where the magic happened and sometimes still does, especially when I'm rollin the dice and lady luck is kind to me. Unlike many who go for the mega-clubs, rollercoaster's, and the latest Cirque du Soleil act. I go for the nostalgic shows and spots that make Vegas . . . VEGAS BABY!!!  One such stop is the legendary Golden Steer. This place is where the rats themselves would frequent which automatically makes it a must on my to do list. So after arriving in town Niki and I got ourselves ready and hit the road. Golden Steer is located on W Sahara Avenue just off the strip. Parking is convenient and it may not look like much on the outside but just wait. When you enter it is like you have been time warped to the late 50's-early 60's. The decor has an old school class that is rarely seen anymore but strangely still sheik. The wood plank walls and red leather booths set the scene and one feels transported to a different time almost instantly after being seated.   The staff is impeccable and informative answering every question and open to offering recommendations without making one feel uninformed. Drinks are a must and something classic is on my mind. I order a whiskey sour and as quickly as I ordered it arrives. It is absolutely perfect and if you like classic cocktails I guarantee that this is the place. When the waiter returned to take our order. To start we ordered the Caesar Salad for two prepared tableside. For our entrees Niki ordered the NY Strip and I the Prime Rib - End Cut with a Jumbo Baked Potato.  In a few short minutes a table was wheeled over and the salad was prepared. It was a show all by itself and it was clear this fellow has made this many times over the years. Let the eating begin. This is not your usual Caesar Salad by any means. The mix of vegetables makes this a more hearty Caesar but the hints of spice and anchovies is blended perfectly to taste.  After we were finished with our salads the entrees and sides arrived. Niki's strip was so tender she could cut it with a fork and my prime rib was equally tender and thick. Both cooked medium rare, juicy, and oh so delicious. This steak ranks up there at the top of my all time favorites.  The jumbo potato was simply that - jumbo. It was huge and cooked perfectly. It came with chives, sour cream, and butter. The combination as always, spectacular.  Now I know that Golden Steer is known for it's Bananas Foster prepared tableside but I am not that big a fan. So Niki and I order the cheesecake. I know it is a safe option but boy it was good. thick, creamy, with a hint of vanilla. Niki is a big fan of cheesecake and nothing gets between her and a slice especially when the quality is this superb.  So that's it folks, the shows over. When in Vegas, do what the boys used to do. Enjoy a great meal at Golden Steer and you'll be swingin like Deano himself. Since I got our attention I want to leave you with a quote from the man himself.  "I feel sorry for people who don't drink. They wake up in the morning and that's the best they're going to feel all day."  Dean Martin

VPBt5mOrW8S6OM9Nozg0Jg.text: Once again the best decision I've ever made!  This will always be a staple in the timeline of my life

QaQei-1eOpJhRo9Su7Jncg.text: One of my fave restaurants in Vegas. Great food especially the table side options. Great service by real pro's. And the greatest hostess ever, who is beyond helpful Rika Cooper.  Just a great all around experience

fv1x66FFxP_ME3DKY0K1mQ.text: Great History and Great food and Staff if you visit Vegas and you like steak and service this is your place there's a reason The Rat Pack hung out here

o_49pU_sNWdqi38-bF-fTw.text: We ate here for the first time Memorial Day weekend.  Great old school place.  Steaks (and everything else we ordered) were superb.  Table side Caesar salad--don't miss it.  Service was very good.  Very enjoyable meal.

i3xdvamz_cEVYaL9Uxi4Jw.text: Las Vegas native that I am, i've been coming to this place for over 45 years. Though I've moved away and live in Berkeley's gourmet ghetto, I still come when I'm in town. The food is great, with fine quality steaks, wonderfully fresh oysters (how do they do that in Vegas?), Ceasar salad and cherries jubilee made table side, and a great ambiance that is light years away from some of the cookie cutter places on the strip.   This place has seen a lot of interesting faces and history in its time (rat pack and otherwise) and holds that in its bones. The hostess is warm and attentive, and the bartender Joe, who's been there for a gazillion years, is a classy work of art, never forgets a face, pours a fine drink, and is very welcoming. I confess that I like some of the old time waiters the best, particularly a waiter named Fabian, an Asian guy with impeccable service who's hair would make any girl swoon, be she 30 or 60, but there are some newbies that are impressive as well. These folks go out of their way to make It a special occasion for you.  I miss the piano players that they used to have here, which really set the place apart from anywhere else in Vegas, but it's still a wonderful place. Once Joe pours you a glass of wine or makes you a terrific Manhattan or Martini, you're transported back in time, ready to nestle into the red leather banquettes where Frank and his ilk once sat, and it's always a lovely visit. .

EtvTvbqwweyoS5zDUVbjTg.text: Food was amazing!!! Best Service I have ever had!! Fast! Food was great we had two Surf n Turf's amazing!! Ask for Tom Kehoe!!

uyJME4TN5yOfyAKmzpbhAw.text: Started off seeing a physical golden steer off the side of the road.  I was curious.  I thought maybe it was a bar or something in a little strip mall. It ended up being a steak restaurant in an old strip mall.  It had some good reviews so I thought I would give it a try.  I was amazed when I walked in the door.  It was gorgeous inside.  Stained glass windows, nice upholstery, the lighting was good.  A hostess/waitress came over and welcomed us.  We said we were just looking and they said go ahead, walk around.  We decided to come back and eat here.  The 2nd visit was just as friendly.  We were seated at a beautiful booth.  The Hostess told us the history of the establishment.  The mobsters used to meet in the back where they had a special back door so they could get out fast if the cops arrived and in the 60's when Sammy Davis Jr could not stay in the hotels on the strip that he played at nor eat in their restaurants, he and his friends would come and eat there.   They still have his original booth with the same upholstery.  Very cool.  I love hearing the history about places.  We ordered the Caesars Salad, Steak, Prime Rib, and Asparagus. Caesers Salad was made fresh at our table and was incredible.  I would come here just for the salad. Both the steak and the Prime Rib were cooked exactly to our liking.  My husband likes Medium well and I like Black in Blue (rare&cold on the inside and just browned on the outside).  The asparagus was perfect.  Crisp, but cooked with a light sauce that was equally delicious. I will come here again.  We also saw the next table over having a birthday.  Their dessert came with sparklers and singing. :)

kSerfWzwq6WA8vHbxr58pg.text: Was absulutly amazed by the food, staff, and atmosphere in this wonderful establishment. Had drinks, awesome appitizers, and a main course fit for a king. Great time and wish to return soon!

CAOuWRGxLyhGEL7CEqdb3A.text: This place was great.  Made a reservation for 12 guys during a bachelor party this past weekend and we were seated immediately upon arrival.  We had our own private room in the back that had been used by mobsters and celebrities alike.  Our waiter even took some time to explain the history of the restaurant which was actually quite interesting.  The food was excellent--a bit pricey but you get what you pay for!  If you're looking for a nice restaurant, away from the bright lights of the city, then this is definitely the place for you.  I'd certainly go back.

dqT5uk4eFnnsWLWHQD4ffA.text: They get some things right like the steaks and the cocktails were amazing but the bread and sides were very   below par. The sides tasted like store bought. If I ever went back i would eat the steak and salad no bread and a cocktail.  Service was topnotch. Atmosphere is old school but maintained.

y5oKgOFK5kFcmNNnSS-dPQ.text: Good Ole Steaks in Old World Charm (After you navigate the rough neighborhood of Sahara and LV Blvd......
