P2xTEwlkQbXg03XurGl0sQ.text: What a gem! This old style steak house. The outside may confuse some yet as soon as you enter the second set of doors you will know you made the right choice.  The service is outstanding. Very friendly attentive. Dressed like wait staff of yester year. What a pleasure!   The food was cooked to order. My Hubs ordered the Tbone and Australian Lobster Tail. He could not stop raving about the Lobster tail.   This is our new go to spot for date night.

bq0efI6GkhFHxS3Mk46LOQ.text: The Golden Steer is everything you'd ever hope for in a steak house. The classy, vintage decor, rat pack feel, white table cloths, excellent customer service and melt-in-your mouth dishes make this place so special. All of the front of the house staff are excellent. Our waiter, Carl, was especially outstanding. He's one of the sommeliers and found the perfect pairing for our Steak Oscar. He created the Caesar salad table-side (which was a treat just watching him) with just the right amount of lemon, Parmesan cheese and anchovies. I wish I could have eaten more of everything. My tastebuds were disappointed when my stomach ran out of room because there were so many wonderful bites left on the plate. This is a True hidden gem and I hesitate broadcasting it because it's like giving away your secret fishing spot.

5nZPeKQNm2yZKSTLH0oi0w.text: So my girlfriend who was born and raised in Las Vegas got us a table here saying this steak house has a rich history and that she has never been here but has heard wonderful things about it.  So there we were chowing down on: Clam chowder  French onion soup Glass of Justin Cabernet  Glass of Five rivers Cabernet  I had the Prime rib end cut $42 She had the Filet mignon $40 with sauteed mushroom. The food was good. The service was good.  The decor and vibe were as expected with rich mahogany and dimmed lighting.

LlII5IJML09Czi1TVbeoPw.text: This is the place to get the best steak you EVER had.  Great service, ambiance, and food.  Been coming here for many years.

0OSMesM-IS4Xt2VpFQzW_w.text: This was really the worse experience I've ever had..server tried to push ceaser salads on us.. try to up sale two bottles of wine when we asked for one.. food came under cooked when we asked for medium server didn't bother caring. We were a large party and the service was just not professional. Finally after being ignore we called a manager, they brought out the hostess.. um a place like that needs a manager not a hostess!!!! Not to forget, once we knew we are being ignore the server NEVER came back!!!!!

TWQwvBWyZ6xI7FNwYxVMmQ.text: The old Vegas atmosphere is amazing. The hostess was sweet and so funny. TOM was our server and he alone made our experience amazing. We shared the steak and lobster (AMAZING). This was the best lobster that I have ever had. I would also like to mention that we had a Groupon for $60 and we experienced no issues using it. Tom was super cool about it. This is now my favorite place in Vegas. This will be my first stop every year.   Thanks Tom & Staff for such a wonderful experience!  Louisiana & Texas

iYbhjyE_TGoaWALqxHAlig.text: Terrible place skating by on reputation alone. Everything was under seasoned, over priced, and no one seemed happy to be there. $300 for a meal I've made better at home (for 2 people btw). They didn't  cook my lobster properly. It was tough and chewy and when I sent it back they proceeded to argue that the middle was raw (not sure if that was supposed to be comforting) even though it was so overcooked on the outside I had to saw at it with a steak knife. They just assumed I wanted another one cooked (although I didn't) and the second one they brought out was barely passable. My cocktail was average and the bread was average. The $12 per person table side Cesar salad was below average and they even served people who were seated after us before us.   There were no specials and the server was totally unhelpful despite the fact we mentioned we had never dined there and we're excited to finally be able to. They even cleared a plate that I was eating from without asking.  There was one thing that was good (crab cocktail) and it was the only reason I didn't give this place a 1 star review. I would never recommend this place to anyone. The servers look down on the clientele and they are pretty much absent if you need anything from them.

mXkZJLzybn7eUD8mu15XYw.text: Disappointing. Staff had half ass attitude on a Monday night. 12 oz filet was tough. Salad dressing was watered down. Ate at the bar. $75 bucks down the toilet. Better steaks at others establishments.  Place looked worn out. Don't fall for the classic old Vegas bull. Maybe I had a bull filet come to think of it?

AsrkgcWyUsY1w1VL4sMOOQ.text: My family and I went here for a wedding dinner. My brother and sister in-law are big fan of nostalgia. Which is fine and dandy, but honesty stories doesn't make food taste better. With that out of the way. Service is top notch, they go out of their way for you. As an appetizer we ordered oyster Rockefeller. I am not a big fan of seafood, and these were delicious. Table service included a salad. I ordered a green salad with a Roquefort dressing. The dressing was bit on the light side, I would of preferred a bit more Roquefort cheese. It is a stronger cheese, so I can see better to err on the lighter than too much. I ordered the petite-est cut-English cut of prime rib with a twice baked potato.  The cut of beef was very generous, juicy and fairly tender, it is closer to a diamond cut in size. The cut is paired with a creamed horseradish. This sauce is served unmixed and is on the strong side. This can not play well with their beef as it is lighter tasting if you get it too strong. There options for a side, I chose the twice baked potato is hits all the points and is generous sized. In the end its a great place that you pay a premium for ambiance and the history, but it kind of balances out with the great food and service. A definite recommendation for special events and celebrations.

jLP20Hdrofqo0b4HMPhLAQ.text: Was really great the old school feel and the service was great . We sat at the John Wayne table across the way from Marilyn Monroe table. The ceasar waa made table side . A little dry or maybe just wasn't distributed evenly over the lettuce . It was ok not the best I've ever had. Our waiter Bryon was amazing . My steak was A Robert was pretty good A lot of fat and tissue for my liking .sides of twice baked potato and asparagus was great . The cappuccino was best o have ever had seriously and the creme brulee to die for . I want to go back again to try the Oscar style filet.  Our neighbor had it and crooked awesome

1-hO5kdfimIIvy7jVyp3_w.text: Yay for The Golden Steer! Everytime we visit Vegas, a good steak dinner is on our list. I have been here twice already and I love it! A good, old-fashion steakhouse serving a good piece of meat and traditional sides that are very yummy! The creamy corn, mashed potaotes and mushrooms are delicious! My petit filet was cooked perfectly and my vodka tonic was just right (refilled at the right time too!). I will say that the salad was not very good - so I would either skip it or try the table side ceaser salad (maybe next time)....  It looks funny from the outside, but has cool history inside (this is where the Rat Pack dined - can't get any cooler than that :)  I love the dim lighting - perfect for a nice dinner. Oh! and their golden cow sign outside is just funny! You must appreciate this place for what it is - a classic steakhouse...

LzW_51MPgO7hG_aCS9dC0w.text: I'm a bit torn writing this review. Our meal was A-OK, but there are at least a dozen other steakhouses I enjoy quite a bit more. That said, this place is a classic. When you step through the doors you are whisked back in time. Hanging on to the past isn't a bad thing. We started with warm bread and followed with a table side Caesar for three. It was pretty average, I don't recommend it. Moving on to the steaks, I had the filet which was nicely prepared. A porterhouse and the bone in ribeye were also had along with the largest baked potato I have ever seen. Total damage was $214 before tip. Ouch... back to present day.

5HixOCOz0ucBZzoBQOiw1Q.text: Our experience could not have been better!  From the moment we walked in we were treated like royalty.  We were immediately shown to a table and ordered drinks.  From there, we had appetizers, more drinks, and our entrees.  After ordering beer and blood marys, we had oysters rockefeller, clams casino, veal marsala, twice baked potatoes, lyonnaise potatoes, toasted raviolis (which were a bonus as we didn't order them), and creamed corn.  I swear I could have stayed for 2 days!  I mentioned that I had a Groupon and not an eyelash was batted.  They retrieved it from my phone and we moved on without missing a beat.  Every single staff member was impeccably dressed, courteous, and accommodating.  I really did feel like I was "Rat Pack" worthy, all the way down the music being played.  We finished dinner and still managed to have enough leftovers to fill a bag. (We don't eat a lot but like to try a lot of different things.)  After paying the check and leaving the restaurant, we were called back by a staff member.  It seems Groupon automatically adds the gratuity and I had added another on top.  I find it refreshing and ethical that they would hurry out to find us to let me alter the total.  We have definitely added a new "regular" place to vist on every trip. I can't believe I didn't know about them before, but believe you me, I'll never forget them!!  Next time I'm asking for Sheckie Greene's table so my butt can sit in the same grooves as his!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Elvis&#39; booth!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our dining extravaganza!

SNuq-SLlcCnYEfcvAn9GRg.text: I always hate to give a bad review. I feel bad for the restaurant but, I feel like its my duty to warn others. We are locals who LOVE steaks. We go at least once or twice a month. We've always said... "One of these days we're going to the Golden Ox". On a cold day in January that day happened. Hubby, 16 year-old son & me headed to the Golden Ox. We'll never go back. What drew us in was the Old Vegas history. On that front The Ox measured up. It's dark, red leather booths & staff that have probably been there since The Rat Pack frequented the joint.  The Food; my steak was lukewarm, and just missing something. We all agreed, the steaks were sub par. The potatoes weren't even good. How do you mess up a baked potato?? We ordered garlic bread & even that was blech!!  Bottom line; we won't be coming back. We'll stick with our favorite, Circus Circus Steakhouse. That's right Circus Circus... Well known locals secret.

dPWHIC2LHelUER51_ADs1g.text: I have never had a bad time here.  The service is just awesome.  I wish some other places I go to would send their servers here for training.  I can say that I have successfully tried all the steaks on the menu and this time I decided to try the pork chop.  My favorite place for a steak has just become my favorite place for a pork chop.  The table side service is excellent.  Salads prepped for the table, bananas foster and cherries jubilee are like a little show.  Thank you to Fernando and all the the staff there for always showing us a good time.

KFOywCFzNm-VV_4intF_IQ.text: Met friends from out of state that we wanted to please. Had eaten here before and were delighted. Can not say the same about tonight. Met at the bar brought to our table, forgot to give menus which was not so terrible. Took another 30 minutes if not more before a waiter decided to come over. My glass of water was not replenished once throughout the meal. The waiter put on his best de Niro game face and tried to make light of the situation. But when diners are spending the kind of money we spent or would have spent more the service should have been top notch instead we were treated like this was steak and ale. Will not be back.

kq85I_GhQpQpAbbWSrMCDg.text: I wish I could give it a bit higher of a rating.....My food was hands down FIVE stars but the service was just meh... We started with the table side Caesar Salad...by the way EVERYONE should make a tableside Caesar! But the person making it had NO personality....my husband even tried to joke around with him and he wouldn't crack a smile....tableside is about a show and we got no show....we barely got a hello. Our steaks were AMAZING I had a petite filet and it was cooked perfectly as our side were great too!  Dessert...of course we had the tableside bananas foster...again...same dry tableside waiter....and the desert was just ok...wasn't the best bananas foster I had (I suggest stop using banana liqueur as you don't need a fake banana flavor and Bacardi 151 and use a brandy.....as it doesn't burn as fast and lets the bananas caramelize more without burning...and yes we make this dessert in our house frequently) I'd like to go back and have a different waiter...maybe I can upgrade to a 5 star review...as the food was certainly deserving of it.

1mVC92aDziosIMSq6YFfhg.text: Wow!   A step back in time!   If you liked old Las Vegas then have dinner here.  We celebrated my daughters Birthday with friends and loved it.  The service was exceptional, the food was prepared and presented beautifully and the drinks were made properly.   We had Escargot, perfectly prepared. Jumbo and I mean jumbo shrimp cocktail and seafood stuffed mushrooms to start.  All perfectly prepared.  Caesar's salad was crisp and well presented. All the steaks were cooked to perfection and extremely tender with aged flavor.  The side dished were tasty and all the food was at the proper temperature.  Almost ate too much bread it was so good.  This was our 3th time here and will return. Always consistent with service and food. As you drive up its a little questionable with parking but don't lit that scare you away. Step back in time and enjoy this place!

h4yNXotEJMUsXRGpnJjtWQ.text: Great old school restaurant excellent service tasty prime rib   Table side preparation of dishes.   Do not be fooled by the location in a strip mall  Would have been 5 stars but tne steak Oscar was tough  Thanks Tom for the service

7nozpZ_ZB8ZyTIPt0pMH7A.text: Went here 2/11/11. I got the petite fillet mignon it was very very good.   A steakhouse should have a great steak and this place definitely did.  The sides-calamari, crab cakes, broccoli, mushrooms, onion rings, were just ok.   The service was excellent.  Hubby got bone in rib eye.  Also, got 2 glasses of wine and a martini.   Total bill was $175 pre tip. I think that is very reasonable dinner total.

LlViPMoqCMepHTFfafNkjg.text: I'm a fan of the Golden Steer! My friend brought me here on our first night in Vegas and we were all impressed with the friendly, attentive service and the great food.   The tableside Caesar was tasty but could have used a bit more garlic in my opinion and the shrimp was awesome! Lots of garlic, a little white wine and a bit buttery.  My friends had steak and they loved it!  Overall, we loved the place, including the cool, retro decor. Next time we are in Vegas, we will be back. Thanks Golden Steer!

46F6OZcGwetYpe0G_k8vgQ.text: Scratching my head on some of the previous reviews, but everyone's entitled to their opinions.  We had an amazing dinner, the service was excellent.  Our server was on top of it, and it seemed like there was an entire crew assembled to take care of us.  We even chatted with the nice lady in the front after dinner for a bit and enjoyed her telling us about the history. We loved the charm of the "Old Vegas" decor, and it is truly authentic as they've been in business since 1958.  My New York Steak was incredibly flavorful, and it was the meat and the juices you tasted, not a bunch of spice you didn't expect.  Twice baked potatoes tasted like a guilty pleasure and I tried my wife's desert (chocolate creme brulee) and it was out of this world.  I find it hard to believe that you could have a bad experience here unless you're looking for a bad experience, then you'll find it even in the best of places.

qeYNNrWuzL3Z1TC_84y6JA.text: The highlight of my trip to Vegas! Both times. I don't understand all these comments about how bad the service was. The first time we came here we were mislead by a guidebook saying this place was tacky and not great but was frequented by the likes of Elvis, John Wayne, Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin, Sammy Davis Jr and on and on. We pictured a diner that served diner type flat top fried steaks. When we walked in with t-shirts and jeans only to be greeted by a man in a tuxedo we knew we couldn't have been more wrong. They treated us great, so great we didn't even care the bill was over $200 for just the 2 of us. This was like stepping back into classy pre-strip Vegas, maybe that's why people aren't impressed.......

Vbf0QzbhQj8BLNHxMkbRvg.text: Lemme start this off by saying that I'm a vegetarian. At a steakhouse. That being said, I found PLENTY of options here that were very tasty. I settled, and I use the term loosely there, on the toasted ravioli, which was AMAZING!!! So creamy, and complimented by a great marinara.  Everyone else seemed to enjoy their flesh, so no complaints there.   The wait staff and hostess were so friendly! I especially loved the hostess, who was joking around with us and very helpful in getting us a cab after dinner. Definitely go here on your birthday. It'll be very "explosive"...

eX-dOjVIWkNxhkl8Bg-3bQ.text: Went there on Friday Jan 28 for my parents' anniversary - party of 7.  The service was great. They kept our party fed and watered in a timely manner. Quality of the cocktails was excellent. The waiter engaged in friendly conversation.  The food was great. Our party of 7 covered quite a bit of ground for appetizers, soups, salads, entrees, sides and desserts. The steaks were very good - though not above what I've had at other places. All 7 of us enjoyed the experience. It was a nice "old Vegas" atmosphere.    We ended with a couple orders of bananas Foster which we passed around. Highly recommended for the table-side preparation and the quality of the dessert (it was really good).

HP5npp0fVGzXyqaxwD0rVg.text: I've been wanting to try this place for a while and I was not disappointed! The Caesar salad was incredible, as was the filet! Will definitely be back.

K7eY8hBgLiQi_W8R1ddzQA.text: Old style Vegas restaurant....reminded me of "NJ mob restaurant" I am originally from there (NJ). Caesar Salad made at table and booths of Old Vegas. We had a few associates from work and wanted to experience non corporate steakhouse....this was great. they need to update outside decor. Graffiti on Gold Steer sign but,...don't let that deter you. Entrees $15-55  - 12 oz filet is $45 but work EVERY PENNY. cocktails were great and we sat at at Mario Andretti booth near to the Winchester Gun display. Impress clients and also great for couples to see Old Vegas style...we had a great time. Saloon long bar..felt so cool in there.

y2J18B4pr6AkgwTKwXj4sg.text: I can probably best sum my opinion of this place up by saying that I could see this restaurant on Restaurant Impossible.  I won't dwell on the service, about which many have commented (which I could actually deal with if the food were good).  I'll start with the fact that none of the wine glasses set up at our table looked clean (all had some white-ish film and mine had a little extra something on it).  That's not acceptable at the prices they charge.  The real problem is the food.  We ordered chopped green salads that were something that looked like a 7-year old could make.  The toasted ravioli may daughters ordered looked and tasted like something you can try in the aisles of Costco on Saturday morning.  The quality of our steaks wasn't bad, but they weren't very juicy.  Of the 4 steaks we ordered, only one was cooked to the medium-rare that we asked for.  The others were medium to medium-well.  I ordered steak fries that were actually seasoned well, but were undercooked and looked like slightly higher quality than something you'd find in an elementary school lunch.  We ordered bananas foster (table-side service) for dessert.  it was kind of a fun process watching it flame up.  Taste-wise, it was just a sugar-bomb with only half a banana in it.  I'll sum up with 3 notes.  1.  I went here on the recommendation of my best friend, who is a certified foodie.  However, my wife reminded me after our beyond-disappointing-for-the-price meal that my friend is Hindu and generally doesn't eat beef (so maybe he doesn't know it when beef isn't great?).  2.  My wife said the best dish was the broccoli (which was a single steamed, unseasoned crown).  To be fair, my wife really liked her apple-tini.  3.  My daughters' comment after dinner:  "The water was nice and cold."  If people like the historical significance of this place, maybe it should be converted into a museum.

TKMY2ZNPDS0ftY_MEDUiLQ.text: I come from a fine dining background, and was very excited to try this place after reading the reviews.    we arrived and were promptly shown to our table.  our host was very friendly and told us a lot about the place.  who had ate there over the years, some of the darker history, ect.  a very nice start.  then we were presented with our menus....and he left with out explaining any of it.  i didn't need a 20min speal, but hearing a bit about different dishes would have been nice.  so he comes back 10 min later to take our order, we order escargot, cesar salad, prime rib and filet mignon.  he asks us if we would like any wine with dinner, and then there is a awkward moment of silence when he notices that we don't have a wine list.  he apologizes and returns with one.  not a big deal, i select a bottle  of champagne , and it is promptly brought out.  our first course arrives shortly there after, the escargot.  it comes old school style, in a dish with the little depressions for the escargot with melted butter, garlic and herbs.  the problem is that we were missing one.  it just wasn't in the dish. it vanished somewhere.  how it left the kitchen, went through our server and the captain who was serving us at the time, i do not know.  they made us another order and once again apologized.    while this was going on, my wine glass was empty.  not just for a second.  it was empty from before our first order was served till we got the second order, around 10 min.  during this time, we had our bread filled, and our water filled by 2 different busboys, and the our server and the host stopped by, none of the noticed.  not the biggest deal in the world, but another small thing that is starting to add up.  they also did not crumb our table, which after 2 orders of escargot, was looking bad.  next up is our cesar salad.  they do it table side, with a bit of flair and some jokes, it was very well done, and one of the better salads i have had in a wile.  no problems here, it was close to flawless.  they came to clear our dishes, and once again do not crumb our table.  i also finished poring out the champagne, as we were going to get a good bottle of red with the steaks.  they did not pour for us 1 time, or notice that the bottle was empty.  on to the main course.  steak is steak right?  sadly, not so.  they used no seasoning at all on our steaks.  both were very large cuts, and looked great, but had no seasoning at all, none.  i know its all personal taste, but i was again let down.  also,  with no red wine, the steak just lacked something.  sure i could have ordered a bottle, but no one came to check on us till we were mostly finished, and i didn't want to get up to chase someone down to order one.   they cleared our plates, but once again did not crumb the table.  we were ready to get out of there, just done and a bit sad overall, when they presented us with a desert menu.  table side bananas foster.  that has to be my favorite desert of all time, and i decide to give it a shot.    our host comes out and does a wonderful job of preparing it, and it looks and smells wonderful.  and it tastes pretty good too.  i was starting to enjoy it, when i found a huge ice chunk in my ice cream.  also they really need to switch to a better ice cream, it was not very good quality.  our bill came, but there were still desert dishes on the table, and crumbs everywhere.  not fine dining.   we paid it, and had to ask them to call us a cab.  not a huge thing once again, but everywhere else in vegas offers to do it for you.  all through out dinner, our host was very personable and funny.  they employees were funny and you could tell they enjoyed what they did.  as for the old school feel, it was wonderful.  as for the fine dining, they missed several points, and the food was average at best other than the salad.  my advice would be that if you don't mind spending a lot of money to experience a really good atmosphere with average food, you should check this out.  if you are only going to do one big dinner in Vegas though, you should check out something else.

_7LzGlglfq9Tba7J1Y4uhg.text: I took my Dad here for his birthday. He was completely indifferent on where he wanted to go for his birthday, and we both love steak. I figured this place was historic in this town, so it'd be cool to say I have eaten here. Also, I had a living social deal that was soon to expire. For all those reasons, it just made sense to try it. The hostess was extremely friendly. She kinda set the tone for what should have been an excellent experience. The ambiance was also pretty sweet. It was exactly what you'd expect after hearing that this place has been around for a while, and the old time Vegas elites used to eat here.   After those two huge pluses, the main drawback was the servers. The servers here are absolutely terrible. No personality whatsoever, no customer service, inattentive, and even molasses would get infuriated with impatience waiting for service. It was a perfect storm of what makes someone a shitty waiter. After your waiter takes your order, you might as well say goodbye because that's the last time you're gonna see him. Someone else brings your food, which in and of itself isn't really a big deal. Your food even arrives in a timely manner. But your waiter won't be back again for anything. Want a refill on your soda? Nope. Apparently, you aren't good enough for refills on your sodas here. At other restaurants the waiter makes sure everything is good with your order, not here. No, at Golden Steer, you're on your own to track a busboy down with any requests or issues you may have. Then you need to cross your fingers and hope for the best. They do however, keep up on your water glass. So you aren't gonna die of dehydration at least. Upon looking around the sea of seemingly disheartened geriatrics eating their meals all around us, I assumed that all those people came into the establishment as bright eyed, young go getters. Then they aged horribly waiting for their check to arrive, while simultaneously losing all the hope they once had in this world. I was convinced I was going to suffer the same fate. I even managed to flag down our waiter and gave him my living social voucher after we were done eating, only to have a completely unrelated waiter bring me my bill without any discount showing on it (for what felt like at least a half hour later). I think they were trying some kind of strange, crafty server scheme. Maybe they would take the $50 off the bill afterwards and split it. Who knows, maybe they just get easily confused when they each have a whopping three tables to attend to.   That whole terrible waiter experience completely took away any of the old school charm the place could have had, it also didn't represent the price they charge for their food (around $100 for two people without any discount). I have no problem paying for a great meal with great service, but this place left much to be desired. It seems awful that the one thing getting the least amount of attention in my review is the actual food itself, which was actually pretty decent. You can do a lot better for your money though. I would take the Palm steakhouse at Caesar's over this place any day of the week. Much much better service, and better food on top of it. I believe the pricing is even a little better there. I was gonna give this place three stars, but when I read the summary of a two star review, it summed it up perfectly. "Meh. I've experienced better." ... Cue "That's what she said" in 3...2...1..

6xxBNDvPZdRBstvIDti5Xg.text: I admit it, I was being petty AF. We had family in town and decided to meet here for dinner. This place sounded cool, being "the oldest" steakhouse in Las Vegas. Been living here for 7 years now and I have sadly seen many places come and go after being in business for only a short time. Golden Steer is located in a sketchy strip mall right next to the new Lucky Dragon Hotel. I really had my doubts about this place, but don't let the surroundings fool you!  The ambience was cool and it takes you back in time with their dim lighting, as well as pictures of legends like John Wayne and Marilyn Monroe on the walls. As recommended, we started off with the table side Caesar Salad. It was fun watching the server make it. Usually Caesar dressing is creamy, but this one was unique and tasted great too. I had the 8oz Petite Filet Mignon, which was cooked to perfection! Didn't have any fork and knife struggles because this steak was so easy to cut and full of flavor. All of us enjoyed the delicious food! We also ordered a side of Whipped Potatoes which were tasty, but nothing special. If you are planning to order dessert, stay away from the Creme Brulee. I'm no expert, but some restaurants are horrible with Creme Brulees. Don't waste your money on them here! Some in our party had the table side Bananas Foster. Watching them make it was very entertaining with the flames and all. I was told that it was good, but a little too sweet and they went kind of crazy with the rum.   Great service! The servers worked as a team and were very attentive with refilling drinks, taking plates away and constantly asking how the food was tasting. Definitely wouldn't mind coming back here again!

CgBbDqxdHlgISYcvfmSc9g.text: If I could give 3.5 stars I would.  They just did. It make the cut to rate 4 stars.  The parking lot is a bit sketchy and I felt a bit uncomfortable leaving my car out front.     The decor is definitely old school steakhouse and pretty well done. The service was pretty good although it could have been a bit more attentive.    The food was good.  The table side Ceasar salad was good but overhyped on the menu.  I have had much better in my days.   The T-bone steak was well prepared but under seasoned.   The Rib-eye steak was much better but again, a bit under seasoned.   The sides were a bit of a disappointment.  The twice baked potatoes were cool (almost cold) and nothing to write home about.  The broccoli was just three huge sprigs of steamed greenness.  They should have cut it down a bit and added an accompaniment or a sauce.  It was just sad vegetable on a plate.    We skipped dessert mostly due to lack of interest.   The meal was not terrible but it was not exciting at all.  Steakhouses should be a guilty pleasure, feel naughty and decedent.  This just was a steak with some sides.   There are much more inspiring steakhouses in Vegas at this quality point.  I am glad I went there as it was in my to-do list.  Been there, done that, no need to return.

yjO_D6Q-BudrLcMKRXhqSQ.text: Definitely an old-school vibe in a hole-in-the-wall strip mall setting which seemed to promise something special, but rapidly failed on several levels. We somehow had two separate servers that kept visiting our table who apparently, never communicated with each other and lead to multiple screw ups. The food was nothing special; basic ceasar, disappointing bread, average steaks. The taste just wasn't there in the meat. Was ready to love the place, but halfway through, was ready to leave.

nHk9OSYk1wwAao8IIUu9Xw.text: The Prime Rib of beef was a piece of lard, void of flavour other than fat. Great for a 2 bites and then overwhelming and sickly.  The filet mignon cut was ok, however 1 of the mediums was cooked a lot better than the other on the table. How do they this wrong?  The caesar salad was excellent. The only real high point.  Service was slow, pretentious and rude.  Won't be back. Don't recommend, unless you really like a good salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SBBM2jGKT1h-9-bVfOmkqw.text: I loved this place!  We were in Vegas and ate here after we were married in a very cute chapel.  This is old school Vegas.  Think Rat Pack!  The steaks were delicious, service was awesome!  They also made a delicious cosmopolitan!!!  Make sure to order the Bananas Foster for dessert!  I am so happy that we selected this restaurant for dinner after our wedding.  It provided a great memory for us!

CdnfGq4dJVZvz8EboBCW9A.text: I can truly say I have never been to a restaurant that gave me so much attention and made sure my experience was special. The food was absolutely wonderful. My husband had the prime rib and said it was one of the best he has ever had. I had the eggplant Parmesan It was delicious!  We requested Frank Sinatra's booth. So much history here. This is a stop every time we come to Vegas

K3N8aPzZYqSKbDMzifGadQ.text: Our return visit to the iconic Golden Steer Steakhouse was excellent! My husband and I came for a date night and sat in Joe DiMaggio's booth. We loved the classic ambiance of this dining establishment with delicious fare. I had a Porterhouse, twice baked potatoe, and my husband had veal parmesan. We shared a shrimp cocktail and had cheesecake for dessert. Our servers Carl and Johnathan were so attentive and welcoming. If you're coming for a date night o  the weekend, i recommend before 7pm. It gets  loud and busy after.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cooked just right!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large Porterhouse!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delectable meal offerings!

KFX-ZlsGgmRq9EeRVypk1Q.text: Historic steakhouse that gives you two servers per table, formal service very good steaks, super pricey, maybe worth it. The creamed corn was good. The handmade Cesar salad at the table is a show and delicious. Don't miss the cheese laden French onion soup, skip the calamari. It is a nice once in a very long while experience.  The pay at table at the end is a hot mess.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet with crab
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamed corn
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French onion soup

c9EllzG30fB4ziKETcdf4w.text: I wanted so bad to be impressed. I'd held off for years not going because of the fear of disappointment. Unfortunately, I was disappointed! The only thing holding any stars at all was the ambiance and history. I'd just wished the food held up. And I can get both the ambiance and the food quality at THE steakhouse at circus circus. And I can guarantee that the Rat Pack would have been eating there if it were an option. Golden Steer was a sub par steak comparatively speaking and much more expensive! The Steakhouse at Circus Circus has much higher quality beef, is cooked on an open charcoal flame (you can watch them cook your food), and the price includes a soup or salad, a potato dish and a vegetable. Golden Steer (like many others) serves sides alecart. So for me, the best bang for the buck remains elsewhere. Unfortunately one and done.

FF3m-yMdTB8Cq05_QBv1Dg.text: Best steakhouse I've been to in Vegas. It was easy to make same day reservations (in fact, same hour reservations) online. It's not located in the best area but who cares about that, we're talking about the food and the history of this place. When we arrived we had to wait a few minutes as they were just waiting to clean a table. No biggie, we just sat in the lounge and I enjoyed myself a glass of wine as we waited. Shortly after we were called and seated in a nice booth, it was Terry Fators booth. Wish we were seated in Sammy Davis Jr's or Frank Sinatra's but oh well. We were promptly approached by our waiter, I think his name was Anthony. He was great! We ordered the Toasted Ravioli to start, 2 tableside Caesar salads, 2 medium rare 22 oz. Bone in ribeyes and an order of mac & cheese. Toasted ravioli first. Omg these little suckers were so good!! It came with a side of a very thick marinara sauce which we absolutely loved. It had great flavor and they served a good amount of the raviolis. The tableside Caesar salads were cool. The gentleman advised everything he was putting in the dressing; egg yolk, anchovy paste, lemon juice, oil, Tabasco, red wine vinegar, I think I'm missing a thing or two... anyway he served us our salads and it was plentiful. No small portions here. Next up the ribeyes, I was halfway full at this point but I had to keep going. The steaks were perfectly cooked, buttery and had a nice char on the outside. The mac & cheese was velvety and had a bread crumb top which was good. It left me wanting more. My boyfriend finished off his meal with a latte and I had another glass of wine. We really wanted to do the bananas foster but we were just so stuffed there was no way we could enjoy it without feeling sick after. After all that, our bill was $201. Not bad at all for the service and food. They took great care of us and made us feel like royalty. We ended up looking around the place to find all the famous booths. That nostalgia and history alone is worth coming for here. I highly recommend this place to anyone who is looking for that old school Las Vegas feel in a world of boujee hotels and crazy crowds that Vegas has become. We will see you again Golden Steer! Cannot wait to come back!

vRqUsEn9I_cZgb7ukB_tEw.text: My first time here was on a saturday nite. We had a reservation and were seated immediately. Place was packed. And who is sitting at the table next to me none other than Francis Ford Coppala.   Service was excellent. Definately have the ceasar salad and the jumbo shrimp cocktail. Steaks were cooked perfectly and absolutely delicious!   Its like taking a step back in time. Place is a dive and hasnt been updated in 40 years and that just adds to the ambience.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge baked potatoe

Qlv09_z6j4ekQsmUwcpTqg.text: Finally made it here after all these years of wanting to go. Was not disappointed. Make sure you get reservations even on a week night. Had a little wait in the bar area but no big deal. They made a fantastic extra dirty martini for me. Service was really great and food outstanding. The table made Caesar salad was amazing. Then split an order of escargot which were some of the best I ever had. Super tender. Then had the bone in ribeye with twice baked and creamed spinach. The steak was easily in the top 3 steaks I have had and I've had steak all over the world. The creamed spinach was like a dessert. Left very full and happy. Would love to go here again some time.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamed spinach
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in rib eye

vJPP_r_gkwLhQrjsHEL_Lw.text: Groupon was my incentive to try Golden Steer.  The decor is classic Vegas, dark big booth seating with wood paneling walls.  The wait staff was great when the place was empty but when it started to fill up, serviced suffered a bit.  I ordered Filet Mignon medium rare and twice during baked potato.  The filet was good but nothing special and the potato was over baked.  Over all a good experience and glad I had the Groupon, but not sure I will go back, I feel like .. been there done that.

ct2TuboNS8-2Gvb4BoT7cA.text: Kinda disappointed. We ordered their signature bone in rib eye to share. Medium rare to medium. It was pretty much raw inside with just a nice crust on the outside. But the worst part was it wasn't really a steak. Just a flat piece of fat. Not much meat. Not talking about a nice marbling, I mean a big slab of fat. And one of the waiters talked so loud about himself and badmouthing precious customers. Made us uncomfortable. The side dishes were delicious and our waiter was nice.

fKFLQdyrS5LvOk-ppEnQQA.text: I ordered bone in ribeye cooked medium.  It was the toughest ribeye I have ever eaten. And the most expensive, too.  It was cooked  beyond medium.  Husband's Dover sole was lovely, however.    Very loud, as there was a convention in town that was mostly men.

qNVYwHLzzfogGJ2sy7YggQ.text: I took friends and business associates there tonight. 7-18-18. My client had the filet Oscar and it just wasn't right. The Hollandaise sauce was watered down. My veal parm was tough and covered in sauce and cheese to help camouflage the over cooked meat. I had to tell the waiter who graciously exchanged it for chicken parm. Two weeks ago my wife had the chicken parm and it was fabulous. Tonight not so. They offered deserts but we were over it. Then later I mentioned to Nickie that we would have desert. 15 minutes later she was running out the door and totally avoided us. How rude. The manager was worthless and took no responsibility for Nickies commitments. Put a really bad taste in my mouth, figuratively and literally. I won't be back. There's plenty of restaurants I can spend $700.00 at. Without attitude. Mike V8

SfsEtrUBgF3gM525BF-p_Q.text: Another steakhouse to add to the list of places I won't return to. If you like dated decor, the place was last remodelled in the '80s, then this is your place. The old boys club decor and service is still in effect here. The food is ok, the prices are high and the service leaves a lot to be desired. After enquiring if the bar had full service dinner menu, I sat down at the bar and ordered a drink and asked for a menu. I then ordered 6 oysters, a caesar salad and an 8 once filet medium rare. At no point did I receive or was asked if I wanted any bread, although others at the bar had received bread. I got the salad first, the dressing definitely had a little too much garlic but otherwise was ok. Then the steak appeared, I asked why  the steak had come before the oysters and the bartender said you didn't get the oysters? I then confirmed this. He asked if I would still like them and I said I wouldn't have ordered them if I didn't want them. He then took the steak back and I received the oysters about 5 minutes later. I had just finished the oysters and my steak reappeared. The steak was slightly overdone but not by much and I enjoyed it. I don't know what others have experienced but when the restaurant screws up by not delivering an appetizer its usually comped, I guess this is something that's not done at the golden steer. All in all it was ok but the lack of service is a little disappointing considering what the prices are. No bread or an offer of bread and forgetting an appetizer without so much an as sorry is unacceptable in my books.

onKOrCyQrG5IG7EcN7b_Yw.text: From being to end our dining experience was very great. Tom, our waiter was very knowledgeable on the drinks and the food.  His recommendations were on point. We will definitely be going back because of the food being simply amazing and the service being great.

aHZ2edhFzteCT0O8GwVGaA.text: I came for my birthday and loved it. I love that whole Goodfellas vibe. I felt it walking in. I felt history and class. And I loved the simplicity. The way it's supposed to be.  We were seated in the Marilyn Monroe booth which I was delighted to be in since she's my girl! Btw they have an amazing shrimp cocktail here. So fresh and beautiful. I love having my horseradish raw where I can see it.  The Ribeye was good. It was juicy. Not one of my tops, but very good. I really liked their chicken parm which is weird Bc I went in wanting meat and then I got the parm and was able to have both! Their Caesar Salad is seriously the best I've ever had. EVER. OMG.   The service was wonderful and the staff is so accommodating and amazing. I would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heart to heart with my girl Marilyn
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twice Baked Tater
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parm

KJgkuJ4lfwKMiIyZPbat4Q.text: We went here for our wedding dinner on 7/3/18 and it was amazing! I ordered a Italian dish so it came with these deep fried raviolis and let me tell you I have NOT stopped thinking about them. My husband's steak was cooked to perfection and he got it oscar style, that sauce ! The service was the best we've received anywhere. If you're look for a piece of vegas history and excellent food GO!

-p-rkw_f5orhj2HlsT59cQ.text: Best steak place I have found. We have been here many times but this was one of the best visits. We had table-side Caesar salad that was just delicious. We had the raw oysters that were on the small side but so good. I had the French onion soup and it was so good. I wish they gave you more broth and less onions but it was perfectly done. We had the rib eye and everyone's was perfect. We shared a baked potato and when they Say it's say it's the biggest baked potato in Las Vegas you should probably take them at their word. This potato could easily feed four people. No room for dessert again great restaurant great wine great cocktails. Get a reservation and sit in the Frank Sinatra booth

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frank Sinatra booth

28c4To-ZNxT3fCFbfoJuvQ.text: If you are looking for vintage Vegas, this is the place. Made sure to call two weeks ahead of time to reserve the Dean Martin table. If you want Frank Sinatra's table you might want to call a few weeks in advance.   We ordered the table side caesar salad, ribeye, petit filet, creamed spinach, and twice baked potato. The food and service was amazing. We knew we made the right choice in restaurant, by every detail of the meal. We ordered a martini and a Pretty Lady cocktail.   For an added treat, because it was my birthday they surprised us with a piece of cheesecake with a huge sparkler. It was perfect!!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from Dean Martin&#39;s Booth
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dean Martin Booth
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tableside Caesar Salad

dsUS0HJjliSO_274xmAcug.text: One of the original Steakhouses in Las Vegas, the Golden Steakhouse has been on my "to try" list for many years. This weekend we decided to pull the trigger and try this place out, here is my review...  Ambiance - I really felt like we stepped back in time as I really like the old west/Victorian style of the restaurant. It was cool knowing the Rat Pack, Elvis Presley and other Vegas celebs have also dine there made you feel part of something cool, we even saw one of our state Senators. The wait staff were dressed in tuxedo uniforms and kinda really had that old school lounge vibe. The displays and pictures on the wall really sealed the experience.  Food - We all first started out with Caesar salad which was made and plated at table side, do not see a lot of steakhouses do this anymore. We then moved on to our meals, STEAK. Everyone received their cuts cooks as ordered and was really that "melt in your mouth" steak. Thou sauces were an option, they were not needed as the flavor of the steak was amazing. Oh yeah they do have chicken and stuff, but WHY?  Service - As expected was great. The wait staff worked well as a team and no one had a empty drink class and it seems the movement of the courses worked. If you read any of my other reviews, one thing I will say is if the cup is empty, there is something wrong.  All in all, no complaints but was happy I made reservations as we had no wait, we went from check in to seating to immediate attention. Therefore I will be back as the staff of the Golden Steer have set the bar pretty high in a town that has more of their fare share of steakhouses.

ihCnXsqaBEpW1FoIVrYm0w.text: Not sure what famous celebrity's booth we sat in, lol, but there was a photo of Muhammad Ali looking over to our  immediate right. It was a treat to see the history surrounding this place.   Service was excellent from the moment we walked in. Everyone greeted us with genuine smiles and warm welcomes. I agree with the reviews that state they make you feel like family. Table service is what they call "team style". You may or may not see the same server twice during your dining experience; Carl, our first server (also the one who cashed us out) mentioned this in the beginning. We didn't mind being served team style. Everyone was kind and super accommodating. I almost favor this type of service because there is ALWAYS someone available to help you when you need something. It's never fun to have a hot plate of food in front of you, but you can't delve in because you have no utensils and there are no servers to be found -yikes!   The best part about our dinner here was the food. I started off with the French onion soup - amazing! This was the best I've ever had. If you live French onion soup, don't miss out on this here. I'm salivating right now thinking about how juicy and flavorful my ribeye was. They hit a Homerun with this one. The marbling was just enough to add that extra kick and it was cooked to perfection. This rarely happens. We each ordered the Las Vegas baked potato. It was delicious, but could've easily been shared.   Everything about our dining experience here was nothing short of amazing. I'm just sad that it took us this long to make it. This is definitely one of my Vegas favorites now!  Can't wait to return!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Las Vegas Baked Potato - YAS!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Onion Soup - Amazing!

xG4OZoedAB7_2nuANgwdAQ.text: Looking for steak in Vegas and Taylor S, the new CM Denver and past CM Vegas Steer-ed me to the iconic GSS. It's their 60th anniversary!  Like entering a time machine into the 1970's. Naugahyde red upholstered booth, some named after famous regulars and a western decor reflected the glory days of Vegas. Big hair and mustache 'n mullets prevailed.   The Caesar salad prepared table side was perfect. Each piece of lettuce was coated with dressing. Every fork full was delicious.   My friend had the filet and it was well charred and still served medium rare. A side of mac'n cheese brought smiles.   The ribeye was good, not bad, but not great. The bearnaise made it tasty. The cream spinach was a bit too creamy.   Ended the evening with Tiramisu. The bomb!  It's a bit off The Strip near the short lived Lucky Dragon Casino. Worth a visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Béarnaise
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac&#39;n Cheese

8L0fZT31ZrbIq35Ra3gGHw.text: Quality food in an "Family style" setting at Off Strip prices.   Husband and I split the Porterhouse. Ordered medium but 75% steak came medium rare which is good for me but my husband and family members prefer meat cooked longer. Sides were decent. Cream spinach was just ok but asparagus was cooked spot on and one Caesar salad was good to share for two of us. My family enjoyed the twice baked potato. It's shareable as well.   The wait staff is friendly and efficient. Lots of servers truly managing a dining room is something to appreciate. The stars are definitely for top notch service. Hostess managed well. Reservation was for 8:30p. Tables were ready with in a few minutes of reservation time.   They are "celebrating" 60 years of being in business and you can see the growth/expansion of the the place as they've bought out the various spaces in the shopping center adding extra dining rooms. The decor is reminiscent of your parents/grandparents house with wood paneling and saloon leather style seats and dusty wall sconces.   The restaurant is not baby friendly. If your kid is potty trained then you're ok but there is no changing table in the ladies room. I had to use my superpowers to change her on my lap inside a bathroom stall.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pass the Courvoisier....
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No frills wine list...

k5sPpmmONTZLyDPZOT1OLQ.text: I have lived in Vegas for over 9 years in the Vacation business, my name is Anthony.  I always pass this place everyday seems like but never went inside.   I saw this place on groupon and thought to check it out.   I paid on line but I couldn't RSVP until after 9:30 Cool  Finally got in lots of empty tables so no RSVP was even necessary.  That being said.  I ordered water baked loaded potatoe, house salad and (1) lobster tail.   My food took over 30-40 minutes to receive and the lobster tail was tough I too 4 bites and I was done.  Meanwhile the food to so long to receive I ordered shrimp cocktail while waiting its tasted chalky dont know why.   Waited came will the bill it was over $133.00.  I was just 1 person. Really even with groupon discounts I still paid 98 00 and left 15.00 because it's right to tip.      I left message on the website and also called and spoke to them, about reviews it seems no one was was really concerned.   Oh I LEFT MY LEFT OVERS ON THE TABLE I WAS SIMPLY SICK TO MY STOMACH.   call the restaurant back they told me they haven't checked the email for any concerns   No urgency at all for my concerns.   Lol.  Anthony. Please do yourself a favor its not worth the pain for a week over priced meal.   Go to high end buffets and save 100 00.  Itll be worth it I promise you.   Anthony

DbYBtHA3jGCgK-w00OkRng.text: I had to laugh at the table side Caesar salad. The guy came out with a Caesar salad already made in a bowl, tossed it in front of us, and served. That was it. I was wondering why on earth they were acting like that was special, but noticed we were the exception. Everybody else got the full "show" where the salad was actually made in front of them with ingredients added individually. Not sure why they brought it out to us already made, but whatever. Was more funny than anything to us.   Pros: I enjoyed the old school setting. The crab legs were perfect, and petite filet was adequate. Not the best, but good enough. Servers were proficient. Caesar salad was delicious and my partner was happy with their wedge salad. Bananas Foster was on point (and it was made table side for real this time, unlike our Caesar salad ;)  Cons: whipped potatoes and creamed corn were disappointing. Potatoes didn't have much flavor. No gravy or any seasoning for that matter. Corn needed to be softer and my partner was really thrown off by the cinnamon flavor of it.   Overall, it's worth checking this place out! Especially if you like that old school Vegas feel! Is it the best steak house in town? Probably not. But good times were still had.

5ptHxJ5e8Md3uaZVyPXlmA.text: For this kind of money, Hugo's Cellar would have been a better choice.  Disappointing experience.  My husband's filet was great, my veal had to be cut with a steak knife.  Capo's makes a veal that can be cut with a fork, as it should be.  When we made the reservation, the host asked if it was a special occasion, it was - our anniversary.  Why'd they ask if they weren't going to acknowledge it?  The table next to us had way better service.  I can drop $240 somewhere else next time.

9NUXsYNeAsTCi5KJKHVLBg.text: The Golden Steer was recommended to us by a bartender. Yes it is a classic and we loved the step back in time. The decor must have been very nice in the late 50's early 60's. We were seated at the John Wayne booth. It turns out my 22 year old daughter had no idea who John Wayne was. The service here is on point and these are professional servers. We started with a Cesar salad tossed and dressed table side was classic and very good. We each ordered a medium petite filet mignon at $47 each. It was a perfect medium. Sides are not included. We ordered the Lyonnaise potatoes, $11 and Bearnaise sauce, $4,00. I did not care for the potatoes and the whole time wished I had gone with the standard baked potato with fixings. The potatoes were sliced browned with onions - maybe just too oily for me. To keep the classic old school theme, we ordered cherries jubliee for one. It's $15 per person. One serving was quite a lot. The jubilee was also prepared table side. It was very good and the caramel was yummy.   A couple of disappointments.  All the meat is corn fed. If you are looking for grass fed meat, you won't find it here. But maybe that for the "new school steak eaters".  I know Las Vegas tends to be somewhat casual and warm most of the time but I just felt that all the very casually dressed diners in shorts after a day of golf kinda ruins the atmosphere. It seem disrespectful to the vintage and classic feel of the Golden Steer. Thank goodness for the perfectly shaken dry vodka martini to help me not see the shorts, baseball caps and t-shirts.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite filet mignon
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cherries jubilee

Y3qQaovDU4n540pIHTpWdA.text: This venue exactly represents precisely what a Mid-Century upscale steakhouse experience is all about. Hands-down, your best rib eye ... and your best dining-room experience ... in Las Vegas.   At the beginning of the first episode of the second season of "Mad Men," Roger, Don & Betty sip martinis while sitting in their restaurant's cozy, comfy, circular leather banquettes and watching their server construct their Caesar Salads fresh, tableside. You don't see that many places these days, but they still do it old-school here at The Golden Steer. And they will flame up your Cherries Jubilee or Bananas Foster desert tableside as well.   The Golden Steer has stubbornly - and quite wisely - retained virtually every detail of its upscale Mid-Century steakhouse dining experience since it was opened by Joe Kludjian on this very spot back in 1958. Only two restaurants have been continuously in operation longer than The Steer: El Sombrero (the Mexican dive joint downtown) and Bob Taylor's Ranch House (way out northwest near Ann Road). And I mean barely longer. And both, IMHO, are not the same experience as they once were back-in-the-day.   Those retained details include the front bar, as ornate and gorgeous as you'll find anywhere in Vegas. And they also include some of the wait staff, several on call here since the 1970s & 1980s. Indeed, the General Manager started here back in the 1980s, as a kid bussing tables.  The Steer has only changed hands once, when Kludjian sold it to Michael Signorelli in 2001. And it's plain that Signorelli takes pride in having changed almost nothing, in having preserved almost every nuance & tradition that The Golden Steer delivered its guests under Kludjian's reign. In fact, most of these black leather banquettes still bear their original leather.  This restaurant drips decades of history unlike any other dining venue in town (except, perhaps, Piero's). Sammy Davis, Jr. would come by after his shows for an after-hours meal at The Steer, because the hotels he performed in wouldn't let him eat in their restaurants. Sinatra once got drunk at the bar and stumbled through the entire restaurant, serenading every table. One of the famous photographs of Marilyn Monroe is of her and then-husband Joe DiMaggio ... dining in a booth at The Golden Steer.   Since it's Vegas, that means The Steer served not only the famous but the infamous as well. O. J. Simpson dined here the very night he committed his armed robbery at nearby Palace Station. Tony Spilotro (the gangster portrayed by Joe Peche in the movie "Casino") and his brother Michael dined at their usual back room table just before they disappeared, found buried in an Indiana cornfield just two days later.  The list of luminaries that have regularly dined at The Golden Steer extends over the decades to the present. But the greatest gift of The Golden Steer is that you too will be served here as though you were just as important as any of them. That is the tradition that steers The Golden Steer.  I've dined here a number of times--their gigantic shrimp cocktail & rib-eye--almost always with a lady friend who deserves the experience; I rely on The Golden Steer and Piero's as my two dining venues to impress. Not one lady friend has been disappointed with a visit to The Steer, given the service is as as tuxedo-ed & polished as it is fawning.   So I am quite sure The Steer will not disappoint you either.

FF8jOq5wfpyTmBigqKaSkA.text: This place should be called "The Golden Snob"...  I would like to state upfront that I loved the 12oz Filet Mignon, Twice Baked Potato, Whipped Potatoes, and "handmade" Side Caesar but I give this place a 2 as I did not feel welcomed here at all. Have you ever been somewhere and felt just "tolerated"...well as the fellow once said "ain't that a hole in the boat?"  My first interaction with the staff at check-in was very cold and off-putting but I paid it no mind because "OMG DEAN MARTIN ATE HERE". For starters, we arrived 15 minutes early for our reservation so we were asked to sit in the lounge area, understandable. At that point I felt compelled to order a drink at the bar...BAD IDEA.   I walked to the bar unsure of what cocktail I was in the mood for so I asked the bartender Humberto for suggestions, his attitude towards me was so smug that I walked away in the middle of our exchange. My lady asked "why didn't you order anything?" and I stated "the bartender was a snob"...keep in mind that the room was completely black...I hugged her and she hugged back. How can someone be an on-shift bartender but then act as if they have something better to do than talk about and make drinks? Ain't that a kick in the head?  We were called to the table about 5 minutes passed our reserved time which was not bad. Overall the food was delicious but I'd never come back which is what I think the Golden Steer wants so "job well done gang!"

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon, Whipped Potatoes, and Twice Baked Potato.

7cm-yTiPevaMnLJ7cMFJdQ.text: Let's take a step back in time to when going out to dinner was more than just a meal. A night at the Golden Steer is more of an event than a simple dinner.   Classic Vegas is truly on display at this gem of an institution. Steaks or seafood, you can't go wrong. The bone-in ribeye is my go to, but I have had and would recommend the porterhouse, petite filet and new york strip.   My wife is more of a seafood eater and loves the king crab, lobster, shrimp and scallops. The table side Caesar Salad is the best salad I have ever eaten. All the sides are great, we usually go with the creamed spinach and twice baked potatoes.   They are also known for their tableside Bananas Foster and Cherries Jubilee, but to be honest, I have been too full to even try them.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0v_AvSkMoWaeVoGJGSlwwQ.text: I have been several times to the Golden Steer. I love the atmosphere and the service. However, I went with some customers on Monday night, September 9th and the waiter messed up the order from my colleague. She ordered a petite Filet and then they brought out a 24 oz New York Strip. When she said it was wrong, he argued with us that was what she ordered when everyone at the table said it was wrong. I ordered the Prime Rib and asked for Medium. It came out cold, almost all fat and was rare. The person spinning the salad was gruff and acted put off by having to make our Caesar salad. It was a bad dining experience and I always go there the 8 times a year I'm in Vegas. For our bill of $500.00, you think it would have been a little better than what we were served.

s49fnL8ee-al6c2-LEyKCQ.text: We go to Vegas every year for my brother's birthday. We came here this year for his birthday dinner.   We weren't really feeling steak, so we just got some sides. We got the baked ravioli, the french onion soup, and the twice baked potato. Everything was pretty good. I was disappointed that the soup came out room temperature, not warm at all.   It's definitely an old school fancy steakhouse. Everyone else loved their steak. It's definitely on the pricey side as you would expect.   The service was good. I'm not sure if it was just where we were sitting, but it was very cold in the restaurant. The strip mall location is interesting for a steakhouse.

v9KL5mFyBr-qPDN7Iq2Tiw.text: EXCELLENT!! My husband and I went for dinner this evening, there was no wait but we did have reservations.  Very classy and time period correct.  The ambiance is amazing, the food is amazing!  I had the prime rib, Cesar salad table side, king crab cocktail and sauteed mushrooms.  My husband had the bone in ribeye, macaroni, twice baked potato and oysters Rockefeller. He is not easy to impress and he  was blown away.  The service was spot on, the food amazing I highly recommend this place if you are in Vegas.

zZeswInCf3TsbojsrY667A.text: This is the best steak house we have ever been to steaks are so juicy and tender.woeth every penny. I will most definitely be back again.

Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. There ceasar salad is so good

2EuM6EyzormId-0EjiigAA.text: I'm not even big on steakhouses, but I went to Golden Steer OVER A WEEK AGO and I've been craving that prime rib and twice baked potato ever since. I'm probably even making another trip to Vegas for that meal ok the future, but this time I'm also getting the creamed spinach, which I should have gotten the first time! I'm so impressed and wish I could have it right now. I wasn't even really hungry when I ordered, but finished everything on my plate with no regrets (except not also ordering that creamer spinach.)

AZuWXgo97_dwouO06pIAGQ.text: An old school steakhouse with an incredible atmosphere! We ate here on a Saturday and was lucky to get a reservation last minute. Make sure you book well in advance. They had a great wine list and the food menu was amazing. The Caesar salad was one of the best I've had and they even make it table side. Their prime rib and filet were both great cuts of meat and was cooked to perfection. Most of the entrees are a la carte so you might want to order a few sides for the table to share. The service itself was something to be desired but the delicious food made up for that shortfall. This steakhouse should be on everyone's list to dine at!
