EeLbVZj9Kxz51wRAJUoZ4Q.text: Amazing gem in Las Vegas with the best service experience in the country. Doesn't get any better than this.

uu7IzprHaC4nMkiYRVzEIA.text: The wife and I had a date here. The food was off the charts good. The steak was cooked to perfection. The ceasar was prepared fresh at the table. The ambiance was un-matched in Vegas giving you an Old school gangster feel. I can't wait to go back.

1cKXEP-G4qlcy9QH6UhDpA.text: Went to Golden Steer tonight with my GF for a New Years day dinner. Let me start off with the service was very excellent from our waiter Scott. We started off with the King Crab cocktail and it was very fresh and the cocktail sauce was delicious and then we ordered a ceaser salad which they made at our table which is very cool that you don't see anymore. The salad was pretty good. My gf had the 8oz Filet and I ordered the Bone in Rib eye with a side of Asparagus and Creamed Spinach. Both of our steaks were delicious and the creamed spinach was surprisingly good. I mean it doesnt compare to Peter Lugers creamed spinach from NY but it was good. The asparagus was not good at all. It was just steamed asparagus with no seasoning on it and it was overcooked and very soft, had no snap crunch to it. The waiter gladly took it off of the bill. I know what I'm talking about, I am actually a professional Chef and I own a company out here in Vegas. Overall the experience was a 4 star review only because the Asparagus was boring and overcooked.

Ejf3Mucd7SYE2xW8ICKlCA.text: We were SO disappointed in our first ever visit to this "oldest steakhouse in Vegas". We have lived in Vegas over 20 years and had never been. My husband and I both ordered the 8 oz filets, his was the Oscar, with crab and Bernaise sauce. Both steaks were stringy and tough, more like chuck roast than filet and were clearly not tenderloin. I complained to the waiter who offered to bring another steak, which I declined. We were given a free dessert, and I told the waiter I wanted management to know at least 2 customers knew what a filet of beef was supposed to be like. Do not go if you are looking for a good filet.

zlxF5890zln6F-O-TH9HfQ.text: Golden Steer a high end restaurant in Vegas will never get our business again.  Upon entering they politely asked my Father to remove his hat.  The  worker stated that no hats were allowed.  My dad removed his hat immediately.  His hat read, "Retired Military".  The worker thanked my dad for his service and again apologized for their policy.  This rule was not an issue with us.  That is until another man walks in with a hat ON his head.  Upon our exit ANOTHER man had a sombrero on.  I went right up to the same worker and said-- why did you ask my 79 year old father to remove his hat and you let other men wear theirs?? She fumbled on her words and said oh we don't allow hats that look like ball caps.  So military hats are not allowed but the other two ethnic hats are allowed.  Shame on you Golden Steer!! I took pictures..  Sorry dad-- I will always stick up for what is wrong.  Plus it is Father's Day .. and they disrespected you!!

bSXBtB87VGO6RRpJUg5nuw.text: As mentioned previously, this restaurant has an old Vegas ambiance and charm. The moment I walked in, I felt as if I was a celebrity and was quickly seated and attended to by the wait staff.  Don't let the location, or outside facade keep you from coming to this restaurant. I had one of the best meals, and accommodations I can remember from any restaurant.   This is definitely on my list of places to go when I want a great meal, ambiance, and service.  ***EDIT*** Best service I ever had....period.

iEm7OYmjnK-CpgSZtbwBGA.text: Judging by the outside you would never know what a wonderful place this is with so much history...   We ate in Joe DiMaggio's both.. Next to Elvis Presley's booth!!!  Also took pictures in Frank Sinatra's booth which is next to Dean Martin and Sammy Davis Jr's Booths...   What?  That's not enough to???   Ok... Let me tell you that the service was wonderful and the food was amazing!!! We had Steak, HUGE Lobster Tail, Caesar Salad, Creamed Corn, great drinks and for desert we had the Creme Brulee and the Flaming Cherries Jubilee which is prepared Tableside!!!! It was hard to choose between that and the Bananas Foster which is also prepared Tableside.... Next time I'm in Vegas I am definitely going back!

R6yq1V5zlUCI-DgY_QWUSQ.text: Very disappointed. Service was awful. Our waiter walked away in the middle of taking our drink order to make a salad at the table next to us. We had to flag him down to get our drink order completed. It only got worse from there. It took us 30 minutes to order food and our waiter would have rather been anywhere else. Our food arrived without our sides then when we asked for them it took 10 min to get them and only after asking for them again. My steak was cold by the time we got everything. Awful, awful experience.

I4N98_E_c90tAM2qK2MbYA.text: From the outside this restaurant doesn't look like much. But once you get inside its an old Vegas feel where you would see the mob having dinner (back in the day) .  Our waiters were amazing. They were all very funny and friendly. They wear suits but their personalities were not as you would think of with a waiter with a suit but their personalities were laid back and just overall friendly and humorous.  The food was amazing. We were offered to try their clam chowder which Im usually picky about this kind of soup but it was really good. We were also given a tasting of a cabernet they had and it went perfect with the  18oz prime I had....and it was cooked perfectly and served with delicious creamy and fresh horseradish. After dinner we were served a complimentary cheesecake with the most sparkly candle ...what a nice surprise from our funny waiter. We also ordered Dirty martini's for after dinner cocktails. After dinner our waiter kindly called us a cab.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary cheesecake dessert.. Delicious and festive
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 18oz. Prime rib cooked perfectly

WVPfBXTOh_g5llkBqHgJUQ.text: I would bump this up a star for service but food was a solid 3 stars for me.  Service was excellent with that old school table side attention.  We had ribeye and a couple of sides including the potatoes and I gotta say, I've had better elsewhere.  Everything was decent but not exceptional.  I hate to say it but N9NE, Capital Grill and Fleming's are all better, just to give you an idea.  They are better than Echo and Rig though.  Echo and Rig is a lot of show and no substance, service was terrible, but that's a whole other review.  Anyway, Golden Steer, worth a try to satisfy your curiosity but they need something more compelling to get me back.  All time favorite steakhouse is still Bern's in Tampa, FL.  Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.

SI1OyohIA4JrdYbjFqD-Hw.text: Very disappointed.. first -waiter give menus and said he will be back to answer our questions and go over it-never happen, second- no waiter asked why we were there ( celebrating my birthday) even though tables around us received special birthday "fireworks "...I never got one.. not coming back..

-UuwYzXyS4BNPLGTf8xV4w.text: Amazing Dinner Oysters Rockefeller, Baked Clams Casino, French Onion Soup,  Salad, Steak Oscar, Creamed Spinach, I had the  Shrimp Scampi

UNDDIZiIBa7PY3UAl73cWQ.text: Old school as can be. A lil loud but most places are now. The service was solid. The tableside caeser salad was great. The homemade dressing was so good. Had the steak and shrimp. Market price is no joke ($75) but comes with your salad and side (actually saved us $2 over ala carte) haha. Not the best steak ive had, or even top 5, but ive had alot of steaks. The quality is there tho. Def worth a solid date night experience as the staff is good & the food quality matches as well. Old vegas is still alive and well in this place!

yOdiDEzmlNyUnQK_zAJnJQ.text: Old Vegas atmosphere; It was neat that they identified each table by the Celebrity that dined there. (IE - John Wayne, Charles Bronson) Table side preparation - love the banana fosters and great steak - prime cuts ! The service was outstanding !

vuLGFLjwELw4SMkoU7Qj9A.text: One of best steaks of my life in one of the most historic show biz venues in the world and the creamed spinach with the touch of Pernod was PERFECT. Seriously perfect. If there was a creamed spinach award they would get the blue ribbon. Exceptional service as well

Tf9jLq-1DMYQAopJiuASzA.text: My husband is a huge fan of Golden Steer. We actually ate here the night before our wedding and my husband has booked business dinners here. We were in town and decided to have dinner. We had to wait for our reservation so we had drinks in the bar. Drinks were good. While having our drinks though, you notice things have changed. You wonder immediately why a restaurant of this caliber is doing a Groupon. Once we are seated, it takes awhile for anyone to get us drinks and then longer for a server to come. We ordered and things arrived in a good time frame. Once our steaks arrived though my husbands wasn't cooked properly. My husband isn't one to send things back but has said 3 times he regrets that. My filet though was delicious as were the cream corn and twiced baked potato. He ordered the most expensive steak on the menu and it should have been cooked right. We ordered dessert and my husband ordered coffee with espresso. The espresso came, then the coffee came and then the check came. No dessert. We just paid the check and left. This used  to be a very classy place. Proper attire required. It still says it at the door but it isn't being enforced. It was very unorganized and just not the great experience it always was. Maybe when the Groupon is done they can get back to serving people like they used too.

Wfs7JbdIv3hUM9j0tAZJcQ.text: Now it doesn't look like much from the outside but looks are deceiving! Everything we ordered was delicious but very pricey. The filet mignon was cooked to perfection and their sauteed mushrooms was very good. We ordered salad too but next time I will pass on that. The bread that came with the meal was good as well.  The ambience was very old school and dark. Very romantic. It was very classy but I did see alot of people in casual wear.  I will definitely come back.

5U_zrjlZmFKrBOMjPu10WQ.text: Simply stated this is probably the best steak house experience you can have in Las Vegas.   You can get a good steak and good service in a lot of places in Las Vegas. But the difference here is the experience. Of course it's old Vegas and the other reviews talk about the history of the Golden Steer. But what sets this place apart is the ambiance, the service, and the old Vegas feel.   Definitely get the table side Caesar salad the first time you go and for the full experience get one of the tableside flambe desserts. There is no chance you can be disappointed with this dining experience. You don't have to go to the strip and the prices are fair and reasonable. Give it a try.

1GanLw6Tdx0xfZ2FNlG2RA.text: WOW! What an experience! Excellent food and service far above and beyond!  Now the place is pretty pricey, but well worth it! The food was phenomenal!  We ordered the stuffed mushrooms and shrimp cocktail. It was pretty standard and we started to worry that it was just going to be a regular steak house. Then we got the Caesar  salad made fresh at our table...AND YUMMY! It was one of the best Caesar salads I have ever had!  And now the main course...bone in ribeye steak. Came to our table with perfect timing! The steak was cooked to order (medium well and medium rare). The steak was extremely flavorful! A distinct flavor that I would definitely come back for! The twice baked potato, fresh asparagus and mushrooms were good, but nothing exciting...but that steak...YUMMY!  Just when we thought they had topped themselves we ordered the bananas foster...and again...WOW! Excellent presentation and the the flavor was an excellent blend of bananas, ice cream and a hint of citrus. This place is a definite must! Come hungry, but don't come broke. It's about $270 for two people, including tip at 20%. We ordered two appetizers, Caesar salad, two ribeye steaks, twice baked potato, mushrooms, asparagus and two desserts.  FYI We plan on going back in about a month!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. WOW! Get the BANANAS FOSTER! It&#39;s So good!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22 oz Ribeye steak!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twice baked potato, asparagus, and stuffed mushrooms.

AGFilrWi-Hmtl8fkp4vh8w.text: I was pleasantly surprised by my dinner here. We took the recommendation of a good friend and decided to stop by the last time we were in Vegas. It was everything he had promised.   The decor was awesome. I could totally imagine the rat pack sitting in these plush red leather booths while eating a juicy steak. The service was attentive and very friendly as well.  We each ordered the steak of our liking, me choosing my favorite, the New York. My boyfriend ordered the rib eye. Both were very good, cooked to a perfect medium rare. I ordered a side of bearnaise sauce that I also enjoyed. I love dipping steak in bearnaise.   We also had the table side Cesar. The server wheeled his little cart over and made the dressing from scratch. It was delicious.   This is an old hidden gem that Vegas should talk more about!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. new york steak, mooing just the way I love

1mV4yWb0nZVG8TxGzOT2vA.text: Felt like I took a trip down memory lane. The interiors were awesome, as well as the steaks. Servings are big and can be shared.

a2HHZB8wM4xRyrJYujknnw.text: I don't recommend this place. Food was medium at best, the service was terrible. And the price was $155.00....you do the math.

Bq-bLCvQS62pWxx4uGfdcA.text: My husband and I were in Vegas for our honeymoon and someone had suggested the Golden Steer. We were very impressed. From the exterior, you can't tell what it is inside, which was a nice surprise. I enjoyed the relaxed environment, we felt important there. The service we had was great and the portions of food were large. We loved our meal. They even gave us a free dessert which was an amazing cheesecake. Such a great experience for us!

hGg6NKSkeL-eXMmbiRhh0Q.text: My wife and I dined at the Golden Steer in mid July 2010 with my parents.  I did a lot of online research regarding Vegas restaurants prior to our trip and the solid reviews on Yelp really got my Dad and I excited for this place.  We both love Frank Sinatra, 'old school' vegas, and good steaks.  We figured this place would be PERFECT for us.   It's only about a $15 cab ride from The Mirage as it's located just northwest of the strip. I don't know if we hit it on a bad night or what, but this place was the absolute disappointment of the trip.  We had a 7pm reservation on a Saturday night and the place was pretty much dead.  There were about 4 people in the bar upfront which had a guy playing the piano who was pretty average.  We were in the 'front' dining room (there was another in back) and it was only us and 2 other couples.  I thought the atmosphere lacked everything the other Yelp reviewers mentioned.  There were hardly any old school pictures of the famous clientele they claimed to have served in the past.  We were in the Frank Sinatra booth and they had a prototypical picture on the wall of the Rat Pack which you could buy for about $5 anywhere.  I didn't see any authentic pictures of anyone dining there in the past and nothing was autographed.  The booths weren't anything all that special - just the old school round leather style with small inconspicuous gold plaque of who's supposed booth it was.  Our group had 1 bottle of wine, soup/salad appetizers, a new york strip steak, 2 petitie fillets, surf and turf (pettite fillet and lobster tail), and a couple of sides consisting of twice baked potatoes and broccoli and the bill came up to $325.  I had no problem dropping a bunch of money on a meal and actually expected to be into it for about $500 at this place - but I thought the prices were an absolute crime for what it was.  The steaks were good but certainly not the best I ever had.  The soup and sides paled in comparison to other high end places I've been such as Mastro's.  I'm absolutely stunned they command the prices they do for how much competition is in Vegas for this price point and how much better it is.    The "schtick" of the place seemed to be sharing stories about who used to frequent the place, how some of their dishes came to be, and other 'humorous' stories.  All of them really lacked charm and authenticity.  Our waiter was Mexican and the hostess lady made 3 derogatory jokes about him being Mexican.  One of which was telling another table that they needed to say goodbye to him because it was the last they would see of him because Immigration was in the kitchen.  I'm not even kidding you, that actually happened.  Along with 2 other jokes along these lines.    It's at this point that I should probably mention that I'm actual not a pretentious person nor do I have excessive dining standards - I'm certainly not a food critic.  However, paying the prices they charge for the quality of their food along with the very underwhelming atmosphere was just a complete disappointment.  I also expect a certain level of professionalism out of the staff at this price point.    There are a number of other places my family and I would've rather dine in retrospect and we wouldn't even had to travel off the strip to do it...

N61QCNabJzvfD03wzftb0w.text: This has been our favorite Steak House in Las Vegas for years.  When we are in town, we always have made a point to eat there, and usually bring friends with us. We brag it up about the great food, the great service, and the unique "old Vegas" charm.  However, this last weekend, I experienced something different than ALL the other times I have been there. There are reviews on here that suggest that it is slowly going downhill, and I would have to strongly agree.  We were there on a Saturday night and the place was half full. I have never seen that before. The server that waited on us seemed to be going through the motions. Completely uninspired.  The server who made the Caesar salad at the table(one of my favorite parts of the meal), was also totally uninspired and not interested at all in answering the questions our guests had about the process of making the salad. We seemed to be bothering him. We ordered a bottle of the Cakebread Cab ($140), and it came to the table warm.  At the prices they charge, and for a bottle of wine at that price point, it is pretty poor service to bring it to the table warm.  When I informed the server of the fact that it was warm, he asked me "what would you like me to do".  I didn't say it, but I thought to myself, "solve the problem!"  Instead, we asked him to chill the wine. We shouldn't have to tell the server how to handle a warm bottle of wine.  AND MORE IMPORTANTLY, why are they serving a nice bottle of wine warm?   Where are they keeping it?  Either way, not the kind of service you expect at a restaurant that charges a premium price. Outback, maybe....but not the Golden Steer. That being said, the food was very good.  Not as good as usual, but good. No complaints about the food. When we finished, the place was a ghost town.  No hostess around to ask to call a cab.  No one to thank us for stopping by.  Something has changed with this place.  Employees are uninspired. They are not busy on a Saturday night.  They are not taking care of the customers like they used to. No longer would I consider this a "special" place to go, and no longer certainly worth the extra time and effort to go off the strip.

F7pGdmv5mKgPO8rjdo3X5A.text: Do not let the look on the outside fool you, this place is amazingly decorated inside. I am a fan of the days of Frank, Sammy, Peter, & Dean hanging out at the Sahara and this place reminds you exactly of that. The food is AWESOME. I have never had a bad meal here, with that said every meal I have had here is amazingly good. In comparison all the steakhouses on the strip are garbage in comparison to the Golden Steer.

6EFw36R9D-61-EN54JjO6w.text: Another old school Steak House.  Open since the 50's!  Steak was good but not in the same league as Flemings or Morton's!

JSONL5h-tBeppPeDNkyHow.text: Food was INCREDIBLE!  The atmosphere is very old school vegas and the service is amazing!!  Don't let the weird exterior fool you.  This place is a classic steakhouse and so fantastic.  I also, would like to give a huge shout out to the Valentines Day photographer who mastered the art of avoiding the double chin in what turned out to be some of my fav pics of my boyfriend and I.

Tr1UbUB9VI0O_49j85vV8g.text: when recently in vegas for my 29th birthday, i had a mission. to go to an old time glitzy vintage vegas steakhouse for my birthday dinner. so i looked around on the internet and it led me to the golden steer.  now don't be fooled by the area that it's in, this is old vegas style. i just loved the huge fiberglass steer on the sign! the minute we walked in i knew we had come to the right place. dark, swanky, huge naugahyde booths with a western theme, a piano player in the bar... oh yeah.   as soon as we were seated the lovely hostess gave us a total history of the place. who used to dine there, who's table was who's (we were at betty grable's table), what was good to drink, etc. she was super friendly and personable. she also clued us in that this was infact the oldest restaurant in vegas.  to eat we ordered the salad, the filet, a twice baked potato, and the chicken of the angels. all were very good. pricey but good. the server was totally old school and very attentive. a table next to us ordered the bananas foster for dessert and it was quite fun to watch it being prepared at their table. we would have ordered dessert too but we were both way too full and even took home leftovers.  after dinner we had a drink in the bar and watched the piano man play. i requested a few old tunes and he loved that i knew old music. a guy sitting watching the piano man kept talking about how he had just visited his friend, dennis hopper (the actor), earlier. i guess this place still attracts the well to do and hollywood types.  all in all it was a perfect vintage birthday dinner and now it will be a tradition whenever we are in vegas. they made me feel like i was a old hollywood movie starlet!

yI6WJcJuZcgIdAq5t_bpaA.text: What a flash back to the past!!!! And not at all in a bad way! LOVED feeling like I was dining in the 50's in this place. The food selection matched the atmosphere! Starting with the cocktails to the dessert , everything was right on!

i27bLRELHrWIajWBT6fIxQ.text: We're steak lovers and after reading all the great reviews, my girlfriend and I wanted to try the Golden Steer so we dined here last night for my birthday. My girlfriend had Caesar's Salad (tell them if you don't want anchovy paste in your salad) and I had the French onion soup -- both were excellent. For dinner, we shared the 16 oz. NY Strip and lobster tail combination with a HUGE baked potato. For dessert, the waiters put a sparkler candle in our tiramisu and sang happy birthday at our table! (We made reservations on opentable.com and indicated a birthday celebration.) All the food was incredibly good and the wait staff was very attentive and friendly! We enjoyed dining here very much and will be back!

xpDLoSKyGJfpedVjWJ9jnQ.text: I'm so disappointed. I really really wanted to like Golden Steer. See, I'm a food and wine writer and I choose only to write positive things in my column - which means I had nothing to write about Golden Steer. We had been planning to dine there for awhile and by chance I happened to get a Living Social certificate for $50 for Golden Steer so everything seemed perfect. From the moment we arrived, it was clear that we were not welcome and our business was neither wanted, nor needed. I would mention the name of our rude, terrible, gum chewing (I KNOW!) server, but he never bothered to give it to us. Nor did he give us a wine list until I asked for one. The server had nothing but contempt for us from the moment we presented our Living Social voucher. (If restaurants have a problem with taking these vouchers, then they shouldn't offer them, in my opinion). I guess he figured we were cheap kids and he wouldn't get a good tip. That really doesn't account for the lackluster service and presentation overall. The food was okay, not great, not bad. My filet mignon did have a piece of gristle in it - which is unaccaptable for a $45 filet, but at least it was cooked properly. The same could not be said of my Husband's ribeye. Honestly, what they did to that poor piece of meat was criminal. It was nearly burned to a crisp (ordered medium rare). Overall, the food sucks, the service sucks, and the ambiance is depressing. It's really time to turn this Golden Steer out to pasture.

IYs7grsRvjbtvDvpO1EeMA.text: I finally got to the Golden Steer last night, and it was simultaneously more and less than what I expected/hoped for.   From the minute you walk in the, the odd juxtaposition of a nice steakhouse in a shitty strip mall makes it self known. Two of the signs on the doorway - "PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED" & "RESTROOMS ARE FOR CUSTOMERS ONLY" are so rarely seen together. However, once you're inside the double entry-way, you have no idea you're on in a rundown plaza on the wrong side of Sahara. There's a very nice looking bar/lounge area immediately at the entrance, and the maitre'd is to the right. We had reservations, just to be safe (I know, it's only Thursday), and were seated immediately. (The Marilyn Monroe booth, if it matters). The decor is nice, no doubt about it, and it pulls off that old steakhouse vibe very well, without feeling phony or pretentious. I was actually quite skeptical on this, but there were no disappointments there. Our waiter, who was a younger guy, and not the old dude everyone talks about, was cordial enough, but definitely didn't do anything amazing. On to the food...  Appetizers: Toasted Ravioli - As Gordon H told me "Not gourmet by any means, but I love them." And that's what went through my head as I ate them. Good stuff, but you're not gonna confuse it for a fancy dish.  Soup/salad: We skipped. The guy at the booth next to us ordered the Caeser though, and it looked good.  Entree:  8oz Petit Filet: My guest had this, and she proclaimed it easily better than the bone-in filet at Joe's, but not better than Joe's ribeye. This really surprised me to hear, but I didn't taste it, so I can't confirm/disconfirm.   20oz? Ribeye: Pretty good, but not great.. I didn't get to finish it, so maybe it could've deserved better. Don't get me wrong, I wouldn't kick it out of bed, but it doesn't stack up to the competition IMO.  Sides: Twice-baked potato: Con bacon. My fucking lady friend said that it was good. I think it was too, but I couldn't compare.  Creamed spinach: Not great. Sweet & too creamy, in both of our opinions. Definitely outdone by Joe's & Del Frisco's here. Onion rings: We both saw the onion rings, prominently displayed on the menu, and hoped that they were some extra special dish. They even had an aura emanating from them upon arrival, but ultimately they were just above-average beer-battered rings.   Desert: Bananas Foster: The fucking business. Flambeed table-side, as it should be. Our man with the frying pan had some liquor ignition issues, so he had to run to the back and start fresh, but the 2nd take went just fine. And the dish was well worth the wait. My FLF said it was definitely amongst the best she's had. I really enjoyed it, but I haven't had enough others to compare.   Overall, I wouldn't rush back here for the steaks. There was a lot of seafood on the menu, which may be excellent for all I know. I will be returning to try the chicken/veal parmigiana, and definitely for deserts. Cool place though, and if I wasn't aware of other places I liked better, I'd probably come here a helluva lot more often.

7sYxW00J2BmWnM8rlXs7KA.text: Everyone from the cabbie to the doorman at the Mandalay knew where this place was.  We had reservations at 7pm but, he it is vegas...  We got hungry and being the drinkers we are didn't realize it was only 4:45pm when we got there.   I walked right up pulled the handle and it was closed.    Dang it.  No worries, they opened the door right up and welcomed us in....now THAT is service.  3 of us got the 24 ounce prime rib that they are famous for...2 medium rare (i would suggest the medium)   and 1 medium.   One got the bone in rib eye.  The sides, salads etc are all "nice" but they are $8-16 a piece and in my opinion not worth it.    4 people got out of there for $300.00 with tip.  It is old school, we didn't sit at anyone's booth but instead sat at a four top near Joe Dimaggio and Elvis Presley's table.  The ambience is classic 50-60's vegas....you could picture the rat pack in here smoking cigars when they allowed smoking in eating establishments and it brought a lot of clarity to our vegas trip.  I will say I did get the meat sweats from all the beef and I don't know how Man -v- Food gets it all down in an hour.  The reason why they get the ding on the star  --  The call the 18 oz cut of prime rib "the ladies cut" to goad you into getting the bigger one.   That is crap.   Get it and smile.

Z2gkEHbyQGqjG4AzjuVfzg.text: We really wanted to like this place but we won't be back.  We celebrated my husbands birthday.  We usually go to Mortons but had a groupon for the Golden Steer.  Our server was ok, a little strange and not overly friendly.  Got the feeling he was over us when we mentioned groupon.  My husand had the Ceasear salad which was a good portion and homemade.  My onion soup was warm and not hot but flavor was good.  I had the smallest prime rib they had which was 18oz and ridiculously large.  My husband had the petite filet.  Both were just ok.  Definitely not the "Finest Steaks in Las Vegas" as they promote here.  The Lyonnaise potatoes were gross.  Smothered in onoions on top so you can't even see it's a potato dish.  Prices are high-not worth it

MTAjnmTmzIM3WOIepWYEnQ.text: Phenomenal steak, had NY Strip 16 oz, which was done to perfection, as was the fresh asparagus as a side dish.  Definitely old school restaurant with friendly professional wait staff (i.e., not actors waiting for next gig), and lots of history.  This was a taste of the original Las Vegas, and it's nice to see something like this has survived the arrival of the facade palaces.  Frank and Dean and Sammy ate here and hung out here, and you might be seated where they once sat (we were).  Not cheap, but worth every penny.  If you want to go beyond the buffet specials and chain restaurants and simulated splendor, definitely go here.  It's a step into the past and the food was great.

WPXwuUEjfSRSnAVMXJN7ng.text: Don't like the way it looks from the outside, but don't ever judge a book by it's cover.  One word to describe my experience with  this place is "SURPRISED."   As soon as I stepped in the atmosphere was nothing like what I had expected.  It was an older, but classy setting and they even had a pianist.  We had excellent service from our waiter and our food was great!  It was worth the price and experience.  If I was rich I'd eat there on a regular basis!

WSbtWM9LSfl4jX0yi7iHJg.text: MY FAVORITE PLACE IN LAS VEGAS !!!!!!  Do NOT let the exterior deter you from going in!! Its "Old School Vegas Baby"  LOVED IT! It truly is like a scene out of Casino VERY 60's-70's esque and the service is IMPECCIBLE!  I do not mind paying for a meal when the guests are treated like this and the food is superb and delicious indeed.  A lot of others should take note of this wonderful place!  The ambience if Old Vegas just enchanted me it just envelopes you as you walk in almost like the set of a movie.  I could care less if a celebrity was sitting there (there was and they "blended in) with the rest if us - EVERYONE was treated the same in this fine establishment.  I can see why they have been in business for so long - good old fashioned EXCELLENT food and IMPECCIBLE service.  I usually order filet mingnon (well done) not an easy task to do but they did it superbly. My steak was rich and juicy AND well done the way I ordered it.  The stuffed potatoe was GIGANTIC and very delicious too! Vegetables were fresh anad crisp and lightly butterred.  The shrimps we had for an appetizer were the size of small lobsters and mouthwatering GOOD!  LOVED then caesar salad and the way it was prepared - right at the table and FRESH and DELICIOUS! You can tell the shrimp and produce were not "sitting" in a fridge for a week either!! Beautiful and FRESH along with the rest of the meal.  No its not cheap but its sure not over priced for quality and service either! If you want cheap go to McDonalds and don't "whine" about the prices! If you want a meal thats "out-of-this-world" go here!  You will be treated like royalty.  I was very impressed that the Maitre-D waited who was kind enoug to wait with us outside while our cab came (yes I tipped him too!  It was just NICE and well deserved!).  A phenomenal experience and I am definitely coming BACK to this favorite restaurant!!  Another nice thing as I frequently travel it was nice to see diners who were dining alone were not ignored for a second - I'd be comfortable coming back here myself - oh its nice to dine with driends but I'd be just fine alone here too!! LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

pZiCV2wk3jFKHmCYIFgS2A.text: oh no!  I think something has replaced my love of Gallagher's... Love love love this place.  Driving up on it may dismay you, the outside it not cute nor inviting but once you walk in its a whole different story.  This is a True old school place where Sinatra, Sammy Davis and even OJ have eaten.  Our waiter who has been there 31 years informed us who has been in and out of this place.  The menu is classic steakhouse with prime beef that they age to perfection.  We ordered Cesar salad's for two, a rib eye 20oz, a filet mignon 12 oz, twice baked potato and mushroom's.  Every thing was perfect and delicious and huge!  Oh and for dessert we splurged on the bananas foster which was prepared table side.  This place is very pricey and you must drive to get to it.  This is also a must do on the Vegas list because of its past.  I love you GS, you will be missed and I will dream of my return sometime soon.

LYkc-wRRz5SfzlHRQLD-GA.text: The service is wonderfully old school attentive. There is so much history to this place.  The Rat Pack and Marilyn used to hang out here. The food is excellent.  Its pricing is the same as a typical class chain like Capital Grill or Del Frisco's, but the serving are huge!  You really get your money's worth here.  The small prime rib (perfectly cooked) is 17 ounces!  The waiters are quick to make suggestions for sides and appetizers.  Listen to them; they know what they are talking about.  And trust them on the wines.  They aren't trying to sell you on a $20 glass of wine.  It's extremely reasonable for what you get.  And ask about the history of the restaurant.  If you only have one night to go out for prime rib or steak in Vegas, make it at the Golden Steer!

BNGpr0MokgblzIgMgkvN3Q.text: I will NEVER  return to The Golden Steer.     I am a local resident, and had visited The Golden Steer only one time before, many years ago.  After my first visit I was convinced that I had eaten at one of the finest restaurants in the world.  The food, the ambiance, and the service were impeccable.  Could it be that when Thomas Wolf wrote 'You Can't Go Home Again' he was referring to restaurants, as well?   On Tuesday evening, December 20, I revisited The Golden Steer with my partner.    The ambiance on my first visit had been that of a Fine Steak House, elegant and tasteful.  On the Tuesday that we visited it was more akin to a Denny's in a depressed area.  Even though the room was nearly empty, we were seated next to a large corner booth occupied by what was obviously a family.  That would not have been a problem, except that shortly after our seating a young girl, about 5 or 6 years old, began singing the one partial verse of Jingle Bells that she knew - over and over.  Again, not so bad - until she started jumping up and down in the seat.  Then a "Hostess' or some female employee came over to their booth and encouraged the little girl to keep it up, sing louder; and even joined in with her for a few more rounds of the same 8 - 10 words that she knew.  I could have asked to be reseated, but I let it go.  It was the Christmas Season, after all.   My guest ordered a dinner salad without tomatoes.   They seemed to take forever to arrive.   They finally arrived via table side cart.  They were finished and placed on the table.  There were tomatoes on both salads.  We told the server, and he took the incorrect salad away on the cart.  Nearly 10 minutes later he returned with the salad plate in his hand, and plopped it down, very unceremoniously, in front of my guest.   The entrees arrived.  I had ordered Prime Rib of Beef (36 oz), baked potato, and creamed corn.  My guest had the Top Sirloin, steak fries and broccoli.  We both asked for our entree to be cooked the same way; medium to medium well.   My prime rib was overcooked - to the point of being DRY.  Fortunately, the au jus was there to make it palatable.   My partner's steak was closer to cremated.   There wasn't even a tinge of pink to be found in that steak.  We have both had meat that was a little too done on the outside edges, only to have it turn out to be fine as we got closer to the center.  We both kept eating, hoping for a tasty outcome.  Unfortunately, that was not the case that night.     After reaching the center of the dry, tough steak, the waiter finally wandered by.  We pointed out how overcooked the meat was.   He made a production of inspecting every aspect of the half eaten steak, flashlight and all, trying desperately to find even a speck of pink.  Unable to do so, he offered to replace it, although he felt it necessary to point out that nearly half of the meat had already been eaten.  We declined his embarrassingly disingenuous offer.  He left, returning a few minutes later to say that he had spoken to the management who had graciously taken half the price of the steak off of our bill.   Nothing was right that night.  The corn was way too sweet.  The baked potato, while big,  was absolutely unfit to serve.  Nearly black on the bottom, it had about one half inch of dark brown, scorched flesh on the inside.  Fortunately, it was large enough that I could salvage some edible parts from the top half.  The broccoli was the opposite, both undercooked (to the point of being hard)  and COLD.  A dab of butter put on top in an attempt to make it palatable,  just sat there, unmelted, throughout the meal.   We asked to have the remainder of our meals wrapped to go.  I specifically mentioned wanting the au jus for my prime rib, since it was inedible without it.  I was absolutely stunned and actually embarrassed when they brought out our take home package.  Cheap Styrofoam clam-shells in a generic plastic bag!  Even Denny's has more class than to present their guests with such a cheap, inelegant farewell.  When I got home I found that the waiter had forgotten (?) to include the au jus.  My dogs appreciated The Golden Steer.  That night, they ate prime rib for the first time in their lives.   The prices were very high, on par with what one would expect from a steakhouse that actually serves good food.  The service was poor, and any sign of ambiance must have fled after Sinatra's last visit.  This is NOT "Old School Vegas".  This is just an establishment that  'jumped the shark' many years ago.

-vYFircynulALiTQgBoc0A.text: We went last night for my husbands birthday dinner.  There were 5 of us and the reviews are mixed.  Auntie order oysters Rockefeller and a grey goose martini she gives it a five for both of those.  Her husband ordered ribeye as did my husband.  Both felt the meat flavor was good and gave theirs 4 stars although they couldn't cut with a butter knife.  mom ordered a combo of crab legs and petite filet she thought her steak was a 3 and her crab legs tasteless like they had been frozen and then put under the broiler.  I am vegetarian I usually love the sides but I give it a 1.  The creamed spinach had an odd spice in it like anise or some strong flavor we all couldn't identify.  The asparagus was steamed and cold they brought us more that was warm but had a bitter sour flavor,  we couldn't eat it.  The $9 baked potato was a 1.50 potato.  I expected the skin to have a nice crust it didn't.  I expected it to be served with butter, sour cream and chives.  It was served with sour cream and margarine.  The French onion soup my husband said tasted like Sysco no flavor.  The salad was iceberg and large but not much too it a few garbanzo beans and tomorrow pieces.  The bread was French loaves but dry and flavorless.

dBFcDe5pA6deQfXQOxc3tw.text: Favorite steakhouse in Vegas. Ambiance is super cool, food was fabulous, and they make the best drink in town.  Old school Vegas all the way.

D6gluQWv8x7tIPpgPkzoww.text: The ribeye was the most delicious steak I've had this year.  The caesar salad (made tableside) was tangy enough but my brother took points off for the fact that they made it in a plastic (not wooden) bowl.  I'm with him on that.  My only other major gripe is the wine list has a lot of room for improvement.  Avoid the twice-baked potato: very dry.  But it's fun and the waiters are great.

DIWAR677Di-J7K0snrTWaA.text: Full disclosure: I don't eat red meat. That being said this place was still delightful. I had an incredible table side Caesar salad and twice baked potato. Service was decent. I was told the steak was delicious. I loved the vibe too. Ill be back!

2SMfiOpcky8k4JRCdQdirQ.text: Recommended by the concierge!  Has a traditional Vegas appeal!   The food was wonderful!  I sat at the bar and had the best service ever from Joe!  He was courteous and professional and made the entire meal perfect!  I had dessert and coffee as well!  Every detail of the meal was incredible!  I travel all over the world and frequent places that I love!  This will be one of my new FAVS!

zrHVPeme1MUqmo0CVpPeNg.text: Had a delicious steak and salad here while I was in town.   I was very happy with my meal there but what keeps this at a three stars is that there were several waiters that assisted us during our dining experience but the the main one treated us horribly.   He treated us like we were inexperienced diners at steakhouses due to a couple questions.   I honestly felt such a genuine air of elitism it was very uncomfortable.   Everyone else was very nice though and the only thing that made up for it was the delicious steak.

GYifeY6SUsbirbt7qhY99g.text: This is a great old school steak house in Las Vegas. I loved it...

jW9UKoP1mAPVnKk1NBzkbA.text: Great food. Lamb chops were transcendent.  Service is old school classy.  It's like stepping back in time to old Las Vegas.  Wish we had saved room for bananas foster or cherries jubilee.

uvqIqSsJDodQciZbf7dKeg.text: 2nd time here and it was amazing both times.  Alfredo was our server but the entire staff was friendly and helpful.  We love the food and the atmosphere!!

bFyquhm_5qZu9bnpLWOs3g.text: We had enjoyed great meals at the Golden Steer,until our most recent visit, which will be our last.  "Regulars" seem to get great service - and a lot of attention from their waiter.  This was evidenced by the table across from us, apparently regulars, who enjoyed (endured) a lo-o-ng conversation with their waiter, who bent over the table to talk to them - at great length - treating my husband and I to a close-up view of his backside, which literally was at the edge of our booth table.  Nice.  Had to ask for bread, and to remind them of our side dishes, which were served about 15 minutes after our a la carte steaks arrived at the table.  Steaks were very poor quality, full of gristle.  Ridiculous for a restaurant of this price range.  Treat yourself to one of the many other, quality steakhouses in Las Vegas - you'll be disappointed at this dive.

3Xl0WAHAtdNnmZeoZX9WZw.text: Fantastic old Vegas style steakhouse. One of Frank's favs.  Off the strip but not to be missed.

F95AVmvGSqx8IOoLy1Qc3w.text: salads watery and cheap, our broccoli was raw.waiter spilled water on me and dropped plates clearing the table.  prime rib was tasteless.  had to navigate a sea of bums in parking lot. worst fine dining experience i ever had.

-VeaoF9PYwtbNfgnhFwttA.text: I wish there was a space for zero stars. I just paid 170 dollars for shit service and a bad steak. I am in the industry so I hate to ever make a stink but this place needs to get it together. I didn't go the orthodox route because we didn't make a reservation. So we thought we would be considerate and just sit at the bar. Waiters yelling at the bartender over lengthy wait for drink times. Her complaining that we say there...I mean really? Then the steak came out overdone( we asked for medium rare). What part of the game is that? If I wasn't so hungry I would've have sent it back immediately. It's not like anyone asked if it was ok though. My partner complained and the manager on duty after being asked if she had a moment to speak replied" yeah I have three seconds, go." I don't care about this places tradition or previous reviews. This place failed on many levels tonight. Nobody I know will ever dine here. I am born and raised in Las Vegas and I work at the best restaurant in the city. Get it together Golden Steer!!!!

aKguqa8nGrdvKpmhT5z6Xw.text: The service wasn't very good. Multiple waiters kept coming to the table to get drink orders. None were particularly friendly . Then when we wanted to order couldn't get the server.  The food was just okay; nothing outstanding.

l23_sc12yxdq393pxknXIw.text: We had a great dinner for my husband's 40th birthday.  We all had prime rib or filet.  Cooked perfectly!  The atmosphere was unforgettable.  If you are visiting Vegas and are looking for a classy place that is reasonable try Golden Steer

VUfqVjnF8zufKV1KqjfyCA.text: This was my first real steak house. I yelped a couple of different spots, but kept coming back to the Golden Steer. My first impression was are you sure this is the right spot. It's in a little shopping plaza so the parking is kind of small. But once your in there, it's surprisingly very nice. It's kinda dark in there, it reminds me of what I would think old skool Vegas would be. It was a little expensive but what do you expect for a steak house in Vegas. I ordered Prime Rib diamond Jim cut that sucker was huge. It looked really intimidating when it came out. I ordered it medium-well wow it was delicious. I would really recommend this. Just keep in mind that all side dishes are not included. I ordered the twice baked potato it was OK but I thought it would of tasted better, it was a little plain. My husband ordered the bone-in Rib Eye steak, this was delicious it was nice n tender and super juicy for being well done. He also ordered the sauteed mushrooms OMG if you love mushrooms you have to order these.. They we soooo good I don't know know what else to say, they were buttery garlicky just yummy. Along with the jumbo baked potato. All I can say about that was WoW. It was huge, it came with all the goodies. All n all I recommend this place if your  carnavor like us. It's a really nice restaurant great for date night or to try something new

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo Baked Potato $8.00
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-In Rib Eye $41.00.. Well Done.. Super juicy
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib Diamond Cut $40.00.. Med-Well.

ifxACeU86-vJWOPcQW4HcA.text: Golden Steer is 5 star through and through. I'd give them 10 stars if I could. From the staff, the food, and last but not least, the old school Vegas feel and look, the Golden Steer is a night out that will not disappoint. Please do yourself a favor and order the table side presentation caesar salad. The best caesar I have ever had. Had the filet and it is outstanding. The baked potatoes are the largest, and best, I have ever seen. And to top it off, the bananas foster table side presentation is the best way to top this fabulous dinner off.  The staff, Alfredo especially, are among the best in the city. Even Fabian, who has been serving there for 40 years, is a treat to interact with. We were lucky enough to sit in Elvis Presley's booth he sat in when he frequented GS. Of course if you would like to sit in Dean's booth, Franks table, or Sammy's as well, all are represented. The GS is worth the cab ride from any resort you may be staying at while in Vegas. It is an original icon and separates itself from the celebrity chef themed steak houses of the strip. Whether your celebrating a special event or are just wanting a great steak in an original, one of a kind environment, the Golden Steer will not disappoint.

emH89aQCq4mdrcSZhvP5Fg.text: Best food ever! For about $100 (ok maybe a lil more) a person, you can get any cut of meat and a lobster the size of your head, plus a starter like soup or salad, and a side, like a twice baked potato! The service is beyond amazing! The staff is friendly and very attentive.   After we stuffed ourselves silly we asked them to call us a cab. They said no. And then had their limo driver take us back to our hotel.   They go above and beyond for their customers.   Also, the decor and overall ambiance is very inviting. I felt like I was back in old Vegas waiting for The Rat Pack to come and grab a table.  If you go to Vegas, this should be a main attraction!

bS893hYhMfqb-TebC4DaQQ.text: Double check your bill.  Our waiter Added an additional 60.00 to our tab. "Oops...I forgot my glasses. My mistake" he said. We had an after dinner drink at the bar. A couple who had been sitting across from us and saw what happened told us that the same thing happened to another couple right after us. I guess James had aa payment due!

vgY39q2GMHgryOj4ubfWWw.text: This is one of those places that you should go to at least once in your life, especially if you're a vegas local. You owe it to yourself to experience this old vegas landmark. You'll likely be in the company of some Old Vegas Money sitting nearby...peering at you curiously. Regardless, its a cool experience with waiters dressed in tuxes and spouting cheesy jokes and factoids for first time diners. The interior is well maintained with classy paintings and red leather upholstered booths that make you feel like you are breaking bread with the rat pack. If you like atmosphere the way I do, you'll feel right at home.  The bread wasn't bad, but nothing particularly memorable. The steaks arrived at a reasonable time-- we didn't really wait that long. The steak itself was perfect-- definitely one of the ten best steaks I've ever tasted in my lifetime. I'm not sure if it was the best outright, or if it was considerably better than the one I had at Hank's steak and martini. It was a ribeye cooked medium rare--just the way any real steak eater likes em. My girlfriend had the prime rib which came with some pretty tasty horseradish and cream dip. We ordered steak fries as our solitary side. I had no problem finishing my rib eye and sampled some of my girlfriends cut, which was perfectly cooked as well. I can't comment much on the sides, other than to say that the fries we ordered were tasty but hardly better than the fat fries you can get at your local Fatburger. From what I've been told, the sides are good but not stellar at this joint. If i return in the future I'll be better able to assess the experience but from what I saw, it was an enjoyable night with good, expensive food.

bMFZZQP6cN34SoKyJKbSWg.text: Went here for dinner after our wedding at the courthouse. Our server was amazing. I'm sorry but his name escapes me (tattoos on his fingers "LOVE HATE"). He was friendly, attentive, and with a great sense of humor. Out of the party of six 4 of us had the 22oz ribeye steak. It was like butter. Cooked perfectly. Our Caesar salad was made at the table. Our sides were asparagus and whipped potatoes. All very tasty. Wine and cocktails were very yum. And they surprised my husband and I with a cheesecake slice with a firework on top.

YIQbwsEkVdmf5n3pgJ5p9A.text: I had a great dining experience here! Great service, food was superb. I would go again and again if I had the chance. I am not a local, so I will put this on the A list every time I am in town.   We had a party of 8, and everyone at the table was just as impressed as I was.

_3XnckYNALi7imfQUToekA.text: Never got the chance to eat. Made the reservation 2 months in advance. Showed up 30 minutes in early. Couldnt get waited on in the bar. When we did the waiter was rude and surly. Very excited to try this place....WILL NEVER BE BACK

Kv2sLcW6_C1uWY9Gld6Ugw.text: Delicious menu, old-school decor, fun to visit if looking for a Rat Pack Vegas feel... especially with a superb new bar next door-- The Mint! The Mint adds that perfect vintage touch, a beautiful new pop of color to the previous dull decor--highly recommended and a must-visit if you're looking to transport back to the banging '60s

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aI9d_RYMug5c2U8MoWxasg.text: This review is way overdue, I apologize for delay. My wife and I thoroughly enjoy the Golden Steer. Whether by ourselves or with our friends, this restaurant never disappoints. Our latest event was to celebrate a friends 50th birthday party. We were fortunate to have the private room available for our party of 15. The room atmosphere was incredible. The service was very professional and the food was well worth the price. Hats off to the entire Staff for assisting with and setting up the presentation of the very memorable 50th birthday cake. Despite the large number of the party, our server handled everyone with individual attention and professionalism. Our friends were very impressed with both food and service. The 50th birthday dinner party was definitely a success, thanks to the Golden Steer. Highly recommend the Golden Steer to everybody!

gC4hkn1P8Po5OLdH4yKYeQ.text: The best steaks we ever ate! Classic side dishes were amazing, shrimp cocktail, creamed spinach. Great sommelier advice. Pricey, yes. Worth every penny yes!

O9ITadYBjzEUYWMLzzj_VQ.text: One of my top 3 dining experiences ever. I had heard of this restaurant and I was saving it for a special occasion.  My boyfriend's birthday was the winning date. I wanted to celebrate him and he is a big steak lover so I couldn't wait.   We get there.. love the ambiance.. I feel like I'm temporarily in a different decade, honestly and I like it. They kept the history of the place in tact.. their menu states that among their guests, Elvis Presley and Frank Sinatra used to frequent this place, and it was cool to feel that for a second.   Next, the service was great from every angle. Everyone we interacted with was top level. Seemed to really enjoy what they do and take pride in their service. I appreciate great service.   Now, for the food and drinks- I ordered the first cocktail on the list, forget the name but it was the best drink I've ever had.. so I'll need to revisit because I'm usually not a cocktail girl. My bf drinks beer but he's a beer snob and he was happy too ;)  We ordered the Alaskan crab as an appetizer.. delicious. I had the filet and lobster for my meal and I couldn't have been more pleased. Incredible presentation and taste.  He had NY Strip and he mirrored my feelings.. we both shared that we were both more than impressed with this dinner.  The sides were good, recommend the twice baked potatoe.  As it was his birthday, they treated him to a piece of cheesecake and a pretty cool birthday candle.. and that ended the perfect celebration of my sweetie's birthday dinner. The experience will be among my favorites.  With it being

c2BKNhDNNgnRV7I5q6xnMw.text: Came here for my parents 30th anniversary. The food was delicious but the service did not impress me. The wait staff were polite and efficient but for the price point of this restaurant I expected more. The wait staff seemed unenthusiastic. Overall it was a good experience but I left off a star because the wait staff needs to go the extra mile a little more...

ItMRC88_TRxV6KwTsZZsAg.text: For our tenth wedding anniversary my wife and I made reservations at The Golden Steer. We were watching a stage show, during that show I received a phone call. Turns out it was someone from The Golden Steer reminding us of the reservation.  Upon our arrival we were immediately seated. As requested we were seated in booth #22. Otherwise known as The Frank Sinatra Booth. How cool is that?  The food was amazing. Immediately, we were served bread and water, the wife ordered garlic bread for an appetizer. For the main course my wife had Veal Marsala ($34.00) Medallions of Veal, Mushrooms, Herbs and Marsala Wine. For a side dish she had Fresh Broccoli ($9.00). Personally I ordered New York Strip 16oz. ($50 .00). For a side dish I ordered Twice Baked Potato ($9.00).  The portions of the side dishes were huge! I don't mind saying, as much as I loved my steak. The twice baked potato was spectacular!   I expected The Golden Steer to be top notch, and that's what I got.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lh5l6FpU9UWC2QR0707a_Q.text: Great old school steakhouse in Las Vegas. It is a little pricey but if you compare it to some of the other places on the strip it is a lot more affordable.   Food - For appetizers we had the crab cakes and calamari. Both were really good! I had the special for the day which was a 12oz filet mignon topped with bearnaise sauce and asparagus. The filet was cooked to perfection and was delicious   Only thing that was just okay was the Caesar salad. It was a little heavy on the dressing   Service - our wait staff was great. Our waiter was hilarious and he had dry humor which I found hilarious

Xz6UdCs5ZjtyOdMetQeXkg.text: Golden Steer is a bit of old Las Vegas charm where you can get a traditional steak dinner where there's plenty of large leather booths, wine glasses, plates and napkins.   This place is something out of the 1950's that's appears not to have changed in years.  There's pictures of John Wayne and other's from that era on the walls.  You come here for a steak or some prime rib and the typical side dishes.   We shared the bone end rib eye that was about 22 ounces and plenty to share between two people.  Got a bottle of wine and started off with some Oysters Rockefeller.  It was a simple dinner, but we were pretty full and didn't have the side dishes.  If you want to get off the strip and you're into old school steak houses, this is a good place to go and get away from the strip (about $20 taxi) and go back in time.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xa6ApIWs-RhxIuOeH_gf8A.text: I will debate anyone. This place is the best steakhouse in all of Las Vegas! You have to come early and get a martini at the bar. The bartenders are "top notch, top notch" as Ted Knight said in Caddyshack. Once you sit down for dinner, you have to order the Cesar Salad. They bring it out and make it right in front of you making your mouth water for more. After that order the filet with Alaskan King Crab legs (that's a solid deck at blackjack cost wise). Desert, the creme Berle is a must. It's the experience and journey along with the food that makes this place great. Oh...and it's the tradition and history that goes hand in hand with the great service that makes you feel #1 here. You haven't experienced Las Vegas dining until you have been to the Golden Steer!

EiTvqorfPQy1ozxVcvjyKA.text: Not nearly the best experience considering  we've been there 3 times for the steaks.  Never again! Our last experience provided us with a New York which was tough, flavorless  and sinewy. No herb butter, no rosemary or thyme sprig to add flavor. The Ribeye was not far behind.  I can only blame myself for expecting more than they are willing to deliver since they have name recognition.  Garlic bread was limited to 3 slices per order and the regular bread order  that followed was not even similar quality (it's the details I care about if I'm going to spend my hand earned $). Soup, house salad...all lacked luster. I could go on, but why dwell on it... Wishing you a better experience!

cqRMaZCmvIVvBm4OEEHFSw.text: I made reservation with Roland for gfriends bday on 4/12 and asked if they did anything for bdays he said he would note reservation but it was never mentioned upon arrival or departure. The GS had been on our bucket list for some time. I thought service was lackluster and food was okay.  The oysters Rockefeller, filet and rolls above average. However French onion soup, whipped potatoes and veal Marsala were nothing special. Upon departure viewed about twenty dirty glasses surrounding one video poker machine...really.  I have had better meals/experiences at number of other steakhouses in town...disappointed in this institution.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qvjxSTcNtxbZrI4LxL0BGw.text: This is an upscale old style steakhouse. They serve excellent steaks, wines and traditions. Their table side Caesar salad is the best you will ever find.  Prepare to be waited on consistently. Your glass will never be empty, dishes peppered and table cleared. It feels like there is still some old town mobster still running this Vegas vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whipping the olive oil for Caesar
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Making the Caesar
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar

kWv8KfAo0tWf1hLdIUCFOA.text: I've passed this place around for as long as I've lived in Vegas, which is about 19 years now, but I've never been until this past NYE to ring in 2018. I can now see why it's been around before my family even moved to the mainland.  Goes back to old school Vegas when you can see Italian-American influence in the decor down to your wait staff's uniforms. Menu's items also reflect old school tastes. LOL. Where else can you see a table-side Caesar salad get tossed for you? Or enviously watch your neighboring table get a flambeed banana foster? Apparently, the Golden Steer Steakhouse is one of the few remaining spots to get this vibe and action.  I've been debating about whether to give this place 4 or 5 stars. Honestly came down to getting great customer service on NYE. It's gotta be tough to be that hospitable when most people would rather actually be the ones out there celebrating with family and friends, so this 5 star review is for the wait staff that were just downright nice and accommodating.  Food and cocktails were great too. Mouth is literally watering just thinking about the lamb chops I had cooked to my preference perfectly. Didn't even mind that there was no accompanying mint jelly for the entree. Ooh... That prime rib the fiance ordered and actually shared with me was amazing. *SIGH*  With about 3-4 specialty cocktails, escargots, French onion soup, a 10 oz. prime rib, lamb chops, a twice-baked potato and sauteed mushrooms, and strawberry cheesecake, the bill came out to be around $275 (includes the 20-25% gratuity) for my fiance and I.  My only regret: not ordering the banana foster.  This place certainly made me feel better about breaking our San Diego trip tradition.

2h6mhyhVy89t2_lta4eMoA.text: Easily the best steak house I've been to when factoring in the history and ambiance. Perfect every time. Great staff, wonderful food, and decadent history make the Golden Steer a 'must go' for me every single time I visit Vegas.

tHRqY90k5YRv1BAW6VI-ng.text: Been going to the steer since 1975 tonight was the worst most disappointing time my wife and I have had filthy dirty while I was sitting at the bar I was surrounded by dirty glasses waiters were putting dirty glasses in front of me, I ordered a espresso I received a espresso with no sugar cube no fresh lemon skin,a dry one from the fruit tray no spoon our experience was the worst time, we remember old Joe the bartender whose service was impeccable, Johnny the manager had that cool elvis look service was top notch I asked my wife to marry me there 18 years ago. What happened to you guys I've been going there since before you had machines

aLqqaByZYX4iUC0HdwYD4g.text: Why have none of the reviews praising the creamed corn mentioned that it tastes like cinnamon and nutmeg? It was so gross. The whipped potatoes and French onion soup were amazing and the steak was definitely solid. But you can't leave so many great reviews of the creamed corn and leave out that vital piece of information. When I eat cinnamon apples or pumpkin pie I'm happy for those flavors. But not ever in my creamed corn!

1TBRJtAdOd9qL3HzqljuVA.text: A giant step up from "chains" but not high enough to be the Best. The food, service, and ambiance corresponds to the price you pay. This will not be the best cut of meat you've ever had, but it will be worlds better than your average at a chain restaurant.  We ordered a couple of filet mignon med rare, and the prime rib. The steaks were cooked perfectly, though the bf did complain that for prime rib, it was lacking flavor. We had one Caesar salad, prepared table side. We had mushrooms, twice baked potato, and the mac n cheese for our sides. All sides were great, a solid 4 stars, but none were straight up perfect.  From the outside, the restaurant looks average. Once you enter, the ambiance is lovely- it is low lighting with candle lit tables. Waiters were all attentive and drinks were always full.  BTW, utilized a Groupon deal here. Was not treated any differently by waiter, in fact, he still assisted us quickly on paying the tab since we had a show to catch. Always tip based on the total amount of bill prior to any specials!

hxRqf4bb4oF7gmvYnt5OgQ.text: Golden Steer is the oldest steak house in Las Vegas and very much from a time long gone by. The interior decor is very traditional steak house, and everything that the modern steak houses on the Strip are trying to avoid being. That's a positive because at Golden Steer, the steak, not the decor, does the talking.  There really is not much to say. Service is impeccable and some of the best I have ever had, menu options were typical for a steakhouse, food tasted amazing, steak was cooked to perfection. I would highly recommend.

jVtJ2wh0R0Co8G9ifwPV9A.text: Decided on the Golden Steer to celebrate our 30th anniversary, as my wife and I are long (long) time Vegas locals. Unfortunately it didn't meet my expectations. The porterhouse house steak, was small in my opinion, good thing my wife couldn't finish her steak. Other than that, everything else was good. However, it was the loud mouth at the Joe DiMaggio table (across from the Marilyn Monroe table, our table) that was dropping the F-bomb loudly and frequently. I was going to tell him to shut up, but my wife didn't want me to cause a ruckus being just across from him. She didn't even want me to tell the waiters, as they obliviously heard him and should  have intervened. I have to agree. I waited to talk to the owner, Mike(?), who was greeting the table behind me but couldn't as our Uber driver arrived (had show tickets). We had such high expectations for a steakhouse that has been around since I we were kids.   I must say this, it's worth checking out just for the ambiance, decor and Vegas history.   p.s. get the table side Caesar Salad.

u15scAlSRK6vYAcanfY1vA.text: Classic Steakhouse with tables side dishes. We were a party of 3 and everyone enjoyed they steaks. We also had the Caesar Salad and Fried Calamari. Calamari was cooked perfect, soft and melt in your mouth. Caesar Salad was prep at table side and tasted very good with fresh crispy lettuce.  Our steaks were cooked to perfection.!! The service was amazing, the waiters were on top of everything with attention to detail.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Potato
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Parmigiana
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side ravioli

vlxLPei0-ojl06mUufoejw.text: 4.5 overall. 5 for the overall history and character of the place, 4.5 for the food, 4 for the service.  I really wanted us to dine at the best possible steakhouse in Vegas while we were there for Labor Day weekend so I was looking and couldn't decide for almost 3 days, there were too many excellent choices after all. Finally we decided on this 'institution'. Hey if it's good enough for Frank Sinatra and Elvis Presley, it's good enough for us, right?   Upon getting there, we were welcomed and asked to wait for around 20 more minutes then we were led to our booth. Classy red leather, exudes quiet elegance. Zach was our server and was warm and friendly, though I felt service was a little inconsistent, had a few pockets where we weren't attended to for quite a long time, and I couldn't ask for another glass of Champagne for like 20 mins.  As for entrees, hubby and I shared the 22 oz. Ribeye steak which we asked to be cooked Medium (I do medium rare, husband likes medium and it was his birthday so it's a compromise), but our steak was done medium rare, which I kinda felt bad for the birthday boy. Creamed spinach was also good.  Given they knew we were celebrating his birthday, Zach brought over a slice of cheesecake complete with sparklers. I thought this was such a nice touch and was kind of the redeeming moment. We definitely appreciated it. We also decided to order the Bananas Foster dessert, which is a House speciality and flambeed tableside. We enjoyed watching the little production number and definitely enjoyed sharing it.  Overall, a memorable dining experience, which was worth coming off the strip for.

IOXhPD_LHfMMffFUcWcqsQ.text: Golden Steer Steakhouse has been on our list for sometime and finally we made the trip into Las Vegas ~     Easy FREE parking, not a stuffy atmosphere, nice bar area and a much larger dining room with tuxedo wearing male servers! While it's not stuffy it is very nice providing a relaxed dining experience with EXCELLENT service!    We started with cocktails, martinis & Manhattans both very GOOD and filled to the brim      We had the Caesar prepared table side which is always a nice touch AND it was delicious too PLUS it was a nice portion ~    Our filets were presented correctly as we ordered them & tasty too with bernaise sauce. Our sides were twice baked potato & asparagus both expertly cooked. The next time I would try a different sides especially the potato side dish just to mix it up.     Both of us ordered dessert, a chocolate cream brulee & tiramisu. My brulee's was good however the tiramisu was better ~     All in all we liked the Golden Steer and would be happy to go back the next time we want steak  ~

k5B6wi2gXinD7LIWArT4MQ.text: ******UPDATED REVIEW: Aug. 2019:******* I have dined here several times- I used to enjoy coming here & made sure to spread the word but after our dinner last weekend I am very disappointed! We were going to order our usual filet mignon and maybe add some lobster but I asked if there was anything else good on the menu & our waiter mentioned the chicken in wine sauce etc. we both took a risk and ordered it. Huge mistake! Honestly, it was probably the worst meal we have had in awhile. Neither one of us even ate more then 1-2 bites! We were starving but it was so bland and soggy I was in utter disbelief that it was actually served. That dish should have never left the kitchen. Ugh. The bread is usually warm and soft but it was neither. I felt like we literally got someone else's leftover meal. It was presented already cut up which was not attractive. When two people don't even touch their meals that should be a huge red flag!! The caesar salad was good-never had the table side done before... but then as we were eating someone came back over and spoke to us for sooo long @ the history of the salad. I couldn't even eat bc he wouldn't leave. If you're going to do that please do it as he makes the salad not after so we cant even enjoy it. We felt very rushed bc the staff kept coming by -I do tend to eat slowly bc I have acid reflux & I like to take my time but I do Not want to be rushed when we are dining out.  We were both just so disappointed. Not sure if it was new servers or they wanted to go home but this was NOT a pleasant dining experience for us at all. Sorry but that chicken dish was awful. We both left extremely dissatisfied, hungry and upset. :(  Just moved to Vegas a couple weeks ago & this place was on my list. Made an early reservation on an off night (Tuesday @6p) Had a Groupon ($35/$60) but don't get it wrong this place is pricey so if you don't want to spend a lot don't bother going. Depends on what you order. Garlic bread was only $5/but they give you comp delish warm bread and butter. I asked for a recommendation for a Riesling/or Moacawhite sweet wine: Moscato/Asti-It was so good. Nice & chilled. Preserved the 12oz filet mignon ($51-the 8oz was $45 so I upgraded) and it was cooked perfectly which rarely happens bc I like mine well done. We also got a porterhouse which he said was good and 2 sides to share($10) Twice bakes potatoes & Mac n cheese. Overall a good meal. I could have def done without the lady who brought her kid and a baby which she was breastfeeding at he dining room table and chugging a 32 Oz beer while doing so. We were not interested in that drunken show. It got VERY loud @6:30pm so if you want a quiet dinner I suggest going super early 4:30-5:30. Our server "Tom" & his assist. "Ali" were great. I'd ask for butter and the other one would bring it within 30 seconds. You are paying $$$$ for a delicious meal quality & efficient service. We hear about 3 other tables using their Groupons so we don't feel out of place lol. Ask for Tom he was great. I'd def go back...also remember to leave at least 20% tip on the "before bill total" if using a Groupon.

fUxcFULOQXCFKMGhmLCVEg.text: My final charge for my Vegas trip. I want a good steak house. Not wagyu jibber jabber. usda prime, leather upholstery, Sinatra would eat here steak house.   I had read this place on the various Vegas lists. So I was determined to try. Once we turned the corner of Sahara and saw that yellow sign in the strip mall  similar to many an adult video store back home. We thought, this might be a mistake.  Inside it looks like your classic steak house from the 50s.   First highlight. Table side Caesar salad. Are you kidding me. How could you even call the garbage I've been eating since Caesar salad. My friend and I were joking about going to a steak house and just getting a salad. For this Caesar. It would be totally acceptable.   Next highlight, the steak. Hands down the best steak I've ever had. I got the New York strip. Perfectly done. Simply seasoned. Super juicy. My only regret was not getting a bigger one.   I don't know if my brother wasn't feeling well or just wanted to be different but he got the sole. I thought it was lame but out the whole fish comes and out server with two spoons deftly deboned and plated the fish.  Wow!    Finally dessert. Bros don't share dessert...unless of course its bananas foster prepared table side. I'm a sucker for a table side presentation. Flames and smells and flair. I love it.    Service beyond reproach. Very professional and polished. Not some millennial that just got laid off from a Chili's.   This is a definite Vegas must do

Zi7FpYwo9xPEeui4s8fqgA.text: Without a doubt, Las Vegas has no shortage of fine steakhouses. However, there is only a handful that will transport you back in time with an 'old school' Las Vegas vibe. We have been eyeing the Golden Steer and we're looking forward to experiencing the old fashioned charm of this legendary steakhouse, as it came highly recommended by our friends (and Yelp).   Las Vegas Restaurant Week was upon us this past June, and we wanted to take full advantage of the deals around the city. You see,  restaurants around Las Vegas will participate in this occasion by providing a special set menu while providing a discount to guests and donating a portion of the proceeds to a local Las Vegas food bank (Three Square). We saw that The Golden Steer was on the list of participating restaurants and secured our reservations.   As others have mentioned, this unassuming restaurant is tucked away in a rather 'iffy' strip mall located to the west of The Strip on Sahara. Don't let its outward appearance fool you. Once you step foot into this establishment, you'll be transported back in time for an exceptional dining experience. With a dimly lit, dark wood interior with red leather clad booths named after Las Vegas legends of years past, you'll immediately know you're in for a retro-infused experience.    We ordered off their Restaurant Week Menu set at $80 per person. The Four Course meal included our following selections :             Two Shrimp Cocktail  Each of us received two jumbo shrimp over ice with cocktail sauce             Two Tableside Cesar Salads  The dressing made fresh at your tableside with romaine lettuce tossed into the dressing mix. Ask them to leave out the anchovies if you'd like.             One Filet Mignon  Tender and well-seasoned steak that was cooked at a Medium temperature. My husband thoroughly enjoyed this cut, and even preferred it to their prime rib!             One Petite Cut Prime Rib  Tender and well-seasoned steak that was cooked at a Medium temperature and served with fresh horseradish. A heartier cut of steak, that he enjoyed as we generally don't order this cut.             One Jumbo Australian Lobster Tail  This was a special add on to the set  Restaurant Week menu. Listed as MP, it was $75 the day of our visit. I enjoyed every bite dipped in butter!             Two Banana's Foster Desserts  The banana slices are flambeed tableside in rum and served over a scoop of vanilla ice cream. It was perfectly delicious!             One Dinner Wine Pairing  This was a special add on to the set  Restaurant Week men that offered a wine pairing (half a pour) with each course of the four courses that were served.     I would highly recommend this steakhouse to tourists and locals alike (whether its restaurant week or not). If you're looking to try something new with a nod to Las Vegas history, come here. It was the best dinner I've had in a VERY long time. The ambiance was spot on, and the service is impeccable. We will return for a special occasion.
