Dz8wXuWoWAhA4VUgoVUuzA.text: A classic Vegas Dining experience!  But like many such places - Cafe du Monde in New Orleans or Union Oyster House in Boston - it ain't what it once was. The Grand Dame of Vegas steakhouses is showing her age, and can no longer offer the quality of food and service that originally made her famous.  I mean, The food is fine - pretty much what you'd expect - but the recipes  are a little old-school for my taste (The Creamed Spinach was mostly cream and cheese with just enough spinach for color. The Mac and Cheese is plain). These dishes might have been novel in 1968. Today, they seem tired.  Also, the tables are now so tightly packed together that the staff often has to scoot sideways to get past each other.  With so many people, The noise level is high, making communication challenging - both at the table, and with our servers. We had to endure at least four rounds of "Happy Birthday" while we ate. I think of that as more of a Hofbrauhaus kind of thing - not something you'd see in a *nice* restaurant.  So, Gone is the classy style of the Rat Pack era; now tourists from the Strip show up in flip flops and sun dresses, speaking in loud voices about how cool they are. Snore.  The history of the place makes it worth a visit. The food is fine, But you can do better in Vegas without spending this much money.

kUAJhgdxTaDDMJRGdaMDMQ.text: This is a review for Golden Steer Steakhouse as a part of my (and my brother's) quest to eat at all of the steakhouses in Las Vegas. The overall score is an average of all other categories with steak being counted twice, since it is a review of a steakhouse.    Overall: 4.2 Decor: 5 Bread: 4 Appetizer: 4 Filet: 5 Side: 3 Dessert: 4   Golden Steer is a classic, old-school steak house, located in the Sahara of Las Vegas.   The decor gives you a feeling of stepping back into the 60s and 70s, where you half expect the rat-pack to walk in the door.   The bread was very good.    I ordered the shrimp cocktail as an appetizer and it was also very good.   The filet mignon was excellent.   As a side I ordered the potatoes lyonnaise and it was not good at all. The potatoes were undercooked and soggy while the onions were piled on to the point where I had to use my bread plate to hold the excess onions after scraping them off. However, the twice baked potato was excellent.    For dessert I ordered Chocolate cake and it was very good.   Overall, Golden Steer Steakhouse was an excellent choice and is a must visit spot for anyone visiting Vegas.

nDDZhu0hZ2CcbpHAOHQ8RA.text: It's been 2 years since my last review. I am happy to say that the restaurant is still going strong. Friendly service, excellent food and old school atmosphere. This evening was a medley of Frank Sinatra tunes. Again we enjoyed the evening in the Mayor's booth.  We were seated immediately upon arrival 10 minutes before our reservation. The bread basket arrived and the choice of water was offered. During dinner the water glasses were refilled without asking. Our server Jonathon was on point taking care of us throughout dinner. We ordered the following after enjoying refreshing cocktails of an Amaretto and a Vesper Martini. Escargots, Petite Filet Mignon, Australian Lobster Tail, Twice Baked Potato, Grilled Asparagus The Escargot Appetizer was delicious. Large plump morsels floating in butter. The dinner roll was great to absorb the last drops of butter.  The 8 oz Filet was cooked as requested, well done and was tender and juicy without being butterflied. The potato was large and the perfect choice for sharing. The Asparagus was lightly grilled and tender. The Lobster tail was 14 oz and the shell was removed table side. This was a large sweet piece of ocean goodness.  The Golden Steer is still firing on all cylinders. Don't change anything.

eMNrMBZvnADnmAPKFio2IQ.text: This steakhouse is an absolute gem!  I was hesitant to come here when my boyfriend suggested we bring his parents here for dinner, they were visiting from out of town.  First off, the drive here is rather deceiving as you pull up to an older strip mall.  The restaurants facade and signage screams old school/possible adult shop.  You're not quite sure what to make of it.  Like how could an upscale steakhouse be located right here???  However, as you enter the steakhouse, you are transported into an atmosphere that has all the old school Vegas vibes with a touch of class.  Such a pleasant surprise and it only gets better from here.    The decor is vintage with a bit of Western art. Pictures of the Rat Pack, Marilyn Monroe, Frank Sinatra and other legends scattered throughout the restaurant.  This is Vegas' oldest steakhouse and I can see why it continues to be a local favorite.  Now on to the food....we ordered the Caesar salad prepared table side, my boyfriend and I shared the Rib Eye Steak Bone-in (22 oz), his parents got the Prime Rib English Cut (10 oz) and Prime Rib Diamond Little Cut (18 oz).  For sides we shared the Twice baked potato and asparagus.    Everything was prepared to perfection.  The meat was unbelievably soft and seasoned flawlessly.  It practically melted into your mouth.  Just WOWWW!  Probably one of the best steaks I've ever tasted!!    Overall, I would not hesitate to come here again.  It is a great place to bring out of town guests or to celebrate special occasions.  Looking forward to my next visit!

Ox3EQKJ_4XdDvrBe62yPkA.text: My husband had a great idea when he suggested the Golden Steer. We love a good steakhouse, but had yet to try an old school steakhouse in Vegas. So the oldest steakhouse in Vegas it was for date night.  The restaurant is located in a small strip shopping center on Sahara. It's not far from The Strip, but not on Strip. It'd be a quick Uber ride for tourists.   Inside they have preserved the old Vegas feel, but in a kept up way. Large red leather booths and tables with pictures of famous past diners on the walls. Seating at the main dining room tables is a little tight, but it didn't mar the experience for us.  Service was professional, friendly, and attentive. Based on reviews I was worried that service might not be great, but we had great service.  One of my favorite things about old school steakhouses is the cart style service. The Golden Steer is no different. Everything is served from a rolled cart. The fun part is that several menu items are prepared tableside. For this experience order the Caesar salad, bananas fosters, or cherries jubilee.   The rolls to start seemed boring at first, but I really enjoyed the simplicity and flavor. I started with a Mixed Green Salad that was simple, but good. It was just iceberg lettuce, tomatoes, carrots, cucumbers, garbanzo beans, and a liberal amount of one of four dressings. My husband liked his Escargot enough, but did say it wasn't the best he's had.   For the main course I went with the Petite Filet Mignon which is eight ounces. I enjoyed the flavor of the seasoning. The steak was not the best I've ever had, but it was still steakhouse quality. My husband really enjoyed his Shorthorn which was plenty of steak for him at 16 ounces. We shared a Twice Baked Potato which was delicious and plenty for two.   Dessert is always a must for me. We each ordered Cherries Jubilee. Delicious! We each received a portion that we could have easily split. Plenty of vanilla ice cream covered in delicious cherries with a lovely hint of orange and cinnamon.  What a great meal and experience. I'd definitely consider returning when family or friends are in town to show them an old Vegas experience.

hX4mZHgp08-anfAulJ9rbA.text: After a short taxi ride from the Bellagio, we arrived at what on the outside appeared to be a rundown place. But, when we walked in, it was like I was carried back in time, but in a good way.  This was one of the best meals I've ever had, but not just due to the food or service, but both, as well as listening to my boyfriend recount memories of when his parents came here in the 1990's.  We happened to be there during restaurant week, and chose to eat from that menu.  That began with a shrimp cocktail (if you see other people's pictures of the shrimp, yes, they are HUGE) for each of us, followed by the Caesar salad prepared table side.  I'm ruined now for all other Caesar salads.  That was followed by prime rib and twice baked potato for him, the filet and creamed spinach for me.  Dessert for me was Bananas Foster, because the only other time I had it, the place didn't flambe it....I mean seriously!  It was really good.  The servers were awesome and gracious, yet not stiff.  I've had service so bad that it pretty much ruined an experience for me.  We're already talking about trying to get back to Vegas for a short trip, and will definitely eat here again!

8l0xbRx9j68urBwvelW0SQ.text: Amazing evening in Frank Sinatra's personal booth! Reserve early if you would like a particular celebrity's booth. Frank's books the fastest.  We started with the table side Caesar salad for two. It was delicious. They have really perfected their dressing, garlicky and a good amount of acidity from the lemon and red wine vinegar, not overly oily and heavy, but perfectly coated the lettuce.  I went with the Shorthorn medium rare and Las Vegas' largest baked potato, fully loaded. Steak was cooked perfectly and needed no extra accoutrements. The potato is quite possibly not just the largest, but the most delicious I've ever had. The toppings were plentiful and the chives were so fresh, they must have a garden somewhere in back!  We saved room for the Cherries Jubilee, again table side service. Great show, and yummy dessert. It was an evening that made you feel like you were back in the glory days of the Rat Pack!

615LxrOabSDpIrNIwCkw9g.text: One of the best steaks I've ever had. Was going to order the New York which I thought was their special, but the waiter suggested the rib eye which is my favorite cut anyway. On top of that, it's cheaper than the most of the other cuts. They serve sliced or whole which we elected the sliced, which was the right choice. Cooked a perfect medium rare and seasoned just right.   They offer their salad as a single, but prepare in the back instead of table side but also split on two plates for us. Was just ok though, but loved that they offered us the option. The creamed corn was avg and baked potato was awesome, just not the largest one in Vegas as advertised. All in all, I will be back again and again for the steak and hope to find other sides worthy of the meal. Service was fast and friendly as well, although you could tell it was the end of a long night for them.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thought New York was the special, but waiter told us to go Rib Eye. Happens to be my fav &amp; plenty for two. Perfect. Thanks

rx-xofKttCUS9XH7Ra1kMg.text: We decided to spend our Valentine's Day here at the Golden Steer and we were not disappointed !! The atmosphere was old school Italian type with big red leather seats, so unique! Our waiter was knowledgeable and attentive.   The food was great! I ordered the Filet Mignon which was cooked to perfection and juicy. The loaded baked potato was enormous!! My husband order the porterhouse which was probably the most favorable steak I've ever had. I probably preferred this cut better!  As for pricing, it was an expensive night. We ordered al la carte. Our steaks were about $60 a piece $10 for our sides/ desserts each.. on the other hand my GLASS of wine was $17 so that seemed a bit much. All in all if you're looking to splurge a little bit on a nice steakhouse this is the place to go!

SBZKqzoXB_Pr7DJ1Y91VvA.text: This place was great. When we first pulled up, I was apprehensive. Once inside, it was a different story. We arrived 30 minutes early, so we had a drink in the bar/lounge. I had read comments about Humberto on here, so when I saw that our server was Humberto at the bar, I was like oh, no. Well, I guess it's all in how you treat others because Humberto was extremely nice and on top of everything.  We moved to our table and ordered appetizers -- escargot (best I've ever had) and calamari (very good). We ordered the table side Caesar salad (was YUMMY) and my husband had French onion soup which he said was delicious. Entrees ordered were my husband and I split Porterhouse (delicious), eggplant (my aunt said it was good but not great), and my uncle ordered lamb which he said was delicious. Sides we ordered were French fries (huge and a lot) and creamed corn (my husband liked, I did not). Dessert was bananas foster (delicious). Service was good!  Definitely a place I will go back to!!

xx_jFBuyLG6OlEvD0xQz_g.text: Now I can cross off another iconic Las Vegas restaurant from my list.  I almost took us to Bavette's but changed my mind at the last minute.  This trip was all about keeping it old school.  The Golden Steer Steakhouse is about as old school as it gets.  Conventioneers enjoying dinner, an old guy with a young lady of the night.  A mixed crowd for sure.  It's Vegas.  Perfect!  It wasn't particularly busy on this Tuesday around 8:45 p.m.  We cozied up to a fairly empty bar and ordered a vodka martini with a blue cheese stuffed olive.  Perfectly made.  We got seated in the Mayors booth across from the old guy and his "girlfriend" for the night.  We split the wedge salad.  Holy smokes this thing was huge.  My half alone was almost half a head of iceberg lettuce.  Great blue cheese dressing.  They must make it here.  We split the 22 oz ribeye, a gigantic loaded baked potato, and a lobster tail.  Bernaise and peppercorn sauce on the side.  The peppercorn sauce was kinda sweet.  Skip it. Everything was on point.  Had to do the table side Banana's Foster.  Woo hoo!  Almost forgot my only grip with this place.  Instead of dropping the check like EVERY nice restaurant does, the waiter rolls up with a mobil credit card terminal and just stands there while you are expected to pay right then and there.  I said give me a minute pal.  He pretty much just stood there until I figured out the tip and did the transaction.  Felt like I was eating at a Red Robin in the end.  Maybe they get a lot of dine and dash situations.  I don't know but I didn't like it.  Will we go back?  Gosh, I don't know.  Probably not. There's so much to try in Las Vegas.  So many restaurants old and new.  At least I can say I've been there.  Recommended if your looking for old Vegas the way it used to be and pretty much still is if you know where to look.

Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tableside Bananas Foster.  My half.  MMMMMMMM

Jl7oJFaKZzKjwJk9CW8mow.text: Service, atmosphere and food like it's supposed to be. This is not just a meal it is a dining experience.  Caesar  salad and cherries jubilee both prepared table side and waiters dressed in black tie. You expect Dean Martin and Frank Sinatra to walk in at any moment. You can dine anywhere on the strip and not experience half of what you do at the Golden Steer.  It is truly the best food and service in Las Vegas.  A testament to what vegas used to be.

QX-0REYzWZUiRMRXvW9gMQ.text: Returned again last Saturday.  The crabcakes were as they were the first time, as were the onion rings.  Consistent on both dishes.  This time, instead of getting the ribeye, I had the prime rib.  I prefer the ribeye.  The prime rib was solid, but not as overwhelming as I was expecting given what I had heard.  It was not crowded at all for a Saturday, but seemed to pick up around 8 pm.  You need to get to GS, old Vegas places are few and far between unfortunately....

oWDbnogFyVJT6FTzLITrYw.text: This is the best old steakhouse In Vegas. You can feel the spirit of the rat pack, Robert Redford - Marlon Brando -  Naugahyde booths / the food is expensive but awesome and delectable, I love it here! Bananas foster! Fresh shrimp cocktails! Prime rib and New York steak! Asparagus w bearnaise. Caesar salad tossed table side. It's elegant! It's classy and it's old world 40s! Incredible. All our food was awesome. Creamed spinach, twice baked potato - prime rib --- so good.

jP7fTDpCk2lbGmiDou7WsQ.text: It's unfortunate that I had to give this establishment three stars but I must say, the food was more memorable than the service. First off, if you're interested in dining at one of their specific booths such as the Frank Sinatra booth, make reservations in advance.. I called a week in advance to reserve the booth and my request was granted. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a gentleman who had us wait in the bar area as our booth was being prepared. When we were finally seated, he elaborated on a few fun facts about the Frank Sinatra booth. It was off to a good start..at least I thought.. Our server came by to introduce himself, gave us a few minutes or maybe more, and then finally took our drink order. After a lengthy wait, another server came by and took our food order.. to make this review short, the service was just weak, there was no interest when it came to our table. I'm not sure if the gentleman I saw walking around to each table was the manager, but I observed as he approached every single table, asked if everything was okay except ours. The quality of the food was decent, the bananas foster was a real hit! It's made table side and what better way to have dessert without adding a little flare! Overall, I wish the service was more pleasant.

DuuGy_8iJRRN6rCnL0T6QQ.text: I finally got a chance to try this place out. I gotta say I wish I would have checked it out sooner. I has the rib eye and fully loaded baked potato. The rib eye was huge and cooked to perfection. The baked potato was just alright but I ate the damn thing anyway. It's a bit pricey but well worth it. Anybody looking to do something away from the strip this is it. It's to too far off Sahara but enough. The app selection looks great. I got a chance to try the baked ravioli and it's was pretty darn tasty. Definitely give this place a shot.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib Eye steal medium rare and their fully loaded baked potato.

gbCMpcJgnJKHN7YtHRk2sA.text: What a surprise! My husband and I accidentally stumbled upon this restaurant while driving back to the Turnberry. Dark and cozy, great bar, best Caesar salad, made table side, wonderful wine list, attentive service, great steak, over-sized baked potato, what more could one want? ( garlic bread could have been better).  Will make this a must place to eat every time we visit family in Lad Vegas.  Don't let the ugly strip mall it is located in scare you off. The restaurant is well worth visiting and returning to again and again.

tGMni8yepZB4eFoe22NIfw.text: This place definitely lives up to the hype.  I had the 12oz filet, twice baked potato, and asparagus.  The steak was great!  The wine, great! And the cherries jubilee, AWESOME!!  The service was exceptional and really reminded me of what Las Vegas is supposed to be about.

SVDNMc8p7HD2h6rGAGewZA.text: The staff was amazing but the food was disappointing! My husband has wanted to come here since we moved here 23 years ago. We have always heard such great things. We had the stuffed mushrooms that were watered down with what taste like bread crumbs, shrimp cocktail that had HUGE shrimp (that was the best thing we ate) rib eye not tender or melting in our mouths, and crab legs that taste like something off a buffet, dry and tough:( It was the worst $ we have ever spent on dinner.

2LX1EYAS-5Ob86FbwzUY5A.text: I'm ambivalent about this place.  Guess we'll have to break it down:  POSITIVES: ---  If you like old-school steakhouses (and I do), you'll really like the atmosphere here.  Nice booths, pictures of old school celebs, Sinatra songs in the background. ---  Service was quite good.  I was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews here, but our waiter was very nice and the service was attentive without being overbearing. ---  Steaks were tasty and cooked to perfection.  NEGATIVES: ---  The tableside Casear salads were merely OK.  I expected a bit better for $12 per.   ---  The sides weren't very good.  The twice-baked potato was marginal at best, and the asparagus with bernaise sauce was NO BUENO.  I'd avoid having the bernaise sauce on my steak if I were you. ---  It's a little spendy - everything is a la carte.  Ended up spending a bit over $100/plate after tip.  I'm not really sure how I still come up with four stars, but there you go.  I REALLY liked my steak, I guess...

x5FUJSD3tZQpvUCSIGS5GQ.text: Love it! Love it! Love it!  It is The Classic Steakhouse, that has ambiance galore.  The steak is the star and they definitely show it off!  The food is of the highest quality and the beverages are fabulous!  The Flamingo Martini is a requirement.  This is a must in Vegas!  If you are there, make a reservation and ask for Tom K., he is hands down THE BEST!  Excellent service, recommendations and a personality that will make you laugh and warm your heart!  There is nothing better than a dinner here - I cannot wait to go back!

zltuwXupLl3O7p4ccG6HCw.text: First time here and the interior was nostalgic for sure. First red flag was the water jugs and menus they prop up on the side of our booth. Not a great experience when water jugs and menus are coming and going a few inches from your head.Get a corner nook or something better!!  The caesar salad didn't impress me at all and it seems they don't prepare tableside if only one is ordered? I've had better salads at outback. Filet and lobster were great. They have a good history here but can't let things slip as there is too much competition in this great town !

dnn7ASsh3N165slwXYcZIQ.text: This place has a great atmosphere. Amazing culture and history. The staff was friendly and the service was amazing. The food was worth every penny. Best tasting steak I've ever had.

l7mgKmocvHUU6ZdlELolJQ.text: The atmosphere is amazing...and the service was even better. Had the Caesar salad, creamed spinach, and the 12 oz filet. LOVED the steak. Very delicious. The Caesar salad rocked too. So-so on the creamed spinach. It was a little runny and tastes sweeter than I expected. (A little salt went a long way). Not a lot of wine by the glass options. They could improve on this for sure. Only 2-3 red wine glass options. Desserts looked amazing, but I didn't order one. I would go again and order the same salad and steak. I would also order a bottle of wine vs a glass.

CxEz2-RhWAgtepxd482dqg.text: The service was attentive. Caesars salad was quiet good. The steak was nothing special nod overpriced. The sauce was overcooked and flavorless. Our meals arrived before we finished the salad. The asparagus was cold, the sauce tasted like paste. Clearly this place is past it's prime and living on overcharging unsuspecting tourists.

6jqUGfOtu_E-ixHWEVY_kg.text: When we drove by this place a couple times, we figured it was a "hole in the wall" steak place.   We decided to give it a try and we are so glad we did! What a class act of a place!!! Beautiful interior, professional wait staff and amazing food! Yes it's a little pricey but very worth it.

Zpo8ChIWHwIp5KveeigbwA.text: We recently had dinner at the Golden Steer. It was an exceptional experience to remember. On arrival we were warmly greeted by the maitre de. We were given a brief history of the restaurant and the significance of the room and booth we would be sitting in. We were escorted to the "Frank Sinatra" booth. A brass plaque proudly announced the fact.i had the petite ( not really petite at 8 oz), a mixed green salad, and the whipped potatoes. As we informed the side dishes were large enough to share. My wife had the Dover sole. The table side preparation was quite a show. The sole was delicious. All of the food was of exceptional quality and perfectly prepared. The entire meal representative of an earlier era where the atmosphere and ambience was every bit as important as the food. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. I would highly recommend this restaurant. I only wish that most patrons would have dressed appropriately and left the shorts and sweats at home.

9Idz6T7LPow2STmOwaQcHQ.text: Sorry to say, but it was a very disappointing evening. The restaurant is very impressive, old Vegas. However the server was in a cranky mood and the food was not worth $190 bill. I would never ever return.

VJbn0mjXH9rFzBsN2iUONw.text: I continue to be in awe at their terrible customer service. After recommending that they improve their reservation system to minimize human error and increase the likelihood that their patrons are able to enjoy their dinner as planned. I was contacted by management so I could voice my concerns, except it was a rude awakening to learn that Golden Steer doesn't actually care.  No one ever responded and they deleted my comment from Instagram as it had never happened. #guiltbyomission    I cannot recommend this restaurant now or ever.

Nl4TnRn-y4-teRedmlwHEQ.text: One Star,  very great service, attentive and they make your salad dressing in front of you Two star, the steak is extremely delicious and they hafe a variety to chose from Three stars, the lobster is large sized and its flavor is inpecable...it melts in your mouth Four stars, amazing low light atmosphere Five stars....just trust us.

mCqBkJACuXVUoNHq4b_z5Q.text: My new favorite place!!! A go to in Las Vegas!! We had the bone in Ribeye, King Crab Cocktail, tableside Caesar Salad and Cherries Jubilee!! We sat in Frank Sinatra's booth and just had the best evening!!!

y6g1v8bueS1pY4AQlgC8Xw.text: A secret gem just off the Las Vegas strip, this steakhouse doesn't look like much from the outside, but inside it is the essence of old Hollywood.  We had reservations and were seated quickly upon arrival.  Our waiter was quite knowledgeable which helped greatly in our meal choices.  Our friends started with the escargots which they said were "divine".  I had the poached salmon with dill cream sauce for my entree... It was spectacular!  The fish was cooked perfectly and the sauce so delicious that I wanted to lick the plate.  It also came with a side of wild rice.  My husband's 18oz prime rib was also good, but so much meat that he couldn't finish it. Our friends had the petite and regular filet mignons.  They raved!  The side of asparagus that we shared as a table was the perfect compliment to round out the meal.  Highly recommended all around!

M4_m0oMY3tKWbVq_KWPA3A.text: Four stars for the food it's always amazing but the guy at the front desk Roland is very vulgar

WVGyz_9WSryq15MiUcBRXw.text: I've now been to Golden Steer twice. It seems like I'm being treated progressively worse. I live in the condo building next door so I try to support businesses in my neighborhood. I can honestly say I'll never be a patron at Golden Steer again.   The first time I came to The restaurant the hostess tried to act like she couldn't seat me despite the restaurant literally being empty. There were literally 3 customers in the restaurant. I brushed it off. The servers were rude to me and practically ignored me and the prime rib was not good at all. I chalked it up to an isolated bad experience.   I came back about 6 months later (today) and the hostess tells me there's a 1.5 hour wait. She later gets on the phone and tells another potential customer that they have space if they come now.   I sat in the bar high tops area for about 25 minutes. Nobody brought me a menu or even acknowledged me. I literally had to go and find a server and place an order. This time I tried the ribeye. I asked for it medium rare +. They gave me a medium-medium well steak. When asked for another steak the server tried to blame it on the au jus. I eat at steakhouses weekly. Au jus had never made a steak more well done in my experience.   As I type this I've been finished with my dinner for about 20 minutes and no one has come to offer me the check. I'm practically invisible. This is very disappointing. None of the other patrons are being treated like this. I'm the only Black patron in the restaurant. I hope this is merely a coincidence.

JdkSmRk04aG02k_F8bCFFw.text: Looked like a great place. But as we found out make a reservation!!!  Next time I'll try it out.

Q-A0W-LT52_ITmO0d31U-Q.text: Inside this unassuming exterior is a time machine of when the rat pack ran the streets of Vegas.  As we entered, we were greeted by a host and hostess, dressed in formal attire and intent on service.  We felt genuinely welcome and were escorted to one of the dining rooms.  The low-light ambiance made it feel private and red booths with plaques reserved for luminaries like Muhammad Ali and Joe DiMaggio ringed the walls with tables in the middle.    Seated quickly, we perused the menu.  It featured items that are not for casual dining.  Rather this place is a treat for those who have discerning tastes and expect excellent service.  Our main server, Tom reminded me of a classic Jersey boy - to the point.  No fluff.  All business.  Not that he's unfriendly.  That's far from the case.  It just felt like the kind of guy Sinatra would want at his table.  Another gem was Fabian.  He also assisted us and had almost a Hawaiian laid-back vibe to him.  Again, he was very attentive and requests were quickly met.  We felt like there was no rush.  That the experience was one to be savored.  We ordered the bone in ribeye, asparagus, surf and turf Combo with fillet mignon and crab.  For sides we also had the French onion soup and cesar salad.  Bread with butter was on the table to take the edge off while we waited.  The salad and steaks either met or slightly exceeded expectations for the investment.  We had them medium rare and medium.  Both were cooked appropriately and obviously seared to lock in juices.  Both were tender and flavorful.  Unlike some other steak houses, these were seasoned minimally to allow the customer to suit his/her tastes.  The bread was nothing spectacular.  Good, but unremarkable.  The asparagus was similar.  Using the lemon and adding some salt really raised it up a notch.  The crab was quite good, A nice touch was they split and grilled some of the legs.  It was a great counterpoint to the other traditional legs served with the meal.  The slightly crunchy texture was delightful.  However, the star of the evening was the French onion soup.  This masterpiece had us both raving.  The broth was very flavorful and the cheese expertly melted.  The thick layer ensured that one could have cheese with the soup even after the initial spoonfuls.    All the ingredients used were fresh and of the highest caliber.  We finished the night with the cherries jubilee.  Fabian attended us again and created the wonderful flaming display.  Always looking for improvement, my wife asked for some chocolate to go with it.  Unhesitatingly, Fabian brought out not only chocolate, but a raspberry topping as well.  He knocked it out of the park with the raspberry addition.  It was spectacular.  It was little touches like Fabian's thoughtfulness, and Tom's chutzpah that made the evening special.  Every person there was part of a team and their goal was the immediate and total satisfaction of the diner.  Though there may be hipper and newer steakhouses - the Golden Steer set the standard.  You don't have to be new and hip if you have brilliance in the basics.

hzg97-KcS7n_v-sDV97DXw.text: One of the last remnants of old Las Vegas, the Golden Steer is still one of the best places in town to get a steak.  I had the pleasure of ordering a prime rib here, and they brought out this monstrous frigging piece of meat that look like it came off the biggest bull ever to walk the earth.  It was very thick, and had the bone still in.  Tender, juicy, and just absolutely the best I've ever had.  I also got a big giant dish of horseradish for it too.  It was amazing.  If you don't mind dining on the pricey side, and are in the mood for a steak, this is one of the very best places to get it.  The staff is very professional, as they have been doing this for a long time.  Would highly recommend.

sPVH8M2TI7AoSHMMzaiNkw.text: Finally made it!  I LOVE SALADS!   We're old fashioned, a steak and potatoes ain't a Steakhouse meal UNLESS there's a fresh Caeser tossed in front of us where we can all watch the action.. our waiter Carl has the goods.  First heard about his skills via Yelp (*thanks Yelp!) so when we booked it, I had requested his services in my reservation.  We arrived and I hadn't been greet by Carl initially which made us all very, very uneasy.  We flew in just for this, you know, so finally after a good 3-4 minutes of awkward eye contact with my father and his lovers.. IT BEGAN!  'The-Beacon-of-Salad-Bowlsing' himself walks right up and just says it.. "YOU BOYS READY TO GET TOSSED!!". I got super wet in my mouth.. it was all happening so fast.  Out rolls the salad table and we all started grinning like children.. my father beat his fist on the table rhythmically and we started too... it was like slow boil that just started going NUTS!  We're here, he's here.. we're happy, he's happy!  Then he does it.. he grabs the bowl and spins it like he's a flipping Harlem Globetrotters, one of my father's lovers starts doing the Globetrotters whistle and Carl slams the bowl on the table shows us it's empty like a magician's hat then he pops out a bottle and does "jerking" motion then starts spraying the bowl with this pearly off white Caeser dressing.  My eyes rolled ALL the way back and I gripped the seat hard.  He flipping in the greens and I swear I heard classical music while he got to work!  I said "YOU'RE THE MASTER... WHHHOOOOAAA!"  Being ever the humble creeper, he goes.. "a Master, you mean this idiot massaging these leafy greens with my tiny digits that always smell like a b-hole" (then he said "coincidentally" while doing air quotes, smelled his Caeser dressing smoothed fingers and flipping winked).  The guy gots flare, who could deny it... seamlessly dancing his spinach shovels in and out while eye-raping the lady's neckline at the table behind us.  I challenged him by saying that he might do better if he became versed in something other than tossing stranger's salad while they're in Vegas.  He said his father did, his father's father did and it's just in his blood.

qRSuVEu_HEoHyK6q7cc8RQ.text: This place is AWESOME! I've driven by for years and have always wondered and it turns out I love it. It's a steakhouse you might see on an old movie about vegas. They make ceaser salad at you table! If you don't like raw egg don't watch the dude make it. This place will get you laid for sure

rLYsSi2WKKZI059AfSXUXA.text: My friend and I went, mostly based on the mythos surrounding Sinatra and his coterie. We both figured it would be decent enough. We called to confirm our reservation and to see if Frank's booth was attainable. The hostess said we had a good shot, but that the evening hostess was different. That excited us, two Italians and Sinatra fans. As the cab pulled up we got worried. Looks like a strip bar in a strip mall, with blaring yellow placards. Upon entry we were greeted by the maitre'd, a hybrid of Alice Cooper and Vangelis, and a hostess who seemed like she thought herself a prosecutor at Nuremberg when we asked for Frank's booth. We let it go, hoping to receive a meal good enough to erase our initial treatment. We followed Igor back to our booth, a red leather wrap around older than either of us. Soon enough our waiter announced himself, in barely intelligible English. We ordered crab cakes to start. I also got the filet mignon, termed here "the aristocrat of tenderness." The crab cakes arrived. Garnished with cocktail sauce and mayo, they had the appearance of breaded urinal cakes. Alas, they likely had worse flavor. First bite impression: undercooked batter. I got no hint of crab. It took immense will power to choke one and a half down. The filet was okay, but came rare, not medium rare as ordered. No sauce, either. Acceptable, but not at $48. We ordered dessert, just hoping that would be good. I asked for bananas Foster. The preparer worked table side, occasionally engaging in feeble attempts at humor. For $15 I got a sliced banana, cheap liquor, and a scoop of generic ice cream. When it came time to pay, $100 plus per including tip, we found out they don't do separate checks. I guess the POS system is circa 1958. I can accept a shoddy meal. Not at $100. That's terrible. Banking on Old Blue Eye's past patronage is pathetic. If this is what they served the Rat Pack and no one had their knees broken...This could be a cool place. They need to ditch the staff, shoot the cook, remodel the place, and not dishonor the Rat Pack. I am tempted to throw out my Sinatra collection.

7Jg7X6bIfL2IVQPxf07ZsA.text: Frigging amazing!!! One of the best steaks I have ever had, even in comparison with all of the fancy chains. Not pretentious. Serious about quality. Well worth the money you spend.   Quality old fashioned. Not fancy. Just right with whiskey and a little sweet.   House bread basket is the bomb. Garlic bread is a little over rated.   Cool place to visit in Vegas!  We will come again with friends!

mILn_Zh14s9ZD8HHx9byrg.text: This restaurant was recommended by a cab driver. Usually they are spot on. Upon arriving I was surprised to learn that it was owned by the same person who owned Chateau Vegas.( closed many years ago) Our favorite restaurant! Old school Las Vegas. Waiters wear tuxes, excellent service. My husband ordered a filet with a mushroom side. The  steak was cooked to perfection, mushrooms were delicious, with a brown gravy sauce. I ordered the Veal Marsala. The sauce was very good, but much to my dismay, the veal was very tough. Not pounded at all! Such a shame. I will definitely go back and try another entree. Don't let the outside of the building scare you away, please try it.

3RVdiQb_5ZmnXaUrW2EE7w.text: Worst experience ever went there and food was horrible, customer was awful and then called to speak with manager mark who never returned my call so I call back and speak with risha the women manager who said oh I only work two days a week and said I will look into it and call you back by Sunday that was 3 weeks ago not sure what Sunday she was going to be. Place needs to close doors. Sad cause we used to go there all the time. Wish I could give zero stars

q9DO_NmiZD0r8BwCsD-Ipg.text: This restaurant was fantastic! Food was amazing and our waiters Alfredo and Henry took very good care of us. I had the crab legs and filet mignon which was a ton of food. My husband had the ribeye and said it was cooked perfectly. The rolls were soft and they make the Caesar salad right at your table. They also have a Clint Eastwood booth. Definitely a must if you're visiting Vegas and want a great steakhouse!

_YUOG8oksuu_j6vLRNWucg.text: It was a great dinner in a great restaurant with years of history. We had many choices that night to get a steak and I Yelped at least 15 different places. We decided to go here. Our second choice was The SteakHouse at the Circus Circus. We will try that next time.  The only problem I had was that I ordered French onion soup and never got it. They never charged us so we didn't say anything. Besides that our steak was awesome and the twice baked potato was good also.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great 22oz rib eye with broccoli and a twice baked potato.

t_u9Wo3Y0fz-8PhIIXvnyg.text: Working in Vegas it would be easy to just hit the various big gun chef restaurants on the strip... Luckily, we were directed to this OG  True Rat Pack steak house.   The host is great at breaking down the historical significance. The staff; sommelier, waiter, etc. are completely attentive.   We enjoyed the old school prep if the Caesar salad table side & the filet / petite mignon's do not disappoint.   Worthy of a visit!   Enjoy the Red Label for a drink & some video poker after.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ext. Golden Steer

WVwveUbWfMoNmEslO4VUxQ.text: Came here based on an Internet search for Vegas restaraunts with True classic charm and this place was exactly what we hoped for. Don't be deterred by the strip mall-esque exterior. This places interior oozes with suave decor and old world classic service. The staff, the food, the ambiance was all 100%. Just do yourselves and your compatriots a favor and dress to impress. You'll be glad you did. A++

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OfnZsiNCH70f4tIyLGMhOg.text: We were very disappointed in our meal. The steaks were improperly seasoned and cooked-our medium came out well-done and our guests' rare was medium well.  Neither had been allowed to rest properly. (It had taken well over an hour to be served from the time we actually ordered, so no excuse there).  We did not send them back because we had already been there so long.                                                             The potato was so overcooked, it was brown and actually burned on bottom.     The $4 peppercorn sauce was a lump of cold brown gravy with peppercorns stirred in. It had to be dipped out of the gravy boat and spread like jam onto the steak. Not how I make mine by any stretch.                                 Good point---the ONE roll we were offered was delicious.                                                    We were in Vegas on a business not pleasure trip, for several nights. The night before we had a $30 meal at a hotel restaurant, and then the next night a $300 meal at this restaurant.  The first meal was much better in quality, service, and experience.   We will go back there. We will not be back at the Steer.

zLk5ZDSugza4X4s0mVRLRQ.text: Went here for our 10th anniversary dinner and sat at Mario Andretti's table. This was my second time eating here. Location is not great but that's part of the experience. Service was very good and the food was delicious. I had the Oscar filet and my wife had the diamond prime rib. Both were top notch. 4 stars for missing the fixings on our baked potato on the side and strawberrys for our cheese cake. All in all a great place for dinner with a cool vibe and lots of history.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XwF-ltDEyWeMmAoGzZhjLQ.text: The place is great but more ambience than food quality. It is a traditional steakhouse with dark woods, deep red furniture, and great service. Eat where Frank Sinatra ate! Food was okay. I must say Caesar salad made table side was good. Steak was underwhelming but the place is worth the trip for sure!

6_HnPTjN9k4cQbmVfXH7Cw.text: This place is quite simply amazing.  It was recommended to me so I thought I would try it out.  The service was perfect. The food was absolutely incredible. I had one of the best steaks I have ever had.  If you want to have something that is old Vegas. Then you should go here. Absolutely amazing!

gCPKxYLGVbzOC2-hxwl9NQ.text: It sells itself as "Oldest restaurant in Las Vegas", which it may well be.  On the upside, for once for this city it's neither chain nor part of Casino, and the steaks are good.    On the downside, it's not the easiest to get to (parking can only be accessed from one lane of a divided highway), and the menu is overpriced.  For steak in this town I still prefer the (chain) options of Fogo de Chao or Smith & Wollensky

nv5kEOWvo-cCvF3UCCTdyw.text: Loved it! We wanted somewhere near the action but off the strip to avoid parking drama. I called for a reservation & they suggested the "Marilyn" booth. The place is old school Vegas! Leather booths and waiters in tuxedos. Our server was impressive. He told all about the history of the restaurant & showed us around to the "mob room" and other famous booths, including the Rat Pack. We ordered the seafood stuffed mushroom caps to start. Delish! Then we had the Table side Caesar salad which was truly amazing and big enough for two. I ordered lobster and my husband got a ribeye. We shared the creamed corn- hands down the best I've ever had- and a twice baked potato and bottle of wine. It wasn't cheap. I think our bill was around $225. That's what you'd get on the strip without the history and incredible service. SO happy we came to Golden Steer. We can't wait to go back and take out of town visitors.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DELICIOUS! Simple, yet perfect!

XhPLsyZYTffDTw89KJ-jEg.text: This is a vintage old school off the beaten path steakhouse. If you were looking for glam and glitzy in a hotel, this is not the place.   However if you're looking for a retro steakhouse with the round red booths and old-school service you're in for a treat.This was one of the favorite places for celebs in the golden era.   Sammy Davis, Dean Martin, Elvis and Mohamed Ali had their own booths each time the  The steaks were cooked perfectly and the Caesar salad prepared tableside was fun to watch.  The bartender definitely knows how to make an awesome Manhattan.   The wine list was quite extensive and the staff is very knowledgeable about selecting the perfect pairing for dinner.  If you want a fun vintage off the beaten path steakhouse, I highly recommend.

qKY3aRYcbXkRuKZR568DaA.text: Out of the way just off the strip. I've dined here often since the early 80's and never been disappointed.  Perfect steaks and perfect service.  Make sure to check the photos on the walls.   This is a destination place.

H6e5_rXcrT_sRAvlOBGyjA.text: Well, I turned 60 yesterday and my wife and I wanted to go somewhere for a nice relaxing, memorable dinner. Looked for a steak house and thought why not, let's give Golden Steer a try, lots of history and old...like me. I'm actually older by a couple years Inside was old fashion decor of years past, very inviting and a nice ambiance. Waiters and servers were very friendly.  Ordered the combo New York and Lobster dinner. The lobster was fantastic, the steak was just a bit overcooked from what I ordered, wanted medium rare, got medium. My waiter was more than happy to get me a new one but, I struggle with throwing a good piece of meat away. It was only a little overcooked and I thanked him for the offer. One of the most incredible taste is the table side made Caesar salad. They make the dressing right in front of you, super fresh and OMG flavor. Best ever. The French onion soup is very good as well. So when I start eating my dinner, things take a turn. They make an incredible Bananas Foster table side. And a few tables away was one being made. To start with they light a firework sparkler thing, like a fountain. Really nice for show but, it filled the entire room with a horrible sulfur smelling smoke. I mean it lingered for 10 minutes plus. Completely ruined my experience eating my meal. My nostrils and my taste buds where ruined for the night. From what I hear, on a busy night there could be 40 of these things going off during your meal. So sorry to give a not too impressive review but for the money, you didn't match my expectations.

SwuUHk8Gy32jCQDH7eSFhw.text: Been coming here for years! Have to say it's one of my favorite steak houses in town to this day. Never ever had a bad experience here. Top-notch service and food. What else can I say.

VwytAecfNxnmKEJEFh4lPQ.text: So sad to write this. I came here five years ago and had the best steak of my life. I was so excited to come back on my wedding anniversary last night. The garden green salad was drowned in runny dressing, the bread was stale and the steak was so bad I sent it back. To their credit they removed it from my bill, still such a disappointment.

pJ3TUwq9VMLnqBRTcpufSQ.text: Had dinner at the Golden Steer and had a great meal and enjoyed the old time feel of the restaurant.  There was 4 of us at dinner, 2 had the filet, 1 had the prime rib and 1 had the T-bone.  We shared the asparagus and mashed potatoes.  Everything was great. Waiter was helpful with the menu and provided a lot of the history behind the restaurant.

x2KtKJqUvP7_ki4VEPphcw.text: Man... What a meal! Appetizer through dessert. Sensational!  Filet was the best I've ever had, creamed spinach and twice baked potato to die for. Creme brulee was very unique with under tones of chocolate and coffee. Highly recommend. Ask for Scot and Bryant... They were exceptional!  Thanks for an amazing Thanksgiving dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ak
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of adult veggies
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet and lobster tail

poNnxdsYfpaTGza8xJKxuQ.text: Oh Golden Steer, I totally have a crush on you!  The Golden Steer is such a throwback to Old School Vegas.  When you walk through the front door, you are transported back to the 1950s.  Back in the 50s and 60s, this was THE place to go for a great steak dinner.  When you are eating, you keep looking over your shoulder to see if Frank Sinatra or Sammy Davis Jr. had just walked in.  It is just way too cool in my book.  So back in the old days of Vegas, all of the Vegas Elite came here and had their own table.  If you were anyone, you had a table with your name on it saving your seat.  This is one of the cool leftovers from that era still in the restaurant.  You can request to sit at Elvis', Marilyn Monroe, Dean Martin (my favorite Rat Packer, oh Dean-o I love you!), and numerous other celebrity tables.  My mom is the biggest Elvis fan in the world, so when I took her here for her birthday last year and got the Elvis table, she almost cried.  It is fun to have something fun in common with a superstar from yesteryear, in if it is just sitting at the same table at a great restaurant.  On top of the coolness factor, the steaks speak for themselves too.  I mean when the smallest steak on the menu is 12oz, you know you are in for a feast!  Last time I was here, i ordered the Prime Rib and it came out on its own plate because there was no room for anything else on the plate.  The Prime Rib was even hanging over the side in more than one place.  I only made a small dent in it and ended up taking it home and it turned into 2 more meals at home.  Now that is some serious MEAT.  Yum and drool all at the same time.  Another awesome aspect of this restaurant is the table side service for the desserts.  This is one of the only places left in the world that does flaming Cherries Jubilee and Bananas Fosters at your table, flames and all.  It is such a fun time watching your server make your dessert right there for you.  And seriously, how doesn't like desserts on fire right in front of you?  My absolute favorite part of this place is if you can go on a slow night when the owner is on property.  The owner is this very nice lady who will make friends with you as soon as she meets you.  I have been several times and she will always come by and just sit down with us at the table.  She will tell you all sorts of stories about interesting things that has happened at the place.  There are even some ghost stories about the place.  And yes, weird stuff still happens there.  BOO!  Now that is a fun dinner to have, steaks and ghosts!  So if you want to experience Old Vegas, eat a huge steak, have a flaming dessert, and maybe get spooked by a spook, this is your joint.  Go check it out and support a local legend.

Jad1pW_gMiS0y2OQHPH9_Q.text: Excellent restaurant. Service was top notch and the food was flavorful. Prices where in line with other steak houses on/near the Las Vegas strip.

DHRNQnulG5bgpmHjkiYZcA.text: I brought my family here while they were visiting from Pennsylvania as their one steakhouse experience for this trip. We've had good luck in the past but this was a big miss. The service was actually really bad, I'm not sure if our servers had more tables than normal or if they just weren't attentive but the reasont doesn't really matter. As a reference, it was bad in the way that three of the four of us were sitting with no drinks for well over 15 minutes during the meal.   We ordered three prime ribs and one filet. I was told the filet was excellent however, the prime rib was on par with the ones you can get for $12.99 in downtown Vegas. It had little to no seasoning and it was not tender whatsoever, more chewy than anything with the fat being hard and congealed rather than moist.   I wouldn't recommend this place at all considering it's at the same price point as any Strip steakhouse.

ixFMX4Q848KwqMp5oiM07g.text: We went there with a group of people of about 25. our section was pre-booked, so they knew in advance to expect a rather large group of people. Our table was the first one the waiter took the order from. After a long wait, about 45 minutes, we noticed that everyone was served and eating but our table. So I complained to the waiter who then rushed off and got our food as well and gave us some fried Ravioli for free. Nice touch, but too little too late. I had the chicken which was very nice. Two others on my table had the crab cakes which were soggy and fishy, just awful. We were not able to eat them. This restaurant is overrated. It is only making money, because Elvis and the rat pack used to hang out there. There is nothing special about their food. Well, the prices are special, especially high! If you want good food (steak), good service and a very nice view, check out Binion's Steak House downtown!

SDuT_SHr_YL7F8AeIwW3cA.text: Fabulous dining experience in a truly authentic Vegas steakhouse. It thrilling to think that celebrities from Marilyn Monroe to Dean Martin dined here. The service was good. Many dishes were prepared classic, tableside manner. Food was good, steak was on the medium well side of medium which is the only reason for less than a five star rating. Prices are steep so bring your casino winnings! Don't let the exterior scare you off. This place is a jewel.

4aylCui94LoblTBIUBrlnQ.text: So good I'm here twice in a row. Golden steer is amazing, great vegas history,exceptional service.

TtE4JOyZ4EVBiwnlOJvF_Q.text: Totally Old Vegas atmosphere, love it! The food was excellent. My husband ordered a filet and lobster tail and lets just say the portions were more than enough to make him happy. I ordered toasted ravioli, so amazing! We also had the table side Caesar salad. It was by far the best Caesar I've had. Everything was delicious and we really enjoyed the restaurant
