OHS__KrPBRBJJkbsPwecXA.text: I dipped my crablegs into what I thought was a bowl of butter. A LOT, of butter, cus I fudgin' looooove butter. Turned out to be a bowl of horseradish. After I got over the initial chokefest, one of the guys at the table dared me to eat a spoonful of horseradish for $100.   I ate the entire bowl. Just because. That's about the time I hit rock bottom.  There was steak & other food involved. 3.5 stars.

MfihMfiKj4qYa7R8UF9vRg.text: Easily the best eggplant Parmesan I've had! The food and atmosphere was nice. The things that did make the dinner a little off-putting was the fact that they seated us in a room where two parties were being held and it was extremely loud, and my friends were shocked to find the steak and lobster was $115 alone but the price wasn't listed. All prices should be listed. The service was fast and we got a reservation with ease.

-aybQkd1n9wO9VgrqRbfbA.text: Couple things on most recent visit- Calamari was surprisingly good Waitstaff still act in a haphazard manner, had 3 different waiters during night. Some of the younger ones went into back room and I speculate were drinking. I mean whatever but its a sign this place is possibly headed downhill My steak ordered medium came out darn near rare and then after a heat up came back leather Finally, the bull that was out on Sahara is now in the backroom as some truck hit the pole it was on and knocked it off! A bit odd this long time iconic sign is gone and doesn't seem they will be putting it back up. Yet another sign this spot is not being run at a high end professional level.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7fa1mwdHFkDwx2yrXomVzw.text: Had the bone in Ribeye, twice baked potato, mushrooms and caesar salad, it was all perfect, and delicious, if you like steak, this is the place, great service also. Frank, marilyn, sammy, and others could not have been wrong.

QUFcCwgrCgJ7v6EC558bXw.text: I understand why this place is still open. It has one of the coolest old school vegas feels ever. I was to buzzed to chance another coctail, but I'll make a point to get back and enjoy a dirty martini

v3ubd5QMKlBj-dm5qE8dJQ.text: Stepping into the restaurant was a time warp back in time. "1958" no updates done at this place! We noticed the AC vent near our table had dust in the vents so no telling what was blowing into people's drinks and food near our table. I had the jumbo shrimp cocktail that was soft mushy and the cocktail sauce came with a small bottle of hot sauce with no sign of horseradish it all. This was about the worst shrimp cocktail I ever had. Another person in our party had a garden salad with the house dressing that wasn't very tasty to them. We ordered drinks and the ginger ale and coke was flat and the Jack Daniels was weak tasting. "How can you mess up Jack n Coke". Someone in Our group also had a beer that had a funny aftertaste. The dinner was average not living up to the statement of "World's Best Steakhouse" however we will not return to this nightmare ever! I would seek another place to eat dinner. Our group only had two out of two that enjoyed their meals and one only had a vegetable dish!

cAuAljNaS_-a7s9n9n8RyA.text: First of all, If you're looking for a glitzy steakhouse with a Food Channel Chef's name on it; this is not the place for you.  This is an old school Las Vegas steakhouse!!!  I am a local and have been to the Golden Steer on multiple occasions and never go home disappointed.  The staff is always friendly and the steaks are always a good quality cut.  The best part of this place, besides the meat, is the history.  For the out of towner's, this is the place where the Rat Pack used to eat and hang out after playing a show at the Sahara, what is now the SLS.  This is also where the Goodfella's used to hang out and eat.  If you ask the staff, they will be more than happy to recall countless stories about either.  Anytime someone is in town visiting, I take them here.  There are a million cookie cutter steakhouses on Las Vegas Blvd., but there's only one Golden Steer.  **There is one more thing I would like to add.  If there is something you do not like during your visit to the Golden Steer, try to bring it up to the management.  The staff at the Golden Steer take a lot of pride in what they do, but it's very difficult to change or correct an issue if they do not know something is wrong.  This restaurant has been in business for decades, and hopefully it will continue to serve Vegas for decades more.**

PJX8F3rkbBYyu8OjA3LGZA.text: It's a hard to find a pretty AMAZING BLOW YOUR SOCKS OFF RESTAURANT on Groupon. But here we have it. The BEST groupon I have ever bought. Among the best pieces of steak I have ever had, in such a beautiful setting. What a find!!  Caesars salad made fresh, from scratch (including the dressing) right in front of you. Do not leave without ordering one. Best Caesar salad ever.  Outstanding service. Polite, kind, diligent, and enthusiastic waiters in tuxedos who LOVE their jobs. Our waiter had been there some 20+ years I think, and many of the others looked like they had seniority. He was so passionate about the restaurant, the owners and the food. I love that!  LOVELY ambiance. Oh how deceiving the outside is. The restaurant is off the strip in a strip mall with no windows. I was scared to walk in. Walked in , and loved it. Old hollywood indeed. And tuxed out waiters to top it off.     Finally the food. Porterhouse was OUT OF THIS WORLD. Amazing. Juicy. Perfect. Generous portion... Great for sharing.  Nothing more you can ask for. And with the groupon, the price was even great. Although with everything they offer, I'd go back in a heart beat, and pay full price... If I lived in Vegas :(

ouyiaWZhKFFPWL6O2MF8tQ.text: OMG where do I begin? I always request Scott, he is amazing, attentive, remembers drink orders, preferences and is incredibly professional. Love the mob history here, the food quality and the ambiance. My tradition in Vegas, such a classy joint! And I'm super picky with food and restaurants!

e2HhkMSN5nA8UYWkqJFFgw.text: My son treated me to any steakhouse in vegas and i picked the golden steer no where else is there character and fine food as you step back in time.going there for my birthday in november

_zA6rJ9Lr8hT2yJObqlOAQ.text: I went to the Golden Steer for a birthday dinner and the time spent was both good and bad. The first and foremost thing is, the food is pretty good. The bad thing is, for a dinner averaging $110 per person, the food should be served hot. It's pretty bad when the food arrives cold or lukewarm and the table has to send the entire meal back. The staff was apologetic and the food came back a second time; some was hot while some was still lukewarm.   I'll go back in the future, but it won't be coming out of my pocket.

uQAfEw9b19XA-r3zaVrH3Q.text: Been here twice. Both times it was the best steak I've ever had. Service is impeccable. Spendy, but worth it. Do not miss the creamed corn!!

4y6GVVJ3TKsLI_cmF9qKxA.text: - amazing food - incredible service - 22oz filet was off the charts - drinks ... nice pours - salad excellent - sides were good.     - mushrooms 5 stars    - creamed spinach and corn .... came out cold but has good flavor   - a must for any vegas steak night

taDOUgyY7dL8X5dpf_Id3Q.text: Now I know there is a lot of competition for great steakhouses in Vegas but our meal service everything was fantastic!!!  Easy to make a Saturday night reservation that's good. We bought a $70 Groupon for $35....nice!    Get there your like hmmm...ok... Strip mall on Sahara blvd...kind of old.  Walk in hostess with big smile offered us ride in house car instead of taxi on way back...nice!  Nice booth... Old school I felt Dean, Frank, Sammi and the boys in the air. The menu tells a great story about how they used to be regulars and you could almost envision it after their shows smokin n drinkin!  Nice wine menu not pretentious. Ordered a steak and shared with my wife with no plate charge. Nice!    Food was great. Service awesome. I bet that waiter has worked there 25 years!!   We had a great dinner. Skip past the outside impression and enjoy the "old school".

KL13sjHMzhMy4WBGGEmOUg.text: Been in Vegas for 12 yrs., and I've been missing out all this time! Great vintage look and the service was phenomenal! For ALL you meat lovers out there, the 22oz Rib eye is a great challenge!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QrKiP2L0BkmhKyn1d9YnbQ.text: Another great meal. . My companion had the prime rib and it was amazing.  Sides were wild rice ( great) and baked potato  (a meal in itself! )  Only criticizim i have is the jumbo shrimp cocktail was rubbery and tough,  which would mean it was probably frozen.. (i had to use the steak knife to cut it....) for 4 shrimp at $20...i expected fresh. ..   Service was great, of course. . But. . Please, please, please. . Use fresh shrimp

V9zkcJkUtaW7qE7YR9GHVg.text: My wife and I went last night and this place is fantastic.  The atmosphere was amazing.  It is the perfect date night venue.  Our booth as cozy, the lighting was perfect and the service was attentive but non intrusive. She had the 18 oz. Prime Rib and I had the 22 oz. Ribeye and the were both perfect.  We also both had the jumbo sized baked potato as a side and it was excellent.  The only complaint we can think of is we shared a Tiramisu and it was no where near the quality of the rest of our meal.  That aside, this place is a must visit when in Las Vegas.

UTCBc0P1SteBFc6KDvTtJA.text: The dinner rolls were very stale. The food was ok, but nothing worth the price we paid. There are other steakhouses in Vegas that I have eaten that are way better.

Ds2VqmG2Pfkh6Zix8PawfA.text: I love this fucking place.  My buddies and I head to Sin City -- this is our spot.  Table for 8, bottles of Cab, cocktails, killer steaks, great sides . . . Old School Vegas.  Muhammad Ali celebrated his birthday here, the Rat Pack, Marilyn and Joltin Joe . . . LOVE IT!    You wanna know what I hate about Vegas?  How they import great restaurants from other parts of the country.  I don't want to eat at Nobu in Vegas.  I want to go to Malibu for that.  I don't want to eat at Carmine's in Vegas.  I want to eat at the one on 44th St in NYC with theatre tickets in hand.  I don't want the replica, I want the gawdamn original.  And that's what Golden Steer is.  Over 50 years.  est1958.  A Vegas original.  For those complaining about the service, you've gotta understand where you are.  You don't trot your significant other or your family into Golden Steer on a Friday night and expect rush service.  If you do expect that, then go to Black Angus.  This isn't 'dinner,' it's an event.  Soak it in.  Chill for a couple hours.  Actually chew your food.  Order dessert.  Extend the evening.  Experience it.    I've found the cooler you treat the staff, the faster and more pleasantly they serve you.  We were joking with our servers, taking pics with one server who looked like De Niro, and tipped the shit out of em.  We were there for a couple hours.  We loved it.  It was incredible.  All 8 steaks cooked perfectly.  If it's overcooked, send it back and grab another drink.  Sure beats a ruined evening while you quietly bitch about an overcooked steak and tell your fellow diner(s) how you can't wait to get on Yelp and destroy them.  Smile once in a while.  This legendary place rocks.  Bon appetit, bitches.

6WPV4M0YBFp8X2twtV4kEA.text: We love Vegas steakhouses. We had waited until we had visitors in town to try this one. We wish we would've waited longer.  We are fine with paying top price for top quality. The Golden Steer is neither. You are overpaying for it's name and the fact it's Vegas' oldest steakhouse.  The ambiance is great, and thats why it get ONE star. Very "old-school" Vegas. The service is absolutely horrible. There were 4 of us. Our head waiter greeted us in the most annoyed and lethargic way. Two separate people asked us which type of water we wanted. We only saw our waiter to greet us, take our order, and ask us for dessert.  We order the "famous" garlic bread to start. It was extremely "crumby" and pretty tasteless.   Each of us ordered some kind of steak or prime rib. The meat was okay. Nothing to write home about. We also ordered the "world's largest baked potato". Again, nothing special here. One of our other sides was sauteed mushrooms. Unbeknownst to us, they are mushroom buttons and not sliced mushrooms.   The final time we saw our waiter, he was there to ask us if we wanted dessert....he REEKED like an ashtray. It was clear he had just finished a smoke break. He absolutely STUNK. And when he brought our bill, he had double charged us for the garlic bread (I mention this because after reading other Yelp comments, this seems to be a recurring problem).  If you want a great steakhouse which is worth it's weight in gold, go to Hugo's Cellar at Four Queens or Hank's at Green Valley Ranch. I promise you won't over pay for what you are getting.  This was a huge disappointment for us. We were really looking forward to this restaurant.

xkvOjJea7me_1FCbQ99dxw.text: I must give the Golden Steer five stars for exceptional service and for the classic 1950's steakhouse vibe.  We patronized the Golden Steer for our wedding anniversary and were not disappointed. The food is very good.  We had the prime rib with whipped potatoes and Caesar salad.  The salad was the best Caesar I had in years, the potatoes very good.  The prime rib was good, but not great.  I don't hold it against the place as you never really know how a whole roast is texture wise all the way through.  I would have preferred a touch more seasoning but that is personal preference.    I would highly recommend going there for the entire experience.

Kb2Uu5MsndT0sCcAaT6twA.text: Great food and great service. My wife had the filet and shrimp and I had the filet and lobster. Huge portions and great flavor. We'll definitely be back.

nntzdzcebln6sNLOHcMoAg.text: Best rib-eye steak I've had in years. Flavor was excellent. Cooked medium  Cream corn was delicious. Creamy but not to sweet.  Creamed spinach was also very good. I didn't have more than a spoon full but I will make note to get it for myself next time I'm here.  The staff are friendly and nice.

zU3cH0fZHgdjt1PhzgCgxA.text: Sure isn't what it used to be.  Way overpriced mediocre food.  I had prime rib and it came out cold, my baked potato's skin was rock hard, the chef knew it (the waiter confirmed) and sent it out anyway.  Yes, I could have complained and sent it back but I shouldn't have to ever be disappointed at a restaurant that charges $55 for a la carte steak and $110 for surf and turf.  It is on the staff to make 100% sure stuff is right before it goes out.  I will never be back and I recommend you find a different steakhouse to enjoy....you won't have any trouble in this town.

DO3crsKdPJ7DieJMQEJP7g.text: I returned to Las Vegas and the Golden Steer, this time for a bachelor party.  We had a party of 12 which was booked through Open Table.  We had to make a few changes with the time and the number in our party and they were very accommodating.  On arrival, they put us in a private room in the back, which was a nice surprise.  We were told that this was the room used by the "bosses" back in the day who had to come in and out through the back door.    We had a team of servers including the Robert DeNiro impersonator that hangs around.  We started out with the the seafood appetizer which was a mix of shrimp, oysters, crab, etc.  All of which was fresh and delicious.    This time, I went with the New York Strip which was cooked to perfection, as expected.  Out of all 12 in our group, there was not a single complaint and compliments all around.  The price tag is steep, but worth it.  Everything was great down to the food and the service.  A must do in Vegas if you are a meat connoisseur

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Strip
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hXm8N0J5KHPujRBHy2dVpw.text: The Golden Steer is a total old school Vegas steakhouse experience. We decided to go on a whim and had no problem making same day reservations.   The Steer is located on Sahara between the I-15 and Las Vegas Blvd in a strip mall. It doesn't look like much on the outside but the inside is quite a surprise. Walking through the double wood doors you are taken back to old Vegas, I expected to see Frank and Sammy walk in any minute. The dark red booths, steer horns over the doorway and pictures of the rat pack and famous celebrities who have tables in their honor.   We were seated at Sammy Davis Jr's table with a signed picture of the Rat Pack on the wall behind us. Our server Scott came right over to welcome us and take our drink orders. For dinner we decided on the caesar salad, the 22 oz bone in rib eye, the twice baked potato and creamed spinach. The Steer has many table side preperations such as the caesar salad, chateaubriand, dover sole as well as desserts.   Brian came over with his cart to prepare our table side caesars. Everything is made from scratch using an egg yolk, fresh garlic, EVOO and parmesan cheese. Although I wished it was served a little colder, it was one of the best caesars Ive had. Shortly after, the rest of the dinner arrived. The ribeye was cooked perfectly medium rare as ordered. I thought the quality was good, but Ive had much better steaks in my life. The twice baked potato was excellent with lots of cheese and bacon. The creamed spinach had an odd anise flavor that we did not care for and the spinach was barely warm so we sent it back.   For dessert we chose the table side bananas foster. At $30 for two I was expecting much more. Brian came back with his cart and started cooking the bananas with brown sugar and rum. He scooped it on to vanilla ice cream and set the dish in front of us. We were waiting for the second one but the one dish was for the two of us. It was quite small and way overpriced for bananas and ice cream although it was very good.   The ambience and history here is 5 stars. Service was also excellent and we enjoyed our table side preparations. Waters were always refilled without asking. I will definitely return, especially with out of town guests so they can experience "old Vegas" themselves.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas foster for two
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brian making our bananas foster
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twice baked potato

ooUTX0KCIZ-nMSCcQlAH6A.text: An amazing spectacle for those seeking that classic Las Vegas vibe. The steak was amazing but to me the star of the show was the service. If you still appreciate that rapidly vanishing "white glove" experience this is the place to go.

WxLJ3dbVytDZmLQo-r-uLw.text: Somewhat disappointed. We made a reservation a week ago for my brothers 60th birthday and the Elvis table we requested was not available. We got the Ali table. Service was a mix of good and not so good. My brother's NY Strip was not cooked enough. My $58 bone in ribeye was borderline but I didn't send it back.  It was very juicy and a big 22oz. My nephew's stomach did not take the bernaise sauce well. Shrimp was good, caesars salad a-ok, cream corn ok. Busy, loud, but good ambience. Its an uber ride from the strip to downtown.

usGV_M2sB7mSAYgmg-1efw.text: Took my boyfriend here to surprise him for dinner and made reservations for 4:30 and we were the first one here. I love the restaurant inside how it's decorated and how the seats were. I love sitting next to my boyfriend when we eat so being able to be right beside him made me happy. We started off with the Caesar salad of course to be prepared tableside. The salad was delicious of course. I also ordered a glass of Malbec wine and it's so good. I usually don't drink much red wine cause it's strong but this Malbec was perfect. My boyfriend and I shared the ribeye with twice baked potato and broccoli. It was amazing. We couldn't finish it because it was pretty big so we had them to go it for us. The staff and servers were so prompt and on top of things. Awesome service here. I love the atmosphere and makes the dining experience wonderful. Last but not least we had the banana foster made tableside and my boyfriend and I finished the whole dessert together. It was soooooo good! We are glad we shared our entree because we made sure we saved room for dessert. We had an awesome experience here and would come back.

z0Y2Lw2xtY-RgAeXYq5Osw.text: This iconic Resturant has it all.  Ambiance and the feeling of the days of the rat pack in the air.   Cesar's salad presentation was my highlight, I love a fresh salad made in front of my eyes.  The steak was to die for.   This place is a must !!!  Viva Las Vegas ..

BTn5Szfyz-GYgQxc7slNbg.text: So, was battling on what steak place to chose in Vegas. My cousins recommended this joint. Loved the "old school" feel and the originality. Waiter & food was great. The host and what might have been the manager could definitely do some stepping up with their customer service. Upon arrival, the manager & host seemed annoyed that I was checking in, I arrived earlier than my reservation and she stated they wouldn't sit me until my reservation time which is fair but her tone and body language was unprofessional. When we sat (after my scheduled time) we found out ONE person would not make it (in my party) she visibly expressed her annoyance by rolling her eyes and giving us her back then proceeded to hand us the menus. I won't use her unprofessional manners against the quality of the food. My steak was great & Caesar salad on point! Our waiter was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moscow mule, delish!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium rare, so freaking delish! Happy birthday to me!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Rib-eye, amazing!

rkfPg6VXbqnVepkL5_U6pw.text: I've been looking forward to coming here for a long time- brought my mother from out of town to have dinner on a weeknight, two hours before a show. The old-school Vegas vibe totally got her into the vacation spirit, and the food was pretty good, but unfortunately the service marred our evening.  Ordered the escargot appetizer ($16) - they were okay, it wasn't the best version I've had, and server did not replenish the bread so that we could enjoy the herbs and oil. Maybe we should have had the seafood-stuffed mushroom caps our server recommended. We had the Caesar salad for the table, prepared tableside ($12/pp) - was disappointed that no anchovies were used in the preparation considering the price, but I liked the croutons. Found it odd that the salad guy did not make eye contact, speak to us, or engage with us at all? Awkward. We waited an hour for our entrees- the Chicken of the Angels (egg battered chicken with artichokes and mushrooms), was incredible, tender and moist without being too heavy. The prime rib (rare as requested, with both fresh horseradish and horseradish cream) was decent, but the creamed spinach  was wayyy too rich.  Our server was absent for the majority of our visit, and was condescending when he was around. He asked for our order twice within 5 minutes of being seated, then copped an attitude when we asked where our food was after an hour of waiting. We let him know we had plans and he was rude about it instead of apologetic. His attitude was completely unnecessary and just made the experience even worse. After we wolfed down our entrees, he took his time coming back and getting our check- I had planned to order dessert, but he took so long that it wasn't an option.   Then, he stood over my shoulder and pointed at the gratuity chart and stared me down as I entered his tip! Completely uncalled for, unprofessional, and disrespectful. Bringing the portable card reader to the table is a tacky move in the first place but there's a way to handle it professionally, and this wasn't it. I was so embarrassed to have picked this spot for my mom to experience a nice dinner on vacation- she commented that even the sports bar we'd gone to the night before had superior service compared to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Signage
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot

ZYJiRXj79SYcLaIQa2cEnQ.text: Las Vegas classic! Great old-school steakhouse ambience. I try to visit here at least once whenever I am in town. Very flavorful filet Mignon. Fabulous tiramisu! Quality selection of wines by the glass. Professional, friendly service.

xkyrKQ0aJTG8LLrUka4tbQ.text: Great atmosphere, fantastic service, and a Fillet Mignon to die for!    The booths have pictures & plaques of the old-time celebrities who used to sit there, from Frank Sinatra to Clint Eastwood. I just wish I could have gone around to see them all.   Carl was a fantastic waiter, and his table side Cherries Jubilee was excellent. We both had the Fillet Mignon topped with King Crab. The Fillet was perfectly cooked, and the best cut of meat I have ever had. Better than Ruth Chris, and I have never had any complaints about their food.   Give the Golden Steer Steakhouse a try next time you are in Vegas, you won't be disappointed.

Kw54VRsY3n0LBbo0cC92EQ.text: Outstanding! Service excellent! We were treated with the up most respect. Treated like royalty. Food was excellent, I had the filet and scampi my husband had the filet and lobster. A bit pricey but was well worth it. It was for our 31st wedding anniversary. We sat in Sammy Davis Jr's. booth, if walls could talk.

mZchUQcISbpFv31l29fLGw.text: Not that I am a Vegas steakhouse expert, but this place remains one of my favorites for different reasons beyond the excellent food. From the outside youd never guess the inside. Looks unassuming from the lot but after entering you get transported back 40 or 50 years, in a good way. Retro Vegas, retro steakhouse. Always presently greeted at the door and once seated the various staff attend to ever need. Usually attending server will spend a little time getting to know you, making you feel more like special guest than customer.

RiO95dC_RDa0mjJF5H9mWA.text: Best prime rib I have ever had! My daughter had the Filet, this place is really nice, and the food is the best! Highly recommended! Food cooked perfectly, portions are good and quality of the meet is spot on!

a-TwmV7h1HuB7JSBjm9j7g.text: To wrap up the foodie portion of my recent Vegas adventure, a friend of mine suggested my boyfriend and I join him at the oldest steakhouse in Vegas: The Golden Steer Steakhouse. I was swimming in visions of going to the trendier, newer restaurants on the strip but decided to roll with his suggestion to treat ourselves and experience old Vegas.   Our hotel happened to the be on the Northern part of the strip, which is where the restaurant is as well. I was feeling slightly apprehensive as this is the least active part of the strip and the venue is part of a tiny strip mall but as the old saying goes, never judge a book by its cover.  Walking in, it was like we were transported to 1950's Vegas. The venue isn't by any means touristy but rather the entire place was kept as it always has been (for the most part) and the servers were dressed up, photos of old Hollywood stars and musicians are scattered across the walls and the booths were delightfully old school (we sat opposite of Marilyn Monroe's go-to booth!). The decor was vintage and the ambiance was sophisticated and cool.  Menus were large in size and the prices meant business - especially since this was also suppose to be the best steakhouse in Vegas. We had one main server while others tended to our drinks and set up our table for each course. There was clearly a team effort happening behind-the-scenes and our main sever was extremely polite and patient answering our questions on the different cuts they offered and helping us make a decision.   Much to my wallet's dismay, I went with the $44 8oz petite filet mignon. They would not serve it medium rare but instead served it medium well. For each preference as to how we liked it cooked to how the food is typically prepared, our server went into great detail as to what we would expect. When my PFM arrived, it was exactly what he said it would be, except juicier. My boyfriend ordered the same as I did and my friend ordered the $40 10oz Prime Rib of Beef: English Cut. That of course was fatty but still very enjoyable and absolutely massive - he couldn't even finish it.  To share, we turned down their famous Caesar salad - which is made in front of every table - and instead enjoyed mashed potatoes and 2 pieces of broccoli so large you would think they were on steroids.  Since we spent the day abusing the Daquirri bars, the boyfriend and I opted to not have wine.  This was a shame as most people know you can enjoy a fine red wine with this meat but at least one of us was able to navigate their extensive wine list and order a glass of red.    In between bites, I took advantage to check out the scene around me. The people dining were older than us but not quite baby boomers and the music, like the venue, was old school. Trolleys would roll by and servers put on a sort of show making each salad and serving it - think old school steakhouse meets your favorite Mexican place that makes the guac right in front of you. Other people chose not to enjoy the steaks but enjoy the Italian and Seafood options instead. Once the meal was over, we were able to pay cash and with two cards (despite the ominous one check per table request) and looked over the dessert menu. Though we had no room for dessert, it did not look worth over stuffing myself for as they mostly covered the basics (think creme brulee). In the end, it was totally worth the splurge and made me appreciate Vegas  for what it used to be before all the glitzy celebrities of the new Millennium took over. The only real hurdle was not finding transportation there - because there are so many hotels and Ubers - but leaving. Cabs don't seem to frequent this part of the strip so you may want to call ahead, download Uber/Lyft whatever or simply wait.

_lIkj7b_9YIUBnTCQPpf-A.text: This place is where you find the beat of everything.  Special place that is one of the few place where the Rat Pack and many other celebrities walked.  Surly in their very booths and enjoy!  The Caesar's Salad is add tables side and the twice stuffed potato is decadent....  the steaks oh my!

bX112oZJJPlIxOz9Qlj3Ug.text: I think this is one of those places you visit for nostalgic reasons only. It's a cool idea of hanging where the rat pack did. We were celebrating an anniversary and I requested the frank Sinatra booth. I was bummed that no one acknowledged our anniversary or even asked if we were celebrating anything special. We like to go to Echo & Rig in Tivoli village. It's our favorite but I convinced my husband to try something new. The filet was good, not great. My lobster tail was over cooked. The crab cocktail was very good. For the price point I thought the service should be more welcoming. At Echo & Rig they actually remember your name or if you are celebrating an anniversary and make it a special occasion every time you dine. We won't come back because of this.

Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9BNcQDFhPETviQyLYBDWew.text: One of the great steak houses in Vegas did not disappoint. I had the 22oz ribeye and it was cooked to perfection! Plus the table side tossed Caesar salad was worth an extra $12. I recommend this to anyone visiting who is looking for a solid food meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 22oz Ribeye - A real nicely done steak! Better then most of the big name steakhouses on the strip

ylTQWyZUftqpCTNXZOAzKA.text: I love a throwback steakhouse, but this one missed the mark. I did enjoy that we were seated in a nice, big booth. Unfortunately, the staff was cold and slow. Both of our steaks came out wrong. You would think a place that has been cooking steaks for about half a century could get a steak cooked to temperature. I will note that the prices are definitely a bargain as compared to the modern steakhouses on the strip. Anyway, the whole experience was a disappointment. If you're in Vegas and want a blast from the past steakhouse, check out Hugo's Cellar.

TdGpV441rO9HSa9ROFBkCg.text: Old school steakhouse, waiter was from when they first opened. Good food, friendly staff.

NV24AeoYN6aRtAd9DZoeSg.text: If you're looking to celebrate something, or just want a great meal with exceptional service Golden Steer is the place. It's been here since 1958, I moved to Vegas in 1992 and unfortunately it took me until 2018 to get here. Too bad I didn't come sooner. I ordered the Lobster Thermidor, an old school dish that was absolutely delicious. The lobster was cooked perfectly and as for the sauce, they could have brought me a bowl of it. The rest of our party ordered filets and asparagus. We also shared the table side Caesar salad. The steaks were cooked perfectly, and it was nice to have old school service with the salad. After dinner we ordered the Bananas Foster, also prepared table side. Once it hit the table, it disappeared quickly.  Topped off with great service. A great dining experience in Las Vegas.

IPKAbtPRdPEZxMDjZPop8w.text: Having to booked last minute for a good stake house in Las Vegas was a pain. Luckily this place has a cancellation and got the spot right away. When I booked it was for a birthday celebration and also to end our trip with good dining.    The city's oldest steakhouse, this legendary restaurant has hosted diners like Mohammad Ali, Frank Sinatra, Elvis Presley, and Nat "king" Cole to name the few since 1958. The atmosphere is truly vintage, old-style Vegas at its most unreconstructed. Stepping into the Steer is like stepping into a museum.. A world of old school elegance, tuxedoed waiters, red leather banquettes and a rolling Champagne cart.   With its impeccable service.  Comes with great food steaks are classic: large, juicy and perfectly grilled and there famous classic tableside Caesar Salad from scratch , which is very authentic, using lemon juice. It has a strong but delicious flavor from the fresh cracked eggs and anchovies, and includes Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, oil and fresh baked croutons. Yummm!! And there award winning wine list so much too choose from.  A True classic Las Vegas steakhouse that has been in business for decades.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A surprise complimentary cheese cake for the birthday celebrant
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. T bone stake

yRza85UbZ--FKnVUcddhqw.text: I don't know how I originally found this place, because the outside looks like a location in an episode of "COPS". The inside is great! It let's you peek into the rat pack era, without the fabrication.   This was my third trip to Golden Steer.  I Started with a Dirty Martini which was very good. As a tradition, I ordered the Oysters on the half, which were fresh but less tasty then previous dinners. The plump shrimp cocktail made up for the oysters. I ordered the bone in ribeye (usually my favorite cut), but also had some of the wifes filet. I would do the filet here. Both were seasoned well. The sides (creamed spinich, wild rice) were just so so.   The service was excellent, like each visit. I most like this place for the atmosphere, steak and service, but rate it 4 overall.  The strip mall location doesn't fit today's vegas. (to be fair, they cant move it. Its the oldest steakhouse in vegas).  But if you don't want that manufactured, trying to look old school steakhouse, look past the exterior and try it.

FPkpa3JUFfiYJK04TpxBtQ.text: This is one of the most over priced steak houses in town. I always drive by and have heard good things. On a spur of the moment me and the wife went here. We weren't dressed to the nines but we were a lil casual considering a steak house. I always find the staff at steakhouses to be generally awkward and overly in your face helpful. The service towards us as opposed to the other table was the exact opposite. Not sure if it's the way we looked or maybe he didn't think we had $. Either way service was a 1 star rating and food was a 3.5 star. For the price I wase expecting a lot more. Ceaser salad was great. They make it in front of you but you have to get ceaser for at least 2 people. Food was good not great. They do bananas foster flambouyed in front of you. I'd rather go to any restaurant on the strip and pay strip prices with a view then go here.

KnCTQD0Xh3VA253LWRaNLg.text: At Golden Steer I finally found a ribeye steak better than I can make at home.  If you are a steak lover and in Vegas make the effort to find this place.  Everything about this ribeye was right - the quality of the meat, the proper melted marbling, the correct seasoning and the temperature.  Just fantastic!  If you order a potato be sure to have someone along to share it - it's huge!  If you looking for the best steak rather than the coolest atmosphere this place should be your destination.

v2lOjdPZ1HC1HSUliC9Vaw.text: I have visited this wonderful old-school steakhouse twice and can't wait to return next time in Vegas. The staff is friendly and the servers are very entertaining with their jokes & antics. The food is top-notch and the steaks are cooked to perfection.

wDh6zkhTeB1Hx3SjlDDJ_Q.text: I don't see what the big deal is about this place.  In Vegas for a trip away from the wives, we ended up at this old school steakhouse.  It started off well when the bellman at the hotel complimented us on our choice for dinner.  When we got to the restaurant, it was a bit bland outside. Picture a generic and plain front with the strip mall look.  We were seated into a booth, Mickey Rooney's!, and looked around to find a pretty empty room. It was a Thursday night at 7pm so we expected a bit more traffic in there.  The service was attentive enough (even when the waiter spilled a beer on the seat next to me).   Come to think of it, he apologized but provided nothing more than getting me an extra napkin to get the beer from the seat and my pants. I didn't press it as much as I should have.   An omen of things to come?  We skipped the starters since nothing was jumping out as us so we focused on the mains and sides.  Josh got the prime rib. I got a T-bone.   Neither of us were happy.   Both were ok to start, not bad, but not at all worth the price. We never felt that it was the best piece of meat we ever got in at a restaurant.    There were no happy plates.  (Moreover, we both felt a little "off" after finishing.)  For the sides, we got broccoli, sauteed mushrooms, and the whipped potatoes. I can't speak for the little trees but the mushrooms were good enough while the potatoes were too buttery. I only tasted butter.  Our intention was there to try something off the strip and something historic. Next time in Vegas, and there always be a next time, I'll find some other old school place.  So, skip it.   (I rounded up to 2 stars due to the fact it's been around so long.)

ctX1p9QqRepY9ACdmCcIIg.text: We got seated by our host and the first thing that I recognized was that we were sitting at Burt Reynolds table. As I looked around, all the other tables were marked with famous actors' names. Whenever a certain actor comes into the restaurant to eat, they get to eat at their table. It's pretty neat. Clint Eastwood's table was right across from ours, so I went over there and sat down. It sounds weird, but it was kind of cool to be sitting at Clint Eastwood's table and where he had sat and dined.  The restaurant has an old fashioned feel to it. It has wood paneling and the lights are dimmed down with Sinatra playing in the background. All the staff were wearing tuxedo's. Don't worry though, I ate in t-shirt and shorts. I felt a little out of place.  The first thing that really impressed me was that when we ordered their famous Caesar salad, the waiter mixed the dressing and lettuce right in front of us. It was one of the best salads that I've had in a long time.  If you love prime rib, this is the place to go! The Golden Steer is famous for it and they do not disappoint. When I cut through the steak, it felt like butter. The steak was cooked perfectly and I can say without a doubt, that it was the best prime rib that I've ever had.  Coupled with the history and the outstanding food, I can't think of better dining experiences. Every time someone asks me for a dining suggestion in Vegas, I always mention this restaurant. It is a little out of the way, but it is the perfect getaway to the hustle and bustle of the strip.

Uvin8uGJBnK6EvVopuSWfA.text: I recommend ordering signature items, that's what I did and thoroughly enjoyed my visit to a legendary steakhouse.  I had the Prime Rib and twice-baked potato upon recommendation from the staff.  Thanks Golden Steer for a warm welcome to the community.

do9TwPiwcjlFaYgeiamxMg.text: Vintage Vegas quite possibly at its best!  I have been going here for years.  Steaks are big, but not cheap. Get a steak-why order pasta or fish at a place known for its steaks!?!? And the steaks taste incredible!  This is traditional steakhouse food-no modern dining here.  Most steaks are about $35 average with NO sides!  Get the giant baked potato and tableside made Caesar Salad!  This place has been around since 1959 or so.  Sinatra is constantly on the muzak.  It is a block from the Sahara , so it is close to the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-rgkfMLXJOOZNv-EYjrO2Q.text: Over priced, tough steak, blan potatoes. The waiter had a pretentious attitude, . We will never patronize this establishment again.

VmZWITMR7yjTCFRW3vdOoQ.text: This is where one can pay a lot of money for a prefabricated meal!  Although the ambiance and service were very nice for an older section of town, the food was nothing short of mediocre and not worth the money we paid!

PGPOXtcdNbLWYMeIUG0VoA.text: The best steak I have had in years! Stephanie was definitely the hostess with the mostess! The table side made Caesar salad was fresh and crispy and the dressing was ooo lala. I would give this restaurant a FIVE STAR.

OgwAyOE7rWF_x7-_bSfRdA.text: 3 stars for the food. one extra star for the atmosphere/old vegas experience. don't let the outside strip mall location deter you from trying golden steer. Inside its beautiful....old school to the nth degree. photos of rat packers are everywhere..waiters wear tuxedos...hostess is especially nice and friendly....Sinatra music plays softly on the speakers...just wish the food would live up to the ambiance they create. Not that the food is bad...but its very expensive and for what they charge it should be better! we started with an  old fashion and manhattan cocktails and were all pleased. Caesar salad was made tableside and received rave reviews. French onion soup was tasty. steaks were fine.....$52 for a rib eye!! NY strip clocked in at $48! the twice baked potato was delicious while beware of the creamed spinach...my daughter thought it was "tainted". highlight of the meal was probably the bananas foster..again prepared tableside and enough to share...what a dessert! the entire experience is positive...the meal part..not so much..just typical. get off the strip just  to say you've been there. Its a slice of las vegas that's hard to find anymore.

mZKyH9wKrtSRAOlpGyc-xQ.text: I went to Vegas this past week with my daughter and my friend and her daughter, both girls were celebrating their 21st b-day.  We made reservations at this old school old Vegas steak house and man was I IMPRESSED!  When we walked in they knew who we were, they greated us so kindly, they gave us a great table where we could see the whole restaurant.   The hostess was so friendly she even came and sat wtih us for a bit after dinner to ask us how our experience was.   The menu had so much good stuff on it i could not decide!  We had steak and salads and appetizers and delicious wines from the huge wine menu.  The waiters work as a team so you can ask any of them for whatever you need.  They were all friendly and helpfu and funny!  I was impressed all the way and would recommend this to anyone and everyone for the old time Vegas steakhouse experience. The prices were also reasonable and we had an amazing meal for a deal!

GUyGNnCiBm8c4uxQG2j5jQ.text: Was really hoping to like this place because of all of the good reviews however I was sorely displeased. The location for this place sucks. Upon entering and being intimidatrd by thr dress code enforced sign we weren't greeted at all. After finding someone to recognize us we were seated and I immediately tried to redeem my Groupon. FYI my phone was acting up in this place so make sure you are able to pull up your groupon prior to ordering. We asked the waiter about their combo meals and holy wow they were almost all 100$ or more. Way more expensive than any other Steakhouse I've been to before. We ordered garlic bread and twice baked potato because of good reviews but I was sorely unimpressed. For $5 we got 3 pieces of dry garlic bread that was crumbly and overseasoned. The free bread is a wayyyyyyyyyy better deal. My gf and I ordered filet mignon which cam out burnt on the outside sitting in a pool of brown water w a single leafy garnish. Worst plating I have seen thus far. They do get one star because the center of my meat was pretty decent. The twice baked potato reminded me of the kind you can buy at the store in the freezer section and microwave. It was dry dry dry and just yuck! I didn't finish mine at all. During our meal we were sort of ignored by all of the staff which is quite odd as they spent plenty of time yacking to an elderly couple right next to us. The bill came and low and behold the guy that took our Groupon forgot to remove it from our bill. Even with a Groupon I thought I overpaid. I have to agree with others saying this place has old school prices for food that I guess is catered towards old people? As a local I will never be back nor refer anyone to this outfit.

370hLeZz53GDaOebb3o0Yw.text: Golden Steer is trading on its Vegas history. We started w crab cakes, lobster bisque, and salads. Salads were very good, but apps were avg. For entrees we had ribeye and fillet. Both ok...not bad but nothing special. Wine list was just ok. Nothing was bad but the prices were similar to higher end steak restaurants and food just wasn't that good. I'd prefer to go to Del Friscos or several other places. The live piano/singer in the bar was nice.

9ooOkHaoLCKgePlB2GM-zQ.text: Old school steakhouse off the strip near downtown.  Steak was perfectly cooked and delicious!  The ambiance was liking walking back into 1958 with red booths and dim lights.  The service however, was extremely lacking.  Our server poured our wine and we basically never saw him again.  We had to ask water refills.  That marred the experience for us.

Jg9Mgs6TUjbyOGlaHrD-Cw.text: Fun old school feel at Golden Steer. We were seated and ordered drinks. O e came wrong so they had to remake it. Orders were taken and the Caesar salad was made table side- very good.  Unfortunately, our entrees came while still eating our. Salad and they hovered tableside until we were done with the salad. My filet, ordered butterflied wasn't and they twice tried to clear while we were still eating. Overall, it was good, but there were several small mistakes and they rushed us like no tomorrow.  Done and out in less than 50 minutes.  For their prices, you should be able to savor the meal longer.

LZvaSnNlvoB6r-xBp3BGLw.text: Well, I wasn't expecting much when I came here -- oldest steakhouse in Vegas? Old rat-pack haunt? They can pretty much phone it in -- which the waiters do, or did on this particular night. But while the service and starters were crap, the steak really was wonderful. I was pleasantly surprised after such a poor start. I had a bone-in rib-eye, packed with flavor and tender. Friends enjoyed their fillet mignon as well. The steaks made up for the whole night. The asparagus and mash were pretty decent, though the cream of spinach was watery and the worst I've had anywhere.   I came for the experience as much as the food and it was 'interesting,' in a good way There was a Marylin lookalike kicking around, and a sign above our booth told us Joe DiMaggio used to eat where we were sitting. Still a formal dining experience but with a bit of kitsch thrown in.   Is it possible for waiters to be very nice and act like they don't give a crap at the same time? Pretty much what they managed here. We got no service for a half hour and then four guys came by in quick succession. One waiter told us he was from Belarus (I think) and then a Mexican waiter came by, and then the Belarus guy came back and said, 'You're all white folks so don't listen to what the Mexican says'. He was joking, they were friends, I guess, but it was inappropriate enough to add to the surreal humor of the evening.  I wouldn't rush back because of the service and the sides/starters -- the salad and calamari we started with were decidedly average -- but really, the steak saved it and got them from 2 stars to 3. And that's what you go there for after all.

xE5-5UY-akH43zVJOA0NJQ.text: You have to be doing something right in Vegas to be open since the 1950's. Well the Golden Steer does service right. Everyone from the hostess to the bartender and waiters are actually glad that you went out of your way to stop by the Steer.   This place IS old school Vegas, table side salads, deep red leather booths and waiters in formal wear.  Start with a martini (gin, vermouth, olive) and enjoy a good experience.  The wine list has some nice selections at reasonable prices ($30-45). The menu has a nice selection of both beef and Italian. I'm a fan of the prime rib.

SmgBUsXkkFwOQBSUg9yDzA.text: There are not many wonderful old Vegas left in town.  My first trip to Golden Steer was a wonderful experience, fun full of history and great food. TIMES HAVE CHANGED. I will say the waiters are still very attentive and full of stories about the glory days of the Golden Steer - we heard our waiter tell 4 tables the same story. The decor fairly rundown but you can overlook it at times to try and get into the spirit of old Las Vegas.  The food tonight just plain not good and far too expensive for what it was.  The shortcuts are evident and the quality compeltely gone.  The frozen lobster tail was $100.  The New York steak had a prime rib au jus poured on top that shouldn't be there and on top of that was so obviously from a powdered packet that it was insulting.  The waiter suggested a twice baked potato that tasted like it had been in the refrigerator since my last visit two years ago. The whole experience made me sad as we are obviously losing another Vegas landmark, as return customers at this time must be few and far between. Bottom line we could have spent the same money or less at Botero or Scarpetta and been wowed by the food - truth is being mugged for the $500 would have been less painful then this meal.

tv8p2KUbFGD5t5ZqAmFEsA.text: We have been coming here for many, many, many years. Haven't been for the past 5 years or so, decided to re-visit some old school charm! No sooner were we seated that we were asked what we wanted to drink and what we wanted to order. I had to explain we were in no hurry to order dinner, wanted a drink first. While waiting for our one drink and bottle of wine, two more servers appeared to ask for our order.  Finally we gave in, not even 1/2 way through our drinks. Caesar salad still served tableside, server overdid the oil so all you tasted was oil. Ordered the filet, medium rare, was served to me raw+, sent it back and within seconds (no time whatsoever) to cook was served to me again and yep, raw, couldn't even cut it with a knife. Seriously? The best steakhouse in Las Vegas...not anymore. Decided not to chance a 3rd time. The baked potato was a baked potato. The bearnaise that was served with the first filet, sat there and got cold while someone in the kitchen attempted to cook the filet to medium rare.  The veal parmesan was adequate. Nothing special so much sauce you couldn't see the veal. They did remove the filet from our check and offered dessert but by that time we were so aggravated we paid our bill and left. Nothing like it used to be with the exception of the restaurant itself. Lastly, they need to get some servers who speak English. Don't bother, go to CUT inside the Palazzo.

kPPFJsp7HkkWiwxeG4xkPg.text: They say that you shouldn't judge a book by it's cover, and this is definitely the case with The Golden Steer. From outside of the building you would never know what lies within. The facade looks like a cheesy run down Vegas spot, but inside the rich burgundy leather seating, crisp white linens, dim-but warm lighting, and pleasant atmosphere is anything bust cheesy and run down. The service is spectacular, the food is nothing less than perfect, and the over all experience is great. Locals and regular visitors alike love and frequent this place. On the more expensive side, but worth the price, the Golden Steer is a place where you are likely to find a high profile public figure or celebrity at the next table. It's a great place to treat yourself or your travel companions to a special dinner with your gambling winnings.

_1E2i4Ije170ESgDVkKE8Q.text: This place is straight out of the Sopranos.  The food is excellent.  It's a steak house, but they also serve Italian food.  Everything is good that I've tasted.  The stuffed mushrooms "BOMB".  The place looks like an absolute dump from the outside, but when you walk in the restaurant  is top flight.

kNltouooN81Pf0Bz__batQ.text: Old School Vegas.Fernando the waiter has been there over 30 years.he is a class act.steaks are prime and very good .very tender,with a nice charr.the may have the best baked potato ive ever had.little pricy but well worth when in vegas

IimJlGukQ-ezIjUEtleBsw.text: I am being generous when I give this place three stars.  The ambience is very posh and the service is unrivled, but the quality of the food for the price is really sub-standard.    I ate here, after hearing about all of the great stories about this place.  The staff is quick to tell you about all of the famous people that ate there including the infamous Chicago mobster Tony "The Ant" Spilatro, but how does that make this pace special?  Ok, if your on a date it is a really nice atmosphere that kind of takes you back to the old days, but the food is a "let down"  The rib-eye is good, but for $40 bucks, my God!  Not worth it!  Trust me when I say Morton's has a much better steak for the money.  However, the appitizers are excellent.  The escargot are done very well along with the oysters, and I must say the desert was fantastic!  The Cherries Jubillee I highly recomend as well as the bannanas foster.    So if you plan on stopping by and just getting a few appitizers along with desert with a date, this place is great.  If you plan on stopping by and getting a whole steak meal with the works, you will be dissappointed along with the two hundred dollar bill for two people!

Yel79VnfYLiDsNQnlaNTWA.text: The steak was delicious.  We shared the 20 oz steak between two people and  was still unable to finish it.  The escargo and twice baked potato was also very good.  The food was good, but quite pricey.  The ambience was dark and decorated in old style, so it may not be the best date place.  Reservations are not needed.  I made reservations online through OpenTable, but when I got there, the restaurant was almost empty.  They didn't even record that I honored my reservation.

LjONgCWKjmPDaFrbV0vf3Q.text: The food and ambiance were above average.  We ordered the French Onion soup, the crab cakes, a prime 8 ounce filet, and the king crab legs.  The prices were comparable to other high end steak restaurants. Drink orders were fill promptly but food orders took a little more time than expect for the amount of diners that were in the restaurant.  The server (his name was Jay) seemed pretentious and to have a classist attitude. I don't know if it was because we were the youngest ones in the place or not.  The waiters attitude wasn't bad enough to give this place a 3 star rating until we got our bill.  Our bill came (didn't have the our gratuity added to it yet) and it seemed right so I paid with a gift card.  When I got the charge slip back it showed my remaining balance on my gift card to be lower that it should have been.  I called my gift card to see how much was charged and it was $30 OVER what was printed on the charge slip.  We called the waiter over the inquire why my gift card was overcharged.  He said that the tip was already included in the bill.  I told him that he had no idea what we were going to tip and that gratuity was not automatically included with only a party of two.  He then got the manager who ran the card with my tip (which was 20% of the bill - $29.13) and said that it ran without a problem.  No apology given by the waiter or the manager was given.  This seemed highly dubious to me.  The pre-tip charge slip must have been printed and voided out and then reran for the higher amount.  It felt like the waiter was trying to guarantee himself a 20% tip without our knowledge.  The way the waiter and manager handled it felt like this fraudulent activity is a very common occurrence at this establishment.  My advice to anyone frequenting this establishment is to thoroughly inspect your bill and to pay CASH only.  It was an unfortunate event that ruined and otherwise pleasant dining experience.

vvrDaWIAVE8yBdJklVZOaw.text: the atmosphere was nice.  old italian and most of the staff was authentic italian.  the best waiter there is Fernando.,  He is attentive and has a great sense of humor.  the main problems are the food and prices.  we were two.  we ordered the 24oz prime rib.,  but it was not warm enough.  the bill for two with one glass of wine and 2 drinks was $150 a bit steep for what we got.

nCA6O3_9atEuf3ynuxblaQ.text: stiff drinks, mahogany and red velvet interior and plenty of red meat.  do you need anything more? they even have booths where sinatra and the rat pack used to come and dine.

Ucm7pBL9ocTL9Vq5G_NaQQ.text: The steaks are a 5 star experience. The other stuff is good but not great. We love the place except some of the waiters are a little too schmaltzy/jokey. One in particular makes some really off color jokes that are just not cool in a lot of ways & he NEVER lets up. Again, the beef here is sublime.

SVLYI9dyrb14dad9gyONWQ.text: My favorite steak house.  This is a place where the OGs go.  Doesn't get any more legit than this.  Lots of history behind this place.

b_XmjZSbeBJDNAkjXRpG2Q.text: I have been a resident since the 70's and this was my first experience at the Golden Steer.  I was very impressed by the staff and the food.  The experience was very pleasant and we were treated to a tour of the restaurant after dinner, with details of it's impressive past.  I will definitely be back!

2Ufd6UUjAvoLTk2Q7EmeWw.text: The best of the best in Las Vegas.  Best wait staff, best martinis, best caesar made at the table (!!!!!!!!!), best steaks - no steakhouse in Las Vegas can come close to Golden Steer.  And you get old school history to boot!  It just does not get better than this.

Wg9M-KYQHNXww8hf2yy5Rw.text: Great piece of meat. I didnt know what to expect from this place but they definitely surprised me. The service was good but not great. No complaints though. I will definitely come back.

fHEfXp1rRjyPBuNult3-yQ.text: This is a great place, although it looks unassuming from the outside (it's located in a strip mall just off the Strip). It has been open since 1958 and has a really great "rat pack" feel to it, which is appropriate considering Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin, Sammy Davis, Elvis, etc. came here often. Each table has a plaque behind it with a celebrity name of someone who dined at that spot; we sat at the Mickey Rooney table. Service is very professional with career waiters in tuxedos. One waiter has been there for 30 years. I had the prime rib, which is their specialty (they have a number of other beef cuts too). It was the best prime rib I have ever had...about an inch and a quarter thick and big. You will find a lot of classic steak house dishes here...tomato & blue cheese salad, creamed spinach, french onion soup, etc. All are very tasty and far more than routine. Most salads and desserts are made at your table by the waiters. The place has a very grown up vibe, not really a place for kids. Although there were a couple of people dining in shorts and t-shirts, I would advise guests to get in the spirit of the place; grow up and dress up! It's not cheap; prime rib alone is $35, add on all sides, appetizers & drinks, etc. Lobster and filet mignon combo was listed that night at $95. That said, I felt the experience was well worth it. I will definitely go back.

kMb3CRltREistkR6aU7F4Q.text: Worst service I have ever had, and i eat out almost every meal.  I thanked the server every time he came to the table after he dropped off the check he mumbled your welcome as he walked away. Be prepared to pay gratuity it says for 6 or more on the check but our server either couldn't count or figured the 5 of us were to cheap to tip. When the food arrived i asked for another bud light halfway though the meal he came by and asked if i still wanted my Coors light i told him bud light he took one of the two empty ones away and came back ten min later with a coors light when i said no sir it was a bud light he acted like i was lying and snatched up the other emlty bottle he left earlier looked at it then said he was sorry he would bring the right one. Ten min later i got the correct beer the check and the mumbled your welcome as he walked away. Never expected such poor service from a place with 7$ beer and 50$ steaks go elsewhere it can't be worse.

dmvi8W8BnYK1ttpZlJOsJg.text: If your looking for that "old vegas" style restaurant.  Golden Steer is your place! still on of the best pieces of meat in the city

d4AixfffBLjjsIMINrbNjw.text: not sure what happened to my  original review from 8/8/2010 ,,,ONE WORD,,, EXCEPTIONAL !!  We dined here for the first time  on a late sunday evening last weekend . This old school steakhouse is a True gem , simply the classic days of vegas ,with dim lighting ,rounded red and black booths surrounding the dining areas. Just to step into this time capsule  where the great performers of the past dined was truly a memorable experience especially from a change of pace from the newer overrated trendy joints.  The best steak I have ever had ( NY 16OZ )  along with a fantastic tableside prepared caesar salad and all the great side dishes.  Everything was outstanding  from the desserts,drinks , atmosphere as well as the friendly service  from all the staff which was top tier and of course our  many thanks go out  to Fernando , the Maitre d'  who entertained us with his funny humor  and out of this world hospitality . It was like a dinner and a show all in one as well as  some good laughs and conversation with some nice folks across the table from us . To sum it up , great food, great service and great feel of the ambiance of  old classic vegas .  It was a perfect dining experience to end the perfect weekend  . When in town guaranteed to be back for sure   !!!

QEpY4MFSYzBfBx-k3QvRKg.text: Great feel as I entered the restaurant, so I was optimistic.  I ended up just being disappointed.  My $50 NY strip was marginal at best.  I have have a fair share of $50 steaks, and this was sub par flavor and actually tough.  My table ordered veal and it was over done and dry.  Caesar salad had no anchovies.    A lot of potential, but failed in execution.  Manager never came by to check on our experience, and the waiter was disengaged.

FYoIHMu-cIABupIrep33Ow.text: Old school steakhouses are OK in my book. Last night was my first time at Golden Steer. The service was excellent as soon as I walked in the door. Camacho is one funny guy. I love the decor of this place. Lots of booths. Warm, dark and really really comfortable dim lighting.   The food. You ask?  Bone in ribeye - Soooo  gooood!!!! Cooked to medium rare perfection.very flavorful steak.   Filet - pink juicy center. Go meat.  Mushrooms - the sauce was awesome.   2x baked potato - its ok... this put our meal to  carbohydrate overload. I bit too much food I think for two people.   Overall, my experience here was pretty good. I'm pretty sure that I will be back.  Note: They have gaming machines at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy Yummy Filet!!!!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in ribeye steak !!!! Freaking awesome!

1ZLEwecQAGVgzAFPFNYM3w.text: Back in Vegas again. Starting to feel like my second home. What an old school classic joint. Feels like I'm in the old movie. The atmosphere was some what like a old gangster classic joint. I'm really enjoying this. Ordered me a glass of red wine and of course had to try the prime rib if beef: diamond him cut 24oz cooked rare. Not the best prime rib I've had but gotta admit on my top 5 list. I would recommend this experience to anyone. Need more joints like this back home.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now this is one nice prime rib

tgaaGJ6ljmaq5EOzURppyA.text: This place was sooooooooooo good the steak is still on mind even tho I was there a month ago and I am writing this now.  The old skool Vegas feel is there and knowing that the Rat pack ate there is awesome

50bYIJ3N2Uzp9c_TQmU2wQ.text: One of the best meals in Vegas! Very old school layout and the staff was very attentive.

w2_sOSWzidCNfSyV6BqLjQ.text: This place is such a gem! My boyfriend heard that the place had been around for a while, so we decided to try it. Boy, was that one of the best decisions he's made! It definitely doesn't look fancy on the outside but the inside is decorated with old celebrity photos, cozy, and extremely impressive! We ordered fresh oysters, and they were pretty good. Beware: their horseradish is no joke! It was good, but strong and unexpected. We also got the Caesar salad, which is prepared table side for two. Their steak is one of the best in town! They claim it's been the best since the 1950s, and they live up to the expectations. For a stand alone steak, with no fancy butters or seasonings, I recommend the golden steer. It is a great place for a date night, or close friends in an intimate environment. For dessert I reccommend the creme brulee...it's chocolate!

FPQRDZOGpAH5-Rfu0iMeIQ.text: Awesome old Vegas restaurant!  Dinner was amazing, service excellent, and atmosphere was great!  I would recommend this to anyone looking for an original Vegas restaurant that can transport you to a simpler, grander time.

Sr9XApM0w0oT_xSxRXnabA.text: I had heard of Carl. Carl the expert salad tosser. Carlthe king of Caesars. Carl the icon of lettuce.  I had expectations. I strolled in with my merry crew of hobos and drunkards lost in conversation.  We were seated in the deep warmth of vinyl plush cushions surrounded by history and glorious meat. But we were not swayed by these worldly temptations, we were focused on one thing and one thing only, that was Carl and his nimble delicate hands ready willing and able to commence the salad tossing extravaganza. A slight shiver and chill went down my spine as I sat there in anxious anticipation.  As the swirling and whirling of salad was tossed with the rich creamy sauce of Carls making, I was ready, ready to fork. All this salad tossing had me worked up. Each salad tossed made it's way to the table and i couldn't help myself, I started to fork one and then as I was near completion I started forking each ones tossed salad around me. I forked left and I forked right. Suddenly there was a frenzy of forking. I couldn't tell who was forking who and before I knew it the forking was over. The table was cleared and by the time the meat arrived we were all forked out. Alas jolly ole Carl came out with a smile and as the bill was paid we all looked at each other and knew we may never fork like this again.  But perhaps next time Carl,!perhaps next time.

3i6AXzNzJLwyibYqDNcSpQ.text: My husband David and I travelled here from St. Louis, MO, and were here for dinner on December 1, 2016. This restaurant was recommended to us by our Uber driver! We would never have discovered this place on our own as it sits in a strip mall and seems less than outstanding in its exterior. But WOW! what a surprise on the interior! That old-time "clubby" feel of leather, dark woods and brass and seeing what the old-school RatPack saw in this place. We were seated in the Sammy Davis Jr.'s booth, which was black leather in a semi-circle, very cozy with my hubby! We had garlicky escargot to start with, yummy, then our choice of Ceasar Salad was prepared tableside, even the dressing!  So good. We had rib-eyes, with baked twice baked potatoes, and the creamed spinach was so "over the top" I had to be held down to keep me from getting the recipe in the kitchen! Because the atmosphere was so wonderful and our waiter so attentive, we decided to prolong the experience and ordered Bananas Foster, which was flamed and prepared tableside. It was indeed fabulous, met and exceeded our expectations. Yes, this place is pricey, but so worth it! And we will be back the next time we visit Las Vegas. During the entire week we spent in Vegas, this place and one other were the only ones we would come back to. And you know Vegas has a ton of good restaurants.

1hnuCjkshhsYcZ9NKbhvEg.text: Fabulous old Vegas vibe. The seafood platter appetizer is the best we've ever had anywhere! Henry is a very attentive waiter and we always request him! Making a reservation for tonight!

Mxmoh7hPF5xXITtCj6HPWg.text: Worth the price for the atmosphere alone! Great steaks! All the courses were wonderful, Petite filet Oscar, T-bone, best Caesar salad ever, prawns the size of a short man's hand, toasted ravioli, fantastic cheesecake! Very nice of staff to celebrate birthday for us. A couple of loud mouth millennials without the capacity to follow unspoken rules of decorum should have been ejected, lucky for them Tony Spilatro wasn't there! Other than that, what a wonderful dining experience! Thank you Golden Steer for a wonderful night out in Old School Cool Vegas!

IF3o0MJslUcGjZph01oMRw.text: One of the best meals of my life.  Fabien was terrific - he understood we were there to take our time and enjoy ourselves and we certainly did.  He was friendly and knowledgable without being condescending.  But more importantly, the food!!!  Very memorable and very, very delicious.  I will measure all future steaks against the standard the Golden Steer set. A Vegas classic that delivers.

0kQyshE-F3-ScoEEmdt4Tg.text: This place is awesome.  Yes I visit this place frequently and Iv'e never had a bad meal.  All their chops are great, the service is great, the atmosphere is great which makes this a great place.  I would highly recommend to any and all.

sKyZ8997cwIn4oqWP3QtCg.text: Came in for an anniversary & was blown away by the service. Specifically Thomas. Ended up making the occasion very special. Will definitely be back in the future.

VhCY5QLcUKGNymTXqE1CEw.text: Wow! This is by far the BEST meal that I've ever had in Vegas. It made me regret spending $70 per person at Bacchanal Buffet in Caesar's the night before,  when I could've just come here for a higher quality meal. Everything was great, from the food to the service.  The Caesar's salad is made right at your table -- something that no other restaurant will do anymore because of health codes, but since the Golden Steer is the oldest restaurant in Vegas, it was grandfathered in. Freshly made Caesar salad is amazing and you can really taste the quality.  We started with the Seafood Platter and the King crab legs were so fresh and sweet that we didn't even need condiments. I got the filet and lobster combination and that came with a 16oz lobster!  I'm a huge seafood snob, and the lobster was clearly fresh and so succulent.  We ended with the creme Brule, which was pretty typical. Aside from the fresh and high quality seafood, I also loved how iconic the restaurant is.  We sat in Joe DiMaggio's personal booth, which is next to Clint Eastwood's booth and across from Marilyn Monroe's. It was also across the way from the rat pack's booth-- they used to come to the golden steer for drinks and food before their shows.  Very cool!  It was really neat to be in such a historic and iconic restaurant.  If you have the time and the funds, this place is definitely worth the experience. The host Mark and our server Tommy were splendid and ensured that we had a perfect dining experience. I will be returning!

m7SxzglHmhg_-PxkZu7mkQ.text: This was our first visit to The Golden Steer Restaurant in Las Vegas on Dec 8 ,2016. The waiter was prompt and attentive. The shrimp cocktail, Caesar Salads were great. Our main entrees, prime rib and a bone in rib eye, both cooked medium rare were a huge disappointment. We were unable to enjoy our main course since they were both tough and chewy. We left them on the plate and did not ask for a take out box. Needless to say this was our first and last visit to The Golden Steer. At 200.00 for a meal for two- one would expect more.

sESHKwblzl4Y_NtPc7KJFw.text: This place is truly amazing. Classy staff, excellent food and they play the best music!  Definitely going to be one of my "regular" places when in Las Vegas from now on!

o2TrL0NWa52F1PQriOstMA.text: Golden Steer Steakhouse is THE BEST steakhouse in Las Vegas and my family's personal favorite. Since the very first time we tried the oldest steakhouse in Las Vegas, we knew it would be our regular spot for special occasions and any day that ended in Y. We always always always ask for Tom because Tom gets it. We live in Las Vegas and have been in the service industry for many years so take it from us when we say the service is unmatched when we have Tom as our server. Frankly, the service is unmatched when Tom can't be our server but he's still in the building and coming over to our table knowing we requested him and checking in on us. Every time I send people to Golden Steer, I send them to Tom, and every time he doesn't disappoint. The most recent visit was just a couple of days ago and my friends were so impressed with the service that at one point someone said they totally expected someone from the waitstaff to come over with a toothbrush and clean our teeth. Let me not forget to mention the food. I don't really like prime rib, my husband loves prime rib. I now love prime rib at Golden Steer. We usually share the 24oz Jim Cut Prime Rib because the massive piece of meat that comes out to the table in all its perfection is more than enough to share between two people, especially when you order the largest baked potato in Las Vegas and the twice baked potato and a side of mushrooms. Don't forget to start with the fresh Caesar salad that they make table side for your enjoyment as well as starting with any of their amazing appetizers like the lump crab cakes or the toasted ravioli. Don't waste your time and money going to those heavily marketed, overpriced steakhouses on the strip. You want to try Golden Steer before your time in Las Vegas is over! Let them know if you're celebrating an event, they will make it a night you'll never forget!

BX3PUnaDDj6C35UWM3lyLQ.text: What a great meal.  The restaurant is in a horrible strip mall that you would normally just drive by, yet the moment you enter you know you are in for a great experience.  The food is excellent, the servers were all quite attentive, yet did not make us feel uncomfortable when we decided to spend some time after the meal was complete.  If there were to be a downside it is a bit pricey, $200 for two with no alcohol.  Yet the food was so good it seemed worth it.  I will return.

XRAe4Z8PkBJSBP4VV8aFHg.text: I'd heard about Golden Steer from other review. To keep this short and sweet, the food selection was average and the quality was average - with over 25 other steak houses that I've eaten at in the last 5 and a half years in Vegas, I won't be coming back for awhile. The service was average. There was nothing to write home about; for my money the Steak House at Circus Circus had similar ambience but far superior food and quality and yes, value for the money.

LG8835NpxbSPyAc5UI7sug.text: For my very first visit, I wanted to experience any vintage Las Vegas that still existed.  My research yielded the Golden Steer, and our experience was magnificent.  Away from the noise, hype, and over-priced cuisine of the strip, this classic 60s steakhouse has the decor, staff, menu, and presentation of a bygone era without being kitschy or fake.  It is completely authentic, from dark woods and red velvet chairs, to the western paintings and decor, to the low lighting and knowledgeable, friendly waiters in full tuxedos.  We enjoyed every second of it.  We intentionally ordered items prepared tableside, first Caesar salad and later Bananas Foster, so that we could be part of the experience and chat with the waiter.  He complimented our attire and my vintage necklace, saying it reminded him of a time when people knew how to  dress appropriately for dinner.  It made me smile, because that was exactly the experience we sought.  The wine list was classic and had plenty of great selections to accompany the menu.  The salad was flavorful and plentiful.  We chose escargot and Clams Casino as appetizers.  Both were delicious.  We did not soak up the escargot juices with the bread, but thinking back, I wish we had!  Our entrees were the 12oz filet and the T-bone with whipped potatoes and mushrooms as accompaniments.  I read one review that said the mushrooms were in a strange sauce, but I don't know where they got their taste buds.  They were perfectly sauteed in butter and garlic and full of flavor.  Had we not been in polite company, I am confident that my boyfriend would have chewed off what little meat remained on the bone when he finished!    For dessert, he had the chocolate cake, I had the Bananas Foster.  The preparation and end result were mouth watering!  The chocolate cake was good, nice and fudgy, but paled in comparison to the Bananas Foster.  Knowing that my boyfriend would inevitably steal some of mine, our waiter made us an extra large portion, so I could share.    I agree with the reviewer who noted that much of the charm and classic menu selections are lost on diners not old enough to remember the 60s.  If you want a 21st century experience, stay on the strip, but for those of us who were born in the 70s, but want to dine where Elvis, Frank, Dean, and Sammy dined, the Golden Steer hits the jackpot!
