MfcBtLKlPfKKaUrJaNRJJQ.text: The food was amazing as well. Went to Vegas to celebrate Bday, and this was by far the best food and service. We will be back for sure. Carl was our waiter and he was absoulty fabulous. Excellent service.

VUyLSaGMeIu7AoVCX8VIfQ.text: Amazing food, awesome staff! Knowing that the rat pack and Muhammad Ali were frequents is more than cool! Do your self a favor and get the creamed corn!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy beef heaven! I ordered the petit filet and my hubby got the bone in ribeye, both are outstanding!

hAXX3HwIU0xMGnph6HRNMQ.text: Let's start with the good things: escargot excellent; Caesar salad prepared table side one of the best of ever had, service excellent. Ambiance: Away from the noisy bar, excellent.  Now to "not so good:" I ordered my steak medium rare which, in all good restaurants means a "warm red center" and it came out rare to mooing. No big deal, mistakes happen. So I sent it back and 10 minutes later they brought me the same steak that had been reheated! C'mon guys, a fine dining restaurant knows that as soon as you cut into a steak the juices escape. I would expect a steak from a casino cafe to be reheated but not a fine restaurant! The steak should have been replaced with a fresh one, not reheated and dried out! Two people, 2 steaks, 2 baked potatoes, 1 shrimp cocktail and one escargot=$300.00! Definitely NOT worth the money.

T0o4trrV5PjGiNdvgKQGRQ.text: Easily, Easily one of my favorite steak houses and restaurants in Las Vegas or pretty much anywhere!   Been here since 1958 and is just a touch off the strip. The look is very old school mafia style, but NOT musky or stale smelling. Great photos of patron celebrities from the past on the walls and just an awesome wait staff that know that have made their career to be there. IT matters to them that you get great service and an great experience in coming there.  Started off with cocktails, (which were made with tremendous care), and they were spectacular! Had a Caesar salad that they prepared in front of us and was amazing! We also got the calamari with homemade marinara sauce, which was decadent! I had the bone in ribeye and my wife had the Alaskan crab legs, - that she absolutely loved and my 10 year old son had the salmon - that he said was one of the best that he has had!   For desert we had tiramisu, which was phenomenal!    We randomly got seated in what ended up to be Muhammed Ali's favorite booth to sit in when he visited...  Such an awesome experience! We look forward to coming here again!

uE5PiT_9f0ZmwELEVLuTOQ.text: Another great meal at Golden Steer.  Went all out with the Caesar salad to a great dessert.  The Steak Oscar was delicious.

bINgouBIvpNoHgWTN-9pag.text: Best meal I've had in Vegas so far and I've been going for years.   Porterhouse & Ribeye were to die for.  Perfectly cooked, nice char, and so tender.  The table-side Cesar salad and Bananas foster were also both amazing.  Cant wait to come back and bring my wife.

lNn_76LZMe2G797NSB--6A.text: My husband and I came here to celebrate his birthday and boy, did we have a treat. First, we came in an hour early because of some adjustments in our schedule and the staff accommodated us with no problem, The staff were so attentive and the service is great notwithstanding the fact that this is the place where John Wayne, Frank Sinatra, Marilyn Monroe and the other movie greats let loose and had dinner. My husband ordered the baked stuffed potato and the 22-oz bone-in ribeye while I had the 10 oz prime rib. They were both cooked the way we wanted them and ate to our hearts' delight.  We even had some left to go!. My hubby is already planning our next visit.That's how food it was!

6BIaGnGHuz4DvG0ojsdYSA.text: Best steak restaurant in Las Vegas. The place has a old Vegas feel about it. Very classy and definitely an upscale place. Expect great service and excellent food. I give this an A+

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very classy old school Steakhouse.

lD-CXAeHsF8CXVnwDUrvJQ.text: I'm shocked that there are only 3.5 stars for this place on yelp. If you've never been, don't let that deter you from trying it out.  On Sahara, just west of Las Vegas Blvd, look for the golden cow and park in their tiny parking lot. Then walk past the red velvet ropes, and step into the vestibule where a vintage cappuccino machine greets you. Don't bother checking the year on your cell phone, it still is 2015, but not inside this joint.  An old fashioned bar with frosted bordered mirrors and a seasoned bar tender, who's probably got more stories than a library, takes your drunk order. Pricey? You bet-cha! Worth it? Yes please! The drinks go down smooth and before you know it, your party is escorted through the restaurant by the maitre-d who happily points out the famous Marilyn Monroe booth, Elvis Presley booth, etc etc.  Yes, every single employee in there takes pride in the restaurant as if it were their very own. I'm assuming the cooks do too because the steaks were cooked to perfection. There is a signature Caesar salad that is prepared table side, which was fun to watch, and tasted great. We skipped on dessert, but maybe next time we'll try one. Yes, there will be s next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table side Caesar salad.

YmIhaFeWjxaFLTFO_hQDtQ.text: I've driven past this restaurant many times and had no idea of the history behind it or or what it was. This place was amazing! A bit in the pricey side dropped a pretty penny for dinner and a few bottles of wine for 4 of us. The history behind this establishment is very interesting as the Mobb used to frequent this restaurant often. The service was great our waiters were on point, yes you have to be patient as the other reviews stated. This is the kind of place you come to for dinner and sit and chat and enjoy the ambience and have some wine. We were there for 3 hours. The rib eye steak was cooked to perfection, oysters Rockefeller were delicious and the lamb chops were a favorite. It's dimly lit and old school decor with lots of historic memorabilia. We will definitely return!

Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters Rockefeller-highly recommend this delicious appetizer!

wjAUgvvOvIwuFR9DTzIExg.text: Short and to the point...very disappointing. Porterhouse was like something from a bad buffet, twice baked potato should have been thrown away the first time and the creamed spinach more like spinach flavored soup. The toasted ravioli is the reason for one star...find a Sizzler/Golden Corral and save yourself $170 dollars!

zaRkLLTYqIyMP-qNII7ATw.text: Don't show up at 10:13 even though the restaurants up until 11:pm because they will not seat you. Restaurant was only 1/3 occupied. But they decided they did not want any further business after checking with their kitchen. Unfortunately we are locals and we pop in on a regular basis after movie night between 10 and 10:15 for an amazing dinner. Time to alter our plans and go to herbs and Rye. Or other amazing restaurants because Golden State in a longer wants our business. Las Vegas is filled with amazing restaurants that want your business. It's an end of an era what an amazing place like Golden Steer turns away locals 48 minutes before closing. Ouch

w-bOMtuRgutiBQkE2bS8KA.text: Had dinner here last night and it was really good!!! The ambiance was very cool, we sat at the Joe DiMaggio booth which is in between Elvis and Holly Madison. The service was impeccable and the meal was above average. My wife had a 6oz filet with crab and I had the 22oz bone in Ribeye. She said hers wasn't anything special but mine was very good and so was the twice baked potato.   We will definitely be going back and would recommend it to anyone.

MJgDj9DCPu2IJs-4brDjYA.text: Great place to explore in historic Vegas hotspot. The King crab appetizer was worth every penny! If your going out for a nice, yet pricy meal this spot would have my recommendation.

09SZx0_dsDW9B-5E00DrEA.text: Was super excited to dine here with my husband (who has been a few times). It didn't disappoint. Great service (from the hostess to our server). The food was fabulous and cooked as ordered. I highly recommend the table side Caesar salad and bananas foster for dessert. This is now going to be a tradition for us when in Vegas!

ft5XzYOtsfm3ebZxGckfnQ.text: Love the old school vibe of this place. As expected, they make excellent manhattans and they have a great wine list. Nothing is cheap here, but that was already expected so no surprises there. We split the ceasar salad, made at the table. My husband liked it but I didn't care for it. Even though he went mild on the anchovies, all I could taste was fish. I got a giant baked potato for dinner, which was disappointing because all the fixings were dumped into and not on the side, and the cheese kind of tasted like government cheese. My husband got the ribeye steak and wished he would have got the prime rib. We will be back and try the seafood next time (although the crab legs were $62, so not that!). The service was excellent and the old school vibe will keep us coming back.

o3IpfT99werl3QxwiS9i9g.text: One of my favorite places in Vegas. I love the restaurant is located in a run down plaza in a ghetto neighborhood, because the outside inside contrasts brings you into a old classic Vegas theme. Used to order the New York every time and it never disappoints. Now under the husband influence, porterhouse is the fav. Absolutely beautiful and delicious every single time. Banana Foster is a must have if you have any room left after the meat feast. Forgot to mention the warm bread to start, so yummy. I also love the one server that gets my imagination going wild thinking he must be the Vegas GodFather or something. You will know who I am talking about if you have been there enough times.

wnMbipeiukr77nwt7wJQ1Q.text: We went here based upon hotel valet attendant recommendation. Total disappointment as we waited for over an hour and was told that the wait time was 20 minutes. The host didn't provide any updates on the estimated time so we were left waiting in the corner. Finally decided that we waited long enough and walked out. Coming from Hawaii...we got absolutely no "aloha" or service at all.

2rkny0SKDJ25gGyc-wrvcQ.text: Where to Start.... my wife and I set reservations For our 25th wedding anniversary the reason that we chose Golden Steer is because we have been Las Vegas locals for 21 years and have heard That you do not want to miss out on the nostalgia And history of the over 50-year-old steakhouse that's hidden on the strip. I will say that the place was very busy which tells me at some point the service must have been great...  but I will tell you that the service that we received on our visit was the worst I have ever seen after waiting for over a half an hour past our reservation time they sat us next to a party of more than 10 people squeezed into a booth that was set up for at the most six people as stated we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and didn't want to sit next to a party of this size as we wanted our privacy (keep in mind we asked For a private booth when we set the appointment) I got up and very nicely asked the manager on duty if there was a possibility to move us to a table not located with a big group of people The manager at this point seemed to get very irritated and asked me which table I would like to sit at...I explained to him that I would be more than happy to sit at any booth as long as there was not a huge group of people sitting right next to us At this point the manager stated that there was only eight people sitting next to us with an attitude in his voice I then stated that it doesn't matter if it's 8,10 or 12 people that we wanted privacy and that The hostess on the phone said it would be no issues When we had called two weeks earlier to set our reservation. Once the manager expressed to us that our business was not important to him or to the restaurant we decided that we did not want to spend our 25th anniversary there and I expressed to the manager how disappointed I was with how he handled the situation so as we gathered our coats and left the table he rudely and loudly expressed for us to have a great anniversary. I will say this that if my wife was not there with me I would've handled the situation much differently than I did.. but we went ahead and left without Incident. I will never go to this restaurant and I will let everybody that I know and anyone looking for a recommendation for a restaurant to never go to the Golden Steer.

61kOChTRgG0hw_qpS4KChA.text: Food was good, but the experience was awesome! We had escargot, table side Caesar salad, shared a ribeye, twice baked potato, and corn. One of our servers, Alfredo, even brought out another escargot because my husband ate all of them while he and I were chatting! So thoughtful! The Caesar was very tasty and the steak was great - definitely enough to share. The twice baked potato was all I hoped it would be. The corn was on the sweet side, so keep that in mind. Gin and tonics were excellent and we finished off with a bite of the table side bananas foster (so full at this point). Tom, our other server, was fun and made the experience all the better! We will definitely be back. :)

ZiRIXjgZ4yHTr1CDttv0Vg.text: After reading the reviews on Yelp for this steakhouse, my family and I decided to try it while visiting Vegas. It was every bit as good as the reviews rave. I am not even a huge Caesar salad fan, but the salad here is so fresh and well prepared, I loved it!   All of our steaks were prepared exactly to our order, and my family of 4 split 4 sides, and it was hard to finish all of them.  For dessert, the creme brulee is wonderful as well as the coffee drink with 8 different liquors. It is definitely on the pricy side, but I felt we got a lot of food, and it wasn't outrageous for Vegas prices.

PSmnZiqeSdO20puvhXEn4Q.text: I WILL NEVER STEP FOOT INSIDE THIS JOINT AGAIN! We made advanced reservations for 8. When we arrived we were told they overbooked and we'd have to wait. The receptionist was very unprofessional and rude, telling us tables weren't available when we could clearly see empty tables from the waiting room. She even said that we could leave if we didn't want to wait. After she was told by my wife, son and daughter who made 3 separate status requests, we left. Maybe our money wasn't green enough, OR IS IT THEY DONT SERVE BLACK PEOPLE! Somebody needs to tell them the year is 2013...not the 1950's

6jTlYkJPQvj9TChpIL0N8g.text: Last weekend we did our seasonal trip to Vegas and like tradition we payed a visit to the one and only Golden Steer . This time we brought 2 newbies that haven't been and let's just say once they walked in they knew what we had all been talking about . Cesar Salad made right at your table is the best Cesar Salad money could buy . The service like always was top notch and the steaks well let's just say we all walked out with a smile to ear to ear . If you haven't been to Golden Steer you really haven't been to Vegas .

LVHw0Ak_ZyhOQZ8DYKFCzw.text: this restaurant is one of my very favorites in the entire world. Food is very good, but the atmosphere is superb, and what really sets it apart. It is such a fun break off of the strip with all the glitzy new restaurants. This truly is a taste of the past. Always a fun experience. I have been there about four times.

-ANPlLJ1RfnTxHFDJTwKHQ.text: Fantastic!  The Ceaser Salad and Creamed Corn were both the best I have ever had.  Atmosphere and Steaks are amazing.

pyNBka9-u5DTVboNLAmaHA.text: Great from steak to vegetable. The asparagus was tender without being over cooked mush. The Caesar salads were made in front of us from dressing to mixing. The service was great the bread was warm. Will be back again with family

GAejZSt2DiupOkMUWnfNog.text: Went here on a whim. Food was great overall, and the service was amazing. Classic steakhouse feel with old Vegas flavor. I cannot stress enough how well we were treated and every request was catered to perfectly. Would come back again.

sjJiciuWxrxYk2zgCFPkiA.text: This use to be a great treasure spot to recommend newbies to, but something has drastically changed in last two visits in two months, the service for a party of 4 that exceeded $600 was the absolute worst I ever had anywhere at a caliber of this kind of restaurant. I have been going to Golden Steer in excess of 25 years and probably responsible for over $75,000 + in last 6 years from hosting private party's and recommendations. What a shame on a legendary place with so so much history.

whmenW10nMywTQH18V8Xdw.text: The worst service in Las Vegas. I've had better service at McDonald's. At least the cashier at McDonald's asks if I would like fries with that. Not Golden Steer. The waiter doesn't want to talk to you. When your sideless dish arrives, before you can say, "Where's my potato", the waiter is gone, not to be seen again. Your beer is poured with the same finesse one uses to dump trash down a sink, and drink that beer slowly because it will be the last beer you'll be offered. In summary, if you want to eat at a restaurant with the worst service in Las Vegas, listening to the clientele boister about having posterior intercourse with a prostitute, Golden Steer is the place for you.

vFzvnTmO-zTVqmJbHj35gg.text: We love this place.  We go whenever we are in Vegas.  Went with a group this time, 5 in all and it's really fun.  It's old style Vegas and they do it really well...  aside from the video poker in the bar, but that's pretty standard in vegas... it does contrast sharply with the decor and ambiance...    The only thing I wouldn't order again is the lobster bisque, which I normally love.  It wasn't bad, it just wasn't spectacular.  We had the ceasar, which was a little over dressed, but made table side which is worth it.  And it tastes great, garlicy.  The bone in rib eye we shared but it was cooked perfectly.  Our table mates had the onion soup, which was great and not salty which is a problem with that soup often.  The roasted mushrooms which were a little weird but good, double baked potatoes and the filet.  We loved and will go back again.  So will they, I'm sure!!  Oh, and our service was perfect.  The waiter talked to us but wasn't annoying and they are on top of everything.  Loved it!

suQ74v0Do_1exaBNPnqaPw.text: Food and service were top notch.   First thing I thought when I got seated was that the movie "Casino" if not filmed there,  had sets modeled after this place. It was clean, but very retro. My biggest complaint?  I ordered the petit filet with bernaise sauce, and was asked house or Caesar salad. Not add, just choose.... I ordered the Caesar, and it was very good, but I would only eat small amount so as not to ruin my meal. Guess what?  It was an a la carte item I would not have ordered..it was an additional. '$12.  I felt misled. Do I mind spending good money for good food?  Not at all...but I would not have not have spent $12 on something I knew I would not eat very much off.

tIn7HMkCl_2IHeLkm6-baQ.text: Don't be deceived by the exterior. This is a really nice restaurant. It reminded me of a classy old style steakhouse. The food was great! My wife ordered a petite filet mignon and I got the 18oz diamond cut rib eye and we both got the twice baked potato. Everything was amazing. The portions are more than enough. We will definitely return.

DbEga32pVcC48BNyZ5sDBg.text: A Vegas classic, opened in 1958, when it was across from the now burned down El Rancho, it is the oldest steakhouse in continuous operation in town.  The walls are covered with photos of celebrities and gangsters, plus a new one of of our current mayor and her husband, the former mayor and mob lawyer.  Ask for the room in the rear, as the lighting is a little lower and the wood paneling a little richer.  We had the Shecky Green booth at the far back and I will remember to ask for it again.  Our waiter, Fabian, was just right, no hovering or "I'll be your server today" prattle, but always just a little way off when we needed him.  And the steaks were fabulous.  My rib eye covered the whole plate. Succulent and marbled with just a little fat, cooked exactly medium rare and let to rest just long enough for the juices to stay inside.  My friend's medium well filet mignon was to his liking as well.  He started with crab cakes, light and flaky and my crab cocktail was the kind that brings you back to Vegas.  My wife's oysters on the half shell were fresh and sweet, though the horseradish sauce lacked punch.  My only gripe is that the wine list is just adequate, not great.  Fabian looked at the Barolo we brought to remedy the problem skeptically, but it was big and still tannic and a great match to the meat and corkage of $20 wasn't outrageous.  Can't wait to go back with our next out of town guests.

zXsZGD_7q0tC1dkkDH1XJQ.text: WOW!! Everyone should do a dinner here.  The GF and I made a date night out of it. The service was fantastic, the wine selection robust and the stake we PERFECT!!  If you are from out of town, don't let the neighborhood worry you.

CqlypDiuJp4FJn7QOx169A.text: I wanted a special place to celebrate my birthday, with my family and chose Golden Steer. I was glad I spent my birthday at such a gem in Las Vegas. Though parking is limited I felt comfortable since the parking lot was well lit. The dinner was delish and the knowledgeable hostess sharing stories about the famous and their booths made the evening enjoyable. The sparkler on my cake made me feel special. The Golden Steer is a nostalgic glimpse of Vegas past. The Bananas Foster should not be missed!

Oq1ZHW6_VRN7b7qs0M8AnA.text: This is the second attempt to eat here (perhaps the ghost is what brought us back) im going to be super real right now... The food is comparable to sizzler or ruby tuesdays. I mean its pretty good but for what youre paying its a little ridic. This place is said to be haunted the server showed us tons of pics on there phone of orbs and weird things about closing / openings so im being super nice with the 3 stars. Youre deffintatly paying for the scenario here. Old school place with alot of history. This was the goto spot for mobbsters back in the day and a few stars have there own booth table set of ups thats always reserved for them so you might get lucky and see someone famous over paying for there food as well so you don't feel as bad

g1AAneG8Uo7lwg_g7lcQkw.text: Best experience ever our server Tommy was Magnanimous. We expected to have a nice dinner but, we never expected the service to be so absolutely fabulous. We sat at the John Wayne booth. The food was so good we vowed to come back once a month. Great music. Romantic lighting. Talk about being transported to the 1950's!!! This is what it must have been like when people cared about a dining experience. Beam me up Scotty cause I never want to leave.

AZqqJUl26UIxCiyZ661XMg.text: Food was great.  We started with the Caesar salad for four, which they make table-side.  Thereafter, I had the surf and turf.  The lobster tail was huge and the filet mignon was cooked perfectly at medium.  We also ordered mushrooms, asparagus, and mashed potatoes for sides which were quite good.  A bit expensive, but every bit worth it.  The service was just right:  they left us alone when appropriate, and checked on us just enough to refill drinks, clear plates, etc.

EUovl37hNJQTtt1Fno0lBw.text: Fantastic! Like other reviews say, totally a step back into classic Las Vegas! Service was excellent! Joey, our waiter, certainly looked the part and took fabulous care of us! Too many exclamation points? We ate early and sat at the Sinatra booth - pretty cool. The whole decor, the leather galore, the photos from back in the day, the music...all added to the experience. Every staff member we encountered was excellent. First though is that we ordered (and ate) too much. We started with two excellent crab cakes. Then the table side caesar salad which was perfectly balanced - lemon, garlic, anchovy, etc. My wife had the filet Oscar (which she loved) and I had the bone-in ribeye (which was the best steak I have ever had). Dry aged, prime beef cooked perfectly (rare). It was absolutely delicious! For sides, we had the twice baked potato and the creamed spinach. The potato was good, but the least good of everything. I thought the spinach was excellent, my wife wasn't crazy about it. They use a touch of nutmeg (which I love and is probably what turned my wife off). I would definitely go back and highly recommend it to anyone that loves a great steak. We wouldn't have known about this classic had it not been for Groupon. With a couple of glasses of wine, our tab was $230'ish - the Groupon knocked $60 off, and it was well worth the price!

rzdC9duaeQog_qXpiQIk4g.text: It's the best steakhouse food I've ever had ~ hands down. That is not up for debate. However, as a longtime local, this is the 2nd visit that my husband and I have made ~ and gotten horrible service, in favor of a much larger table ~ despite our "ordering it up" and tipping very generously (+20%). That makes me sad ~ that is not Old Vegas at all, which is the only reason we go there.

8lAWiy6Y8t-wpgTBsYBK5Q.text: Celebrated my birthday dinner at The Golden Steer.  We made reservations in advance and requested for Frank Sinatra's booth (Table 22) as we were walked to the table the hostess told us this was the best seat in the house.  Sinatra's booth was across from Dean Martin's booth and Sammy Davis Jr's.  Our dining experience started as soon as we walked through the door, from the host stand to sitting in our booth and all throughout the meal.    We started with cocktails: a dirty martini for me and 3 fingers of Jack with an ice cube for him.  The servers work as a team so there were several people coming around checking on us, complimenting on my boyfriends cocktail (Sinatra's drink of choice).    Now on to the food, we ordered the cocktail shrimp appetizer, ribeye med rare with a side of sauteed mushrooms for me and NY strip med rare with a loaded baked potato for him.  While waiting for our appetizers, the dining room was filled with other diners ordering table side Caesar salads or cherries jubilee for dessert.  There was so much to watch in the small dining room of about 9 or 10 booths, whisking of Caesar Salad dressing from scratch, flambeing of cherries, birthday sparklers going off around us, and this was all before we even got our food.  Our shrimp cocktail didn't have any bells or whistles when served, but it didn't need to, the size alone was ridiculous!  The shrimp cocktail comes with 4 huge pieces of shrimp, cocktail sauce, lemon wedges and small bottle of Tabasco.  When the entrees arrived, our steaks were cooked a perfect temperature of med rare and the serving size again, made for a hungry man.  Lucky for me, I don't believe in taking a good steak home for leftovers so I did some work.  The sides were good accompaniments but the steaks were the main star.    For dessert we decided on the Bananas Foster made table side.  You can definitely taste the ingredients added in front of you with hints of orange and nutmeg.  We ordered the Golden Steer Coffee to go with desert, the server forgot about this but as soon as we mentioned it, he immediately apologized and said, "No, you have to get it, completely my fault, it's on me"  as we were finishing up our dessert and coffee, the maitre d came by and asked us if we needed any assistance with a cab which I thought was a nice service touch.    After 4 drinks, appetizer, 2 entrees, 2 sides and dessert, bill came out to a little over $200 not including tip, not bad for the service and food.  Definitely recommend for the experience and a great steak.

9O9-FkczqywieLCtg3jYRQ.text: Best steakhouse in Vegas! Old school. Table side ceaser salad was excellent. Ordered two petite filets, excellent medium rare. The twice baked potato and asparagus were great as well. My wife enjoyed the Marylin Monroe booth I requested. Great service and drinks. (Martini, Old Fashioned) We'll be back next time in Vegas for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great old school steakhouse

yXxZy2psSrWmG9xnEfUz6Q.text: Worst service ever received. If I could rate less then one star then this place deserves it. Literally took a little more than an hour to get my meal and my water cup had not been refilled for about the same amount of time. It was practically dead inside so I do not understand the slow service. Was not satisfied with my time here.

HVEmUUEfIZlnH41PBx5f7w.text: I love the ambiance of this place. It's so totally awesomely old-school Vegas. Dark, red booths, tuxedo waiters, etc. And it's where Elvis Presley, the Rat Pack, etc. dined. There are even plaques next to the booths they regularly sat at. (Yeah, I totally went and sat in the Elvis booth.) 5 stars.  When you walk in, there's a bar area with gaming on the bar and some couches and whatnot.   We were greeted and seated promptly. The place was virtually empty on a weeknight.  Our waiter was friendly, but the service just wasn't what one would expect of an old-school establishment, nor was it on par with the service at other Strip establishments. I love the old-school places where they fold your napkin for you if you get up and use the restroom, where the courses are properly timed, where the food is held and not brought to the table of everyone isn't there (because someone went to the restroom), etc. But alas, this place did not offer that sort of classy service. 2 stars.  We started with the Caesar salad and French onion soup. The salad is made table side and was $12 a person. It was crazy delicious. Easily one of the best Caesar salads I've ever had. 5 stars. The French onion soup was also yummy. Bubbly and full of cheese. 4 stars.  Before I was even done eating the salad (and whilst I was in the restroom), the steak was delivered. We opted to share the 22oz ribeye. At $50-some bucks, it's a big steak for a relatively low price (by comparison). But it wasn't all the great. It certainly wasn't bad and was cooked exactly as we ordered it. But it just didn't have a lot of flavor to it. 3 stars. Shoulda ordered the filet...  To go with the steak, we ordered the bernaise and peppercorn sauces. Both were rather ho-hum. 3 stars.  We also ordered the twice baked potato at the waiter's suggestion. It was overdone and not particularly flavorful. 2 stars.  With the Groupon, the price we paid wasn't too bad. But I gotta say, had we paid full price, I wouldn't have thought it worth it.  The main attraction here is the ambiance and history. The food is alright, but there are far better steak places around town.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AAugnrT4VHmK29cGWULZCA.text: I'm a steak lover through and through. Knowing this, my boyfriend took me to Golden Steer for some birthday steak, not cake. This place ROCKED! It's authentic old-school Vegas. I have no doubt that members of the mob and the 50's-era Brat Pack frequented this place back in the day.   But that's not even the half of it.  The food is outstanding. The service was wonderful. And the ambiance and decor takes you back in time.  I had surf & turf and HO-LY CRAP! My steak was perfection. I almost ignored the lobster because the steak was THAT good. The "ambassador of tenderness", as they call their filet, was beyond tender. I could have cut it with a plastic butterknife. It was one of the best steaks I've had.   Needless to say, birthday dinner was an absolute success at Golden Steer. I loved it.

lJ0CZZV8EuUObV-Prwsupw.text: This restaurant is wonderful!  My husband and I came here for our anniversary and we enjoyed it tremendously!  Our waiter was Carl and he told us some great stories about the Rat Pack and the history of the restaurant.  The ambiance is definitely old school Vegas!  The service was great starting from when we walked in the door.  We were seated in "Dean Martin's booth" and there was a great pic of the Rat Pack including Peter Lawford and Joey Bishop.  The food was so awesome starting with the Ceasar salad made tableside to the main course to the desert.  We had the Cherries Jubilee that was flambeed tableside and served over Vanilla ice cream.  We will definitely be back since this is truly an old school Vegas jewel!!

t7Rr5UJ7xIez4IWqfNYyNQ.text: Wish I could rate 5 star. Customer service was good but we waited for over 2 hours even though we had a reservation. I don't know how they forgot about us.   Once we were seated or shall I say found a table at the bar the food was amazing. One of the best fillet minions I've had! Cooked to perfection. I normally order medium well but this time I decided to taste the meat more- I ordered medium. Yum yum!   Also, don't miss out on table side salad making. I make a pretty good Cesar but this is 100% Made from scratch right in front of you- Benihana style.   I would go back and try it again The waiter and bartender were very nice!

Yexk_jzoHQqFY2QukHJ2-w.text: Wow, what a wonderful place. I've spent a lot of time in Las Vegas and had never heard of this place but now I'm a Golden Steer evangelist. This is a must for everyone that is looking for the vintage Vegas experience. When making reservations ask for a rat pack table and for the restaurant historian to share the history of those amazing tables.

5iU-Dq2ZHt3ZJxkjDxl9mg.text: What an amazing old school Vegas restaurant!!  Service, atmosphere, and food are ON POINT!  Love love love this place!!!   PS we were told by our server (who worked there for over 10 years, by the way, that some celebrities still visit this place too ;)

XIJy9ZoNDbZov_4olvVazw.text: The quintessential Vegas restaurant of yesteryear when the mobbed up town played host to the likes of Dean Martin, Sammy Davis, Jr, and Old Blue Eyes himself (the guys whom the streets are named for).  Back when a steakhouse served steak and service meant jacket clad waiters prepared your salad, shelled your lobster, and flambeed your dessert tableside.  The Golden Steer brings it all to you.  Make no mistake, despite its location in the Badlands and it's tacky 1960's looking sign, this is a classic, "elegant" steakhouse.  Ballers of the past called this their kitchen, do not come looking for the $2.99 NY steak.     Straight to it, do NOT pass on jumbo shrimp cocktail.  Huge (U8), perfectly cooked and chilled, sweet Gulf shrimp served simply with a lemon and horseradish supercharged cocktail sauce, classic in every respect.  Add a gin martini and all is right with the world.        The tableside Caesar salad as good as you want it to be.  Just chopped crisp romaine, raw egg, anchovy fillets, parm, and croutons.  Adjustments are made on the fly for personal preference so speak up.  A good French onion soup.  Beefy, load of caramelized onions.  Not as cheesy as hoped for but great taste.  To the steaks, all USDA Prime dry aged.  Well trimmed, tender, very even searing and always cooked to temp.  The T-bone and bone in rib eye very flavorful and though the char masks the umame finish, plenty of goodness to be enjoyed.  Next, the excellent prime rib.  Served with a deeply favored au jus and creamed horseradish.  Beefy, juicy, and just good eats.  Simple sides (no truffle this or pancetta that).  Steamed asparagus, creamed spinach, giant baked potato with the works.  Portions are shareable.  Finally the flambes.  Bananas foster and Cherries Jubilee are outstanding.  A great show and as classic as can be albeit a bit heavy on the liqueur flavorings.  Service is steakhouse friendly and efficient.  No complaints.  Weak wine list for a steakhouse lacking vintage, varietal, and producer depth.   Fair markup.  Sometimes, you just need to embrace Vegas.  Luck Be a Lady after all.  Do it My Way.  As Time Goes By remember, That's Life and most importantly, The Best Is Yet To Come.

s0Kxgp4Rsim8KGeZNuhk_Q.text: Place went to shit, reservation is a waste of time, you will wait well beyond your time and watch everyone else get seated. Have ate here for the last 20 years ever since I was 21, But Like everything else in Vegas it's time just came to a end for me.

mW9SQqUy_bj7nu4j7qAfPg.text: FEAR THE STEER  We ventured here under the assumption that this was a high quality steakhouse and restaurant. The atmosphere didn't disappoint. Unfortunately, everything else did. If you decide to enter this establishment in anything less than full formal attire, you will be seated in a separate dining area hidden in the dank back corner of the restaurant. Soon after segregating you, they proceed to offer the quickest meal service possible to kick you out the door as if your money is no good there. If you order food that would normally be served tableside, don't be shocked to find it is pre-plated as if your highschool cafeteria lady had slopped it on like hamburger helper.   At this point I assume the staff just came off the boat fresh from a farm in Russia. Naturally I order a Moscow Mule. So the appetiser wasn't their forte, how could they possibly screw up a cocktail right? I'm not sure what they brought me, but it tasted like a glass full of aromatic bitters. If that fancies you, skip the beer at the steer and go for the mule!   Main course time. As they bring my plate with my New York and Crab legs, they are kind enough to offer me a complimentary briss. The sharp steak knife is hurled at my crotch like a trigger happy Rabbi trying to fulfil his quota for the month. Almost joining the Lance Armstrong club is truly what tipped the scales and inspired this review.   Please do yourself a favour, go to Outbacks and stear clear of the steer.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If you&#39;re concerned about cleanliness, Google Street View assures us that The Steer is now in the clear! For now anyways.

ZuGbO_ZlD5Rvx6Sw9BK4MA.text: Old school Vegas steakhouse.   Looks and feels like Vegas of years past.  Service was very good, steaks were excellent.  The ribeye is much better than the porterhouse.  Highly recommend the Banana Foster, made table side.  Shrimp cocktail was delicious as well.  Just an all around quality spot.

_zZqpaTJknSgQGeXrEnoyw.text: I had the ribeye, it was ok. I like it, and ate every bit of it. Also the service was just ok. I had a potato and it was massive. Everything was cooked perfect. Easy to get to. We took an uber. Its off the strip, but thats ok. Its worth the drive.

El6upD4ENWcTsQozgGJhqA.text: This review is for 3.5 stars.  To begin, I am a fan of strip steak houses.  Yes they are overpriced but they offer that upscale, good-eats environment that almost guarantees a quality meal.  Golden Steer steers in a little different direction by staying True to its Vegas origin.  The scale of the restaurant is less than a strip steak house, however.  Though the waiters are wearing tuxedos and the prices on par, the restaurant itself is located right off Sahara in a unwelcoming shopping plaza; the bar even has machines to play blackjack.  Very Vegassy vibe.  I decided to give Golden Steer a shot because I found a Groupon and was craving a nice dinner.  I ate at the bar and was served a very nice old fashioned for $12.  I then ordered a caesar salad ($12) and a 12oz filet ($48), medium rare.  The caesar salad, though not prepared bar side like I was hoping, was a top notch salad.  Nothing too extraordinary but a top quality salad nonetheless.  The steak came without sides and was cooked all over the place.  The outside was easily medium if not well done.  The inside was perfect, but only about 70% of the steak was cooked correctly, so that was a little lackluster for a top steak house.  In all, Golden Steer is worth a go only with a coupon.  It's a nice, classy environment and different from on strip places, but I believe you can find a very similar steak (if not better) either downtown or in the suburbs for a cheaper price. albeit not back in time in old Vegas.

zdaEzAjBmerCNBnVO5JvlQ.text: Went here for our 2 year Anniversary.  Everything was great. They were pretty busy which I think made service a little slow.  It is pricey. I want to go back and try the ribeye.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach martini and lemon drop martini.

SPR19sNin8Uh0P4eYQw0MQ.text: I was going through my reviews today and I came to a shocking discovery. I have never written a review on our favorite steakhouse in Las Vegas, NV. HOW is this possible? Luckily, this wonderful restaurant was on my mind today since we just ate here again recently. We come here for every occasion that we can think of so that we have an excuse for spending $400+ on dinner. We have been here for birthdays, fathers day, Christmas Eve etc. It is without any doubt our favorite steakhouse in town.   First of all, the outside is hokey and unexpected. Do not judge a book by it's cover. Once you walk in the front door, you a transported to one of the oldest steakhouses in town where loads of celebrities and members of the Rat Pack dined. It is dark, quiet and full of oversized booths with tables sporting draped white table clothes. This is a destination place for anyone in this city.   We found a server we really like: Berto. We are now asking for him each time.   On multiple occasions, ordered the seafood tower which is superb but on this trip we ordered crab cocktail and escargot. Both were excellent. For dinner we ordered steaks, surf and turf combo with shrimp scampi and a lobster tail. There is not a single thing negative to be said. The steaks were cooked to perfection and their lobster tails are some on the best in town. We ordered asparagus, sauteed mushrooms and a twice bakes potato for the sides.   Let me tell you, this is the place to go. I urge anyone to try this steakhouse and really be taken to "old Vegas".

wul87rEcpQ0FqnB0I4818w.text: I recently had an amazing experience at the Golden Steer.  This place is full on old school Vegas and I had NEVER heard of it.  I was fortunate enough to be invited to a dinner party here by a friend's boss, who reserved a room and treated close to 20 people to an amazing meal.  had I come on my own, my experience may not have been so amazing, but this was awesome.     First, I felt like I'd gone back in time when I entered, then the staff was all dressed formally and the bartenders looked like they had been here since Sinatra was last here.  Our meal was a whirlwind of deliciousness.  We were started with a platter of cold seafood: lobster, crab, oysters, and shrimp with the appropriate accompaniments. There was yummy bread and butter, then our meals came.  Several at my table had prime rib, there were a few different steaks and a friend at another table went all out with the lobster!  We also had sides of mashed potatoes, creamed spinach and sauteed mushrooms.  I had ordered a baked potato and it was seriously one of the biggest potatoes I've ever seen!  Everything I ate was delicious.  We had beverages on our own dime and I have to say the whiskey sour was PERFECT.  We were definitely too full for desserts, but overall, we felt super spoiled, especially since all we paid for was our drinks!  The place was clean and cool looking.  You really feel like your in old Vegas    The ONLY reason why I didn't go for a full 5 stars is that our main waiter was a little odd - kind of brusque and then he jacked up our drink bill and was kind of snotty about it.  But otherwise, LOVE LOVE LOVED the experience!  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED, but keep in mind, it's PRICEY!

wdJIOoJPSk_Fd4_SiT8sUg.text: Killer's meatballs!   Classy place in the middle of a classless neighborhood in Las Vegas

pPc-ryr9yrm5UWOOtGRqNA.text: Love this place! Service was perfect, very attentive, We sat near the door, restaurant is very loud but it was during the rush. I had the Chicken of the Angels with mushrooms and articokes, it was very tender and the best chicken I ever had. The boyfriend had Prime Rib, and loved it but also started eating off my plate too. We shared some stuffed mushrooms and had fried Ravioli with our food. We were full after that, even though we wanted dessert, we couldn't eat anymore.  Get to this place early, parking spots are few, and we had to park behind the restaurant by 7-Eleven. (Not a good idea, a guy told us it almost got towed) Over all, expensive but worth it, it was awesome and hopefully will be back!

UsFPyb8CtRoaJw58J04O0g.text: The one star is for the service and overall experience.  We brought our young niece (20 years old) to the Golden Steer for dinner.  When both I and my girlfriend stepped out for a cigarette and returned our niece showed us a note from the waiter (this guy was in his late 50's with grayish hair) with his number on it.  He was hitting on her when we stepped away!  Our conclusion was that either he is a ...... old man or this place is a known hook up spot between staff and young dinners.  Either way we will not be returning.

fBIru04ICB4V2LF9QXe62g.text: Everyone in the restaurant is extremely rude.  Walked in the ladies up front were extremely rude.   No hospitality in any way.   Saying their next table available will be in 3 hours I should have made a reso online.  Ok?!?!  So we debate if we should eat here. We decided to walk out, think about it and went back in.  Sat at the bar. Waiter was rude and sarcastic. I am visual so like to use yelp to look at pics of food before I order.  Waiter Erick was like "don't ask you waiter, he won't know what's good". I was like, huh? Are u the waiter or the water boy I wasn't sure.   So I said to him I am visual so like to see how the dishes come out first.  The i asked "are you our waiter tonight and what do you recommend?"  He walks off yelling I don't like anything on the menu, there is NOTHING I recommend!!"  Wtf?? Is wrong w this guy.  Sarcasm or just rude?!?!  I ended getting the table side Caesar, it was delish.  The rib eye was perfect!!! Melted in your mouth, little fatty but guess the marble is what makes it.  The French onion soup was sooo good.  Food 4/5 since there was a lot of fat on the bone in rib eye.  Check came, gave Groupon $30 for $60 and the lady who was rude to me when we walked in she had this frown on her face and literally went to the grown with her frown.  Now u must be the owner I guess, why offer Groupon if you don't want to take it and why don't u show it a little more on your face!!!  Over it, tried it, yeah the food was good. But horrible service   Not coming back

AnAlaSqKQmWJjn1wcSfX1g.text: Let me start first by saying you can definitely find a better steakhouse for the money.  I'm not snobby, but this experience was not what I expected for the price and the other positive reviews.  We should have known better when, in casual conversation with our very casual waiter, he mentioned he's part of the new blood replacing the old employees who had been at the restaurant for awhile.  (New blood didn't prove anything better for service or professionalism, as we would later find out.)  I asked about a wine, and was given an answer in a off-handed way that it is sweet and has bubbles.  Really?  Gee, thanks for the description.  French onion soup was average. Because only one Caesar salad was ordered, it wasn't prepared at the table - but they don't tell you that when you order.  The steaks were good but overpriced, and they didn't mention the sauces that you could add.  The garlic bread was horrible, and they put it on the table in the same looking basket as the rolls, without telling us it was the garlic bread.  My wine glass was empty for 10 minutes without anyone asking me if I want another or something else.  The water glasses were attentively filled.  Mushrooms were good, but twice baked potato was ok.  We were pretty much ignored during our meal, including at the end when our dishes sat for 10 minutes before being cleared.  When the bill came, they have a machine to run it at the table.  They had predesignated tips listed.  As soon as my husband chose a tip, the waiter grabbed it from his hands, finished the process, said a quick thank you and then left our table.  No 'thank you, hope you'll join us again' or anything like that.  Don't worry, we didn't need any encouragement to return - we had already decided this was a mistake.  Service was not attentive, and not to the level of other steakhouses.  We will go somewhere else to spend this kind of money, and get better food and better service - and know that we will want to return again.

NwNe5WN8xUyA4Yo6_nSsWA.text: Heard so many great reviews about this place so decided to try it out and I was definitely satisfied. The ambiance was perfect for a beautiful dinner for my best friend and I which is my man by the way. The servers were on top of everything. Yes I said servers, your table comes with two. Food was amazing and came out in very good timing. Ordered the 22oz ribeye medium and it was absolutely perfect. It is for sure on the list of having one of the best steaks in Vegas. A must try if you're ever in the mood for a good steak!

L-tD1uGy_F3-MWlcrEmtng.text: The ambiance of the restaurant was outstanding; historical and romantic.   The service was nothing special, just same as you'd expect in any other steakhouses.   The french onion soup was superb. This meal itself deserves 5 star.   I really underestimated the size of bone in ribeye steaks. It is huge.   I ordered my ribeye as rare and though i understand every chefs' doneness is slightly different and given the fact that the steak was very thick;  it was a tiny bit undercook. I generally love undercook meat but even for me, it was a little too raw for me.   You cant go wrong with banana foster, in addition, they make it in front of your table.  Overall, it was an enjoyable experience and cool to try it out

9mYXhIBfERObS-oeVS1Enw.text: It's almost like I got into a time machine.  This Restaurant brings me back to old vegas in a good way.  The drinks were super strong and the steaks were amazing. The service is hands down exceptionally great!  Dan was the best server for my birthday dinner. It ended well with a fire work finale! They even scraped the tablecloth clean of crumbs, before dessert!  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone.

4wfDKRjK7Dy6QUQfSiUnvQ.text: Great steakhouse, old school layout, and sitting in Frank's booth was Uber cool. Tableside bananas foster was incredible.

zhywrFufkpBGDKt_zCEL8w.text: Nice service.  Good food.  Good steaks.  Not the best in Vegas but good.   Lots of history.   And well maintained.   Just like the vibe.  Try it.   Not my fav in Vegas but worth a visit.

ATzYqmJjYo0sCIo8g2qxbg.text: We came here back in September when someone in our hotel elevator strongly recommended this place.  We were feeling adventurous so why not.  The cool thing about this place is that it's authentic and it's like stepping back in time!  There seems to be a lot of history to this joint.  The food and drinks are amazing and spot on.  There are no frills to this place.  But the atmosphere is great, the staff is friendly, it's clean and we will definitely be heading back again!

j219OzbS5puP_KtN2XlK2A.text: Nice place but snobby service. (Except the front hostesses.  They were helpful and nice) The steak was nicely done and the atmosphere was old Vegas. That was cool.  But the coldness I felt from all the staff made our night not fun. They seemed busy , tired and too good for us. The food was good though. But not worth coming back to get treated like an interruption to their day . The worst and most awkward part was when we went to pay. We gave them 2 credit cards and split the bill and then they hover over you with this little credit card machine and ask you if you want to add gratuity. So as they stare at you and hold this machine you have to press a button for a percentage for the tip. For such a snobby place that was tacky.

qUPD0fRGZneM2dEiKdIAKQ.text: We had never been to this establishment before but we shall come back every time going forward.  Transport yourself back in time to when going out to dinner was an event rather than a regularity.  We started with the Caesar salad prepared expertly at our table.  Service was on point and the filets that we ordered were cooked to perfection.  Sides of creamed corn and a twice baked potato completed  our meals.  As more and more "old" Vegas disappears the Golden Steer remains a constant.

dNpdH5fEfqeV54t9cuktGg.text: I was told this was a great place.  The ambience is beautiful the service is wonderful the food has absolutely no taste. It was such an expensive dinner for two people over $300 that my partner came home and was sick all night I was so disappointed after spending all that money for no taste and she was sick. I would not go back so disappointed

sRwcOWXVVseM4wqgyDkOQg.text: Went in for the first time ever.  It was a Friday night and I had no idea what to expect. Girlfriend and I were thinking it would be some kind of gaming bar. Envisioning Cheers with slot machines and video poker. We were so wrong! When we walked in, we thought we would be dining with Frank, Dean, and Sammy. Seriously.  From the subdued lighting and dark, rich wood decor, the only thing missing was a piano in the corner. The service was on point. Great timing and never intrusive. The dinner was excellent.  My girlfriend had the Idaho trout and French onion soup.  I had the bone-in ribeye and sauteed mushrooms.  Terrific choices. The only reason I didn't give the 5th star, and I could be too critical, is the menu prices.  It is on the steeper side. Reasonable but a little too steep for me. With that said, I'd recommend the Golden Steer to anyone.  It really felt like it belongs only in Vegas.

fOwfnOSxCVl5TQ_5yhAjWw.text: The filet mignon was AMAZING!!! The lobster tail though ... super fishy and I could have gone without. The caesar salad was awesome.   I hear the desserts are amazing - they look fun but I didn't try them. Wish i had though!

JRl5r2A1A04N1M7eSzkyLA.text: Yesterday evening, we were heading home on W Sahara and we both decided that we wanted steak for dinner. I immediately pointed out how close we were to the Golden Steer and we pulled in. We were early, their first dinner guests, but we hadn't eaten all day and I didn't want to kill time just to avoid looking like senior citizens.   The location is in a small, raggedy-looking strip mall but don't let that deter you... the restaurant doesn't match the mall.  The Golden Steer is definitely old school, but classy old school. It's dark but our booth had more than enough light for reading our menus or eating our food, something a few other restaurants could learn from. Seriously, if you have to attach a flashlight to your menu, you've gone too far.  We got bread and butter first, good but nothing special. The butter was cold but not frozen and it was fresh enough that it didn't crumble, so no complaints. We were served our escargot first, and the snails were tender plus the sauce was exactly the right old-school garlic butter that hooked me the first time I had properly done escargot. They didn't serve any bread or toast with it, but we still had bread from our basket so used that. We both love soaking bread in the garlic butter and the lemon wedge added just enough extra zing.  Next, we had the Caesar salad, which was prepared table side. It was good, and the inclusion of anchovies made it authentic. It was a tad salty for my tastes but hubby loved every bite. I know, I'm weird but I'm just not a fan of highly salted food. Unless it's peanuts or potato chips, then go figure.  Our entrees arrived once hubby stopped eating his salad, showing the unobtrusive attentiveness of our waiter. We both ordered filet mignon, medium rare, and I added bearnaise sauce while hubby added peppercorn and bearnaise . While our filets were vastly different sizes, both were perfectly prepared and nicely seasoned and juicy. The sauces were also fantastic, with hubby wreaking devastation on the peppercorn.  We also ordered two sides, the mushrooms and creamed corn. Both were excellent, and the creamed corn was obviously handmade and vastly superior to anything canned. I had to limit myself on that one, because of my milk-product intolerance, because I could tell that real cream was used.  All in all, the meal was great. The service was impeccable, the food fantastic, and the ambiance made me feel underdressed. We definitely ordered more food than I could eat but hubby did his best to make up for the imbalance.  The tab was $190, with no wine or dessert, and was about what I expected. We will definitely return!

scJ2BHyZo7wd0Nfnb3gwKw.text: We ate here for the first time on Sun, 2/17/19.  Do NOT be afraid of the place when you see it from the outside. Lacks a lot in curb appeal.  Inside is dark and cozy.  The bone-in rib eye is 22 oz, so my boyfriend and I shared.  Delicious, but a bit on the bland side.  Service was 5 from our informative nice server--Bryant I think--and all the wait staff.  Bread, wedge salad, creamed spinach and mac-and-cheese were great too!

ZGd4YL6UYNuWStaZQtrmig.text: Wow! What a great time at an old fashioned / traditional / classic Steakhouse - if you were in Reno it would feel like the Harrah's Steakhouse when Debbie was at the front door doing seating. Trolley service , salads made at the table , four person teams to service your table so the service was great - it is ala carte so order your entree and sides as you look over the menu. The filet and crab legs were perfect melted butter , creamed spinach, French fires and a Au Gratin style potato that was yummy. The Camus was swirled in a decanter and was sweet at the start and full bodied at the end.  I truly enjoyed the Golden Steer and can't wait to get back!!

v3c5VgC-rq-XU6bc5_0Luw.text: We were told about this place by the locals and it was amazing!  The Rat Pack used to hang out here after shows for drinking and dinner.  Their photos are al over and the history in pics and mementos are fun to look at. The service was impeccable and the food very good!  Their drinks were also well made and so top shelf!  I had a Perfect Manhattan and it was the best.  The steaks are well cooked and the Oysters Rockefeller were to die for!  Of course dinner was topped off with 24 year old Port and Creme Brulee and Cheesecake.   If you want classic Vegas and to eat in the rat pack room where the stars diner in the heyday, this is the place!
