8lKHnsN9SLT2nFE5OlIPdw.text: The service is great but the food is ok. The veal kinda tough n steak was ok, had better. Side are small portion, just enough if you're on a diet.

XrA1mtiWwkmVQoFGh4K7nQ.text: Great place to experience "Frank Sinatra" Vegas!!! Great steaks, great martinis... little pricey but worth it !!!  I would recommend it for dates ... treat your partner with a classy outing.

7NWCCzkstrjpQusjXjr6-Q.text: Old School Cool , but Food Just Okay  I have lived in Las Vegas since 1991 and this was my first time dining here . It was my 51st Birthday back in September and my son wanted to take me . The decor is old school Vegas and we sat at the Joe DiMaggio table next to the John Wayne table . The booth was comfortable and nice set table . The service was as expected in a nice steak house , very good . Now I got the larger Filet Mignon with twice baked potato and my son got the petite Filet Mignon with Shrimp Scampi . If you like your steak to taste like steak and not over seasoned then this is good for you . It is kind of bland , but you can get like I did the Bearnaise sauce to add a little to it . It was good meat , but my son said he liked my steak I cook at home better , which I thought was funny . I cook mine low and slow in a iron skillet with olive oil and a few seasonings . Don't get me wrong , others may like a more meaty unseasoned steak , it is to each persons taste .   The best steak I ever had in my life was in San Antonio , Texas back in the 90's and it was cooked in a Burgundy Wine Sauce and the meat was so moist you took a fork to it and pulled the meat off without using a knife ! I went there 3 times in 2 years , not cheap , but wow . Anyway , they gave me a slice of cheesecake with chocolate drizzle and a big candle like a firework and sang happy birthday , which was cool . The cheesecake was really good . We also had 2 salads and a bottle water and one beer . It came to around $180 plus a generous tip . My son was very happy with the service and that they took care of us . I would recommend to some people , but I think we will try somewhere else next time . It is good to have variety .

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Baked Potato with Butter .
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon and Shrimp Scampi .
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butterfly Filet Mignon and twice baked potato .

ECLstJQCszcGXBbSsqt_AQ.text: One of my biggest embarrassments is that I just RECENTLY went here for the first time. Classy old bars and restaurants are my favorite, and being the oldest steakhouse in Vegas, this place is a must.   Before I entered, a fun little escapade occurred with an attempted dine-and-ditch guest. The staff were very professional about it (especially considering they were all practically wearing tuxedos).  The ambiance - 100% in my book. Old-timey, leather booths, dark and moody. Sign me up always.  The FOOD. Ok, so you are going to a pretty classy and classic steakhouse. Expect to spend a little cash. However, if you were at a spot in a hotel casino or at a steakhouse in L.A. or Seattle, the prices here are considerably rad and do-able by comparrison.   We split a bottle of wine for our party of two. (Don't ask me what kind, because how could I possibly remember). It was amazing. I split a Caesar Salad with my guest, and the dressing was prepared table side (that's how fancy people do it btw). It was great - I hate that powerful anchovy taste, but this dressing was very well balanced. We also split the Rib Eye Steak, some asparagus, and perfectly creamy mashed potatoes.   Since this was an "anniversary" (kinda), we were surprised with a flaming cheesecake situation at the end of the meal. Don't ask questions - just go experience it ;)  I want more money, so I can eat here constantly.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad made Tableside
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and other goodies

wGi_mDtLD9_i8Dk0f5q77A.text: This place is top notch. If you're looking for a high-roller meal, go no further. The Golden Steer has hosted (and can prove it) some of the most prolific people in history and for good reason. The steak was one the best I've ever had (Filet) and the made-at-your-table Caesar salad is as fresh and tasteful as you can get. 5 stars isn't enough. Thanks for a great and forever memorable evening!

Ro65whWJ-g4cgYCiwn_f9g.text: Best thing about this place is the ambience and the French onion soup. I had a New York strip ordered it medium rare and it came out perfectly cooked. The flavor was OK not as much marbling as was led to believe by our waiter when ordering. My coworker had the fillet it was cooked perfectly but flavor was lacking. He had a house salad iceberg lettuce and a few other things carrots tomato cucumbers. We shared broccoli which was way under cooked,  barely blanched.  We had to check it out since it was historical in Las Vegas, but will definitely find a better steak elsewhere.  The Las Vegas area could be such a rip off if you're not careful.

oVqNWOcT-GiNDNWG8-flbw.text: I've been here numerous times. The steaks are spot on. The service is impeccable. One of the original steak houses where all the greats would come to eat. Must stop place.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L0F1CeVaiwCsiTu0xlOHig.text: Est. 1958 Truly an 'oldie but goodie'. Wow~ just wow! In a good way! I'm from out of town and my bro-in-law wanted the family to experience something unique from the old Vegas when Elvis and the Rat Pack frequented town. Boy, am I glad that he read an article that led us to this place! There is so much history here and we were that are that right time, that we were able to get a private tour! Can you believe that a medium sized restaurant had history enough that could warrant a tour? Well, it did! We learned of how the mob used to enter from he back way and present a chip in a sandwich as a way of making themselves known or something of that sort! We even heard of a possibility of the haunting of the ghost of the dress shop owner who died in a fire next door - which space was quickly rennovated and added to the restaurant... coincidence or foul play? Who is to say, but photos falling from the wall and choking guests in the same bar seat were stories that were shared with us... WHAT'S FUN: You can sit in the booths that old world celebs used to reserve. We happened to have sat in Muhammed Ali's table, which was formerly Natalie Wood's table! See an article about it here: reviewjournal.com/news/d... WHAT'S TASTY: Touted as the best Steakhouse in Vegas, I was not disappointed. I had to share the Rib Eye with 2 of my sisters because it was so huge, but size was not it's only attribute. Taste was so very delicious too! I really wanted to pick up the bone and gnaw on it, but the restaurant is still nice (e.g.: waiters in tuxedos) so it didn't feel appropriate, although the atmosphere is relaxed and not stuffy, I still wanted to maintain some sort of decorum. :) Really enjoyed the table side Ceasar salad and from afar I noticed a table side Bananas Foster! What a cool show! I really enjoyed the crab cocktail too. The meat was fresh and sweet. I couldn't ask for anything more. So the food is classic and you might say it's hard to find a place like this anymore amidst all the new fusion places that abound in Vegas nowadays. WHAT'S UNIQUE IN SERVICE: When is the last time that a Maitre D' made you feel like you were the most special people in the room? Kudos to Roland Paz who did just that. Not only was he the one who shared all the wonderfully intriguing restaurant history, but he went one up and offered to call us a ride to our hotel. AND WHAT A RIDE! It was the nicest, cleanest Limo shuttle I've ever been in. I'm not sure if this is a regular thing they do, but it was sure nice that it was available and offered while we were there. WHAT'S WEIRD: Don't expect your basic server and server assistant... I think we had like 4 or 5 different people serve our table in one form or another. Maybe they were all helping each other out, but it wasn't a style of serving that I am familiar with. Again, I love that the waiters wear tuxedos and most of my family was dressed nicely, but many of the diners were wearing super casual stuff. I think it would be fun to go there in black tie to dine on a special occasion. WHAT'S MORE: So, my mom loves Elvis and she and I took a side detour to sit in his booth... a nearby father and son were dining and overheard us. He told us that that day was actually Elvis' death anniversary and his wedding anniversary. Me being totally oblivious, was happy and wished them a happy anniversary, thinking the mom was in the bathroom or sick at home... later my mom tells me that the wife was not there anymore... like she had passed on already. I felt soon very badly that I did not express condolences and maybe gift them with a surprise dessert or something... So if they ever read this. I am sorry! My condolences and thank you for being so kind to me and my mom during such a tough time for you. God bless you. I said a prayer for you and your family. OVERALL: If you are going to Vegas and tired of the glitz and glam and craziness of the strip, go off strip for an experience at one of the last spots in town that reflect old Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The shuttle limo!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E37ubax3MZIMsbXSxQnTMw.text: Great bar.  Then had an amazing dinner and desert.  Highly recommend.  Service was fantastic

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Golden Steer Steakhouse was founded in 1958.

em9tCcOlDk_z8G6dPF0sOw.text: Best prime rib and rib eye hands down in Vegas! Excellent ambiance and waitstaff. Erick deserves a raise!  awesome! Will definitely be back next time we are in town. Worth the price!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RSpHTME9F-xIwT74diWaMg.text: This is a tricky review because it was my first time here and it was not a good experience however I do feel like they went out of their way to rectify the situation and not much was able to be done about it.  We walked in, no reservations. Waited about 15 mins. The staff is all very polite and welcoming. We were seated and ordered a couple appetizers, steak and a couple sides. They brought the steak and even though we requested medium well it arrived super raw. It was so raw we kind of lost our appetite. We sent it back and they threw it back on the grill mean while we are eating our sides so they won't get cold and by the time the steak arrived again, it had already lost its flavor. We didn't eat it. We asked for the check and informed the waiter we were not paying for it. The lady in the front came over and was super apologetic for the experience. She said she said we would not be charged for the steak and offered us a choice of free dessert. - again mistakes happen and I feel that because they wanted to fix it I would try this place again just not any time soon.   We ordered the banana dessert and it was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their banana dessert is the best!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nope

u5LVEnTShKtYTIsN1Ta5dA.text: I put 5 stars because I couldn't find 100! This is THE BEST steak and prime rib that I've ever tried. The place IS AMAZING what an ambiance, so coooool real old Vegas. You can feel as if you have the Rat Pack eating next to you. Unbelievably beautiful!! I would live and eat here every day if I could afford it but definitely will be here every month CONGRATULATIONS AND THANKS FOR ONE OF THE BEST MEALS EVEEEEER!!!

FKy9bKfGtfywgiRGtpn0Zg.text: Top Notch service...Celebrated Mothers 84th Bday and couldnt have asked for anything better, service was EXCELLENT and food was superb...Filet was cooked to perfection and ceasar salad was fresh and delicious...first time and will definitely return...Thank you!

9taGKWLm7V0UJ2TgWPtlkQ.text: My wife and I and a friend from Kona dined at the Golden Steer last night.  We have been here several times and it never gets old.  First class service with fabulous food.  Henry was our server and that just made it even better.  We will be back for sure.  It would be nice if they had a "Happy Hour" in the bar area, maybe sometime in the near future. And before we dined we had the pleasure to meet the bartenders.  Umberto is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining at the Golden Steer.

hE3xZUvnUiEBvFpjIh4z6g.text: This place is celebrating its 60th anniversary and I can see why. You walk in and the place is so old school! Pictures of famous Vegas Strip stars from years ago, traditional seating with giant leather booths, wallpaper, just a cool place to have dinner.  Service was excellent. We ordered a prime rib to share, which was very good.  The sides weren't as awesome, we had creamed spinach and asparagus, which was just not to my liking.   Pricing is pretty high, but you are paying for the atmosphere and good service. We ordered a couple of bottles of wine, pricing on those, depending on the bottle seemed to be about double what you would pay in a liquor store, so that really wasn't bad. Again, you're paying for the experience, and we had a good time and shut down the place, as we were the last ones out.  The table next to us was apparently not happy with their service, which we were surprised about because the waiter was definitely taking care of them. They walked out complaining that it was the worst experience they ever had in there.  My friend and I couldn't understand what the problem was at their table. We watched as they had table side caesar salad and all their entrees came out timely from what we could see.  Maybe they just didn't care for the waiter.   All in all, I would go back and try a steak next time and a couple of different sides.

_8rYJCK6WDh_rriMzIlXvA.text: Very disappointed in the service and quality.  6 of us in a freezing booth with very impersonal waiters. Food was okay if we were at Outback but not when we spend $350 for 2 dinners.  And the broccoli was cold with no flavor.  To make matters worse we had to bring out our phones to add up our checks because they could not divide the check between 3 couples.  Over all experience a 1.  Over all food for the prices  - a 2.   Obviously they do not want business from Las Vegas locals.  We wont be back.

mLgetZu6hMFQ-ziqodnBDg.text: Wow. Where do I begin? Classic steakhouse vibe. Check. Great drinks. Check. Great food. Check. Great service. Check.   I had heard a lot about this place beforehand and had very high expectations going in. For my bachelor party dinner I heard this would be the highlight of the trip and it did not disappoint. We got there a little early and started with some drinks while we waiting. The Old Fashioned was perfect. Next we were taking to the dinner table a few minutes later and the Duckhorn wine was flowing. Our server was awesome, helping us with any and all questions we had.   Everyone by the end of the meal was talking about how stuffed we were and how good everything was. Can't recommend this place highly enough. The rich history just adds to the ambiance and good times. Perfect for a date spot or a group dinner.

_jkd4oy26fmU0W_5lEENQA.text: Company dinner here last night and what a great surprise. When you pull up outside it doesn't look like much in a non assuming strip mall. But you step inside and you are taken back to the good old days of Vegas. Cool atmosphere and decor, amazing Caesar salad, and the steaks were top notch. Staff all great as well!

eM6McNHd0euHbjOl105fGg.text: Disappointed overall.  Bad service, poor quality and incompetent wait staff.  Bad service:  I finished my beverage and then counted the number of times wait staff passed by the table without offering to refill my glass.  I got up to 13 before finally asking a passing waiter for a refill and even that waiter passed me by without seeing or hearing me.  Sure soda gets less attention than wine or cocktails but 13, no 14 times getting passed by is a little too much.  Poor quality: I ordered the Ribeye and my friend ordered the New York.   There was gristle in the meat.  I've never seen such poor quality in USDA prime meat (which is what we were told it was).  Also my Ribeye was barley warm.  Incompetent wait staff: at the end our waiter didn't know how to use the credit card terminal and had to call another waiter over.  The asparagus was nice (crunchy, the way I like it).  I was looking forward to having a fun experience at this nostalgic place but what good is the nostalgia when the food and service are so poor!

0_bwxUxpw9b_RwR0Quo1kA.text: Every time I'm in Vegas I try to make sure to stop here! Really nice cuts of meat with delicious a la carte sides - creamed spinach is sooo good. My favorite appetizer is the escargots!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gUF5U0iK1BPj3LhnPlo2HA.text: Food: 4/5 Service: 5/5 Cocktails: 3/5 Ambience: 5/5  Came here for the first time last weekend after wanting to try this place for a long time. I am big fan of old school Vegas and this is the place for some good history and great ambience.   Service was fantastic the entire meal, we had 2 or 3 waiters and they were all nice as could be and very informed about the menu.   Can you get a better steak elsewhere? Yeah, you can. BUT, this is still very top notch. Unless you are steak snob (I can be) then you and your friends/family will love this place.   My only gripe would be the cocktail and wine prices. The wine list is ultra expensive for a decent wine. They need to get that in check. Other than that, all the sides, table side ceaser and steaks were all cooked very well and tasted great.  This is CLASSIC steakhouse food, not elevated, not modern, and that's A-OK in my book.   Worth a try for sure, just bring your wallet, our 3-person meal with one bottle of wine was $500+.

NbipLiJM8QoO4Ruw3EErvw.text: My family and I just moved to Vegas last month and we are enjoying all the great restaurants this city has to offer!  I made a reservation for a Saturday at 5:30. My party and I were about 20 minutes early but the host was quick to accommodate us and we're we're seated immediately. Walking into the dimly lit restaurant was like walking into another era. It was fabulous! From the looks of the outside of the restaurant you would never know of the treasure it holds inside.   All of the staff in the entire restaurant are great... Attentive, kind, prompt and, entertaining! Our waiter Humberto was awesome, sharing history of the restaurant and the decor surrounding our table. He also mentioned to us it was a popular hangout for the mob and that they have a private dining room referred to as "the mob room". That would be great to see in a future visit.   Now the food! We started with the garlic bread it was slightly crunchy, flakey, cheesy and, not overpowered by garlic it had the perfect balance of flavors. Followed by the table side Caesar salad, the dressing was mixed and doctored up right before our eyes. Tossed and served with homemade croutons. The dressing was the best Caesar dressing I have ever had! It was creamy yet had a bit of tang that my entire party really enjoyed. Now on to the entree, the filet mignon with a twice baked potato to accompany. The filet was delicious! It was large enough to feed two adults comfortably. Simply seasoned and cooked to perfection. Again one of the best I have ever had! The twice baked potato was good. The potato was baked, then the tender potato was scooped out and whipped with delicious toppings, placed back in the skin and baked again with delicious seasoning on top.   Now from what I researched prior to my visit, The Golden Steer is popular for their prime rib. I had the pleasure of sampling (from a family members dinner). It was so tender and flavorful, definitely living up to its popularity.  I look forward to visiting The Golden Steer again, it was quite a treat for my family and I!

U_NbQaO9cNruqhfgb9HzwA.text: My favorite steakhouse in Vegas and the oldest too! Sure you could hit one of those celebrity steakhouses on the strip and have to walk a half mile to get into or you can pull right up to the Golden Steer. The moment you walk in you can feel old school Vegas! Every time I go I reserve the Sinatra booth. The Rat Pack often used to hang out here as did Elvis and other old school celebrities. The cocktails are stiff and the meat is perfectly cooked. I got the filet with the twice baked potato sooooo flavorful. So when you need a great steakhouse. This is the place to be! See pics below.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qx8tVRjpuNAnp9rpAMopMg.text: This place is riding only on it's reputation and rat pack connection. Steaks are okay, sides are...hmm...okay. There are plenty of waaaay better steakhouses in town to go to than to slug through an average piece of beef.   Decent bar when it's not busy, but once it is, the bar/lounge is straight up hostile. Bartenders slamming cooler doors and barking at patrons to pick up their own drinks (not us, we sat at the bar) it's fine at 3 in the afternoon but don't bother any other time.

3zpFcdQyayJlIBAc22QY6Q.text: Great staff and drinks and food  . Have a great time.  Ask for Erik ! Great staff Dinner menu is very high priced

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Drinks and the staff

SdM4mlND8C1cFaQ6so_LAQ.text: I had wanted to go here for a long time so I finally made it happen!!!!   DELICIOUS    I had steak with crab meat on top it was great my steak was cooked perfectly very juicy and tender I got it paired with asparagus with just as yum!!!   I was very happy to find a place that did cherry jubilee it was the BEST!!! Just as good as I remember I will for sure come back

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ykgwE5F-ZohU6H5GKSwOHw.text: For a steak house that has been around for ever it's a disappointment... 4 out of 5 plates had to get sent back and they still didn't get it right... This place is dead in our book, never again...

xtUzbJ8-pOE2XbVlfhvbMQ.text: I brought my 11 year old, going in 31 year old son here for a post birthday treat independent of his twin sister and older brother.  When we arrived, the maitre d' welcomed us and promptly showed us to our booth.  I enjoyed watching the interaction between staff and my son.  When we sat down my son commented that he did not expect this restaurant to be so big or nice inside based on the appearance outside. The Golden Steer is a great restaurant to get a feel of historic, nostalgic Las Vegas! I thought the service was good but I was not overly impressed based on how high the prices were.  To begin, we ordered the table side Caesar salad which was delicious and pleasant to watch, the 22 ounce prime rib steak cooked medium rare - to share(it was good but my son preferred his father's seasonings- I agree), the creamed corn (too sweet) and for dessert my son ordered the bananas Foster prepared table side with a lovely fire show, I had one bite! And finally, I trying to be "the good mom" ordered a slice of strawberry cheesecake to bring my two children at home to split - that did not happen! The strawberry topping which was fresh strawberries in a sugary sauce (not a gooey glaze) was love at first bite.  I ate all but one forkful. All in all it was a pleasant experience that I would recommend to any local or tourist who wanted to get a feel for old, traditional Vegas style dining, and table side preparations which are not all that common anymore.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I just love that strawberry goodness.
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love to dress up for date night!

sIVaxL_7Qqd7t6MRaQXX4w.text: My wife heard that this was a great place and we were not disappointed in the least. We both had filets cooked to perfection and I had crab legs with mine that were equally delicious. The twice baked potato was fine but nothing terribly special either but that's not what you're coming here to eat. Our server, Thomas, and his assistants were there with anything we needed and great beards too. This is one of the reasons you should have a car to explore the town away from the strip.

DmXNywbrmMAd2YR6YK2nPw.text: Well, let's just say it was... Disappointing.   I will start with the very tender meat that is quite good and juicy and that's the only positive point with the host that was really friendly.   Waiters are cocky and their sales pitch is poor. They don't even know what's in their meals (one of them was not making the difference between ganache and icing on their chocolate cake when asked) and would rather sell you the place and its history than their food.   And it's understandable. Meat is juicy and tender but it's basically broiled (to taste) without any char. But ok, why not.   Presentation is poor as the meat arrives by itself in a plate that is not meant to cut meat easily. Same with the expensive and quite scarce sides.  But it's ok because you won't see it anyway. I know that steakhouses have the (bad) habit of dimming the lights but here it's basically turned off completely. I couldn't make the difference in my ribeye between fat, meat, bone ad grissel. Meh.   In the end 4 people, 2 small glasses of wine, 1 vodka, 1 ice tea, 4 meat platters and 3 sides turned out to be 300 dollars before tip. It's way too much for what it's worth.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The waiting room is really nicely decorated in a very old fashioned over the top way.

2wvk9-84jbvMH4-11L1t9g.text: I thought it would be cool to check out an old steakhouse establishment.  Apparently the Rat Pack came all the time in the old days.  I had their ribeye and twice backed potatoes.  Very good steak.  Juicy and just the right amount of fat.  Twice backed potatoes was ok.  Should have gotten the standard baked potatoes.  Definitely on the pricier side.  It was a good one time experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye and twice baked potatoes

DvQwQ_y_f8s-LoHQIGhbqg.text: This place is fantastic..Great food, great service with an old school Vegas atmosphere.  High quality without being pretentious.  Highlights of our meal were the table side Caesar salad (amazing), the mushrooms and the bone-in rib eye.  Highly recommend!

PrmDYBa-FZjhtjzPceCneA.text: Excellent service and amazing food! I ordered the escargot, a rib eye, and a twice baked potato! All amazing! I'll definitely be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UIMpvuKB52WMnNGw2_C2KA.text: If you're going for the food,  don't. If you're going for the nostalgia, do. If you're going for the drinks and bartenders, definitely do.  Food is low grade swill.  Drinks and service are fantastic.

RlMtJTfZCBLNJHQc7k2zXQ.text: Golden Steer is a Vegas classic, steeped in Rat Pack lore. My friend, who steered us to the Steer, insisted on booking Sinatra's booth, and book it we did. Initially indifferent, I must admit there was a certain feeling of cool sitting in the booth where Ol' Blue Eyes used to sit. We debated whether there was enough room in the booth for the entire Pack. I argued there was only room enough for Frank and up to 2 broads. This was confirmed when we noticed similar booths tagged with the names of Dean Martin and the rest.  The dark, classy back-room ambiance is definitely a throwback to a gone-by era of guys and dolls, gangster and dames. Just ask one of the waiters for a story from the old days...Though most of the staff is younger, there is  a guy who looks like he time-traveled from 1960 to make  you a table-side Caesar salad--which, by the way, is just what he does when you order one.  Steak was uniformly excellent. Even though I'd already eaten dinner and didn't order food, my friends were nice enough to offer me cuts of their meat. The New York Strip, which was mistakenly delivered to my friend who ordered filet mignon but did not mind, was juicy even at medium.  They also make a mean Old Fashioned, about the only thing on the menu that I actually ordered for myself.  On the way out, my friend confused two Canadian businessmen in town for CES for waitstaff, thanking them for a wonderful night. Oops, but the verdict was right.  PS: You already know this, but make sure your wallet is stuffed with Grants and Benjamins and your credit card is loaded before venturing in.

eqz8rIJRV8_u_DTdexCYRw.text: Amazing service excellent food. A bit pricey but well worth it. Great wine list and phenomenal bannas foster. Will be going back for sure

JFafRh5BkabqbgFazsU15Q.text: An iconic steakhouse worthy of its reputation.  The waiters are in jackets, the lights are dim but not dark, and the place has all the charm of Sinatra himself.    The table side caesar was great.  They mix up the dressing to order and then toss in shredded romaine and parmesan.  The portions are very generous, enough for a meal.  This was definitely one of the best caesars I've ever had.  We also tried the petite filet and the new york steak.  They switched the doneness on the steaks, but they were still very good.  I didn't mind at all.  The new york was definitely more flavorful.  The filet was honestly a bit bland, as far as steak goes, but it was very tender.    Everything is a la carte, so you have to order sides separately.  I tried the double baked potato and it was alright.  It reminded me of potato skins.    Oh, the bar is fantastic.  I tried their signature golden steer and manhattan and both were on point.    My only regret was not saving room for dessert.  They have a table side bananas foster and cherries jubilee that looked amazing (table next to us ordered the bananas foster).  Also, the table behind us was celebrating a birthday and they were raving about the cheesecake.  Definitely going to try next time.

CaqnE7qVC5mHbzw-vJwExQ.text: Overall it was ok.  The food and service could have been better.  Drink prices were overpriced.

5ZNOHtkRNW0s1OF0g4eXyg.text: Great food, great atmosphere, and great service! If there's any place I don't mind paying extra for it's Golden Steer! Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Everything we ordered from the steak to the cappuccino was delicious!

5dxPcqf-9fvUNutqN-gLag.text: Golden steer is an iconic Vegas steakhouse. We have been wanting to try it since we had moved here..so what better time than for my fiances 45th birthday! He is a huge fan of Frank Sinatra. So of course I requested the sinatra booth.  You would not think that the inside would be what it was from the outside. It is in a strip mall, next to a deli and a local bar. But if you can look past that and wait til you walk in the door of Golden Steer you will go back in time. The ambiance is old school vegas, a great bar, piano and sitting area are there when you 1st enter. They sat us almost immediately. Frank Sinatras plaque is on the wall! Which was so special for my fiance, thinking he was sitting right where Sinatra had sat for so many years.  We had another couple with us to enjoy this experience.  We both ordered the chateaubriand for 2 and the table side Cesar salad.  The presentation was the best I have ever seen. The chateaubriand came out whole on a platter, 2 huge heads of cooked broccoli and carrots. The waiter carved the meat and plated it along with the vegetables.  It was cooked to perfection. It was served with hollandaise and bearnaise sauce.  It was not only the best meal we have had in Vegas but the entire experience  was truly special.  We will be back!  Thank you for making his 45th one that can never be forgotten!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TXCgU2SWUmEgyI4PsCnmyQ.text: The service started out iffy when making a reservation.  The person who answered the phone was more concerned about getting my contact information than confirming if my requested time was available.  Then he proceeded to give me times that were not the time I requested.  When our party arrived, I was surprised to see the place as empty as it was.  Based on the attitude of the person on the phone, it sounded like they are going to be busy.  Once we sat down, the service and food was what you would expect for the price.  I had the prime rib, Cesar salad, and baked potato.  Everything was good.  Nothing that would make me say this was the best steak house in vegas.    It is definitely a place one should visit at least once.  Would I go back, sure.  However, I would not go out of my way to eat there.  There are many other steak houses to give a try.

yVMHKIeeAnJADq4zOBoDgw.text: Congratulations golden steer on starting my yelp career! Never felt the need to write a review on any of my experiences good or bad. That is until I took my fiance here for his 30th birthday dinner on 8/14/2015.  Food was okay, had the NY Strip and the ginormous lobster tail and even bigger baked potato. Combo meal came with soup or salad and veggies. Selected asparagus and clam chowder... Blah... (I'm from New England so I'm hard to impress with chowder). Good ,but nothing to rave about for any of the items definitely will not dream of eating anything I ordered.   Now onto my terrible experience. We arrived around 8 pm without reservations, which wasn't an issue, and were seated right away. Great so far. Restaurant was quite empty for a Friday night. Ambiance was lovely, very old Vegas. Nice. Snuck to the "bathroom" to set up a birthday surprise for my love. Hostess told me it is complementary and she would hook us up. Still going Great. Now here's were the ship starts to sink. Quickly. Waiter took our order. TWO lobster and steak dinners. TWO steaks ordered differently. Waiter comes out with one soup. Sorry sir we ordered two. No problem, he grabbed another promptly. Ate our "blazay" chowder just in time to receive our main course. ONE meal arrived and was placed in front of my fiance. Surely mine was next. Nope I was handed an empty plate and utensils. "I'm sorry sir I ordered one as well". Blank stare. He left to figure out the problem. The man who placed our order came over and said he thought we were gonna share and he apologizes. (Mind you we ordered a well done steak and a med well steak, don't c how the chef would pull that off). Still no big deal things happen right? He told me it would take only 15 min or so to fire it up. Cool. Birthday boy offered to wait for my food as well. Cold lobster? No enjoy your food babe I'll wait. 20 minutes later no food! 30 minutes later my food arrived. Did I mention the restaurant was not packed? To bad my fiance was full and done with his plate. So we ate two separate meals. By this time im a tad bit annoyed. Oh yea when my food came out they forgot my veggies and my lobster was over freakin cooked and my steak was well done!!! Whatever just bring on the damn cake. While eating I seen others celebrate their birthday with cake being brought out with sparklers and a cheerful hostess singing. Sweet. I wrapped up my plate as I was over it (still hadn't received my veggies, just a plate of meat) . The hostess comes over with an UNLIT slice of cake (there was a candle in it just wasn't lit) wtf? She places the cake down and said let me check on your veggies I'll be right back!!! Are u freakin kidding me? F$&& the veggies lady! Yay surprise happy bday bae . We sat there awkwardly with an unlit cake for 5 min or so until a different waiter came and asked if we needed anything ... Umm yea a birthday celebration would be nice. I told him the hostess ran off and never came back. He giggled and said I can light it. I wasn't amused. He lit the candle and stood there.AKWARD. I sang to him alone. Never again. By this time I was livid. He said I'm sorry about the confusion but I'm sure the food was good? What? Are u kidding me. No manager no compensation no anything. He proceeded to bring me the check with a smack in the face when he charged me 10 bucks for two glasses of water!!! 300 bucks for two dinners ,two waters and a side of disappointment. Thanks for ruining his birthday dinner Golden Steer.   You get one star simply because my fiances meal was correct and tasted fine.

AzBEDFAMllLEFAcfTBNaOw.text: They are not kidding when they say "The Best Steakhouse On Earth".  The service was incredible! I think we were helped by every service person sans the barkeep. If you made eye contact, they were at your table asking "Is there anything you want?" Not need, but want. The hostess was ready to seat us before our reservations were confirmed!   The food was incredible. The best steak we've ever had. Truly. The wine was served perfectly. No room for dessert.

gxTm1EqSAsuTkscg0w12-g.text: Formerly locals, we went looking for a traditional restaurant away from the modern Strip. We found it and loved it.  Summary: A bit pricey, lovely service, and great food.  Started with cocktails: perfectly made cosmo and Manhattan. Bread was delicious, followed by the escargot. Huge snails prepared perfectly! Next, we both had the prepared-fresh-at-the-table Caesar salads. Oh, my, these were the best. We both ordered filets (her 8 oz; mine 12 oz) cooked to medium-rare perfection. We split a twice-baked potato and simply had no room for dessert. With a glass of wine each, the total (before tip) was just a hair under two bills. Not Ruth's Chris, but not Outback, either. I'd say the value for the experience (old school room with dressed-up waitstaff and Sinatra on the sound system in an otherwise quiet room) is spot-on.

8-TPPp4fUFWobCrnvpdbtw.text: If you are in Vegas you have to eat here. Great Old Vegas atmosphere. The wait staff is awesome. Best table side Cesar salad and lets not forget their table side Bananas Foster (best I've ever had). I've been here 4 times now and have never had bad service.

Bhn4LGDedPEl-AiKRBgi8w.text: I honestly can't figure out why this restaurant only has 3 stars. If you want an authentic Vegas dinner, this is your place. The atmosphere is old school Vegas and the steak is some of the best I've ever had. The service was friendly and quick. My friend is gluten-free and the hostess and wait staff were incredibly patient and accommodating while explaining her options. I had the filet mignon and tableside ceasar salad and highly recommend both!  I'm definitely going back the next time I'm in Vegas!

V4aO_74_cDDGp3hEu0tbJg.text: The 3 of us went here Saturday night, no waiting that should have been a clue. Sat down got a quick rundown on specials, ordering was fairly fast, service was spotty for the price of their food. Multiple people bringing you the order. Food was subpar for the price you pay. This place is living on it's past of the 60's and 70's. Nothing wowed us from the stuff we ordered, servings were small for the price. Would not come back here. Lots of other similarly priced places in Vegas with better service and quality of food. To the owners those that don't adjust get left with the times and this place is 20 years behind in quality and service.

isQGXztQXmqUmVEhhs_q0w.text: Had a great night here. I had the filet and some seafood for an app. Everything was delicious.   From the outside this place isn't appealing to the eye but go inside and it's very old school steak house. Loved it. Would return again!

isU8t0QJODA9j6Ts6LnTiQ.text: This is the first time I have ever written a review on any type of establishment or service, but I felt so strongly about the way our bill was presented I had to voice my displeasure to all that will see. Went to the Golden Steer steakhouse with a close friend, We are both born and raised in Las Vegas and remember coming to this restaurant many many years ago. It was one of the few fancy steakhouses back in the day. Wanted to enjoy a nice meal in a old school higher end not OUTBACK steakhouse since it had been forever and thought we may get much better quality and service then one of the chains we go to all the time Morton's, Del Frisco's  Flemings etc.....looking forward to their table side caesar salad since not too many places offer that these days. The captain or waiter not sure of his title was polite enough but not very engaging. A little too aloof for that job only my opinion The salad was decent not the best table side Caesar but okay. We both ordered the shrimp scampi which was good. Shrimp were decent size and the scampi sauce was delicious!  The service was not so great or the caliber you would expect from a restaurant that markets itself a certain way along with the prices it charges. We had to request additional water along with bread several times. They kept forgetting, and it wasn't busy at all. That in itself doesn't turn me off from coming back or recommending a restaurant, everyone has an off night, but what does and why I am writing this is the way the bill was presented. The Captain/waiter brought over a portable credit card reader swiped my card and then stood there and pointed out the tip choices. He got his 20% which would be the norm that I tip but it was out of the pressure of him standing over us. While he would have received a tip, the service wasn't very attentive it was mediocre at best my feeling 15% tip would have been fair.  I have never ever been presented a bill in this manner and would never expect this at a so called higher end steak house. For that I will never patronize nor recommend this establishment to anyone. Management really needs to revisit this practice. It screams very low class

5se2opUlGVxwZtBWqUXirQ.text: Well, I wanted to like this place.  I was here recently with a bunch of coworkers, one who has been here many times in the past and was raving and even he said that this time, it was just "meh".  I ordered the Rib Eye, rare...it was medium/well when I got it, dry and cost $50!  Crazy!  I also tasted the asparagus side (just ok), the large baked potato (just ok) some potato/onion side (greasy), the fries (cold) and I had a tomato salad (didnt care for that at all).  What I'm saying here is, the food was WAY below par and the prices were outrageous!!  I'm only glad I didnt pay for anything.  If I had, I would have complained and sent the food back.  The food quality was a joke.  The service was fine and the atmosphere was fine as well however at the end of the day I only care about the food and it was not that great, end of story.  Would not go back.

iq3qOHKJ6f5K8X4X5UrGgQ.text: I was concerned when I read the negative reviews but decided to try it anyway. When I got there I was told they were full. However, the hostess smiled and said she would see what she could do. I was led to a small booth that was perfect (Clint Eastwood's booth). Service was superb; fast, friendly, and correct. The Caesars Salad was excellent. The filet and baked potato were perfectly cooked and so good. I had a cocktail and glass of wine. Again, just right! All in all, I highly recommend this place. It's pricey but definitely worth it if you are looking for a special place.

Et73HMZPyH9fExTfHClRng.text: Wonderful food but horrible service. Not sure if it's worth spending all that money to be treated so poorly.

gVBPTeuICo_WTElndWhIyA.text: Amazing food. The hostess was friendly and kind. The server was professional and prompt. I had the filet. It was 5 stars in itself. Love the ambience. I'm from Vegas and this feels like part of my roots. Great Birthday dinner!

fOkb-I6c7UarB4vyl_kK7g.text: If you are old enough to remember the RatPack, this is the place for great steaks.  Atmosphere is genuine old school. Steaks were great. The staff was even better.

an3GQUIkDB6jwqz4179HVA.text: The best non-touristy steakhouse in Vegas. For the money, you wouldn't find better service or food anywhere in town. I have been many times and have never been disappointed. All of the servers have been there forever and provide individualized old school service which adds to this unique experience. Try the succulent ribeye, escargot (hard to find nowadays), table side salads and cherries jubilee. Just delicious.

5gxB463xRO70qquNTrBlow.text: Food was great!  Service not so great...  When you're paying that much for a meal, the service should be just as good as the food.  Get the bananas foster for dessert, you won't be disappointed!

HtgfBfoncPojEkpcBZyQdA.text: The GREATEST old school Steak House in The Las Vegas. This local legend opened since 1953, The Golden Steer has welcomed clients and celebrities from around the World. Its first class atmosphere and settings make the restaurant a "time capsule" where you are sent back to the 1950's were customer care and service meant something. You will enjoy the stellar service brought to you by Fabian, Cliff, Henry and the 5 star team as they bring you your fare in style! Their is a problem.....making a decision on what to order. The food here is magnificent and offers only the best cuts of prime meat available in the USA. Each steak or Chateau is careful prepared to order with no mistakes, grilled to perfection with seasonings and herbs that delighted fussy eaters such as "The Rat Pack" crew and John Wayne. Only the best here. The "Steer" offers all beer and wine and has an excellent bar with virtually all drinks available. The Bar manager "Joe" is also a celebrity in his own right. If you are looking for a nice Surf and Turf, you can order your steak with a Lobster Tail or Crab. If you are not sure, order the Seafood Appetizer that has an array of fresh delicious from the Ocean. Always fresh and tasty. If you love  "SHRIMP COCKTAIL" you must order this here. The Shrimp are large and the same is exceptional. My recommendation is the Bone in Ribeye Steak (cooked med. rare to rare). The Ribeye is large and thick but is prepared so that the meat is tender and literally can be cut with your fork. It melts in your mouth for an experience you will never forget. All entrees are separate and the sides are large enough to share. The creamed spinach, baked potato, Caesar Salad tossed and made at your table, are among the many sides you can order with your meal.If you have room after dining, the restaurant offers great desserts that are made fresh daily and complete that special dinner. I cannot say enough about this restaurant. It is the jewel of steak houses that believe it or not, many locals do not know about. Please expect to have the greatest experience here. Having said this the restaurant is 5 stars and is reflective in their pricing (which is not too out of budget). If you are lucky enough to be here in Vegas and try The Golden Steer, you will have the dining experience of your life.

DmFLq_oEJ0eo6RdDNfuHMQ.text: Really, there's a star here for service and a star here for ambience. If we weren't grading on a curve, it'd be 0 stars.  I took my boyfriend for his b-day ... we went to vegas to celebrate for the whole weekend, and his one request was a great prime rib dinner. We Yelped and Googled, settled on Golder Steer or Lawry's, asked around and decide on the Golden Steer.  Food was *terrible*. Granted, we got there at the end of the night, but when you're dropping $200 at minimum on dinner and wine, the 9:00 seating should still get some pretty badass food. Seafood stuffed mushrooms were squishy, bland and sub-par to even crappy Red Lobster stuffed mushrooms. Tableside Caesar was a joke. Had a really nice bottle of pinot noir, so even with teh bad food, we pressed on to dinner.   My filet was overdone, underseasoned and grainy. His prime rib was repellant. You know that reason a lot of folks think prime rib is gross? His was it: raw, full of uncooked, glisteny fat and sitting in a pool of bloody 'au jus'. I couldn't even look at it.   So, so disappointed. Will never be back.

Nb9swMhEkhm0NcnppM3MKg.text: Amazing. Fantastic food. Awesome classic decor. Old school vegas. Try the caeser salad - made at the table.

lQGiLSZ-J8nMfICZevTKsg.text: My families been going here for the past ten years. One of my favorite steak houses in LV!

d5NdM8BGDYqGsnbXj2hx_A.text: Excellent venue with a fun nostalgic ambience. Best steaks and seafood in Vegas. Great wine list. I Highly recommend the Golden  Steer.

VTW0FddAhz7i9Tnsh87OoA.text: Old school, classic American, Rat Pack era steak house. Tuxedo staff, exceptional service and perfect cocktails. Caesar salad made at table side, phenomenal steaks cooked to perfection, sides were delicious and enough to share! Desserts were decadent and amazing! What s fabulous way to celebrate my birthday!

XYqAp6Y2_ewLVKU3SXXivQ.text: Disappointing and overrated sums up my review.   First of all I was surprised how loud the room was. It was extremely hard to have a conversation. The decor was nice old school Las Vegas Steak house with lot of memorabilia on the wall of famous patrons. The service was interesting, I've been to many restaurants where there is a team that serves you. The Golden Steer had this concept but it wasn't done well. Service was slow and spotty with multiple head waiters not being attentive.   The topper of tacky was at the end when you use a credit card to pay the bill, a credit card machine is brought to you and the waiter said "you can enter a higher amount and you don't have to use the suggested tip amount". The food was meah the prime rib was good not a lot of au juice. My wife had the petite filet and it was ok  not much flavor but tender. Dessert was super disappointing the so called in house made tiramisu was frozen solid and the cream brulee was not white but brown. The wine list was very nice and they had an excellent selection but the prices we're extremely marked up for Las Vegas.   I was surprised that an old school restaurant like this did not have a wine somiler.

2yxArObC83n3ON-5jRkvLA.text: We enjoyed the best surf and turf we've ever had...couldn't stop talking about it!  Everything was impeccable, service, wine, ambiance.  We will definitely be back!

qk6sf4VSsnTKpBwTCBgVUA.text: Not amazing, not horrible.   Old school steak house. Our server was very nice, not in any rush though. Had to call someone over twice to get a drink refill.   My steak, the NY strip was ok. Not a lot of flavor though. Tried adding salt and pepper... Ended up needing some steak sauce.   Boyfriends prime rib was good and the portion was HUGE.   It's pricy, but that is to be expected. For Vegas though, the taste just didn't do anything for me. I probably wouldn't go back. The stars are mostly for the staff.

l5D8572yENFEhWY61QNAvA.text: What a great way to experience some old Vegas ambiance!   Food, atmosphere, and service were all on excellent.  Enjoyed the Ribeye on the bone (cooked to perfection).  Also, the bananas foster were spectacular.  Recommended for something different, away from the Strip.

KLizF28SaGa1U1WrKSfARA.text: We had the pleasure of being served by the greatest server of all time, Carl.  Everyone in the restaurant kept calling him the "Flaming Banana", but I never figured out why; he later explained it was his "stage name."  Well, the Flaming Banana turned out to be a real ball of fire!  He was eloquent, energetic, charismatic, loquacious, and scholarly.  His stage name seems to imply he is coquettish, but I found this to be unTrue.  Carl is the man, and the steak he serves up ain't bad either.  We will definitely be back to see our favorite Banana!

Znw6TnxlOYATUvi1aH8pxA.text: Uber driver suggested we try this LV staple. It was the best steak I've ever eaten (22 oz bone in rib eye). We had the table side Caesar salad which was definitely a treat. It was my bday when we went and our server brought out a fantastic blueberry cheesecake for dessert (definitely were full) and a massive sparkling candle that lit up 3 ft in the air. We will be going back next time we're in LV.

blqL8a2bg30_K3ypkgn6lg.text: I live next door at Allure and decided to finally give this place a try. Excellent food and service - very old school Vegas formal ambiance.  I chose the lobster and petite filet which was amazing - choose the twice baked filet and French onion soup as sides!  Listed as Market Price I ended up paying a little more than expected at $100+ with tax and tip, but it was a meal well worth it.  Recommend this place and will be back for sure.

pwL6obrjaKw3YxAT5B-TCw.text: Very nice ambience, good food, bad service. I don't recommend this place.   I had at least three different servers approach my party. After having one assigned to be our server, he was rude, very unpleasant. He snapped at my friend while we were placing our order. He disappeared for a long time and after 30 minutes brushed past our table banged his fist against the table and said "you guys ok?!" And kept on walking. This was unacceptable treatment for a patron.   I do not recommend this place. Lawry's Steak House would never allow their staff to treat patrons this way.

wHiAGTjEbfQMwqnQITX9gA.text: If you are looking for a flavor of old school Las Vegas, while at the same time have the best steak in in town, then Golden Steer is a must. The staff are amazing and so knowledgeable about the history of this great place. If you haven't been, treat yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jjsj8oWTGDAH_OEQiV9ayQ.text: Exceptional steak and even better "Rat Pack" atmosphere!  Definitely bringing customers here, often.

guImF1gtDJqU2gzRrcu8mw.text: I love prime rib and I've had lots of prime rib in a lot of places. This is the best I've had.....ever.

cPdLmHM53llsfNq3VPT-sw.text: The atmosphere of this place is old school nostalgia. Overall this was an excellent place for a special dinner.  The apps were excellent and the table side Caesar salad was the best I've ever had.  The steaks were cooked to perfection, but might have stood for just a bit more seasoning.  The lobster tail was very large and good, but a little chewy.  And cherries jubilee, are you kidding me?  Outstanding, you can never find that any more.  The service was outstanding, and thanks to the management who comped my son's meal before his deployment overseas.  Top notch!

y1hsV6x1V-Zbtk-Wht6X8g.text: Great service, terrific steaks, and wonderful sides.  All this, in addition to a rich history, made for a memorable evening.

soBtaA86NRCO9QAqvTptIg.text: This place gave me a reservation at 8 PM and didn't honor the reservation. When we showed up with our party all they did was apologize and screwed is on the seating. They were rude and could care less about our business. I have never been treated so poorly. This place is a joke. They are living in the past. Pass on this place.

25fH7c3F0y_VH35AKBXDxg.text: There is something to be said about having a dining "experience".  Servers giving you time to peruse a menu, pick a cocktail or wine, moments of pause between courses to enjoy the conversation and company of your companion(s), and never rushing to finish your table, in order to present the bill and hustle you out the door.  From the warm decor, to the attentive service, to the mouthwatering food...I enjoyed every minute of it...and it felt even more special considering the history of it.  The dry aged beef obviously reigns supreme here, but the succulent shrimp scampi accompanying my petite filet was pretty tasty, too.  Growing up in Vegas, The Golden Steer is one of a few places left of "old Vegas" that I've always wanted to try, and I'm soooo glad I finally did.  Treat yourself and go to The Golden Steer...you deserve it!

IrZAjIYf_41Fiu9XmPjwvA.text: Old School Vegas Steak House, not much more needs to be said. This is a classy Vegas steak house, so you should try and dress nicely when you come here. I had the Filet Mignon and it was amazing!! It had asparagus and hollandaise sauce on top of it and was probably the best steak I have ever had. My friend had the New York Strip and it melted in your mouth! Treat yourself and get the Caesar salad, they make the dressing at your table and it was the best!! The staff is wonderful and the service is exquisite. Each booth is named after some Las Vegas icon, so it has some Vegas history built in. It is an a carte menu, and the steaks are about $50 a piece, so plan ahead. Make sure and tip the wonderful staff, they deserve it.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Caesar salad, ever. They make the dressing at your table.
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York strip melts in your mouth!
Photo of Golden Steer Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon, medium.

fN9XK7irJ1d_Yfq_RY8Etg.text: Finally made it to this place. My gf made a reservation for us and her mom, who is here from TX. Pretty unbalanced experience. The food was actually really good for the most part. We ordered the escargot and Caesar salad for the table to start. Escargot was nice, but I can't say much for the Caesar salad. It was prepared table side, which is nice, but too much dressing and too garlicy for me. I am a big fan of Caesar salad and this didn't really do it for me.  Now this is where the experience took a turn. We told our server that we had a Groupon and it's like his entire attitude changed after that. He became short and never came by. We ordered an 18oz Prime Rib and a chicken dish. This took over an hour and I always order my prime rib RARE. The few times we were actually able to flag our server down during this hour, he said he had another table that he had to help prior to us, and he said this several times. We finally told him I had to go to work, which I did, and been there about an hour and a half at this point. Food came out, Prime Rib was ok. Not the best I've had. The angel chicken and mushroom dish was awesome. We also got creamed spinach and it was just way too rich. Overall the food was fine like I said.  So after we were done eating our server comes and gives us our check. He could of asked if we wanted desert or maybe bring one on the house since I waited over an hour for a rare Prime Rib? Naw, he doesn't roll like that. He said, said we told him we needed to leave is there anything else? I was thinking desert, but he just made me feel like I was wrong for saying anything in the first place. He then brought a little credit card machine, pointed to the gratuity part and made sure to point out the original total before the groupon discount..again like he wasn't getting a proper tip, which was his attitude towards the whole thing from the beginning. It was like beyond obvious.  So if people ever read my reviews I rarely go off on service like this or ever really. But this guy single handedly ruined our experience. So after all that I am still giving 3 stars, because of the food and the atmosphere. I just don't think will be back.

L4kRfsBa6D8QmtFmbBTnCA.text: *****READER NOTE: I RATE BASED ON ENVIRONMENT/SETTING AND YUMMINESS OF FOOD. I NEVER CONSIDER SERVICE IN MY RATING (NO MATTER HOW BAD OR GOOD)****** Setting: 5/5 Food: 2/5  ***SPECIAL NOTE: Had a Migraine and Upcoming Fever coming into this steakhouse, but my taste buds were still there, my brother and sister confirmed my judgement on their food****  Like many other reviews, this place is riding mainly only its reputation of hosting Sinatra, that's the reason I came. I absolutely adore places like this, it was away from the strip, the mood was intimate and felt classy. The decor reflected its classic history. However, the food was just not up to par. My siblings and I ordered the seafood platter, Manhattan Clam Chower, a filet mignon, and 2 prime ribs (an 18 and 24 oz). Seafood platter was quite the disappointment, clam chowder was aight, prime ribs were cooked to the correct texture, BUUTTT it was under seasoned. Ordered the 3 steak sauces, all three were quite underwhelming. Food wasn't gross that's why I didn't give it a 1, but it was overpriced for the quality of the food.   So in short, if it weren't for Frank Sinatra and the lovely environment, this place wouldn't have people flocking to it. This place doesn't need to be the best steakhouse, but it does need major step up in the quality of their food if they wanna stick around.      If my migraine impaired any judgement, it was giving the restaurant the benefit of the doubt, cause I was in denial of how underwhelmed I was.

-Te6JGXvJo_xr1H8JecBsA.text: The food was average,  I didn't have meat so perhaps that's why.  It's a steakhouse so meat is probably their specialty. HOWEVER, I have gone to other steak houses and gotten fish and it was wonderful.  The sea bass at Flemings for example.  Having said that, I will give this place another chance and have a steak.  What I didn't care for was our server.  He was not in a good mood and we felt it.  We ordered $130 bottle of champagne and he never brought a bucket of ice, we had to ask for it.  The place was crowded and it's a hard job, however when you pay good money for food, there are no excuses.  Suck it up and give Everyone your best.It wasn't just him either, while waiting in the lobby I spotted an old cappuccino machine, I asked an approaching waiter if it still worked and he just walked past me without a word.  I was the only person in the area, so he heard and saw me, he just ignored me.

ieglA6dBFPoE9JQai5DdXA.text: I have been here a few times... Work team dinners, and most recently, I took my husband here after our wedding in Vegas! (We live in Henderson).   Con:  When I took my husband there the last time, I have to say that the food was  5 star experience. It was even better than usual. However, the server was rather pushy.  We ordered a bottle of wine, 2 appetizers, 2 filet dinners with 2 sides.  Even the server himself (as they always do) reminded us of how "ridiculously large" the portion sizes are. Yet the server became visibly angry and downright pushy when I said NO to desert. That's not how you treat a local for their wedding dinner.  Especially after the AMOUNT that I had ordered.   Pros: That lousy waiter aside, I love this place. The service is NORMALLY ok... a few bad apples here and there... The food, I feel, is delicious if you enjoy a good steak.   The price is a bit high, but it's not everywhere in Vegas where you can experience "OLD Vegas."  The baked potatoes are delicious - and GIANT.   I also enjoy the french onion soup and the lobster bisque.   Overall, I've never had a bad meal here - ever. I also enjoy the bar from time to time. The bartender is always great and the drinks are not bad.

YEoN6TjRnF9bIBTQHJBz8A.text: This is easily the best steakhouse I've ever been to. Don't let the exterior scare you away! When we pulled up, I wasn't sure what to think. When you enter, you get a real old-school vibe. The servers are helpful and not over bearing, as they can be at other steak houses. The steak was OUTSTANDING. my mouth is watering writing this review.

xDLFS5uQMX468iK0brgW4Q.text: I am so disappointed with last night's experience at Golden Steer Steakhouse.  I have been going to this restaurant for 20 years whenever we are in Vegas.  We were a party of 5 and after 1 1/2 hours the woman hostess asked us to leave because she needed our table. She was very rude and had been rude when we walked in.  Instead of asking us nicely to have an after dinner drink or coffee in the bar area so we could continue our conversation, she rudely kept standing at our table and repeating that we should leave.  The service was excellent but she spoiled the evening which included an 86 year old man who lives in Vegas.  The calimari was not freshly prepared and the bloody mary drink I ordered was not good.  What a shame to have this experience after so many years of great steaks and great service.  This woman hostess must go.

fhE_i1lWLX1YdViIbQbDiA.text: I'm not from Las Vegas but my husband and I wanted to have a nice steak dinner for Valentine's Day. I found this place on yelp and was impressed since its one of or if not the oldest steak houses in Vegas. After dining here, I really don't understand how anyone could post a negative review. The outside entrance is very deceiving. It looks outdated and old but once you walk inside, WOW. This place is very classy and unique. Its a beautiful restaurant. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Our food was delicious. Our steaks were cooked just right and full of flavor. Yes, this is on the pricey side but it is worth every penny. My husband an I ordered their table side dessert Bananas Foster. OMG! I definitely will come back next time I'm in town. Fabulous place. Fine dining at its best!

eKPtJvcdShFzueLiMAFKxA.text: Place is nicely decorated... Servers wear suits but the service was horrible! (And keep in mind it was NOT busy ...Our main servers name was Brian ...But the food OMG I don't think I've ever had such disgusting food! Should have listened to our driver who advised us not to come here but instead I went off of the 4 star Yelp review and brought a few other people with me (and EVERYBODY in my party was very dissatisfied with EVERYTHING)... I had the chicken Parmesana  which was drenched in the tomato sauce yet it was very tasteless smh ...for $28 a piece of chicken (no sides includes -most sides are $9 even French fries) I really expected sooooooo much more .... Perhaps we went on a bad day but I am very disappointed with this place... Would not come back and DO NOT recommend!

kAp3BmZ1i3dYwfETaf0iFg.text: This was our first time - we loved it! The food was delicious. The service and overall attention was perfect. Don't pay too much attention to the seedy parking lot...

VB3OGbeeu2jpb7Hm96S8TA.text: Based on a Friday night 7:30 res- 3 adults: Hate to give this spot a poor review, given it's history, but it deserves it.  This review is entirely service based.  Except from the lovely hostess who greeted us with a smile and helped us to our table, the rest of the wait staff didn't have a clue.  I say wait staff, because we never really were clear on who was our server.  It didn't matter who helped us at a given time, they all messed up an order, forgot to get something we had to flag them down to request, or simply ignored the table.  We shouldn't have to call a server over for every phase of the dining experience.  Luckily, we are all patient individuals. The food was great, but it hurts the experience if the entree comes well before any of the sides, as well as no wine (which was specifically ordered to come with the entree) until after the meal is almost complete (trust me, we held out as long as we could to wait for the wine, but there simply wasn't a server that came near us for a solid 10 min). No check-in by anyone after the food came. The icing on the cake was that when the bill came, the server explained that he comped two drinks for having to wait.  That's nice and all, but the experience still suffered, and he also had an attitude as if he was doing us a favor, which frustrated me even more. As Vegas locals, we've been here several times.  The impression that I got is that they are relying on their reputation as an 'old school'  Vegas steakhouse to carry them.  That will work ok with the out-of-towners, but we probably don't have a reason to go any longer.

n9WtmDbA3zJayPyILkYgCA.text: Very disappointed about our experience after hearing/reading such rave reviews.  Service was terrible.  We were a big group but had an early dinner and the restaurant was close to empty.  Took forever to get to us for drink orders, then didn't check back throughout the meal to see if we wanted more.  Don't restaurants make a mint on alcohol sales?  /shrug  The waiter was non-existent throughout the meal, we had to chase him down to get the check.  Three of the steaks were dried out pieces of leather.  One person in our party said it was the worst stake she ever had.  At $40+ a steak, it damn well be the best.    We had a side of broccoli - it was practically raw.    Overall this was a very disappointing meal - certainly not worth the price.  There are many other steak houses in Vegas that do it much better.

r2H4qkHX5XEkhmnOpni2JA.text: We visited the Golden Steer for the first time on Sunday night, and are so glad to have found this place. We love eating, we love Vegas, we love places with character, and places with great service. Golden Steer hit all of these marks. We live in San Diego but come to Vegas multiple times a year- that being said, we will DEFINITELY be back. We've done the celebrity chef route time and time again, but in my opinion, you can't beat a place that probably hasn't changed since the day it opened its doors. If it aint broken, don't fix it. The service was also great. Our waiters were very friendly and knowledgeable about the establishment, telling us about the history of the restaurant, as well as the fact that it might be haunted!  Highlights- table side caesar salad, both our prime rib and steak were cooked to perfection. The only downside is, my stomach isn't big enough to eat everything. Next time, we will definitely save room for the bananas foster or cherries jubilee!

wgD3zohCyF6iAXofjKsgEw.text: I had the rib eye with mushrooms and Caesar salad was the best I have ever had. The Bananas Foster ended our wonderful evening. Service was above the top Brian did our table service with the salad and dessert. Thanks for a wonderful evening.

t4FRnlZ9ztPov9nBhN66_g.text: this place is disgusting. i have been to places much nicer than this and even cheaper restaurants with better customer service. the bartender humberto argued with me the entire time because of a groupon i was trying to use with my friends. the pathetic manager didn't come to us the entire time even after i kept asking for him. this place is overly pretentious for a restaurant that doesnt even make enough money to be on the strip and has the audacity to charge $55 for a steak and treat people of color as if theyre ordering from some chicken joint in the hood. anyone who goes here is either out of their mind or a racist. disgusting is all i can say after being so disrespected. they need to learn what the hell customer service is.

MiYQi-2drlftSmBwkHjSaw.text: Pretty damn good steakhouse and a classic. We were treated very well. The chateaubriand  was quite good. The escargot was excellent as was the French onion soup.  I had been wanting to check this place out for years and it did not disappoint.

aUZWVlf8-_2GikKcs3uvHA.text: As good a steak as I've had anywhere. Service was flawless and the old school ambience is for real.

iG2DOcL5oR2D5C7UD_NtYg.text: We came out from Victorville for the SEMA show on the 5th, and decided to look for the best steak joint we could find. Ended up finding The Golden Steer on the Forbes website. Our waiter Scot was awesome, the food was amazing. We got the Cesar salad, Scampi, Prime Rib , and Filet Mignon. Everything was delicious, and the hospitality was unbeatable. It had a really cool old school Hollywood/Mobster feel. Definitely going back when we are in Vegas again!

GBjr1a1W0X727noV8kZ11Q.text: From the moment I waked into this place I was made to feel like I did not belong. Even with a reservation, they made me feel as though I was not welcomed. Rude host staff and bartender who seemed to truly careless about anybody other than some fat cat sitting on the end of the bar.   Oh, well, on to my seat, and this is where the fun begins. I should have trusted my gut instinct immediately upon entering the restaurant and gone someplace else, btu I was hoping the food would redeem the poor service.  I was sooo wrong.   The food here was not what I expected for the price. My steak was tough, filled with tendon and not cooked properly, Escargot was amazingly bland, and sides had a "pre-packaged" taste/quality I could not get past. On top of the "okay" food, the service was disgusting. I dined alone, and was not pinching pennies; I wanted to spoil myself. At the end of the meal my server asked me if I had a coupon! This was beyond outrageous and I can venture a guess at to why he targeted me as a possible "coupon carrying" person. I paid cash, no coupon, and vowed to never return to this place that clearly is use to, and wants to, cater only to the "Good Ol' Boys". They should really be ashamed.

6cqNdR-O53sqahTJGJn3GQ.text: We made a reservation for the Dean Martin table and could not have been happier to sit in history..our waiter was very helpful and the food was amazing..great place for a 40 year wedding anniversary.

MWif1-erTpohr9nrotNbQA.text: Wanted to try a different steakhouse than the usual ones we eat at when traveling to vegas. I found this one on yelp and decided to try it out today dec. 16, 2016. All I can say is the reviews are all right on the money. This place is awesome! We had the assorted seafood sish appetizer which consisted of wvery sea crustation and it was soooo good! Then we had the rib eye 22oz bone in. And brah let me tell you, 22ounces is all meat, they dont consider the bone weight. Soft, juicy, no need add salt or peepa. Oh and the moscow mule, da best I ever had. Cream corn, sauted mushroom, brah dis place you gotta try out. Sorry had no room in stomach fo desert. Next time.

Onck4NX-2YGNjTni9VidFg.text: What can I say this place is awesome! The food is ridiculous, the history is incredible, and the service is second to none! All the ambiance as a high end strip steak house, for half the price. Do yourself a favor and take in some of Vegas history!

CEuQMtr7gwE7VaJbAMyxEQ.text: A wonderful place to go to. Old Las Vegas restaurant but still the greatest quality and service. Wonderful service. The quality of the food is fabulous. The atmosphere is great. I can't say enough wonderful things about the place.

rJ7jj1AE5L_X2QaJzS4Zmw.text: There on the 4th for my birthday dinner. The food was great and service was attentive, fast and friendly. My reservation had a note on it "birthday dinner", my wife mentioned it while talking to the host. Nothing from the staff, not even just "happy birthday". Any other day and I would give 4 or 5 stars, but they missed the most important detail of all (at least to ME). Even the slot machines said happy birthday when I put my player card in!   There's a good cigar shop four doors down for an after dinner smoke!
